source: नूनं मुक्तो वज्रभृता स नागो भ्रष्टो नाकान्मन्त्रविसस्तकायः। घूर्णन्नाकाशे नष्टसंज्ञोऽभ्युपैति तीव्रानि:स्वासान्निःश्वसन्पन्नगेन्द्रः॥
target: The snake has been forsaken by the wielder of thunder-bolt (Indra). his body has been disabled by our Mantras. (Behold), he is falling from the heavens, (behold) the king of snakes, deprived of his consciousness, comes rolling in the sky breathing loudly.

source: अर्जुन उवाच इन्द्रस्यार्धासनं राजन्नयमारोढुमर्हति। ब्रह्मण्यः श्रुतवांस्त्यगी यज्ञशीलो दृढव्रतः॥
target: This man, o king, is worthy of even sharing a seat with Indra. Respectful toward Brahmanas, well read in Shrutis, even engaged in the performance of sacrifices, selfsacrificing, of firm vows,

source: ततो नारायणो विष्णुर्नियुक्तः सुरसत्तमैः। जानन्नपि सुरानेवं श्लक्ष्णं वचनमब्रवीत्॥ उपायः को वधे तस्य राक्षसाधिपतेः सुराः। यमहं तं समास्थाय निहन्यामृषिकण्टकम्॥
target: Thus besought by the foremost of the celestials, that searcher of hearts, Visnu, although cognizant of the means whereby Rāvana was to be destroyed, asked the gods these amiable words,-What, you gods, is the means of compassing which I could slay that thorn of the ascetics? Nara means a multitude, and Ayana, dwellingplace. He whose dwelling-place is a multitude, is Nārāyana. Metaphorically, the word means evidently the Scorcher of hearts, worlds, and dreadful to ascetics!

source: ततस्तत्र समासीनौ नातिदूरे निरीक्ष्य ताम्। न्यग्रोधे सुकृतां शय्यां भेजाते धर्मवत्सलौ॥
target: Then viewing from where they sat at ease their well-laid bed under the banian tree, those virtuous ones (Rāma and Sītā) went to it.

source: ऋते कृष्णान्महाभागात् पाण्डवाद् वा धनञ्जयात्। एष तस्मात् पुरोधाय कञ्चिदन्यं ममाग्रतः॥
target: Except the illustrious Krishna or Dhananjaya the son of Pandu, I do not find any one in the three worlds who can slay me in battle.

source: यत्रेच्छागामिनो दान्ताः सर्वशत्रुनिषूदनाः। प्रार्थयन्ति च यद् दान्ता लभन्ते तन्न संशयः॥
target: The self-controlled can go everywhere at will. The self-controlled can destroy every enemy. Forsooth, the self-controlled succeed in getting everything they seek.

source: करेण तु करं तस्या ग्राहयित्वा मयस्तदा॥ प्रहसन्प्राह दैत्येन्द्रो राक्षसेन्द्रमिदं वचः।
target: Taking her hand with his own, Maya, the lord of Daityas, laughing said to that lord of Raksasas.

source: पुनश्च शरवर्षेण च्छादयामास भारत। कर्णो वैकर्तनो युद्धे भीमसेनमरिंदमः॥
target: But once more, O Bharata, that subduer of foes viz., Vikartana's son Karna, covered Bhimasena with a shower of arrows.

source: दमस्तेजो वर्धयति पवित्रं दम उत्तमम्। विपाप्मा वृद्धतेजास्तु पुरुषो विन्दते महत्॥
target: Self-control increases energy; self-control is excellent and holy. Absolved from his sins and having his energy increased (by selfcontrol) a man obtains great results. are

source: सा सेना महती राजन् पाण्डुपुत्रस्य संयुगे। द्रोणेन वारिता यत्ता न चचाल पदात् पदम्॥
target: Thus assailed by Drona that mighty division of the son of Pandu could not stir one step forward, though striving vigorously.

source: निकृत्यैतद्रथानीकं बलिनं लोकविश्रुतम्॥ सूतपुत्रं महेष्वासं दर्शयात्मानमात्मना।
target: Of your own accord show yourself to the great bowman, the charioteer's son. Advance with great force, O foremost of Bharatas.

source: ददर्श तत्र गोविन्दं ब्राह्मण वपुषान्वितम्। तेनैव दृष्टपूर्वेण सादृश्येनैव सूचितम्॥
target: He saw Govinda gifted with his Brahmaform. It took after that form of his which had been seen before and which, therefore, helped the recognition

source: धुमत्सेन उवाच श्वराम धर्म नियतास्तपस्विनः। कथं त्वनीं वनवासमाश्रमे निवत्स्यते क्लेशमिमं सुता तव॥
target: Dyumatsena said : Exiled from my kingdom we have taken refuge in the woods and have been, like ascetics, practising virtue with subdued passions. How will (therefore), your daughter, unworyour of a forest life, put up with (its) hardships living in the forest?

source: प्रविशन्तौ कदायोध्यां द्रक्ष्यामि शुभकुण्डलौ। उदग्रायुधनिस्त्रिंशौ सशृङ्गाविव पर्वतौ ॥
target: When shall I behold those (two) wearing burnished ear-rings, entering Ayodhyā, placing before them their weapons and swords, like unto two hills furnished with their summits?

source: तस्यास्यान्नासिकाभ्यां च श्रवणाभ्यां च. सर्वशः। तेभ्यश्चाक्षिसहस्रेभ्यः प्रादुरासन महार्चिषः॥
target: From those blazing flames of fire came out of his mouth and nose and ears and all those thousand of eyes.

source: आगतोऽस्मि वशं भद्रे तव मन्त्रबलात्कृतः। किं करोमि वशो राज्ञि ब्रूहि कर्ता तदस्मि ते॥
target: Gentle lady, drawn by the power of your Mntras, I have come under your power. Now that I have been subject to your power, tell me, Queen, what I shall do. I shall do whatever you may command me.

source: कृष्णशुल्कावुभौ पक्षौ गयायां यो वसेन्नरः। पुनात्यासप्तमं राजन् कुलं नास्त्यत्र संशयः॥
target: O king, the man who lives at Gaya during both the white and the black fortnight, no doubt sanctifies the seven generations of his race upwards and downwards.

source: एतस्मात् कारणाद् देवा गन्धर्वोरगराक्षसाः। मनुष्याश्च पिशाचाश्च प्रयता धारयन्ति तत्॥
target: It is therefore that the celestial and Gandharvas and Uragas and Rakshasas and human beings and Pishachas hold it with care.

source: पर्यङ्क इव विभ्राजन्नुपविष्टो बभूव ह। शैलराजसुता चास्य नित्यं पार्वे स्थिता बभौ॥ तथा देवा महात्मानो वसवश्वामितौजसः। तथैव च महात्मानावश्विनौ भिषजां वरौ। तथा वैश्रवणो राजा गुह्यकैरभिसंवृतः॥ यक्षाणामीश्वरः श्रीमान् कैलासनिलयः प्रभुः। उपासन्त महात्मानमुशना च महामुनिः॥ सनत्कुमारप्रमुखास्तथैव च महर्षयः। अङ्गिरःप्रमुखाश्चैव तथा देवर्षयोऽपरे॥ विश्वावसुश्च गन्धर्वस्तथा नारदपर्वतौ। अप्सरोगणसंघाश्च समाजग्मुरनेकशः॥
target: Sitting by his side, the daughter of the king of mountains shone in brilliance. The great gods, the Vasus of immeasurable energy, the great Ashvins, those foremost of physicians, and king Vaishravana attended by many a Guhyaka,-that king of the Yakshas, endued with prosperity and power, and having his abode on the suminit of Kailasa,-all waited upon the great Mahadeva. And the great sage Ushanas, and the foremost of Rishis headed by Sanatkumara, and the other celestial Rishis headed by Angiras, and the Gandharva Vishvavasu, and Narada and Parvata, and the various clans of Apsaras, all came there to wait upon the king of the universe.

source: अनिष्टसम्प्रयोगाच्च विप्रयोगात् प्रियस्य च। मनुष्या मानसैर्दुःखैर्युज्यन्ते चाल्पबुद्धयः॥ गुणैर्भूतानि युज्यन्ते वियुज्यन्ते तथैव च। सर्वाणि नैतदेकस्य शोकस्थानं हि विद्यते॥ अनिष्टं चान्वितं पश्यंस्तथा क्षिप्रं विरज्यते। ततश्च प्रतिकुर्वन्ति यदि पश्यन्त्युपक्रमात्॥
target: Men of low intelligence are overpowered with grief at the occurrence of something which is not agreeable to them or nonoccurrence of something which is good or much desired. Every creature is subject to this (law). It is not merely a single creature or a class, that is subject to misery. Congnisant of this evil people quickly mend their ways, if they perceive it at the very out-set, they succeed in curing it altogether.

source: अल्पेनाल्पेन देयेन वर्धमानं प्रदापयेत्। ततो भूयस्ततो भूयः क्रमवृद्धिं समाचरेत्॥
target: Little by little should be drained from a prosperous subject. The demand should then be gradually increased till it reaches a fair amount.

source: सत्यधर्मरतो दान्तो विप्रपूजादिभिर्गुणैः। सदैव त्रिदिवं प्राप्तो राजा किल युधिष्ठिरः॥
target: King Yudhishthira is constantly in the enjoyment of heavenly bliss, in consequence of his devotion to truth, righteousness, control passions, worship of the Vipras and such other qualities.

source: मया वध्योऽभविष्यत् स भैमसेनिर्घटोत्कचः। मया न निहतः पूर्वमेष युष्पत्प्रियेप्सया॥
target: Then it would have been my (painful) duty to slay Bhimasena's son Ghatotkacha. It was only for pleasing you that I did not slay him before.

source: अभिनन्द्य समापृच्छय समाधाय च राघवम्। स जगामाश्रमं त्यक्त्वा कुलैः कुलपतिः सह ॥
target: Then having paid homage to Rāma, and spoken to him and encouraged Rāghava, the patriach ascetic renouncing the asylum, went away along with his own people.

source: ज्यातलज्ञधनुःशब्दः कुञ्जराणां च बुंहताम्। पादातानां च पततां नृणां नादो महानभूत्॥
target: There was a great noise of the bowstrings, bows and lances and the loud roar of elephants; as also there were terrible shouts of the foot soldiers and men falling (upon the earth).

source: तथैव रावणेनापि पात्यमाना मुहुर्मुहुः। अर्जुनोरसि निर्भाति गदोल्केव महागिरौ॥
target: And striking again and again against Arjuna's breast Ravana's club looked like a huge firebrand.

source: त्वमेवैको जातु पुत्रस्य राजन् वशं गत्वा सर्वलोके नरेन्द्र। कामात्मनः श्लाघनो द्युतकाले नागाः शमं पश्य विपाकमस्य॥
target: O Lord of men, you, alone of all the world having come under the influence of your headstrong son, regarded success as sure and did not prevent the dispute at the time of the game; now, see the result of this.

source: एतास्तु सीमन्तशिरोरुहायाः शुल्कोत्तरीया नरराजपल्यः। राज्ञोऽस्य वृद्धस्य परं शताख्या: स्नुषा नृवीरा हतपुत्रनाथाः॥
target: These ladies, the hair on whose heads shows not the parted line, and who are clad in white, are the widows of the killed sons of Dhritarashtra. They are the daughters-in-law of this old king, the wives of his hundred sons, now deprived of both their husbands and children who have been killed by heroic enemies.

source: इन्द्रियाणि मनो वायुः शोणितं मांसमस्थि च। आनुपूर्व्या विनश्यन्ति स्वं धातुमुपयान्ति च॥
target: The senses, the mind, wind, blood, flesh, bones, one after another, meet with destruction and enter each into its own productive causes.

source: प्रकृतय ऊचुः यः पुत्रो गुमसम्पन्नो मातापित्रोर्हितः सदा। सर्वमर्हति कल्याणं कनीयानपि सत्तमः॥
target: The people said : O king, it is true that, the son who is accomplished and who seeks the good of his parents, deserves all prosperity, though he is the youngest.

source: चरितब्रह्मचर्यास्ते सोमपा भूरिदक्षिणाः। जयाय पाण्डुपुत्राणां समाजाग्मुर्महीक्षितः॥
target: By them had been observed Brahmacharya vows, drunk the Soma juice; and liberal presents had also been made by them to the Brahmanas in sacrifices; these kings came for ensuring victory to the sons of Pandu.

source: यदृच्छयाधनुष्पाणिर्बद्धखङ्गो वृकोदरः। ददर्श तद् वनं रम्यं देवगन्धर्वसेवितम्॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Vrikodara wandering at pleasure armed with (his) bow and sword, beheld that delightful forest frequented by the celestials and the Gandharvas.

source: तस्य शब्देन वित्रस्तास्तावका भरतर्षभ। सिंहस्येव मृगा राजन् व्यद्रवन्त महाभयात्॥
target: Terrified at his roars, your warriors, O foremost of the Bharatas, fied, O king, out of panic, like deer flying at the sight of a lion.

source: तेन संचोद्यमानस्तु ततस्तांस्तुरगोत्तमान्। सूत: संचोदयामास युयुधानस्थं प्रति॥ ततो दुर्योधनः क्रुद्धो दृढधन्वा जितक्कमः। शीघ्रहस्तश्चित्रयोधी युयुधानमुपाद्रवत्॥
target: Then inspired by him that charioteer proceeded those excellent horses to the car of Yuyudhana. Then that resolute bowman that indefatigable warrior, king Duryodhana versed in various modes of warfare and endued with great lightness of hands, rushed upon Yuyudhana.

source: संजय उवाच केशवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा बीभत्सुरपि राक्षसम्। अभ्यभाषत कौरव्य घटोत्कचमरिंदमम्॥
target: Sanjaya said Hearing the words of Kesava, Vibhatsu also addressing that Rakshasa, that slayer of foes viz., Ghatotkacha said, O foremost of the Kurus, these words.

source: दर्शयन् सर्वसैन्यानां स बाह्वोर्बलमात्मनः। सिंहनादस्वनं कृत्वा निर्जगाम धनंजयः॥
target: Showing the prowess of arms to all the hosts, Dhananjaya (Arjuna), sending forth a leonine shout, came out of the Panchala ranks).

source: तद्बभूवाद्भुतं घोरं युद्धं वानररक्षसाम्। शिलाभिर्विविधाभिश्च बहुशाखैश्च पादपैः॥
target: The monkeys, waged with diverse rocks and innumerable trees, waxed exceedingly furious.

source: न वासुदेवभक्तानामशुभं विद्यते क्वचित्। जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिभयं नैवोपजायते॥
target: They who are devoted to Vasudeva have never to meet with any evil. They become freed from the fear of birth, death, decrepitude, and disease.

source: महारत्नसमाकीर्णं ददर्श स महाकपिः। विराजमानं वपुषा गजाश्वरथसंकुलम्॥ लङ्काभरणमित्येव सोऽमन्यत महाकपिः। चचार हनुमांस्तत्र रावणस्य समीपतः॥
target: That mighty monkey concluded, “This is the ornament of Larikā bodied forth beautifully to the view, covered with elephants, steeds and chariots."

source: उपधाय भुजं तस्य लोकनाथस्य सत्कृतम्। कथं नामोपधास्यामि भुजमन्यस्य कस्यचित्॥
target: Having laid my head on the beautiful arms of that lord of men, how shall I place it again on another's?

source: न ते चालयितुं शक्या धर्मव्यापारकारिणः। न तेषां भिद्यते वृत्तं यत्पुरा साधुभिः कृतम्॥
target: Those promoters of virtue cannot be seduced from the path of virtue. Their conduct, in imitation of that of virtuous men of yore, can never be otherwise.

source: बाहुभिश्चन्दनादिग्धैः साङ्गदैश्च विशाम्पते। हस्तिहस्तोपमैश्चापि भुजङ्गाभोगसंनिभैः॥ ऊरुभिः पृथिवी च्छन्ना मनुजानां नराधिप। शशाङ्कसंनिभैश्चैव वदनैश्चारुकुण्डलैः॥
target: And O ruler of men, with arms decked with sandal-paste, adorned with Angadas, with human thighs, resembling trunks of elephants or the plump bodies of snakes, the earth became literally covered over. With faces resembling the moon and with heads graced with beautiful ear-rings.

source: काम्यकागमनं चैव पुनस्तेषां महात्मनाम्। तत्रस्थांश्च पुनर्द्रष्टुं पांडवान् पुरुषर्षभान्॥ वासुदेवस्यागमनमत्रैव परिकीर्तितम्। मार्कण्डेयसमास्यायामुपाख्यानानि सर्वशः॥
target: The return of the Pandavas to the forest of Kamyaka; the arrival of Krishna to see the sons of Pandu; the arrival of Rishi Markandeya; and his various recitals%3B

source: तस्य शापस्य शान्त्यर्थं प्रददौ पन्नगोत्तमः। स्वसारमृषये तस्मै सुव्रताय महात्मने।॥
target: To neutralise ve effect of that curse, the best of snakes (Vasuki) married off his sister to the high-souled Rishi of rigid vow.

source: समेतास्तत्र वै देशे तत्रैव निधनं गताः। कौरवान्कारणं कृत्वा कालेनाद्भुतकर्मणा॥
target: Time brought them all together in this place and making the Kauravas the cause, destroyed thein all.

source: अर्जुनस्य इमे बाणा नेमे बाणाः शिखण्डिनः॥ कृन्तन्ति मम गात्राणि माघमां सेगवा इव।
target: These are the arrows of Arjuna and not of Shikhandin, arrows that are cutting me to the quick like the bleakness of winter cutting kine to the quick.

source: आशंसमानः कल्याणं कुरूनभ्येति केशवः। येनैव राजन्नर्थेन तदेवास्मा उपाकुरु॥
target: Keshava comes here expecting to do good to the Kurus. Do that, О king, by which that object may be gained.

source: स त्वं सुरहितार्थाय मायायोगमुपाश्रितः। वामनत्वं गतो विष्णो कुरु कल्याणमुत्तमम्॥
target: O Visnu, aided by your power of illusion, assuming a Dwarf form, accomplish the welfare of the gods.

source: कश्मलं प्राविशद् राजा बहु तत्र समादिशन्। स कश्मलसमाविष्टो भीममाहूय पार्थिवः॥
target: Became totally overwhelmed with grief and entreated Bhima with numerous prayers. Then overwhelmed as he was with grief, the king summoned Bhima, near him.

source: एवं मां भगवान् व्यासः पुरा पौरवन्दना प्रोवाचासुकरप्रज्ञस्तस्मादेवं चिकीर्षितम्॥
target: O descendant of Kuru, the illustrious and wise Vyasa formerly told me this. Therefore I am resolved upon doing it.

source: मौने ज्ञानफलावाप्तिर्दानेन च यशो महत्। वाग्मित्वं सत्यवाक्येन परत्र च महीयते॥
target: By practising gifts one acquires great fame. By observing truthfulness of speech, one acquire the fit of eloquence and comes to be respected in heaven.

source: तत् सर्वं प्रतिजग्राह धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। मुदा परमया युक्तो गोविन्दप्रियकाम्यया॥
target: Wishing to please Govinda (Krishna), Dharmaraja Yudhishthira, being himself filled with great joy, accepted all those presents.

source: स शब्दस्तुमुल: खं द्यां पृथिवीं च व्यनादयत्। तं शब्दं पाण्डवाः श्रुत्वा पर्जन्यनिनदोपमम्॥
target: That tremendous din resounded through the welkin. the heavens and the earth. Then hearing that sound that resembled the rumble of rain-clouds, the Pandavas.

source: एवमुक्तस्तु भृगुणा मैत्रावरुणिरव्ययः। अगस्त्यः परमप्रीतो बभूव विगतज्वरः॥
target: Thus addressed by Bhrigu, Mitravaruna's son Agastya of unfading power and glory, became highly pleased and freed from every anxiety.

source: यः स सोदर्यवान् नाम द्वियोधी कृष्णसारथिः। अभ्यासघाती संदृश्यो दुर्जयः सर्वराजभिः॥
target: He, who wielded the bow with both hands, who was invincible to all kings, and who was exceedingly handsome and well skilled in killing the enemy, out with that possessors of great strength Bhima, and Krishna drove the car.

source: एवमेष कुरुश्रेष्ठ प्रादुर्भूतो महात्मना। एकः कर्ता स कृष्णश्च ज्ञानिनां परमा गतिः। इदमाश्रित्य देवेन्द्रो देवा रुद्रास्तथाश्विनौ।। देवं देवर्षिराचष्ट नारदः सर्वलोकदृक्॥
target: Thus, O chief of Kuru's race, this universe was created by the great Krishna. He is the end of intelligent. That observer of all the worlds, viz., the celestial saint Narada, has said that Krishna is the Supreme God.

source: तदन्वेव विराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः॥ तदनन्तरमेवासीन्नीलो नीलायुधैः सह।
target: Next to him stood those two great carwarriors Virata and Drupada; next to them was Nila armed with poisonous weapons.

source: तस्मिंस्तु घोरे संग्रामे वर्तमाने भयंकरे। दुःसहो नवभिर्बाणैरभिमन्युमविध्यत॥ दुःशासनो द्वादशभिः कृपः शारद्वतस्त्रिभिः। द्रोणस्तु सप्तदशभिः शरैराशीविषोपमैः॥
target: Thus when that awful and terrible combat raged fiercely, Dussaha pierced Abhimanyu with nine arrows, Dushasana pierced him with twelve, Kripa and the son of Saradvata with three, Drona with seventeen arrows, all resembling so many snakes of virulent poison.

source: तमापतन्तं महिषं दृष्ट्वा सेन्द्रा दिवौकसः। व्यद्रवन्त रणे भीता विकीर्णायुधकेतनाः॥
target: When Indra and the other dwellers of heaven saw that Mahisha was advancing to attack them, they fled leaving behind their arms and colours.

source: य इदं दारुणाकारं न जानीषे महाभयम्। एष तीर्वार्णवं रामः सेतुना हरिभिः सह॥ अवमन्येह नः सर्वान् करोति कदनं महत्। मया त्वपहृता भार्या सीता नामास्य जानकी॥
target: Unaware of this dreadful calamity (we have been visited with). This Rama together with the monkeys having crossed the sea by means of a bridge and disregarding us all is waging a terrible war. I have stealthily abducted his wife, named Sita, the daughter of Janaka.

source: सप्तगङ्गे त्रिगङ्गे च इन्द्रमार्गे च तर्पयन्॥ सुधां वै लभते भोक्तुं यो नरो जायते पुनः।
target: One who gives oblations of water to his departed manes at Saptaganga and Triganga and Indramarga, obtains ambrosia for food if one has still to go through rebirth.

source: एवमुक्तास्तथा चक्रुस्तदा राज्ञः प्रियैषिणः॥ ततः प्रहर्षः सैन्यानां पुनरासीत् तदा मृधे।
target: Thus accosted by the king, all his wellwishers did what they were asked to do.

source: तस्मिन् बद्धे भविष्यन्ति वृष्णयः पृथिवी तथा। पाण्डवाश्च विधेया मे स च प्रातरिहैष्यति॥
target: On his imprisonment, the Vrishnis and the Pandavas, in fact the whole world, will be at my disposal. Krishna, too, will be here tomorrow morning.

source: स वै विवदनाद् भीत: सुधन्वानं विलोकयन्। तं सुधन्वाब्रवीत् क्रुद्धो ब्रह्मदण्ड इव ज्वलन्॥
target: He (Prahlada), being alarmed at their quarrel, looked at Sudhanva. (Thereupon) Sudhanva thus spoke to him burning in rage as the Brahmadanda (club of Brahma).

source: इमां मे सोपमां वाचं शृणु सत्यामशाङ्कितः। तां श्रुत्वा श्रेय आदत्स्व यदि साध्विति मन्यसे॥
target: "To these truthful words of mine, illustrated by an example, listen without entertaining any doubt or suspicion and hearing that accept the moral if you think my story good.

source: श्वेताश्वौ पुरुषौ दिव्यावास्थितावरिमर्दनौ। शुशुभाते महात्मानौ चन्द्रदित्यौ यथा दिवि॥
target: Those scorchers of their enemies, the mighty warriors, with white steeds attached to their cars, looked like the sun and moon of the skies in brilliancy.

source: जनकस्य तु राजर्षेः कूपस्त्रिदशपूजितः। तत्राभिषेकं कृत्वा तु विष्णुलोकमवाप्नुयात्॥
target: There is (another) well sacred to the royal sage Janaka worshipped by the celestials. Bathing there one goes to the region of Vishnu.

source: गृहीतश्चैव पृष्ठश्च काले दृष्टः सकारण:। कच्चिन्न मुच्यते चोरो धनलोभानरर्षभ॥
target: And, O best of men, is a thief, that has been caught, interrogated (as to his guilt), and found with the stolen property on his person, set free (by your men) from motives of gain.

source: को धर्मः सर्वधर्माणां भवतः परमो मतः। किं जपन् मुच्यते जन्तुर्जन्मसंसारबन्धनात्॥
target: What religion is that which, according to your judgment, is the foremost of all religions? What are those Mantras by reciting which a living creature becomes freed from the fetters of birth and life?

source: असृजत् सर्वभूतानि पूर्वदृष्टः प्रजापतिः। स्थावराणि च भूतानि इत्येषा पौर्विकी श्रुतिः॥
target: Seen first (to appear in an embodied form). Prajapati (then) created all the primal elements and all immobile creatures. This is the ancient Shruti.

source: राज्यं हि सततं दुःखं दुर्धरं चाकृतात्मभिः। भूयिष्ठं च नरेन्द्राणां विद्यते न शुभा गतिः॥
target: Sovereignty is always painful. It is incapable of being borne by persons of impure souls. Generally kings fail to acquire auspicious ends.

source: न जानपदिकं दुःखमेकः शोचितुमर्हति। अशोचन् प्रतिकुर्वीत यदि पश्येदुपक्रमम्॥
target: One should not only grieve for a sorrow that affects a whole community. Without grieving, should, if he finds opportunity, seek to use a remedy.

source: ये रणाग्रे महीपालाः शूराः समितिशोभनाः। वध्यन्तेऽभिमुखाः शक्र ब्रह्मलोकं व्रजन्ति ते॥
target: Those heroic kings and ornaments of assemblies who give their lives in battle with faces towards the foe, attain, O Shakra, to the region of Brahman.

source: स्वशरीरोपरोधेन धनमादातुमिच्छतः। सत्यसम्प्रतिपत्त्यर्थं यद् ब्रूयुः साक्षिणः क्वचित्॥ अनुक्त्वा तत्र तद्वाच्यं सर्वे तेऽनृतवादिनः। प्राणात्यये विवाहे च वक्तव्यमनृतं भवेत्॥
target: If a creditor wishes to take from his debtor a payment of the load by bodily service, the witnesses would all perjure, it, summoned by the creditor for establishing the truth of the agreement, they did not say what should be said. When life is in danger, or on occasions of marriage, one may say an untruth.

source: ऊनषोडशवर्षों मे रामो राजीवलोचनः। न युद्धयोग्यतामस्य पश्यामि सह राक्षसैः॥
target: My lotus-eyed Ráma is not yet turned of sixteen; and I do not perceive his fitness to cope with Raksasas in battle.

source: कालोऽयं दारुणः प्राप्तो भरतानामभूतये। निश्चितं मे सदैवैतत् पुरस्तादपि भाविनि॥
target: A dreadful time has set in to bring about the misfortune of the Bharatas; from some time before this has been settled conclusion, O fair damsel.

source: यन्मया वार्यमाणस्त्वं नावगच्छसि दुर्मते। पश्चादस्य फलं प्राप्य ज्ञास्यसे निरयं गतः॥
target: As, O wicked-minded one, you desistest not, albeit forbidden by me, you shall, afterwards attaining the fruit of this, and repairing to hell, know (the fate that follow there).

source: एतच्छ्रुत्वा दीक्षितस्तप्यमान आस्ते होतारं चोदयन्कर्मकाले। रथो महेन्द्रः स्वयमाजगाम॥
target: Having heard this, the king, installed in the sacrifice, became very sorry and urged the Hota to do his duty. He too, with Mantras, began to pour the ghee into the fire. Thereupon Indra himself came to the place.

source: जानासि हि यथा क्षत्ता द्यूतकाल उपस्थिते। अब्रवीद् यच्च मां त्वां च सौबलं वचनं तदा॥
target: You know what Khatva (Vidura) said to me, to yourself and to the son of Subala (Shakuni) at the time of the play.

source: हा लक्ष्मण महाबाहो गुरुचित्तप्रसादक। ह्रियमाणां न जानीषे रक्षसा कामरूपिणा॥
target: Ah! mighty Laksmana, ever ministering to the satisfaction of your superiors, do you not know that I have been stolen away by a Rākṣasa assuming shapes at will?

source: स चेन्ममार संजय चतुर्भद्रतरस्त्वया। पुत्रात् पुण्यतरश्चैव मा पुत्रमनुतप्यथाः॥
target: When that king, O Srinjaya, who surpassed you in the four attributes of religious, merit, knowledge, renunciation, and wealth, and who was purer than your son, met with death, do not grieve for your son who is dead.

source: ततोऽपश्यत्स पितरं पृष्ठश्चाख्यातवान्पितुः। यथान्यायममेयात्मा तं चोवाच महानृषिः॥
target: He then saw his father and hailed by him, made him proper answer. And the great Rishi then asked him.

source: ज्वलन्तं प्रासमुद्यम्य संग्रामान्ते नरान्तकः॥ दिक्षु सर्वासु बलवान्विचचार नरान्तकः। प्रमृद्गन्सर्वतो युद्धे प्रावृट्काले यथानिलः।७३।।
target: Raising a glowing prasa, the powerful Narāntaka began to range about in the rear of the forces; dashing everywhere (against the foe) in fight, like the wind in the rainy season. *Sangramānte, I presume, means rear of the forces; although literally it means, at the conclusion of the conflict, because this interpretation would not be proper, the battle being now at its hottest.

source: मयि वै त्यज्यतां क्रोधः किं मे क्रुद्धः करिष्यसि। न ते बिभेमि पवन यद्यपि त्वं स्वयं प्रभुः॥
target: Do you vomit all your anger upon me. By becoming angry, what will you do to me? Even if your power had been all your own, I would not still have been afraid of you. I am superior to you in power. I am not afraid of you.

source: विद्याधराः समुत्पेतुस्तस्य शृङ्गनिवासिनः। किन्नराश्च समुद्विग्नाः शक्तिपातरवोद्धताः॥
target: Vidyadharas living on its summits soared into the air. The Kinnaras also became very anxious, bewildered by the fear caused by the fall of Skanda's arrow.

source: यथा कर्णस्य च रथो धार्तराष्ट्रस्य चोभयोः। गन्धर्वैः शतशश्छिन्नौ तथा तेषां प्रचक्रिरे॥
target: As the Gandharvas cut off the chariot of Karna and of the sons of Dhritarashtra, so they tried to do the same with respect to their (Pandava's) chariots.

source: नोचेदयमभाव: स्यात् कुरूणां प्रत्युपस्थितः। अर्थाच्च तात धर्माच्च तव बुद्धिरुपप्लुता॥
target: Otherwise why should the sons of Kuru have come to this state. Your intellect. O dear, has fallen off from both virtue and worldly profit.

source: ततस्ते कल्पमुत्थाय तस्मै राज्ञे न्यवेदयन्। ब्राह्मणा विस्मिताः सर्वे यदुक्तं चित्रभानुना॥
target: At this, all those Brahmanas were struck with surprise and rising on the morrow, they told the king what had been said by the firegod.

source: वासुकिप्रमुखानां च नागानां जनमेजय। सर्वे शशंस गुरवे यथावद् द्विजसत्तमः॥
target: That best of Brahmanas also told his preceptor everything about Vasuki and the other Nagas that had occurred.

source: उच्चावचकरा दाप्या महाराज्ञा युधिष्ठिर॥ यथा यथा न सीदेरंस्तथा कुर्यान्महीपतिः।
target: The king, O Yudhishthira, may levy high taxes, but he should never levy such taxes as would oppress his people.

source: न हि मे विक्रमे तुल्यः कश्चिदस्ति पुमानिह। यथैव सवितुस्तुल्यं ज्योतिरन्यन्न विद्यते॥
target: Just as no luminary is equal to the Sun in effulgence, so there is no man equal to me in prowess and strength.

source: प्रत्यक्षं गुणवादी यः परोक्षे चापि निन्दकः। स मानवः श्ववल्लोके नष्टलोकपरावरः॥
target: That man, who speaks of one's qualities when the latter marks him and who speaks ill of him when he does not see him, is really like a dog. Such a person does not acquire heaven and the fruits of any knowledge and virtue that he may have.

source: ततो मारुतिवाक्येन कोपस्तस्य प्रजज्वले। संरक्तनयनो यत्नान्मुष्टिमावृत्य दक्षिणम्।। पातयामासवेगेन वानरोरसि वीर्यवान्।६६।।
target: At the speech of the Wind-god's son, his ire flamed up. And then that one endowed with prowess clenching his right fist carefully, let it alight a main on the monkey's chest.

source: ते वेश्मस्वपि कौरव्य पृथ्वीशानाप्नुवन् सुखम्। चिन्तयन्तः क्षयं तीवं दुःखशोकसमन्विताः॥
target: O descendant of the Kuru race, the lords of the earth could not enjoy pleasure while resting in their own abodes; and they could not obtain sleep, thinking of that immense massacre.

source: तावास्थितावेकरथं सौभद्रशिनिपुङ्गवौ। सौबली समरे सेनां शातयेतां समन्ततः॥
target: O chastiser of foes, then Subhadara's son (Abhimanyu) and that best of the Shini's race, both mounting the same car began to slaughter the army of the son of Subala.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच वने निवसतां तेषां पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम्। वर्षाग्येकादशातीयुः कृच्छ्रेण भरतर्षभ॥
target: Vaishampayana said : O best of the Bharata race, thus living in the forest, the high-souled Pandavas spent eleven years in great misery.

source: अथैनं पञ्चविंशत्या नाराचानां समार्पयत्। पश्यतां सर्वसैन्यानां तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: Then he pierced Bhima with twenty five small shafts before the eyes of all; and that seemed highly wonderful.

source: ततो दुर्योधनो राजा त्वरमाणो महारथः। सेनामचोदयत् क्षिप्रं रथनागाश्वसंकुलाम्॥
target: Then that mighty car-warrior namely Duryodhana himself in all haste urged on his army teeming with chariots and elephant.

source: समेत्य लोकपालैस्तु सर्वैर्वैवस्वतादिभिः। द्रष्टास्यनघ देवेन्द्रं स च तेऽस्त्राणि दास्यति॥
target: O sinless being, you will behold the lord of the celestials, together with Vaivasvata and all the Lokapalas, who (the lord of the celestials) will grant you weapons.

source: विधातृविहितं मागं न कश्चिदतिवर्तते। कालमूलमिदं सर्वं भावाभावौ सुखासुखे॥
target: Who can avert by his cleverness the decrees of fate? None can go beyond the path marked for him by Providence. Existence and non-existence, pleasure and pain, come by Time.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच यदा स्कन्देन मातृणामेवमेतत् प्रियं कृतम्। अथैनमब्रवीत् स्वाहा मम पुत्रस्त्वमौरसः॥
target: Markandeya said : When Skanda had done all these favourite works of the mothers, Svaha appeared before him and said, “You are my son.

source: पराङ्मुखाय दीनाय न्यस्तशस्त्राय सात्यके। क्षत्रधर्मरतः प्राज्ञः कथं नु प्रहरेद् रणे॥
target: How can a wise person, practising the Kshatriya duties, strike in battle one who runs away or is helpless or has laid aside his weapons or who begs (for his life)?

source: कुमारोऽयं वसुर्नाम स चेहाद्याभिषिच्यताम्। श्वभ्रं च यत्सुखस्पर्श क्रियतां शिल्पिभिर्मम।।।।।
target: Do you therefore even today, place the prince Vasu on the throne, and let the architects prepare ap leasant den for me.

source: निर्भिद्य विविशुस्तूर्णं वल्मीकमिव पन्नगाः। सोऽतिविद्धो भृशं द्रौणिः पाण्डवेन महात्मना॥
target: Quickly pierced her body like snakes entering into an ant-hill. Thus deeply pierccd by the lustrious son of Pandu, Drona's son. arrows

source: ततश्चतुर्दिशं सैन्यैर्दुपदस्याभिसंवृतः। निर्दहन् क्षत्रियव्रातान् द्रोणः पर्यचरद् रणे॥

source: न शक्यः स सुरैर्द्रष्टुं नासुरैर्न च पन्नगैः। यस्य प्रसादं कुरुते स वै तं द्रष्टुमर्हति॥ नहि यज्ञफलैस्तात न तपोभिस्तु संचितैः। शक्यते भगवान्द्रष्टु न दानेन न चेज्यया॥ तद्भक्तैस्तद्गतप्राणैस्तचित्तैस्तत्परायणैः। शक्यते भगवान्द्रष्टुं ज्ञाननिर्दग्धकिल्बिषैः॥ अथवा पृच्छ्य रक्षेन्द्र यदि तं द्रष्टुमिच्छसि। कथयिष्यामि ते सर्वं श्रूयतां यदि रोचते॥ कृते युगे व्यतीते वै मुखे त्रेतायुगस्य तु। हितार्थं देवमानां भविता नृपविग्रहः॥ इक्ष्वाकूणां च यो राजा भाव्यो दशरथो भुवि। तस्य सुनुर्महातेजा रामो नाम भविष्यति॥ महातेजा महाबुद्धिर्महाबलपराक्रमः। महाबाहुर्महासत्त्वः क्षमया पृथिवीसमः॥ आदित्य इव दुष्प्रेक्ष्यः समरे शत्रुभिस्तदा। भविता हि तदा रामो नरो नारायणः प्रभुः॥ पितुर्नियोगात्स विभुर्दण्डके विविध वने। विचरिष्यति धर्मात्मा भ्रात्रा सह महामनाः॥ तस्य पत्नी महाभागा लक्ष्मी सीतेति विश्रुता। दुहिता जनकस्यैषा उत्थिता वसुधातलात्॥ रूपेणाप्रतिमा लोके सर्वलक्षणलक्षिता। छायेवानुगता रामं निशाकरमिव प्रभा॥
target: The celestials, Asuras or Nagas-none is capable of casting his looks upon him. He alone can see him with whom he is pleased, O my son; neither by the fruits of sacrifices, asceticism, selfcontrol, gifts, sacrifices, nor by anything else can one behold the Illustrious Deity. Those alone can see Him, who have devoted themselves, their life and being, to him and who, by virtue of discriminative knowledge, have got their sins burnt. if you are willing to behold him hear, if you do like, I shall describe everything at length. At the end of the golden age and the beginning of Tretā Yuga the deity Nārāyaṇa shall assume a human form for the benefit of men and celestials. A son by the name of Rāma shall be born to Dasaratha, of the Ikşvaku race who shall govern earth. Rāma shall be highly effulgent, highly powerful and in patience like to earth-and the enemies in the encounter shall not be able to eye him as they cannot the sun. In this wise the lord Nārāyaṇa shall appear in a human form. At the behest of his sire, the pious and the high-minded Rāma shall sojourn in the forest of Dandaka in the company of his brother. His spouse the gracious Lakşmi, shall be celebrated under the appellation of Sītā. She will be born as the daughter of Janaka, the king of Mithilā and will come out of earth. In beauty she shall be matchless on earth and be gifted with auspicious marks and shall be matchless on earth and be gifted with auspicious marks and shall always follow Rāma like a shadow as the rays follow the moon.

source: किं मां न प्रेक्षसे राजन्कि वा न प्रतिभाषसे। बालां बालेन संप्राप्तां भायां मां सहचारिणीम्॥

target: None can except to reap the fruits of his meritorious deeds here, since you, O venerable pious old man, lie prostrate on the ground being slain (by your enemies).

source: सबाष्पशोकाभिहता समीक्ष्य तौ भ्रातरौ देवसुतप्रभावौ। वितर्कयन्ती निधनं तयोः सा दुःखान्विता वाक्यमिदं जगाद॥
target: With her eyes shedding plentiful tears, she seeing those brothers, endowed with god-like prowess, concluded them to be dead; and overwhelmed with grief, spoke as follows. as as

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच राष्ट्रगुप्तिं च मे राजन् राष्ट्रस्यैव तु संग्रहम्। सम्यग्जिज्ञासमानाय प्रब्रूहि भरतर्षभ॥
target: Yudhishthira said How, O king, may a kingdom be firmly established, and how should it be protected? I wish to know this. Tell me all this, O foremost of Bharata's race.

source: एतद् बलमभूच्छेष धार्तराष्ट्रस्य माधव। मोक्षो न नूनं कालात् तु विद्युते भुवि कस्यचित्।
target: These, O Madhava, are the remnant of Duryodhana's army. Truly no body will escape from death.

source: घृतालाभे तु यो दद्यात् तिलधेनुं यतव्रतः। स दुर्गात् तारितो धेन्वा क्षीरनद्यां प्रमोदते॥
target: If in absence of even a cow made of clarified butter, one makes a gift of a cow made of sesame seeds, observing a vow the while, one succeeds with the help of that cow to get over all calamities in this world and to enjoy great happiness hereafter from these rivers of milk that you see.

source: आयुष्यमारोग्यकरं यशस्यं सौभ्रातृकं बुद्धिकरं शुभं च। राख्यानमोजस्करमृद्धिकामैः॥
target: They attain to long life, health, fame, intellect, prowess, and good brothers. Therefore it behove those good men, who wish for prosperity, to hear this story perpetually.

source: कुर्वन्तस्ते महावेगा महीं चरणपीडिताम्। रजश्च सहसैवोर्ध्वं जगाम चरणोत्थितम्॥
target: They, endowed with great impetuosity, went on, oppressing the earth with their battle-array; and clouds of dust suddenly arose from the march of the soldiery.

source: यन्मङ्गलं सहस्राक्षे सर्वदेवनमस्कृते। वृत्रनाशे समभवत् तत् ते भवतु मङ्गलम्॥
target: May that blessing crown you, which was attained by the thousand eyed Indra, honoured of all the deities on the occasion of killing the mighty Asura Vſtra.

source: तत्र मे बुद्धिरुत्पन्ना जनकस्य सुतां प्रति। अत्रोषितामिनां सीतामानयेयं कथं पुरीम्॥
target: At that time even I was stricken with anxiety regarding Sītā that how I could take her home since she had resided in the house of the Raksasas.

source: ततो गान्धारराजस्य मन्त्रिवृद्धपुरःसरा! जननी निर्ययौ भीता पुरस्कृत्यार्धमुत्तमम्॥
target: Then the mother of the king of the Gandharas, filled with fear, and with all the aged ministers of state, came out of her city, taking an excellent Arghya for Arjuna.

source: सुखोचितमदुःखाहँ दुरात्मा ससुहृद्गणः। ईदृशं दुःखमानीय मोदते पापपूरुषः॥
target: Having brought you, who are used to happiness, to such a miserable plight that vicious-souled wretch delights with his friends.

source: तस्याद्य विप्रलम्भस्य फलं प्राप्नुहि दुर्मते। एष त्वा सजनामात्यमुद्धरामि स्थिरो भव॥
target: Take now the fruit of that act of deception, O wicked one, for I will now slay you with all your relatives and ministers. Wait a bit.”

source: हतानां गच्छतां स्वर्ग युध्यतामथ धावताम्। प्रेक्षतामृषिसङ्घानां बभूव न तदान्तरम्॥
target: And no room was left (in the sky) in consequence of its being thronged by hosts of sages; and warriors, wounded and rushing for conflict, and (finally) ascending heaven.* *The idea of the author is: "The welkin was thronged with sages as well as warriors, who swelled the ranks of the sages stationed in the sky, by ascending heaven after having fallen in fight.”

source: अतिथीनां च सर्वेषां प्रेष्याणां स्वजनस्य च। तथा शरणकामानां गोप्ता स्यात् स्वागतप्रदः॥
target: The righteous or good man is he who protects his guests, servants and other dependants, his own relatives, and all those who seek his protection. Such a man always welcomes these with the usual polite enquiries.

source: कर्मणा बुद्धिपूर्वेण भवत्याढ्यो न वा पुनः। तादृशोऽयमनुप्रश्नः संव्यवस्यः स्वया धिया॥
target: By acting intelligently the king may or may not acquire wealth. Guided by your own intelligence do you think what reply should be given to your query on this subject.

source: मोक्षार्थमकरोद् यत्नं ब्राह्मणैः सहितः पुरा॥ न च श्रेयोऽध्यगच्छत्तु क्षीयते राष्ट्रमेव च।
target: Consulting with the Brahmanas, he began to make mighty endeavours for releasing his kingdom (from affliction). No good, however, came of his endeavours, for the kingdom continued to dwindle.

source: अर्जुन उवाच नरदेव कथं तस्य राष्ट्रे कर्म करिष्यसि। विराटनगरे साधो रंस्यसे केन कर्मणा॥
target: Arjuna said O god among men, how will you work in his domain, O virtuous one, in what capacity will you reside in the city of Virata?

source: ततो राजा महावीर्यो नहुषः पृथिवीपतिः। परमित्यब्रवीत् प्रीतस्तदा भरतसत्तम॥
target: Then the highly energetic king Nahusha that lord of all the Earth, filled with joy, O best of the Bharatas, said-Sufficient.

source: स्फीतोत्सवमनाधृष्यमासेदुश्च गिरिव्रजम्। ततो द्वारमनासाद्य पुरस्य गिरिमुच्छ्रितम्॥ बार्हद्रथैः पूज्यमानं तथा नगरवासिभिः। मगधानां सुरुचिरं चैत्यकान्तं समाद्रवन्॥
target: Going to the gate of the city (they did not enter through it); the brothers pierced the heart of the high Chaityaka (hill) which was ever worshipped by there of Brihadratha and by the citizens (of Girivraja), the hill that delighted the hearts of all the Magadhas.

source: निहतेषु तु योधेषु हते दुर्योधने तदा। पृथिव्यां पाण्डवेयस्य नि:सपत्ने कृते युधि॥ विद्रुते शिबिरे शून्ये प्राप्ते यशसि चोत्तमे। किं न तत् कारणं ब्रह्मन् येन कृष्णो गतः पुनः॥
target: When all the warriors were killed and Duryodhana was struck down, when for the battle the empire of Pandu's son became perfectly safe, when all the (Kuru) camp became empty, when the son of Pandu won great glory, what was the cause for which Krishna had once again to go (to Hastinapura)?

source: अस्त्रैर्वा गदया वापि बाहुभ्यां वा रणाजिरे। अभ्यस्तं येन वा राम वर्ततां तेन वा मृधम्॥
target: Either with weapon or with clubs, in whatever you are expert, do you fight .with me in the battle-field, O Rāma.

source: स हि सर्वातिथि गो बुद्धिशास्त्रविशारदः। गुणैरनुपमैर्युक्तः समस्तैराभिकामिकैः॥
target: That Naga is always fond of guests. Gifted with great intelligence, he is well conversant with the Scriptures. He possesses all desirable virtues the like of which are not to be seen in any other person.

source: तेषां संभाषमाणानामन्योन्यं स विभीषणः। उत्तरं तीरमासाद्य स्वस्थ एव व्यतिष्ठत॥
target: They addressing each other in this wise, Vibhīşaņa descended from the sky on the northern shore.

source: स गर्भो दिव्यसंस्थानो दीप्तिमान् पावकप्रभः। दिव्यं शरवणं प्राप्य ववृधे प्रियदर्शनः॥
target: Indeed, the child, possessed of a beautiful form, shone like the god of Fire. Of beautiful features, he began to grow in a charming forest of reeds.

source: तथा कृष्णस्य महात्म्यमृषभस्य महीक्षिताम्। यथाहं शल्य जानामि न त्वं जानासि तथा॥
target: O Shalya, you do not know, so well as I do, the greatness of Krishna, the foremost of kings.

source: रारुह्य घण्टानिनदप्रणादम्। गजं खरं गर्जति वै महात्मा महोदरो नाम स एष वीरः॥
target: That high souled hero is named Mahodara that, furnished with right coppery eyes resembling the sun new risen, and ascending a car resonant with the sound of bells, shout shrill.

source: राक्षसीवशमापना भय॑माना च दारुणम्। चिन्तयन्ती सुदुःखार्ता नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे ॥
target: A captive of the Rākşasis, subject to their terrible threats and taunts, sunk in grief and anxiety, I desire not to keep my life.

source: धर्मात्प्रच्युतशीलं हि पुरुषं पापनिश्चयम्। त्यक्त्वा सुखमवाप्नोति हस्तादाशीविषं यथा॥
target: One renouncing a person, lapsing from virtue and bent on sinful acts, attain happiness, even as one does by shaking off a venomous snake from his hand.

source: त्वया त्यक्ता गमिष्यामि यत्र तत्र विशाम्पते। तत्र मे गतयः सन्तु सन्तः सत्यं यथा ध्रुवम्॥
target: Being abandoned by you I shall go wherever I please, O lord of the universe, making the righteous my refuge, for truth is indestructible.

source: एवमुक्ता तु सर्वज्ञा वानरैस्तैः स्वयंप्रभा॥ प्रत्युवाच ततः सर्वानिदं वानरयूथपान्।
target: Thus addressed by the apes, the all-knowing Svayamprabhā replied to the monkey-chiefs, saying,

source: जनमेजय उवाच कथं वैकारिको गच्छेत् पुरुषः पुरुषोत्तमम्॥ वद सर्वं यथादृष्टं प्रवृत्तिं च यथाक्रमम्।
target: Janamejaya said, How can one who is subject to change succeed in attaining to that foremost of Being? Do tell me all this, which is, no doubt, know to you! Do you describe to also of Renunciation in due order.

source: कश्मलं लघुतां याति पाप्मना च प्रमुच्यते॥ यानपात्रे च याने च प्रवासे गजवेश्मनि।
target: His burden of anxiety becomes lightened, and he becomes freed from every sin. By reciting these excellent Savitri Mantras on board a vessel, or in a car, or in the courts of kings, one acquires high success. There where these Mantras are recited, fire does not burn wood.

source: अत्र गत्वा सुखस्यान्तं दुःखस्यान्तं प्रपद्यते। अत्र वृत्तो दिनकरः सुरसं क्षरते पयः॥
target: Here do men come and attain to a termination of their happiness and misery and coming here does the maker of day (the sun) pour water having a nice taste.

source: एतादृशस्य किं मेऽद्य जीवितेन विशाम्पते। वर्धन्ते पाण्डवा नित्यं वयं त्वस्थिरवृद्धयः॥
target: O king, when the state of my mind is such, when the Pandavas are daily growing in prosperity and our possessions are daily decreasing, what do I care for life?

source: त्वामिहैकाकिनी दृष्ट्वा निर्जने गहने वने। प्रार्थयिष्यन्ति राजानस्तस्मान्मैवं मनः कृथाः॥
target: Seeing yourself alone in these dreary and solitary woods kings will court you; therefore do not set your heart on such a life.

source: त्वाष्ट्री तु सवितुर्भार्या वडवारूपधारिणी। असूयत महाभागा सान्तरिक्षेऽश्विनावुभौ॥
target: Tvashtri, who had the form of a mare, became the wife of Savita. She gave birth in the sky to a twin Ashvinis.

source: त्यज राजन्निमं शोकं मिथ्या संतापमागतम्। यदियं त्यज्यतां चिन्ता शत्रुहर्षविवर्धिनी॥
target: It this anxiety of your conduce to the joy of the enemy, do you cast it off. and, O hero, bestir yourself, and summon up spirits.

source: सोऽङ्गदं रोषताम्राक्षः संदिदेश महायशाः। सुग्रीवः कथ्यतां वत्स ममागमनमित्युत॥ एष रामानुजः प्राप्तस्त्वत्सकाशमरिंदम। भ्रातुर्व्यसनसंतप्तो द्वारि तिष्ठति लक्ष्मणः॥ तस्य वाक्यं यदि रुचिः क्रियतां साधु वानर। इत्युक्त्वा शीघ्रमागच्छ वत्स वाक्यमरिंदम॥
target: Thereupon the far-famed Laksmana, having his eyes reddened with ire, spoke to Argada, saying-0 child, do you inform Sugriva of my arrival. O conqueror of foes, do you tell him:-'Laksmana, the younger brother of Rama, being stricken with grief on account his brother's disaster, has come to you and is waiting at the gate. If it pleaseth you, do you make good your promise.' Saying these words do you speedily return, O my child, O conqueror of foes.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तो भगवता प्रत्युवाच युधिष्ठिरः। भीमार्जुनौ समालोक्य सम्प्रहृष्टमुखौ स्थितौ॥
target: Vaishampayana said Having been thus addressed by that exalted being (Krishna), and having seen Bhima and Arjuna standing there with cheerful face, Yudhishthira thus replied.

source: न किंचिदुक्त्वा दुर्मेधास्तस्थौ किंचिदवाङ्मुखः तमशुश्रूषमाणं तु विलिखन्तं वसुंधराम्॥ दृष्ट्वा दुर्योधनं राजन् मैत्रेयं कोप आविशत्। स कोपवशमापनो मैत्रेयो मुनिसत्तमः॥
target: That wicked wretch (Duryodhana) did not speak a word, but he hung down his head. O king, seeing Duryodhana thus offer an insult to him by silently scratching the earth (by his foot), Maitreya became angry. That best of Rishis, Maitreya, overwhelmed with anger.

source: अर्जुन उवाच भगवन् ददासि चेन्मह्यं कामं प्रीत्या वृषध्वज। कामये दिव्यमस्त्रं तद् घोरं पाशुपतं प्रभो॥ यत् तद् ब्रह्मशिरो नाम रौद्रं भीमपराक्रमम्। युगान्ते दारुणे प्राप्ते कृत्स्नं संहरते जगत्॥
target: Arjuna said : O exalted one, O Vrishabdhvaja. O lord, if you will grant me what I desire to possess, I ask from you that fearful weapon which is wielded by you and which is called Brahmashira, that weapon of fearful prowess, which destroys at the end of Yuga the entire universe.

source: जगत्स्रष्टुमना देवो हरिनारायणः स्वयम्। चिन्तयामास पुरुषं जगत्सर्गकरं प्रभुम्॥
target: The illustrious Narayana, otherwise called Hari, when he was bent upon Creation, thought of a Being who would be powerful enough to create the universe.

source: भविष्यथ विश क्षिप्रं द्रष्टासि पितरं क्षये। अनुज्ञातो भगवता गृहं गत्वा युधिष्ठिर।॥
target: Having got the permission of the illustrious god, I then went home, O Yudhishthira, and saw my father, O son, coming out after having finished his daily sacrifice.

source: तेन शङ्खविमिश्रेण भेरीशब्देन नादिना। उपयाति महाबाहू रामः परपुरंजयः॥
target: That captor of hostile capitals, the mightarmed Rāma, was advancing (upon Larikā) with the sounds of drums mixed with the blares of conchs.

source: परश्वधधराश्चान्ये तथान्ये शूलपाणयः। ततस्तूर्यसहस्राणां संजज्ञे निःस्वनो महान्॥ तुमुलः शङ्खशब्दश्च सभां गच्छति रावणे।
target: Some of them were bearing spades and others with darts in hands. As Rāvana marched towards the court, there arose the loud blares of a thousand trumpet, and the uproarious sounds of conchs.

source: यस्याः पुत्रसहस्रेस्तु कृत्स्नं व्याप्तमिदं जगत्। तां दृष्ट्वा रुदतीं शक्रो न सुतान् मन्यते परम्॥
target: Seeing her the whole earth is filled with whose sons by thousands, weeping, Indra understood that none is an object of greater affection than a son.

source: संजय उवाच पुत्रस्तव महाराज मद्रराजं महारथम्। विनयेनोपसंगम्य प्रणयाद् वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥
target: Sanjaya said O great king, your son, approaching the prince of Madras, that very powerful carwarrior, with enough of humility, spoke these words to him out of affection.

source: किं तस्य तपसा कार्यं किं वृत्तेन किमात्मना। श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः॥
target: What need has such a person of penances, or of conduct, or of endurance? Every man has Faith. Faith, however, is of three sorts, viz., as partaking of the nature of the qualities of goodness, darkness, and ignorance, and according to the nature of Faith which one has, one is named.

source: अथर्षयः समुद्विग्ना देवान्गत्वाब्रुवन्वचः। अग्निनाशाक्रियाभ्रंशाभ्रान्ता लोकास्त्रयोऽनघाः।। विधद्ध्वमत्र तत्कार्यं न स्यात्कालात्ययो यथा। अथर्षयश्च देवाश्च ब्रह्माणमुपगम्य तु॥
target: Thereupon the Rishis went to the celestials in great anxiety and addressed them thus, "O immaculate beings, the three worlds have been confounded at the cessation of their sacrifices and ceremonies for the loss of fire. Therefore, be pleased to do the needful. There should not be any loss of time.” Their celestials and the Rishis together having approached the great Brahma,

source: ततस्तौ विरथौ राजन् गदाहस्तौ महाबलौ। चिक्रीडतू रणे शूरौ सशृङ्गाविव पर्वतौ॥
target: Then, O monarch, those two heroic mighty warriors deprived of their cars, armed with their clubs, began to roam in the field of battic like two mountains adorned with peaks,

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच शीलं प्रधानं पुरुषे कथितं ते पितामह। कथं त्वाशा समुत्पन्ना या चाशा तद् वदस्व मे॥
target: Yudhishthira said You have said, O grandfather, that conduct is the first thing (for a man). Whence, however, does Hope arise? Tell me what it is.

source: ततो वायुः प्रादुरभूदधस्तस्य महात्मनः। शब्देन महता तात गर्जन्निव यथा घनः॥
target: Thereupon, a child, (only a quantity of) wind came out of the stomach of the high-souled one with great a sound as that of the roaring clouds.

source: कामं क्रोधं च लोभं च भयं स्वप्नं च पञ्चमम्। परित्यज्य निषेवेत यतवाग् योगसाधनान्॥ ध्यानमध्ययनं दानं सत्यं ह्रीरार्जवं क्षमा। शौचमाहारतः शुद्धिरिन्द्रियाणां च संयमः॥
target: By renouncing desire, anger covetousness, fear and sleep, one should controlling speech, practise the observances favourable to Yoga, viz., contemplation, study, gift, truth, modesty, candour, forgiveness, purity of heart, purity of food, and the subjugation of the senses.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच सैनापत्यं तु सम्प्राप्य कर्णो वैकर्तनस्तदा। तथोक्तश्च स्वयं राज्ञा स्निग्धं भ्रातृसमं वचः॥ योगमाज्ञाप्य सेनानामादित्येऽभ्युदिते तदा। अकरोत् किं महाप्राज्ञास्तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥
target: Dhritarashtra said Having attained the generalship of the army and been addressed by the king himself in sweet and brotherly terms and thereupon having ordered the troops to be arranged in battle-array towards the rise of the Sun, relate to me, O Sanjaya, what did the highly intellectual son of Vikartana, Karna, do at that time.

source: तं तु छित्त्वा रणे भीष्मो नाराचं कालसम्मितम्। निजने कौरवेन्द्रस्य हयान् काञ्चनभूषणान्॥
target: In that battle, Bhishma, having cut off that Naracha that resembled the Destroyer himself, slew the steeds caparisoned with golden ornaments, of that foremost of the Kurus (Yudhishthira).

source: वनानि सरितश्चैव व्यतिक्रम्य शनैः शनैः॥ भचक्राम तं देशं यत्र वै मुनिपुङ्गवः।
target: And gradually passing by woods and fells, he arrived at the place where that foremost of ascetics was.

source: गतेषु वानरेन्द्रेषु रामः सुग्रीवमब्रवीत्। कथं भवान् विजानीते सर्वं वै मण्डलं भुवः॥
target: On the monkey-chiefs having departed, Rāma said to Sugrīva, How is it that you know all the quarters of this earth?'

source: विवाजिसूतो विधनुर्विकेतुः॥ हतो रथाग्रादपतत् स रुग्णः परश्वधैः शाल इवावकृत्तः।
target: That prince fell down dead from the front of his car, bereft of his head, arms, his steeds and banner like a Shala tree hewed down with the axe.

source: संरक्ष्यमाणः पार्थेन भीष्मेण च विवर्जितः। यथा न हन्याद् गाङ्गेय दुःशासन तथा कुरु॥
target: O Dushasana, act in such a way that Shikhandin, who is protected by Arjuna and whom Bhishma will avoid may not (finally) kill the son of Ganga (Bhishma).

source: ततः सीतां महाभागां दृष्ट्वा तां धर्मचारिणीम्। सान्त्वयन्त्यब्रवीद् वृद्धा दिष्ट्या धर्ममवेक्षसे॥
target: Seeing the virtuous Sītā engaged in righteous acts, the old lady consoling her, said "By luck it is that you regard righteousness."

source: क्लृप्तमेव तु तत्रासीत् स्नानीयं पार्थिवोचितम्। असत्कृत्य च तत् सर्वं तत्रैवान्तरधीयत॥ स मुनिः पुनरेवाथ नृपतेः पश्यतस्तदा। नासूयां चक्रतुस्तौ च दम्पती भरतर्षभ॥
target: The various articles necessary for a bath and such as were fit for a king's use, were ready there. Without using, any of those articles, the Rishi once more disappeared there and then by his Yogapower, before king Kushika (and his wife). This, however, O chief of Bharatas, failed to disturb the equanimity of the royal pair.

source: सात्यकिर्भीमसेनश्च धृष्टद्युम्नश्च पार्षतः॥ विराटदुपदौ चोभौ राक्षसश्च घटोत्कचः।
target: arose Then Satyaki, Bhimasena, Prishata's son Dhrishtadyumna, both Virata and Draupada, the Rakshasa Ghatotkacha,

source: दृष्ट्वा सर्वे महात्मानस्ततस्ते वानरर्षभाः। विसृष्टाः पार्थिवेन्द्रेण किष्किन्धां समुपागमन्॥
target: Beholding (the installation of Rāma) the highsouled monkeys, taking leave of the lord of earth, went to Kiskindha.

source: लक्ष्मणस्तु सुसंक्रुद्धो निःश्वसन् वाक्यमब्रवीत्। केनायमपराधेन राजपुत्रो विवासितः॥
target: Thereupon Lakşmaņa waxing wroth, breathing hard, said, For what fault of his has the Prince been banished?

source: सर्वविद्यातिरेकेण जयमिच्छेन्महीपतिः। न मायया न दम्भेन य इच्छेद् भूतिमात्मनः॥
target: That king who wishes for his own prosperity should try to make conquests by fair means, but never with deceit but ones on or with pride.'

source: येन कृच्छ्रात् पाण्डवानुज्जहार तथाऽऽत्मानं नौरिव सागरौघात्। यत्राब्रवीत् सूतपुत्रः सभायां कृष्णां स्थितां श्वशुराणां समीपे॥
target: By this (i.e., the deed of Krishna) she took the sons of Pandu out of their difficulty and herself out of hers, as a sailor takes (a ship) out of the sea waves. There, in that council hall, where was standing Krishna in the presence of her father-in-law, the son of Karna thus addressed her.

source: साब्रवीन्मां ततो देवी नैष धर्मो महाकपे। यत्ते पृष्ठं सिषेवेऽहं स्ववशा हरिपुङ्गव ॥
target: Whereto she replied — 'This is not the pious course, O great monkey, O you the foremost of your race, that I shall, of my own accord, place myself on your back.

source: कामं लोकास्त्रयः सेन्द्राः ससुरासुरमानवाः॥ भवतामग्रतः स्थातुं न पर्याप्ता रणाजिरे।
target: These three worlds combined, with Indra, celestials and mortals, are incapable of long staying before you in the field of battle.

source: सच क्रोधसमाविष्टः पाणौ पाणिं निपीड्य च॥ बाष्पविह्वलया वाचा राजानमिदमब्रवीत्। पिता मे निहतः क्षुद्रैः सुनृशंसेन कर्मणा॥ न तथा तेन तप्यामि यथा राजंस्त्वयाऽद्य वै। शृणु चेदं वचो मह्यं सत्येन वदतः प्रभो॥ इष्टापूर्तेन दानेन धर्मेण सुकृतेन च।
target: Beside himself with anger he squeezed his hands, and addressing the king in a voice choked with tears, he said-'My father was killed by those wretches with a cruel contrivance. That act, however, do not pain me so keenly as this condition to which you have been reduced, O king, Listen to these words of mine which I swear by truth itself, O lord, and by all my acts of piety all my gifts, my religion and the religious merits I have won.

source: पाण्डवाश्च यथा मुक्तास्तथोभौ माधवौ युधि। कृपश्च कृतवर्मा च भारद्वाजस्य चात्मजः॥
target: Tell me how the (five) Pandavas and the two Satvatas (viz., Krishna and Satyaki) and Kripa and Kritavarman and Drona's son, have escaped with life.

source: रथनागाश्वमनुजानर्दयन् निशितैः शरैः। सम्प्रविश्याकरोद् भूमि कबन्धगणसंकुलाम्॥
target: Breaking through the hostije array, he began to afflict car-warriors, elephant-riders, horse-men and infantry with his great arrows; and thus made the earth impassable with headless trunks.

source: वासुदेवमयः सोऽहं त्वयैवास्मि विनिर्मितः। विभज्य भागशोऽऽत्मानं व्रज मानुषतां विभो॥
target: Thus created by the essence of Vamdeva. I have been created by yourself Dividing yourself into portions, O Lord create yourself among humanity.

source: तौ रौक्मिणेयमागम्य वचोऽब्रूतां दिवौकसाम्। नैष वध्यस्त्वया वीर शाल्वराजः कथंचन॥
target: These two (celestials), coming to the son of Rukmani, thus told him the message (sent) by the celestials. They said "O hero, the king Shalva is never to be killed by you.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच तदाज्ञाय हृषीकेशो विसृष्टं पापकर्मणा। हृष्यमाण इदं वाक्यं द्रौणिं प्रत्यब्रवीत्तदा॥ विराटस्य सुतां पूर्वं स्नुषां गाण्डीवधन्वनः उपप्लव्यगतां दृष्ट्वा व्रतवान् ब्राह्मणोऽब्रवीत्॥ परिक्षीणेषु कुरुषु पुत्रस्तव भविष्यति। एतदस्य परिक्षित्त्वं गर्भस्थस्य भविष्यति॥
target: Vaishampayana said “Knowing that weapon was thrown into the wombs of the Pandava women by Drona's sinful son, Hrishikesha, with a cheerful heart, said these words of him:-'Seeing Virata's daughter who is now daughter-in-law to Arjuna, while she was at Upaplavya, a certain pious Brahmana said, while the Kuru line will became extinct, a son will be born to you. This your son, for the reason, will be called by the name of Parikshit.

source: धेन्वाः प्रमाणेन समप्रमाणां धेनुं तिलानामपि च प्रदाया पानीयदाता च यमस्य लोके न यातनां काञ्चिदुपैति तत्र॥
target: are Kine are sacred. They are the foremost of all things in the world. They are indeed the refuge of the universe. They are the mothers of the very celestials. They indeed incomparable. They should be dedicated in sacrifices.

source: इदं हि वेदैः समितं पवित्रमपि चोत्तमम्। श्राव्याणामुत्तमं चेदं पुराणमृषिसंस्तुतम्॥
target: This (Bharata) is equal to the Vedas; it is holy and excellent; it is the worthiest of all that should be listened to. It is a Purana, adored by the Rishis.

source: सा तु रावणवेगेन पुष्पवृष्टिः समन्ततः। समाधूता दशग्रीवं पुनरेवाभ्यवर्तत ॥
target: And that blossoms shower all around, drawn up by the vehemence of the ten-headed Rāvana, again alighted beside him.

source: दस्यूनामिव यद् वृत्तं सभायां कुरुनन्दन। तेन न भ्राजसे राजस्तापसानां समागमे॥
target: O descendant of Kuru, O king, as these wrongs have been perpetrated in your Sabha, wrongs that are like the acts of thieves, you cannot shine in the assembly of ascetics.

source: सधनुर्मण्डल: संख्ये तेजोभास्कररश्मिवान्। शरदीवोदितः सूर्यो नृसूर्यो नृसूर्यो विरराज ह॥
target: Himself emitting great effulgence and wielding that bow drawn to a circle in his hands, he appeared like another autumnal sum.

source: निदर्शयन् कर्णवधं ब्रुवाणः। भूमिस्तु चक्रं ग्रसतीत्यवोचत् कर्णस्य तस्मिन् वधकाल आगते॥
target: Then on the arrival of the hour of Karna's death Kala invisibly appeared on his car and reminding him of the Brahmana's course said-“The earth is devouring the wheel of your car."

source: तस्माद् विधीयतां कश्चित् सारथिदेवसत्तम। सफलां तान गिरं देवकर्तुमर्हसि नो विभो॥
target: In consequence thereof, do you appoint some such best of the celestials as the charioteer. O illustrious one, it is necessary for you to make good of that word said to us.

source: एवंगुण: सम्बभूवेह राजा यस्य क्रतो तत् सुवर्णं प्रभूतम्। तत् त्वं समादाय नरेन्द्र वित्तं यजस्य देवांस्तर्पयानो निवापैः॥
target: So virtuous in this world was that king, at whose sacrifice such an enormous quantity of gold was collected, and now, O prince you must collect that gold and adoring the gods with due rites, do you celebrate this sacrifice.

source: ऋषि उवाच नित्यमुद्यतदण्डः स्यानित्यं विवृतपौरुषः। अच्छिद्रश्छिद्रदर्शी च परेषां विवरानुगः॥
target: The king should always remain with the rod of punishment in his hand. He should always show his prowess. Himself without shortcomings, he should mark those of his enemies. Indeed, his eye should always be used for that object.

source: वासवस्य भवेद् दूतो वैश्रवणस्य वा। प्रेषितो वापि रामेण सीतान्वेषणकाझ्या॥
target: He may be the emissary of Vāsava, or of Vaiśravaņa; or he may have been sent by Rāma himself from eagerness to get at the whereabouts of Sita.

source: इति निश्चित्य मनसा जरत्कारुर्भुजंगमा। तमृषि दीप्ततपसं शयानमनलोपमम्॥ उवाचेदं वचः श्लक्ष्णं ततो मधुरभाषिणी। उत्तिष्ठ त्वं महाभाग सूर्योऽस्तमुपगच्छति॥
target: Having thus thought over the matter, the sweet-voiced snake Jaraikaru, thus spoke to the Rishi, resplendent with asceticism and lying like a mass of flame, "O great Lord, arise, the sun is setting."

source: भुवि कृत्वा शुभं कर्म मोदन्ते दिवि दैवतैः॥ महेन्द्रगुरवः सप्त प्राची वै दिशमाश्रिताः।
target: Indeed, by doing good deeds on Earth, people sport happily in the celestial region, with the celestials. These Rishis are the priests of Indra. They live in the East.

source: अवश्यमेव वक्तव्यं मानुषं वाक्यमर्थवत्। मया सान्त्वयितुं शक्या नान्यथेयमनिन्दिता ॥
target: Must I therefore use the language of a common man or else I shall not be able to console the dame of a blameless person. (This passage clearly indicates that Sanskrit if not spoken by men, and women of the upper classes of the time when Rāmāyaṇa was written, was at least understood by them, and was commonly spoken by men of priestly class and other educated persons")

source: तेऽपि सर्वे निवर्तन्ता ये च सूदानुयायिनः। मया यथोचिताजीव्यैः संविभक्ताश्च वृत्तिभिः॥ चाप्यनुरताः पौरा राजभक्तिपुरः सराः। धृतराष्ट्र महाराजमभिगच्छन्तु ते च वै॥
target: Let all those that depend on cooks also desist (from. following me). Let those citizens that have followed me from loyalty and whom I have hitherto supported properly go back to the great king Dhritarashtra.

source: इमां हि रम्यां गजयूथलोडितां निपीततोयां गजसिंहवानरैः। सुपुष्पितां पुष्पभरैरलंकृतां न सोऽस्ति यः स्यान्न गतक्लमः सुखी॥
target: Bathing in this beauteous stream agitated by herds of elephants, whose waters are drunk by elephants, lions and monkeys, which is graced with flowers, and which is decked with multitudes of blossoms, there is not one who has not his fatigue removed, and who does not feel exhilarated.

source: नानाशास्त्रेषु निष्पन्नं योगेष्विदमुदाहृतम्। परं योगस्य यत् कृत्यं निश्चितं तद् द्विजातिषु॥
target: All this that I have told you has been stated in the various treatises on Yoga. The highest fruits of Yoga are seen in persons of the twiceborn order.

source: अशुभा गतयः प्राप्ताः कष्टा मे पापसेवनात्। काममन्युपरीतेन तृष्णया मोहितेन च॥
target: On account of my indulgence in sin. I had to come by various miserable and inauspicious ends, filled as I was with lust and anger, and deluded by cupidity.

source: एते क्षत्रियदायादास्तत्र तत्र परिश्रुताः॥ धोकारहेमकारादिजातिं नित्यं समाश्रिताः। यदि मामभिरक्षन्ति ततः स्थास्यामि निश्चला॥
target: These children of the Kshatriyas have been heard of as housing in different places. They are residing with artisans and goldsmiths. If they protect me I shall then remain unmoved.

source: ते रक्तकण्ठिनः सर्वे किंनरा इव शिक्षिताः। तुष्टुवुर्नृपतिं वीरं यथा वत्सं प्रहर्षिणः॥
target: And those songsters, well trained and having a musical voice like the Kinnaras, began to eulogise the heroic king, to the increase of his joy.

source: गज सा गजनासोरूय॑दि दृष्ट्वा त्वया भवेत् तां मन्ये विदितां तुभ्यमाख्याहि वरवारण॥
target: O elephant, methinks you do know about the daughter of Janaka having thighs resembling your trunk; pray tell me if you have beheld her.

source: यैः स्म ते नाद्रियेताज्ञा न च ये शासने स्थिताः। पश्यामस्तान् श्रिया हीनान् पाण्डवान् वनवासिनः॥
target: Let us go and see the Pandavas who are now divested of their prosperity, who are now living in the forest, who never obeyed commands and who never owed you subjection.

source: अविध्यदिन्द्रजित् तीक्ष्णैः सौमित्रिं मर्मभेदिभिः। सौमित्रिश्चानलस्पर्शेरविध्यद् रावणि शरैः॥
target: Then Indrajita pierced the son of Sumitra by sharpened arrows capable of penetrating into the vital parts. And the son of Sumitra too wounded the son of Ravana with arrows having the touch of fire.

source: सात्यकिं तु महाराज प्रहसन्निव भारत॥ दुःशासनस्त्रिभिर्विद्ध्वा पुनर्विव्याध पञ्चभिः।
target: But O Bharata, Dushasana, smiling a little, pierced Satyaki O king, first with three and then with five shafts,

source: अपेयात् किल भाः सूर्याल्लक्ष्मीश्चन्द्रमसस्तथा। इति लोको व्यवसितो दृष्ट्वेमां भवतो व्यथाम्॥
target: Seeing your this affliction, (the people of) the world have come to this conclusion that light may (some day) forsake the sun and beauty may (some day) forsake the moon.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच पाण्डवान् धार्तराष्ट्रांश्च कृतास्त्रान् प्रसमीक्ष्य सः। गुर्वर्थं दक्षिणाकाले प्राप्तेऽमन्यत वै गुरुः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Seeing the sons of Pandu and Dhritarashtra accomplished in arms, Drona thought that the time had come when he could demand the preceptor's Dakshina (remuneration).

source: अगृह्णां यच्च ते पाणिमग्निं पर्यणयं च यत्। अनुजानामि तत् सर्वमस्मिल्लोके परत्र च॥
target: I renounce all the advantages pertaining either to this world or the next which I am entitled to by virtue of having obtained your hand and having made you circumambulate the sacrificial fire.

source: न बिभेति परो यस्मान्न बिभेति पराच्च यः। यश्च नेच्छति न द्वेष्टि ब्रह्म सम्पद्यते तदा।॥
target: When a person lives in such a way that another is not filled with fear on seeing him, and when a person is not himself filled with fear on seeing others, when a person ceases to cherish desire and malice, he is then said to attain to Brahma.

source: ब्रह्मावर्तं ततो गच्छेद् ब्रह्मचारी समाहितः। अश्वमेधमवाप्नोति सोमलोकं च गच्छति॥
target: One should then go with concentrated mind and with Brahmacharya life to Brahmavarta. He obtains the fruits of Ashvamedha and goes to the region of Soma.

source: वर्तमाने तथा घोरं संकुले सर्वतोदिशम्। अविज्ञाताः स्म युध्यन्ते विनिघ्नन्तः परस्परम्॥
target: When such a dreadful battle raged on all sides, people not know themselves killed one another.

source: गृहीत्वा लोहमुसलं द्वारं विष्टभ्य तिष्ठति॥ अथ संदर्शनात्तस्य ऊर्ध्वरोमा बभूव सः। हृदयं कम्पते चास्य वेपथुश्चाप्यजायत॥ निमित्तान्यमनोज्ञानि दृष्ट्वा राम व्यचिन्तयत्।
target: And taking up an iron mace he stood at the gate. Beholding him, Daśānana's hairs stood on their end his heart and body trembled. And seeing these bad omens, O Rama, he began to think within himself.

source: अर्जुनाभिमुखे तस्मिन्रावणे राक्षसाधिपे। चण्डः प्रवाति पवनः सनादः सरजस्तथा॥
target: Ravana, the lord of Raksasas, having set out with a hostile intention against Kārtavīryarjuna, the wind mixed with dust began to blow high with tumultuous sound.

source: ते वर्म भित्वा पुरुषोत्तमस्य सुवर्णचित्रा न्यपतन् सुमुक्ताः। वेगेन गामाविविशुः सुवेगाः स्नात्वा च कर्णाभिमुखाः प्रतीयुः॥
target: Those well-directed and mighty shafts, winged with gold, after piercing the armour of that noblest of human beings, entered the earth and having bathed (in the water of Bhogavati) again return towards Karna.

source: परिगृह्य तु कैकेयी श्वशुरं सुकृतेन मे। मम प्रव्राजनं भर्तुर्भरतस्याभिषेचनम्।७।। द्वावयाचत भर्तारं सत्यसंधं नृपोत्तमम्।
target: Bringing my father-in-law under control by means of her virtuous deeds, Kaikeyi begged, of that truthful, best of monarchs, two boons namely the exile of my husband into woods and the installation of Bharata,

source: सराक्षसगणा राजन् सकिन्नरमहोरगा। जङ्गमाः स्थावराः सर्वे नालं पार्थस्य संयुगे॥
target: And the Rakshasas, the Kinnaras and the reptiles, O king, in fact, with all the mobile and immobile creatures, cannot withstand Pritha's son Arjuna in battle.

source: बभञ्ज चैनां त्वरितो जानुन्यारोप्य भारत। पश्यतः पार्थिवेन्द्रस्य तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: Then before before the very eyes eyes of the Pragjyotishas, O Bharata, he broke it into pieces placing it on his things. This feat was indeed wonderful.

source: नाथं पतगलोकस्य चितिमारोपयाम्यहम्। इमं धक्ष्यामि सौमित्रे हृतं रौद्रेण रक्षसा॥
target: Placing on a funeral pile, I shall cremate, O Saumitrī, the dead body of this king of birds who has been destroyed by the grim-visaged Raksasas.

source: भरद्वाज उवाच चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य वर्णेन यदि वर्णो विभिद्यते। सर्वेषां खलु वर्णानां दृश्यते वर्णसंकरः॥
target: Bharadwaja said If the distinction between the four castes be made by means only of colour, then it seems that all the four orders have been intermixed.

source: स भवान् परमं वेद पावनं पुरुषं प्रति। तेन संयोजयेथास्त्वं तीर्थपुण्येन पाण्डवान्॥
target: You know the great means by which men are purified. Therefore, persuade the Pandavas to acquire the virtue which is obtained by visiting Tirthas.

source: ताभिराश्वासिता सीता रावणं राक्षसाधिपम्। उवाचात्महितं वाक्यं वृत्तशौटीर्यगर्वितम्॥
target: Thus consoled by them, and being proud of her good conduct and her husband's heroism, Sītā thus addressed Rāvana, the lord of Raksasas.

source: स तेन नागप्रवरेण पार्थिवो भृशं जगाहे द्विषतामनीकिनीम्। पुरा सुगुप्तां विवुधैरिवाहवे विरोचनो देववरूथिनीमिव॥
target: That monarch (Bhagadatta) with that foremost elephant of his, thoroughly agitated the host of the enemy, like Virochana agitating in battle the celestial host well-protected by the immortals in the days of yore.

source: स तत्र बहुभिः शूरैः संनिरुद्धो महारथैः॥ न चचाल तदा राजन् सात्यकिः सत्यविक्रमः।
target: There he was opposed by many heroic carwarriors; in consequence whereof, Satyaki of uobaffled prowess could not move even one step forward.

source: नारायण न जानीषे क्षात्रधर्म पुरातनम्। अयुद्धमनसो भीतानस्मान्हंसि यथेतरः॥
target: O Nārāyaṇa, you are ignorant of the timehonoured morality of Kşatriyas; and therefore like a base wight you slay us, desisting from fight and exercised with fear.

source: ततः सा बाष्पकलया वाचा दुःखेन कर्शिता। उवाच नैषधं भैमी शोकोपहतचेतना॥

target: Arriving at Kurukshetra, the powerful Pandavas, accompanied with the Somakas, advanced against the Kurus with the desire of victory.

source: ततो भग्ने बले तस्मिन् विप्रलीने समन्ततः। सव्यसाचिनि संक्रुद्धे त्रैगर्तान् भयमाविशत्॥
target: When that host was shattered and scattered in all directions and when Savyasachin was inflamed with wrath, panic seized Trigarttas.

source: पञ्चधारणके ह्यस्मिन् शरीरे जीवितं कुतः। तेषामन्यतराभावाच्चतुर्णां नास्ति संशयः॥
target: How we can say that there is life in this animal body which is composed of the five elements? If one of those clements disappear, the dissolution of the other four is brought about.

source: जहाति मृत्युं च जरां भयं च न क्षुत्पिपासे मनसोऽप्रियाणि। दन्यत्र वै चेन्द्रियप्रीणनाद्धि॥
target: Death does away with decrepitude, fear, as also hunger and thirst and all that is disagreeable to the mind. There is no duty there but delighting in one's senses.

target: Taking white vessels full of water, thousands of well-trained survivors stood waiting before the high-souled (Rāma).

target: The earth devours these two, as a serpent destroys living in holes viz., a king who is not a warrior and a Brahmana who has never been away form home (to holy places).

source: ततः प्रागुत्तरां गत्वा सागराः प्रथिताः दिशम्। रोषादभ्यखनन् सर्वं पृथिवीं सगरात्मजाः॥
target: Then repairing to the famous North eastern region, Sagara's sons becoming enraged, began to dig the earth.

source: अतो भूयोऽपि नेदानीमिक्ष्वाकुपुरवासिनः। स्वपेयुरनुरक्ता मा वृक्षमूलेषु संश्रिताः॥
target: Attached to me, the denizons of Ikşvāku's city will not again indulge in sleep underneath trees.

target: O best of the Bharata race, he who knows these to be the true sacred Gayatri which possesses every virtue, is not liable to worldly destruction.

source: तस्यास्थिभिरथो शक्रः समप्रहृष्टमनास्तदा। कारयामास दिव्यानि नानाप्रहरणानि च॥ गदावज्राणि चक्राणि गुरून् दण्डांश्च पुष्कलान्।
target: With his bones, Shakra gladly made many kinds of weapons, such as thunder-bolts, disci, heavy maces and many kinds of clubs and bludgeons.

source: तृप्तिराश्चर्यभूतानां कथानां नास्ति मे विभो। कर्मकालो मुनिश्रेष्ठ लम्बते रविमण्डलम्॥
target: O Kusika's son. I never, O lord, am tired of listening to that wonderful narration. Now, O foremost of ascetics, the hour for performing the daily devotions has arrived, and the solar disc hangs aslope.

source: इमे स्म परमोदाराः किंकराः पाण्डुनन्दन॥ प्रणिपत्य ततः पार्थः समालभ्य च पाणिना। सर्वाणि मानसानीह भवतेत्यभ्यभाषत॥
target: "We are here, O illustrious one, we are your servants, O son of Pandu.” Then saluting and taking them with his hands he said "Do you all live in my memory." Then taking all those weapons he became of delighted countenance.

source: एवमुक्तस्तया भीष्मः कन्यया विप्रसंसदि। चिन्तामभ्यगमद् वीरो युक्तां तस्यैव कर्मणः॥
target: Thus addressed by that maiden before the Brahmanas, the heroic Bhishma began to reflect what should be done. to my

source: रामवृक्षं रणे हन्मि सीतापुष्पफलप्रदम्। प्रशाका यस्य सुग्रीवो जाम्बवान्कुमुदो नलः॥ द्विविदश्चैव मैन्दश्च अङ्गदो गन्धमादनः। हनूमांश्च सुषेणश्च सर्वे च हरियूथपाः ॥
target: I shall destroy Rāma-like tree in the conflict whose flower is Sītā and whose branches are Sugrīva, Jāmbavān, Kumuda, Nala, Divida, Mainda, Angada Gandhamadana, Hanuman and all other leading monkeys.

source: नकुलं त चतुःषष्ट्या धृष्टद्युम्नं च पञ्चभिः। सप्तभिद्रौपदेयांश्च त्रिभिर्विव्याध सात्यकिम्॥ धनुश्चिच्छेद भल्लेन सहदेवस्य मारिष।
target: And he struck Nakula with sixty four and Dhrishtadyumna with five and the sons of Draupadi with seven and Satyaki with three arrows. With a broad-headed arrow, he then, O king, cut off the bow of Sahadeva.

source: उर्वशीतीर्थमासाद्य ततः सोमाश्रमं बुधः। कुम्भकर्णाश्रमं गत्वा पूज्यते भुवि मानवः॥
target: Going to the Tirtha called Urvashi and then to Somasrama and bathing at Kumbhakarnasrama a wise man becomes adored on earth.

source: अलोहं निशितं शस्त्रं शरीरपरिकर्तनम्। यो वेत्ति न तु तं नन्ति प्रतिघातविदं द्विषः॥
target: He, who knows that there are sharp weapons capable of cutting the body though not made of iron and understands also the means of warding them off, can never be injured by the enemy.

source: प्रगृहीता बभौ तेषां वस्त्राणामावलिः शिवा ॥ शरदभ्रप्रतीकाशा हंसावलिरिवाम्बरे।
target: The various gorgeous attires which they had worn resembled rows of cranes in the sky, looking like autumnal clouds.

source: तासां नादो रुदतीनां तदासीद् राजन् दुःखात् कुररीणामिवोच्चैः। ततो निष्पेतुर्ब्राह्मणक्षत्रियाणां विट्शूद्राणां चैव भार्याः समन्तात्॥
target: The wail they uttered at that time, O king, from sorrow, resembled the loud lainentations of a swarm of she-ospreys. Then the wives of the citizens-Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, and Vaishyas and Shudras-also came out into the streets from all sides.

source: ततो देवगणाः सर्वे सेन्द्राः सहधनेश्वराः। नारदं प्रेषयामासुः श्वसनं च मनोजवम्॥
target: Thereupon all the celestials with Indra and the lord of wealth (Kubera) at their head sent (to Pradyumna) Narada and the god of wind (Vayu) with the speed of mind.

source: एतत् ते सुकृतं कर्म नात्र किंचन युज्यते। वयमप्यनूजानीमो नात्र दोषोऽस्ति कश्चन॥
target: It is your noblest duty; nor is there any impropriety in it; we all assent to it and there is no guilt in that.

source: सा गृहीतातिचुक्रोश रावणेन यशस्विनी। रामेति सीता दुःखार्ता रामं दूरं गतं वने॥
target: The virtuous Sīta, being thus caught by Ravana, began to cry aloud, addressing Rama, who had gone away to a distant forest.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच बभूव ब्राह्मणः कश्चिन्माण्डव्य इति विश्रुतः। धृतिमान् सर्वधर्मज्ञः सत्ये तपसि च स्थितः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : There was a certain Brahmana, who was known as Mandavya. He was learned in all the precepts of virtue; he was devoted to truth and asceticism.

source: अपि त्रैलोक्यराज्यस्य हेतोः किं नु महीकृते॥ निहत्य धार्तराष्ट्रान् नः का प्रीतिः स्याज्जनार्दन।
target: Not even for the sake of the sovereignty over the three worlds, much less for that of this earth! What pleasure will be ours, O Janardana, by killing Dhritarashtra's sons!

source: अतिष्ठन्मारुताहारः शतं किल समाः प्रभुः। आराधयन्महादेवं बहुरूपमुमापतिम्॥
target: The powerful Vyasa remained there for a hundred years, living on air alone, engaged in worshipping many formed Mahadeva, the lord ofUma.

source: उद्याने क्रियमाणे तु मत्स्यानां तत्र रज्जुभिः। प्रविश्यान्तरमेतेषां स्थितः सम्प्रतिपत्तिमान्॥ गृह्यमेव तदुद्यानं गृहीत्वा तं तथैव सः। सर्वानेव च तांस्तत्र ते विदुर्ग्रथितानिति॥
target: When the fishermen began to tie up the fishes they had caught, the Shakula who was known for presence of mind placed himself in the midst of those that had been so tied and remained quietly among them, biting the string, for he thought that by it they would take him to have been caught. The fisherman believed that all the fishes tied to the string had been caught.

source: प्रियमेतदुपश्रुत्य शत्रूणां च पराभवम्। कृतकृत्यश्च कौरव्य विधत्स्व यदनन्तरम्॥
target: Hearing this pleasant news of the defeat of our enemy, do you decide, O Kauravya, as to what you should do hereafter.

target: And when the king of the gods came to know that Brihaspati was much aggrieved, he went to him attended by the Immortals and spoke to him thus.

target: O king, Death himself, has taken birth in the form of your son. Slaughter is never spoken high of in the Vedas. It can never produce any good.

source: वेगवन्तः प्लवन्तो ये प्लवगा मारुतात्मज । तेषां मुख्यतमं मन्ये त्वामहं कपिकुञ्जर ॥
target: O Son of Maruta, O best of monkeys, I know you to be the foremost of all monkeys.

target: The Sovereign of all this world, resembling Mahendra or Varuna, Rāma, the graceful son of Dasaratha, entered the woods of Dandaka, in company with his brother, Laksmana, as well as his spouse, Vaidehi. His wife has been forcibly carried of by Rāvana.

source: ततः संश्राव्यमाणेषु राज्ञां नामसु भारत। अत्यकामद् धार्तराष्ट्र सा कन्या वरवर्णिनी॥
target: The names of the kings being mentioned to her that fair maiden passed by the son of Dhritarashtra as she had passed others before him.

source: पश्चान्नारदमव्यग्रौ पाद्यार्थ्याभ्यामथार्चतः॥ पीठयोचोपविष्टौ तौ कृतातिथ्याह्निको नृप।

target: According to qualities and (fruits of) actions, I have created four castes. Though I am their Creator, yet know me as being not a creator and not perishable.

target: O son, this Raibhya is greatly powerful, so are his two sons. Therefore, be careful never to approach him.

target: It was embellished on all sides) with various animals, diverse trees and big mansions made by Viśvakarmāt himself. It was adorned all around with artificial forests and all the trees there bore flowers and fruits, spreading their branches like to umbrellas and having golden and silvern pavements under them. target: Was he not alone and forlorn, while slain by the Pandavas in battle? O son, it was told by you beforehand how the heroes my side were slain.

target: Assuring one another, they should cheer up the cheerless. The victor should protect the newly conquered country. He should not cause his troops to pursue the dispersed enemies.

source: हा पुत्र मम मन्दायाः कथमेत्यासि संयुगम्। निधनं प्राप्तवांस्तात पितुस्तुल्यपराक्रमः॥
target: Alas! son of my unfortunate self, why did you go to the battle? Oh son equal in prowess to your father, how could you perish?

target: He was a Brahmachari, always engaged in austere penances, regular in meals, a great Rishi of controlled sexual desire. He was known by the name of Jaratkaru.

source: पूर्णमापूरयंस्तेषां द्विषच्छोकावहोऽभवत्। असूर्यमिव सूर्येण निवातमिव वायुना।। कृष्णेन समुपेतेन जहषे भारतं पुरम्॥
target: Was brought to a full limit by the wealth that he (Krishna) brought, and thus all their (the Pandava's) griefs were removed. By the arrival of Krishna, the capital of the Bharata race was gladdened like a sunless region by the sun, or a region of still air by gentle breeze.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच ये सर्वभूतेषु निवृत्तकामा अमांसादा न्यस्तदण्डाश्चरन्ति। न हिंसन्ति स्थावरं जङ्गमं च भूतानां ये सर्वभूतात्मभूताः॥ निराशिषो निर्ममा वीतरागा लाभालाभे तुल्यनिन्दाप्रशंसाः। तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र॥
target: Dhritarashtra said Those men who are freed from desire for all articles of enjoyment, who abstain from meat, who never take up the rod of punishment, and never inflict the least harm on mobile and immobile creatures, who have formed themselves the soul of all creatures, who never accost others by pronouncing blessings upon them, who are entirely freed from the idea of mineness, who are shorn of attachments for every thing, who view profit and loss as also praise and blame in equal light, only those men, O great Rishi, go to such regions. I shall go to a higher region. Indeed, Dhritarashtra shall not go there.

source: सान्त्वयित्वा तु तं पुत्रं निष्क्रम्सयान्त:पुरानृपः। ऋत्विजा सहितो राजन् सहामात्य उपाविशत्॥

source: एकादशविकारात्मा कलासम्भारसम्भृतः। मूर्तिमन्तं हि तं विद्धि नित्यं योगजितात्मकम्॥ तस्मिन् यः संस्थितो ह्यग्निर्नित्यं स्थाल्यामिवाहितः। आत्मानं तं विजानीहि नित्यं योगजितात्मकम्॥ देवो यः संस्थितस्तस्मिन्नबिन्दुरिव पुष्करे। क्षेत्रज्ञं तं विजानीहि नित्यं योगजितात्मकम्॥ जीवात्मकानि जानीहि रजः सत्त्वं तमस्तथा। जीवमात्मगुणं विद्धि तथाऽऽत्मानं परात्मकम्॥
target: Know that the soul is embodied in the corporeal disguise, in the eleven alloteopus conditions (of the animal system) and that though eternal, its normal state is apparently modified by its accompaniments even like the fire purified in its pan, eternal yet with its course altered by its surroundings; and that the divine thing which is kindred with the body is related to the latter in the same way as a drop of water to sleek surface of a lotus leaf on which it rolls; know that Sattva Raja and Tama are the attributes of all life. Life is the attribute of spirit and spirit again is the attribute of the Supreme Soul.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवं गतेषु पार्थेषु विसृष्टे च सुयोधने। आगते हास्तिनपुरं मोक्षिते पाण्डुनन्दनैः॥ भीष्मोऽब्रवीन्महाराज धार्तराष्ट्रमिदं वचः।

source: अत्र धर्मश्च सत्यं च कर्म चात्र निगद्यते। गतिरेषा द्विजश्रेष्ठ कर्मणामवसायिनाम्॥
