source: ते तु सर्वे वरुणस्योत यज्ञं द्रष्टुं गता इह आयान्ति भूयः। अष्टावक्रं पूजये पूजनीयं यस्य हेतोर्जनितारं समेष्ये॥
target: They had all gone to see Varuna's sacrifice. Behold they are (all) coming. I pay homage to the revered Ashtavakra by whose favour I shall today join him who has begotten me.

source: अविषह्यं ततो दृष्ट्वा राधेयं युधि योधिनः। भीमसेनमुपागच्छन् कर्णबाणप्रपीडिताः॥
target: Thereupon seeing the son of Radha irrepressible in battle all those warriors, assailed by Karna's shafts, approached Bhimasena.

source: इति पृष्टा सुमनया मधुरं चारुहासिनी। शाण्डिली निभृतं वाक्यं सुमनामिदमब्रवीत्॥ नाहं कापायवसना नापि वल्कलधारिणी। च जटिला भूत्वा देवत्वमागता॥ अहितानि च वाक्यानि सर्वाणि परुषाणि च। अप्रमत्ता च भर्तारं कदाचिन्नाहमब्रुवम॥
target: Thus questioned swectly by Sumana, Stiandili of sweet smiles, addressing her fair interrogatrix, thus answered her silently. I did not wear yellow robes; nor barks of trees. I did not shave my head; nor did I keep matted locks on my head. It is not on account of these deeds that I have acquired the status of a celestial. I never carelessly addressed any harsh words to my husband.

source: दत्त्वा धेनुं सुव्रतां साधुदोहां कल्याणवत्सामपलायिनीं च। स्तावन्ति वर्षाणि भवन्त्यमुत्र॥
target: By giving away a goodnatured cow, that quietly allows herself to be milked, that always brings forth living and healthy calves, and that does not fly away from the owner's house, the giver enjoys happiness in the next world for as many years as there are hairs on her body.

source: तौ दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ तत्र प्रवीरौ पुरुषर्षभौ। शयानौ पुण्डरीकाक्षौ कुमारविव पावकी॥ शरतल्पगतौ वीरौ तथाभूतौ नरर्षभौ। दुःखार्ता करुणं सीता सुभृशं विललाप ह॥
target: Seeing those brothers, foremost of heroes and best of men-having eyes resembling white lotuses, and them selves like to Kumāras, lying in the field,* the fire sprung one, Sītā stricken with grief, beg a to weep piteously. *Virān narashabhān-heroes and best of menoccurs again, left out on the score of redendancy.

source: को जिजीविषुरासादेद् धृष्टद्युम्नं च पार्षतम्। पञ्चैतान् पाण्डवेयांस्तु द्रौपद्याः कीर्तिवर्धनान्॥
target: What man valuing his life can approach the descendant of Prishata Dhrishtadyumna also the five sons of the Pandavas who have added to Draupadi's glory.

source: ततो हयैश्च संयोज्य हरितैः स्यन्दनोत्तमम्।। ततः काञ्चनचित्राङ्गः किङ्किणीशतभूषितः॥ तरुणादित्यसंकाशो वैदूर्यमयकूबरः। सदश्वैः काञ्चनापीडैर्युक्तः श्वेतप्रकीर्णकैः॥ हरिभिः सूर्यसंकाशैर्हेमजालविभूषितैः। रुक्मवेणुध्वजः श्रीमान्देवराजरथो वरः॥ देवराजेन संदिष्टो रथमारुह्य मातलिः। अभ्यवर्तत काकुत्स्थमवतीर्य त्रिविष्टपात्॥
target: Then yoking with steeds that best of cars, curiously wrought with gold; adorned with hundreds of small bells; resembling the Sun new risen; having its pole studded with lapises: yoked with excellent horses caparisoned in gold; furnished with white chowris, drawn by steeds resembling the Sun; decked with golden networks, and provided with a golden standardthe graceful car of the sovereign of the celestialsMātalī commanded by the king of the immortals, ascending the car went out of the celestial regions and came to Käkutstha.

source: विविधायुधहस्ताश्च शूलमुद्गरपाणयः। गदाभिः पट्टिशैर्दण्डैरायसैर्मुसलैरपि॥ परिधैर्भिन्दिपालैश्च भल्लैः पाशैः परश्वधैः। निर्ययू राक्षसा घोरा नर्दन्तो जलदा यथा॥
target: And bearing various weapons in their hands, and wielding darts and clubs, and equipped with maces and bearded darts and rods and iron bludgeons and parighas and bhindipālas and lances and nooses and axes, those terrific Rāks asas sallied out roaring like to clouds.

source: गङ्गोवाच तिष्ठन्त्येते यथास्थान नगा टेकनिकेतनाः। ते त्यजन्ति ततः स्थान प्रातिलोम्यान्न वेतसः॥
target: Ganga said Trees stand in one and the same place and are never displaced from where they stand. For this by their nature resisting our currents, they are obliged to leave the place of their growth. Canes, however, act otherwise.

source: पार्थहेतोः पराक्रान्तो भीष्मस्यायोधनं प्रति। आर्जुनि कोसलैन्द्रस्तु विद्ध्वा पञ्चभिरायसैः॥
target: Displaying his prowess, for helping his father Arjuna then rushing at the car of Bhishma. Then the ruler of the Kosalas having pierced Arjuna's son with five dares made of iron,

source: यज्ञाङ्गान्यपि चैतानि यज्ञोक्तान्यनुपूर्वशः। विधिना विधियुक्तानि धारयन्ति परस्परम्॥
target: The things named above as the limbs of sacrifice, and those that have been mentioned as necessary in sacrifices and that are indicated in the ordinances, all maintain one another when used according to the approved ritual.

source: तत्र धर्मपरो भूत्वा त्रितः स सुमहातपाः । कूपे च वसता तेन सोमः पीतो महात्मना॥
target: The great and pious ascetic Trita had lived there. While in a hole that great man had drunk the Soma juice.

source: कथमुत्सृज्य गन्तासि दक्षां भार्यामनुव्रताम्। विशेषतोऽनपकृते परेणापकृते सति॥
target: Why have you gone away forsaking your able and devoted, wife, specially when she had done you no harın, but you have been wronged by others?

source: आतपत्रेण सदृशे शिरसी देवयोस्तयोः। एवं लक्षणसम्पन्नौ महापुरुषसंज्ञितौ॥
target: The heads of those two gods were large and round, resembling open umbrellas. Endued with these marks, they were certainly very superior persons in appearance.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रतियाते तु दाशार्हे राजा दुर्योधनस्तदा। कर्णं दुःशासनं चैव शकुनि चाब्रवीदिदम्॥
target: Vaishampayana said The scion of the Dasharha race having gone away, the king Duryodhana then said thus to Karna, Dushasana and Shakuni.

source: एवमेष क्षयो वृत्तः पाण्डवानां ततस्ततः। तावकानामपि रणे भीमं प्राप्य महाबलम्॥
target: And thus the losses which attended the Pandava forces in their several divisions, were equal to those of your own, when the allpowerful Bhima joined them (the Pandavas) in the field.

source: तत्र कामगुणैः सर्वैः समुपेतो मुदा युतः। महाभोगो महाकोशो धनी भवति मानवः॥
target: In that life he gets all articles for gratifying his wishes and appetites. Indeed, blessed with the possession of such articles, he gets riches and a wellfilled treasury.

source: अमर्षजो हि संतापः पावकाद् दीप्तिमत्तरः। येनाहमभिसंतप्तो न नक्तं न दिवा शये॥
target: The pain that one feels in suppressing his anger is more burning than fire itself. I burn with it even now and I cannot sleep either in the night or in the day.

source: गदायुद्धविशेषज्ञो गदायुद्धविशारदः। कृतवान् रौहिणेयो यत् तन्ममाचक्ष्व संजय॥
target: “Tell me, O Sanjaya, what Rohini's son, well-skilled in mace encounters and well acquainted with all its rules did on that occasion!"

source: तस्य पार्थिवतामीप्से करस्तस्मै प्रदीयताम्। भवान् पितृसखा चैव प्रीयमाणो मयापि च। ततो नाज्ञापयामि त्वां प्रीतिपूर्वं प्रदीयताम्॥
target: I desire to see him acquire (it) the imperial dignity. Let tribute be paid by you to him. You are my father's friend, and you have been also gratified by me. I cannot command you. Therefore, let the tribute be paid by you with cheerfulness and at your own (free) will.

source: अमावास्यां हि पितरः पौर्णमास्यां हि देवताः। मन्मुखेनैव हूयन्ते भुञ्जते च हुतं हविः॥ सर्वभक्षः कथं त्वेषां भविष्यामि मुखं त्वहम्।
target: At the new-moon the Pitris and at the fullmoon the Devas are fed through my mouth with the oblations are offered unto me. Being their mouths, how can I be the eater of all things?"

source: सत्यं चानृततः श्रेयो नृशंस्याच्चानृशंसता। तमेवं बहुदोषं तु क्रोधं साधुविवर्जितम्॥ मादृशः प्रसृजेत् कस्मात् सुयोधनवधादपि। तेजस्वीति यमा हुर्वै पण्डिता दीर्घदर्शिनः॥ न क्रोधोऽभ्यन्तरस्तस्य भवतीति विनिश्चितम्। यस्तु क्रोधं समुत्पन्नं प्रज्ञया प्रतिबाधते॥ तेजस्विनं तं विद्वांसो मन्यन्ते तत्त्वदर्शिनः क्रुद्धो हि कार्यं सुश्रोणि न यथावत् प्रपश्यति। नाकार्यं न च मर्यादां नरः क्रुद्धोऽनुपश्यति॥
target: Truth is superior to untruth and gentle to cruel conduct; why should I, for slaying Suyodhana, display that anger of many evils, renounced by the virtuous? The far-sceing sages regard him as a man of character in whom anger does not exist; the learned men, seeing the real things, always regard him as a man of character who restrains his rising wrath. O you of fair hips, the angry man does not observe the real state of things; the angry man does not see his way nor regard persons.

source: आत्मकेवलतां प्राप्तस्तत्र गत्वा न शोचति। ईदृशं परमं स्थानं निरयास्ते च तादृशाः॥
target: That Reciter who becomes identified with his Soul (by withdrawing everything into it) goes there. He has, after this, never to experience any sorrow. This region is called Supreme. The other regions are hell.

source: पार्कण्डेय उवाच बाढमित्येव तं व्याधः कृताञ्जलिरुवाच ह। प्रदक्षिणमथो कृत्वा प्रस्थितो द्विजसत्तमः॥
target: Markandeya said : The Fowler with joined hands said to him, "So be it.” That foremost of Brahmanas then walked round him and went away.

source: दृष्ट्वोपविष्टां राजर्षिः पाण्डवो महिषीं प्रियाम्। प्रत्युवाच स धर्मात्मा द्रौपदी चारुदर्शनाम्॥ धर्म्य धर्मेण धर्मज्ञे प्राप्तास्ते निधनं शुभे। पुत्रास्ते भ्रातरश्चैव तान्न शोचितुमर्हसि॥
target: Seeing his dear queen sit in Praya, the royal and pious sage Yudhishthira addressed her, saying,-'O auspicious lady, you do not follow the code of morality, your sons and brothers have met with a noble death. You should not grieve for them.

source: महानदी च कौरव्य तथा मणिजला नदी॥ चक्षुर्वर्धनिका चैव नदी भरतसत्तम।
target: Mahanadi, the Manijala, Chakshuas, and the river Vardhanika, O descendant of Kuru, O best of the Bharata race.

source: तत्रोपविष्टं पृथुदीर्घबाहुं ददर्श कृष्णः सहरौहिणेयः। प्युपोपविष्टाङ्ग्वलनप्रकाशान्॥
target: Krishna with the son of Rohini (Balarama) saw there seated Ajatashatru of well developed and long arms and sitting round him were his younger brothers, surpassing the splendour of fire.

source: एवमेष महानात्मा सर्गप्रलयकोविदः। विकुर्वाणः प्रकृतिमानभिमन्यत्यबुद्धिमान्॥
target: It is in this way that the Soul, becoming united with Nature and invested with Ignorance, undergoes changes and becomes conscious of Self.

source: नाहं भीषयितुं शक्यो वामात्रेण कथंचन। अन्यं जानिहि यः शक्यस्त्वया भीषयितुं रणे।॥
target: I am not to be frightened by mere words. O Shalya, he, whom you will be able to frighten in battle, is some other person.

source: ते शङ्खनादेन कुरुप्रवीराः सम्मोहिताः पार्थसमीरितेन। उत्सृज्य चापानि दुरासदानि सर्वे तदा शान्तिपरा बभूवुः॥
target: The sound was so loud that it fainted all warriors fighting for Kauravas and they stunned in unconscious state so deep as the arms/weapons in their hands were dropped down when the conch was blown by Arjuna.

source: यथा हि शिशिरापाये दहेत् कक्षं हुताशनः। तथा तदस्रं पाण्डूनां ददाह ध्वजिनीं प्रभो॥
target: O lord, as fire consumes a heap of dry grass in summer, even so did that weapon begin to consume the army of the Pandavas.

source: बृहस्पतिरुवाच कृत्वा पापानि कर्माणि अधर्मवशमागतः। मनसा विपरीतेन निरयं प्रतिपद्यते॥
target: Brihaspati said By committing sinful deeds with perverted mind, one gives way to the influence of sin, and accordingly goes to Hell.

source: विदुर उवाच राजन् बहुतमश्चासि त्रैलोक्यस्यापि सत्तमः। सम्भावितश्च लोकस्य सम्मतश्चासि भारत॥
target: Vidura said O king, you are thought very well of in the there worlds, indeed as, the best of men. You are beloved by the world and respected as well, OBharata.

source: एकाग्रता च मनसः प्राणायामस्तथैव च। प्राणायामस्तु सगुणो निर्गुणो मनसस्तथा॥
target: One is the concentration of the mind, and the other is called Pranayama (suppression of vital airs). Pranayama is said to be real; while concentration of mind is unsubstantial to it.

source: अथ वर्षगणानेवं स्वर्गलोके महीयते। ततो गन्धर्वसहितः सहस्राण्येकविंशतिम्॥ पुरन्दरपुरे रम्ये शक्रेण सह मोदते। दिव्ययानविमानेषु लोकेषु विविधेषु च॥ दिव्यनारीगणाकीर्णो निवसत्यमरो यथा। ततः सूर्यस्य भवने चन्द्रस्य भवने तथा॥ शिवस्य भवने राजन् विष्णोर्याति सलोकताम्। एवमेतन्महाराज नात्र कार्या विचारणा॥
target: Thus accoutred, he received great honours in the celestial region for many long years. With Gandharvas in his company, for full twenty-one thousand years, he sports in bliss with Indra himself in the abode of Indra. He roves at pleasure every day through the various celestial regions, riding on celestial cars and conveyances, and surrounded by celestial dainsels of great beauty. He is able to go to the abode of the Sun, of the Moon, and of Shiva. O king, Indeed, he succeeds in living in the same region with Vishnu himself. It is even so, O inonarch. There is no doubt in this,

source: सुवर्णपुङ्खा नाराचाः शत्रुघ्ना वैद्युतप्रभाः॥ त्वयास्तास्तस्य वर्माणि भित्वा पास्यन्ति शोणितम्।
target: Let the gold-feathered iron shafts, capable of dealing death to the enemies and emitting rays of lightning, sped by you go straight into the vital organs and drink his blood.

source: प्रतिविन्ध्यं तु समरे कुवार्णं कर्म दुष्करम्। दुःशासनसिभिर्बाणैर्ललाटे समविध्यत॥
target: In (that) battle, Prativindhya, who was achieving frightful feats, was pierced by Dushasana in the forehead with three arrows.

source: गजो गजेन समरे रथिनं च रथी ययौ। अश्वोऽश्वं समभिप्रायात् पदातिश्च पदातिनम्॥
target: In that battle elephants rushed against elephants, car-warriors against car-warriors, horseman against horseman and foot-soldiers against foot-soldiers.

source: रेषा मृत्युर्देवदिष्टा प्रजानाम्। प्राप्ते काले संहरन्ती यथावत् स्वयं कृता प्राणहरा प्रजानाम्॥
target: Renouncing all grief, he has obtained the fellowship of the virtuous. Death has been ordained for all corporeal beings by the Creator himself. So when their days are numbered, they suffer destruction. The death of creatures is brought about by their ownselves.

source: सत्क्रियां हि भवानेतां प्रतीच्छतु मया कृताम्। राजंस्त्वमतिथिश्रेष्ठः पूजनीयः प्रयत्नतः॥
target: Do you receive the hospitality which I extend to you. O king, you are the foremost of guests, and art worthy of assiduous homage.'

source: समृद्धैश्चाश्वमेधैश्च इष्ट्वा परमदुर्जयः॥ राजवंशांश्च बहुशो बहून्संस्थापयिष्यति।
target: None shall be able to vanquish him. He shall celebrate many a horse-sacrifice with profuse gifts and shall establish many royal families.

source: अक्षैर्हि शिक्षितोऽभ्येति निकृत्यैव युधिष्ठिरः। विद्वानविदुषोऽभ्येति नाहुस्तां निकृति जनाः॥
target: O Yudhishthira, so also a man skilled in dice approaches one who is not so from the desire of vanquishing (his opponent). One who is conversant with the truths of science approaches another that is not from the desire of victory, which is scarcely an honest motive.

source: ततस्तु निनदं गोरं कृत्वा युद्धाय चाह्वयत्। परिवारैः परिवृत्तो नादर्भिन्दनिवाम्बरम्॥
target: Setting up a terrible uproar and rending the sky with his cry (Sugrīva) encircled by his kinsmen, invited (Vāli) to battle.

source: स क्षुपो नाम सम्भूतः प्रजापतिररिंदम्। ऋत्विगासीन्महाराज यज्ञे तस्य महात्मनः॥
target: The divine being, O chastiser of foes, who was thus born from Brahman passed by the name of Kshupa. Highly powerful be became a lord of creatures. That Kshupa officiated as priest, O king, in the sacrifice of the highsouled Grandfather.

source: शत्रुरेष त्वया वीर देवगन्धर्वभोगिनाम्। यक्षाणां दानवानां च महर्षीणां च पातितः॥३.।।
target: O hero, this enemy of the gods, the Gandharvas, the Uragas, the Yakshas, the Danavas and the Maharshis has been destroyed by yol.

source: ते रत्नहीनास्तरुणाः फलकाले विवासिताः। कथं वत्स्यन्ति कृपणाः फलमूलैः कृताशनाः॥
target: And bereft of elegant apparel, how will they of tender years, exiled in this time of enjoyment, pass their lives in misery, subsisting on fruits and roots!

source: अवमृद्नन् स राष्ट्राणि पार्थिवानां हयोत्तमः। शनैस्तदा परिययौ श्वेताश्वश्च महारथः॥
target: Grinding the kingdoms of many kings that excellent horse wandered. And it was followed slowly by the great car-warrior Arjuna of white horses.

source: निरुद्धा रावणेनाहमल्पवीर्येण रक्षसा। समर्थः खलु मे भर्ता रावणं हन्तुमाहवे॥
target: I have been captured by Rāvana, a Rākşasa of feeble prowess. Forsooth my lord is capable of slaying this Rāvana in conflict.

source: ततो लोभः समभवद् दस्यूनां निहतेश्वराः। दृष्ट्वा स्त्रियो नीयमानाः पार्थेनैकेन भारत॥
target: Seeing those widows escorted by Pritha's son alone, O Bharata, the robbers felt a great temptation.

source: तत्र दिव्योपमं मुख्यं स्फाटिकं रत्नभूषितम्। अवेक्षमाणो हनुमान् ददर्श शयनासनम् ॥ दान्तकाञ्चनचित्राङ्गैवैदूर्यैश्च वरासनैः। महार्हास्तरणोपेतैरुपपन्नं महाधनैः॥
target: And there Hanumán employed in looking around saw a grand dais made of crystal; and embellished with jewels; comparable to one belonging to the celestial regions; furnished with superb and costly sofas, having their parts painted and composed of ivory, gold, and lapis lazulis; with highly precious canopies.

source: नेह पश्यामि लोकेऽन्यं यो मे प्रतिबलो भवेत्। पश्य मे सुमहद्वीर्यमप्रतिद्वन्द्वमाहवे॥
target: Find I none on this earth who can withstand my prowess. Do you behold my matchless prowess in battle.

source: अर्थसिद्धौ हरिश्रेष्ठ गच्छ सौम्य यथासुखम्। समानय च वैदेहीं राघवेण महात्मना ॥
target: Your end having been attained, go, O mild one, O foremost of monkeys, according to your pleasure. Bring about the meeting of Vaidehī with the high-souled Rāghava.

source: स त्वं विद्वन् धर्ममिममधिगम्य कथं नु माम्। अत्यार्थं समुत्क्रम्य प्रमाददादिव भाषसे॥
target: O learned man, well-acquainted as you are with the scriptures, why being tempted by the desire of offspring, do you ask me again, forgetting the ordinance."

source: शशाप तत्र भीमस्तु राजमध्ये बृहत्स्वनः। क्रोधाद् विस्फुरमाणौष्ठो विनिष्पिष्य करे करम्॥
target: Thereupon Bhima, squeezing his palms, and his lips quivering in anger, took a terrible oath in a loud voice in the midst of the kings.

source: एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशः शीघ्रमश्वानचोदयत्। दूरं प्रयान्तं राजानमन्वगच्छजनार्दनः॥
target: Having thus spoken, Hrishikesha urged the steeds to the best of their speed and he then followed behind the king, who had already advanced a long way.

source: यथा तासां च मन्येत श्रेय आत्मन एव च। तथा कर्माणि सर्वाणि राजा राष्ट्रेषु वर्तयेत्॥
target: He should, in his kingdom, adopt such measures as would in his view secure their good as also his own.

source: यथा चन्द्रार्कसंयुक्तं तमस्तदुपलभ्यते। तद्वच्छरीरसंयुक्तः शरीरीत्युपलभ्यते॥
target: Rahu becomes visible only when it exists with the sun or the moon. Likewise the Soul is apprehended only when it exists with the body.

source: अश्वबन्धोऽथ नकुलः सहदेवस्तु गोकुले। सैरन्ध्रीं द्रौपदीं विद्धि यत्कृते कीचका हताः॥
target: Nakula is in charge of steeds and Sahadeva is in cow-pen and know Sairandhri as Draupadi for whom Kichaka's were slain.

source: लोमश उवाच स तस्य ब्रह्मवध्यायाः पारं गत्वा युधिष्ठिर। अर्वावसुस्तदा सत्रमाजगाम पुनर्मुनिः॥
target: Lomasha said : ( Yudhishthira, having observed the vow prescribed in the case of killing a Brahmana, Arvavasu, the Rishi, again came back to the sacrifice.

source: बुद्धिर्हि व्यवसायेन लक्ष्यते नात्र संशयः। लक्षणं मनसो ध्यानमव्यक्तं साधुलक्षणम्॥
target: There is no doubt in this, viz., that the understanding, by perseverance, perceives all things. The characteristic of mind is meditation. The characteristic of the good man is that he does not allow his acts to be noticed.

source: अवारयत तं देवी क्रुद्धं पशुपति पतिम्। पुत्रत्वमगमद् देव्या वारिते शंकरे च सः॥
target: The goddess Uma then interposed and forbade the angry lord of all creatures, viz., her consort, to kill the Brahmana. And on account of Uma's having thus prevented her lord from fulfilling his purpose, the ascetic Ushanas became the son of the goddess.

source: इतिहासपुराणानामुन्मेषं निर्मितं च यत्। भूतं भव्यं भविष्यं च त्रिविधं कालसंज्ञितम्॥
target: And a compilation of the Puranas and the history which has been composed by me and named after, the three divisions of time, namely, Past, Present and Future.

source: प्रातिकामी तथा पापो द्रौपद्याः कुशकृद्धतः। भ्रातरस्ते हताः सर्वे शूरा विक्रान्तयोधिनः॥
target: The wretched Pratikamin, who had seized Draupadi by her hair, has been killed! All your brave brothers also, who fought with great velour, have been killed!

source: महद्भिर्विहितैः सत्यैः सिद्धैः सर्वार्थसाधकैः। ऋषिणा तण्डिना भक्त्या कृतैर्वेदकृतात्मना॥
target: Those names have been used by eminent persons. They are, again, true and fraught with success, and are capable of accomplishing all the objects of the utterer. They have been given to Mahadeva by Tandi whose soul was purified by Vedic learning and who invented those names with the help of his devotion.

source: संयुद्ध्यमानो बहुभिर्भीष्मः शान्तनवस्तथा। अवकीर्णो महामेरुः शैलो मेधैरिवावृतः॥
target: Then fighting with tremendous odds, Bhishma the son of Shantanu looked like the mount Meru enveloped by clouds on all sides.

source: आपूर्यत मही चापि सलिलेन समन्ततः। रसातलमनुप्राप्तं शीतलं विमलं जलम्॥
target: The world became full of water; the cool and clear water reached even the nether regions.

source: एवं सेन्द्रा वसिष्ठेन रक्षितास्त्रिदिवौकसः। ब्रह्मदत्तवराश्चैव हता दैत्या महात्मना।॥
target: Thus were the dwellers of Heaven, headed by Indra, rescued from great distress by Vasishtha. It was thus that those Danavas, who had received boons from Brahman, were killed by that great Rishi.

source: क्षीबा इवान्ये चोन्मत्ता रङ्गेष्विव च वारणाः। उच्चुक्रुशुरथान्योन्यं जघ्नुरन्योन्यमेव च॥
target: Many infuriate elephants as if perfectly mad, uttered loud shrieks and killed one another, after the manner they do so in arenas of sport.

source: पृथिवी पर्वता मेघा मूर्तिमन्तश्च ये परे। सर्वं तद् वारुणं ज्ञेयमापस्तस्तम्भिरे यतः॥
target: Earth, mountains, clouds, and all things which have form, are all as transformations of water. They have all been produced by water being solidified.

source: न च रात्रौ सुखं शेते ससर्प इव वेश्मनि। यः कोपयति निर्दोष सदोषोऽभ्यन्तरं जनम्॥
target: He cannot sleep at night in peace, like one having a serpent in the room; who, being a guilty person himself, provokes other people against one who is innocent.

source: गृहस्थ एव यजते गृहस्थस्तप्यते तपः। गार्हस्थ्यमस्य धर्मस्य मूलं यत्किचिदेजते॥
target: The householder who lives like a householder, celebrates sacrifices and practise penances. Whatever is done by anybody for acquiring happiness has for its root the domestic mode of life.

source: भर्ता प्रविष्टः सहसा तस्या भरतसत्तम। सा तु दृष्ट्वा पतिं साध्वी ब्राह्मणं व्यवहाय तम्॥ पाद्यमाचमनीयं वै ददौ भर्तुस्तथाऽऽसनम्। प्रह्वा पर्यचरच्चापि भर्तारमसितेक्षणा॥
target: Her husband, O foreinost of the Bharat race, entered the house all on a sudden. The chaste house-wife, seeing her husband and neglecting that Brahmana, gave to her husband water for rinsing the feet and mouth, as also a seat.

source: अमात्यैः सह पौरैश्च गुरुभिश्च द्विजातिभिः। सह सर्वं चरिष्यामि पद्भ्यां परिवृतः स्वयम्॥
target: Accompanied by by counsellors, citizens, preceptors and twice-born ones, I will on foot range every direction.

source: प्रवर्तनाद् द्वापरस्य यथाभागमुपाश्नुते। कलेः प्रवर्तनाद् राजा पापमत्यन्तमश्नुते॥
target: If he creates the Dvapara, he attains to blessedness in heaven in proportion to his merits. By creating the Kali age, the king incurs a heavy sin.

source: महेन्द्रसदृशः शौर्ये स्थैर्ये च हिमवानिव। समुद्र इव गाम्भीर्ये सहिष्णुत्वे धरासमः॥
target: Resembling the great Indra in bravery, the carth herself in patience, the Himalayas in firinness, and the ocean in gravity.

source: साजभ्यगच्छत मां देवि रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि। प्रदक्षिणं लोभयन्ती मां शुभे रुचिरानना॥
target: One day, that lady of beautiful face, peerless in the universe for beauty of form, came to me, O goddess, for circumambulating me but, in sooth, moved by the desire of tempting me.

source: ततः पश्चात्सुमहती पृतनक्षवनौकसाम्। प्रच्छाद्य महती भूमिमनुयाति स्म राघवम्।।२८
target: Behind them, the mighty array of bears and monkeys followed Rāghava, severing a wide surface of land.

source: हयारोहवराश्चैव तव पुत्रेण चोदिताः। चतुर्दश सहस्राणि सौबलं पर्यवारयन्॥
target: And supported by fourteen thousand picked cavalry soldiers urged by your son, encompassed on all sides the king of the Subala's.

source: जनक उवाच भगवत्याः क्व चर्येयं कृता क्व च गमिष्यसि। कस्य च त्वं कुतो वेति पप्रच्छैनां महीपतिः॥
target: Janaka said O holy lady, to what course of conduct are you given? Whose are you? Whence have you come? After finishing your business here, where will you go?

source: अविज्ञानादयोगो हि पुरुषस्योपजायते। विज्ञानादपि योगश्च योगो भूतिकरः परः॥ अशङ्कमानो वचनमनसूयुरिदं शृणु।
target: Ignorance yields barrenness of invention about means. Finding out of expedicnts, again, through the help of knowledge, becomes the source of great happiness. Without cherishing any misgivings and any malice, here these instructions.

source: भगीरथ महाराज प्रीतस्तेऽहं जनाधिप। तपसा च सुतप्तेन वरं वरय सुव्रत॥
target: O Bhagiratha, O mighty monarch, pleased am I with you. O lord' of men, on account of your ardent austerities: do you, O you of excellent vows, ask for the boon you would have.

source: तेजोभिर्गतवीर्यत्वाज्जामदग्न्यो जडीकृतः। रामं कमलपत्राक्षं मन्दं मन्दमुवाच ह॥
target: And rendered inert in consequence of his energy having been dispelled by Rāma's own, Jamadagna mildly addressed Rāma of eyes like lotus' petals, saying,

source: लब्धश्चानभिभूतार्थैः पित्र्योंऽशः पृथिवीपते। विवृद्धस्तेजसा तेषां तत्र का परिदेवना॥
target: O ruler of earth, having obtained their paternal share of the kingdom and not being deprived of it, they have grown (in prosperity) by their own energy. What is there to make you sorry in all this?

source: अथैनं छिन्नधन्वानं नाराचानां शतैस्त्रिभिः। छादयन् समरे राजन् विव्याध च सुपत्रिभि॥
target: Then, again, O monarch, he (Shrutakarman) covered, with three hundred arrows, him, whose bow was already severed into two pieces and pierced him in the field excellent winged shafts.

source: स्तस्मै प्रयच्छन्ति सुखानि देवाः। तद्भाविता: स्पर्शनदर्शनेन इष्टां गतिं तस्य सुरा दिशन्ति॥
target: That mortal who live by the side of Ganga and sees her every day, becomes purified by her sight and touch. To him the gods give every sort of happiness here and a high end hereafter.

source: संधाय चान्यं सुमुखं शरमाशीविषोपमम्। आजघान महातेजा वक्षसि द्विविदाग्रजम्॥
target: Then aiming other fair-headed arrows resembling venomous snakes, that exceedingly energetic one smote Dvivida's elder brother in the chest.

source: देववंशान् पितृवंशान् ब्रह्मवंशांश्च शाश्वतान्। संत्यज्य मूढा वर्तन्ते ततो यान्त्यश्रुतीपथम्॥
target: And since those little-witted men live by abandoning the eternal paths of the gods, of the Rishis, and of Brahma, therefore, they attain to paths disapproved of by the Shrutis.

source: राजोपरिचरो नाम बभूवाधिपतिर्भुवः। आखण्डलसखः ख्यातो भक्तो नारायणं हरिम्॥
target: There was, in days of yore, a king on Earth, Uparichara, by name. He was known to be the friend, of Indra the king of gods. He was devoted to Narayana called also by the name of Hari.

source: श्रमं तवावगच्छामि महता रणकर्मणा। नहि ते वीर्यसौमुख्यं प्रकर्ष नोपधारये॥
target: I knew that you had been fatigued in consequence of your mighty exertions in the fight. And I could not perceive that your prowess then stood superior (to that of the foe).* *Two negatives in this verse amounting to an affirmative. This is the only instance of double negatives in Valmiki.

source: अपरे तत्र तत्रैव परिधावन्ति मानवः। ज्ञातिभि:पतितैः शूरैर्याच्यमानास्ततोदकम्॥
target: Numerous other soldiers, running to and fro in search of water for their chivalrous family members now fell down on battled field due to injuries when they have asked for water.

source: दयितो वासुदेवस्य बाल्यात् प्रभृति चाभवत्। पितृणामिव सर्वेषां प्रजानामिव चन्द्रमाः॥
target: The child became a favourite of Vasudeva from his earliest years and of his father and uncles. He shone like the moon become and the favourite of all the people.

source: अभिप्रायं तु कृष्णस्य ज्ञात्वा परपुरंजयः। आजिशीर्षगतं पार्थं भीमसेनोऽभ्युवाच ह॥
target: Then seeing through the purposes of Krishna, that subduer of hostile cities viz., Bhimasena, addressing Arjuna then stationed at the van of the troop, said these words.

source: ततो युद्धं समभवन्मम तस्य च भारत। दिवसान् सुबहून् राजन् परस्परजिगीषया।॥
target: Then did the fight take place between myself and him, O Bharata for a great many days, O king, during which each was desirous of vanquishing the other.

source: मां ततो वै द्विगणं रथश्चैव हिरण्मयः। मनोजवौ वाजिनौ च दित्सितं ते महासुर॥
target: O great Asura, to me you have intended to give twice as much and a golden chariot and a couple of horses with the speed of mind.

source: वासुदेवसहायस्य गर्जतः सानुजस्य ते। मध्ये कुरूणां कौन्तेय तस्य कालोऽयमागतः॥
target: Proceeding from yourself and your younger brothers having Vasudeva for your ally, with a roar in the midst of the Kurus. O son of Kunti, the time for that has now come.

source: वृद्धोऽहं त्वं युवा धन्वी सरथः कवची शरी। न चाप्यादाय कुशली वैदेहीं मे गमिष्यसि ॥
target: Old though I am, you shall not be able to carry away with safety Jānakī in my presence, young, accoutred in mails as you are with bow and arrows in your hands and ascending a car.

source: नारद उवाच कच्चिदभ्यागता दूराद् वणिजो लाभकारणात्। यथोक्तमवहार्यन्ते शुल्कं शुल्कोपजीविभिः॥ कच्चित् ते पुरुषा राजन् पुरे राष्ट्रे च मानिताः। उपानयन्ति पण्यानि उपधाभिरवञ्चिताः॥
target: Narada said O king, do your officers who are paid from the taxes to be realized from merchandise, take only their just dues from the merchants that come from distant place (to your kingdom) with the desire of gain? Are the merchants and traders well-treated in your capital and kingdom? Are they capable of bringing their goods without being any way deceived?

source: काञ्चनस्तम्भनिहवैदूर्यकृतवेदिकम्। जाम्बूनदमयैर्दिव्यैर्गवाक्षैः सर्वतो वृतम्॥ सेवितं चाप्सरःसङ्गैर्गन्धर्वैर्दिविचारिभिः। विमानं समधिष्ठाय श्रिया परमया ज्वलन्॥
target: Ascending on a car equipt with a chamber consisting of a top supported by columns of gold, furnished with a seat made of stones of lapis lazuli, with windows on all sides made of pure gold, and full of Apsaras and Gandharvas and other celestials, he blazes forth to splendour.

source: यमो वैश्रवणः शक्रो वरुणश्च महाबलः। विशिष्यन्ते नरेन्द्रेण वृत्तेन महता ततः॥
target: By virtue of magnanimity of character, a king surpasses Yama and Vaiśravaṇa and Śakra and Varuņa endowed with mighty strength.

source: स सूतश्चोदितो राज्ञा राज्ञः स्यन्दनमुत्तमम्॥ युधिष्ठिरस्याभिमुखं प्रेषयामास संयुगे।
target: Then the charioteer, being thus urged by the king, led the foremost of cars belonging to the king to the presence of king Yudhishthira in the battle. were an

source: तथा हि कामो भवतस्तथा कृतं महानसे त्वं भव मे पुरस्कृतः। नराश्च ये तत्र समाहिताः पुरा भवांश्च तेषामधिपो मया कृतः॥
target: I have done what you desire, you are appointed in my kitchen. I place you at the head of those who have been appointed there before by me.

source: ते तु दृष्ट्वा तदाऽऽविद्धं भीमसेनेन पादपम्। विमुच्य द्रौपदी तत्र प्राद्रवन्नगरं प्रति॥
target: Then seeing the tree that had been uprooted by Bhimaseni they set Draupadi free and ran towards the city.

source: स्रस्तहस्तैश्च मातङ्गैः शयानैर्विबभौ मही। नानारूपैरलंकारैः प्रमदैवाभ्यलकृता॥
target: With trunkless elephants, scattered on the field, the earth appeared charming like a damsel adorned with various of ornaments.

source: नसंख्येयान् कालकेयांश्च सर्वान। लेभे शङ्ख देवदत्त स्म तत्र को नाम तेनाभ्यधिकः पृथिव्याम्॥
target: He, after destroying numberless Daityas and the Kalakeyas in the dominion of Indra, received the Devdatta conch; there is no mightier man than he in all world.

source: शरीरिणां हि मरणं शरीरे नित्यमाश्रितम्। प्रागेव मरणात् तस्माद् राज्यायैव घटामहे॥
target: Wealth is ever established in every creature having corporeal body. Therefore we should try to get possession of our kingdom before we meet with death.

source: युधिष्ठिरो राजपुत्रो ज्येष्ठो नः कुलवर्धनः। प्राप्तः स्वगुणतो राज्यं न तस्मिन् वाच्यमस्ति नः।३१।।
target: “The eldest of the princes, Yudhisthira is the perpetuator of your race. He has acquired the kingdom by virtue of his birth. We have nothing to say to this.

source: अद्य मद्वाणनिर्दग्धं पतितं धरणीतले। द्रक्ष्यतस्त्वां रणे वीरौ सहितौ केशवार्जुनौ॥
target: Today the heroes, Keshava and Arjuna, will both behold you prostrate on the field of battle, consumed with the fire of my barrows.

source: तास्तदा प्रत्यभाषन्त रासभाः सर्वतो दिशः॥ प्रातिष्ठत ततो भीष्मो द्रोणेन सह संजय।
target: Asses from all directions began to bray in response (to the jackal). O Sanjaya, then left the assembly Bhisma, Drona with

source: अनुकरुपासङ्गैः पताकाभिर्ध्वजैस्तथा। उपस्करैरधिष्ठानैरीषादण्डकबन्धुरैः॥
target: (And with) Anukarshas and quivers, standards and flags and Upaskaras and Adhisthanas, shafts and crests of cars.

source: जग्मतुस्तैः समागन्तुं शालां भार्गववेश्मनि। पञ्चानामेकपत्नीत्वे विमर्शो दुपदस्य च॥
target: Their arrival at the house of the potter where the brothers were living; the grief of Drupada, because Draupadi would be married to five husbands;

source: छिन्नांश्च तोमरान् राजन् महामात्यशिरांसि च॥ परिस्तोमान् विचित्रांश्च कक्ष्याश्च कनकोज्ज्वलाः। चैवेयाण्यथ शक्तीश्च पताकाः कणपांस्तथा॥ तूणीरानथ यन्त्राणि विचित्राणि धनूंषि च। भिन्दिपालानि शुभ्राणि तोत्राणि चाकुशैः सह॥ घण्टाश्च विविधा राजन् हेमग स्त्सरूनपि। पततः पातितांश्चैव पश्यामः सह सादिभिः॥ छिन्नगात्रावरकरैनिहतैश्चापि वारणैः। आसीद् भूमिः समास्तार्णा पतितैर्भूधरैरिव॥
target: O king, broken lances, heads of elephantsdrivers, beautiful housing of elephants, chords as shining as gold, collars darts, mallets, quivers, various kinds of machines, beautiful bows, short arrows with polished heads, hooks and screws various sorts of bells and belts decked with gold, these were seen falling or already fallen on the field of battle. With elephants having the fore parts and hind parts of their bodies and trunks cut off or entirely killed, the battle field appeared to be strewn with fallen cliffs.

source: वैरस्यास्य गताः पारं हत्वा दुर्योधनं रणे। राज्यं युधिष्ठिरः प्राप्तो वयं च गतमन्यवः॥
target: Having killed Duryodhana in battle, we have terminated our hostilities. Yudhishthira has regained his kingdom, and we also have been freed from anger!'

source: स विद्धो न्यस्य वैदेहीं शूलमुद्यम्य राक्षसः। अभ्यद्रवत् सुसंक्रुद्धस्तदा रामं सलक्ष्मणम्॥
target: On being thus pierced, the Rākṣasa set Vaidehi down, and, upraising a dart, rushed in wrath towards Rāma and Lakşmaņa.

source: द्रौपद्युवाच नास्मि लभ्या विराटेन न चान्येन कदाचन। गन्धर्वाः पतयो मह्यं युवानः पञ्च भामिनि॥
target: Draupadi said Neither by Virata nor by any other man I am to be won, O fair lady, for I have five youthful husbands who are all Gandharvas.

source: क्षीणरत्नां च पृथिवी हतक्षत्रियपुङ्गवाम्। न ह्युत्सहाम्यहं भोक्तुं विधवामिव योषितम्॥
target: I do not like to enjoy and longer the Earth that does not contain wealth and best of Kshatriyas and that has accordingly become like a widow.

source: पृथिवी वायुराकाशमापो ज्योतिश्च पञ्चमम्। बुद्धिरात्मा मनः कालो दिशश्चैव गुणा दश॥ नित्यमेव हि पश्यन्ति देहिनां देहसंश्रिताः। सुकृतं दुष्कृतं चापि कर्म धर्मभृतां वर॥
target: O foremost of the virtuous, the five elements, viz., fire, air, earth, water, and sky, and the mind, the intellect and the Soul, and time and space and the ten organs of sense, are all in the bodies of men and always witness the good and evil deeds of men.

source: उदासीनारिमित्राणां सर्वमेव चिकीर्षितम्। पुरे जनपदे चैव ज्ञातव्यं चारचक्षुषा॥
target: Having spies for his eyes, the king should learn all the acts and intentions of his foes, friends, and neutrals.

source: संहृष्टवदनो राजा सभार्यः कुशिको मुनिम्। सिद्धमन्नमिति प्रबो निर्विकारो न्यवेदयत्॥
target: With a cheerful face, king Kushika, together with his wife, then offered the Rishi cooked food with great respect. Gifted with wisdom, and with heart totally unmoved, Kushika made this offer.

source: नाहं पादौ धाविष्ये कदाचित् यावत् स्थितः पार्थ इत्यल्पबुद्धेः। व्रतं तस्यैत त् सर्वदा शक्रसूनो कच्चिन त्वया निहतः सोऽद्य कर्णः॥
target: Have you, O son of Indra, slain in today's battle the dull-headed Karna, the son Suta, who had taken an oath not to wash his feet till Partha breathed?

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रजापतेस्तु दक्षस्य मनोवैवस्वतस्य च। भरतस्य कुरो पूरोराजमीढस्य चानघ॥ यादवानामिमं वंशं कौरवाणां च सर्वशः। तथैव भरतानां च पुण्यं स्वस्त्ययनं महत्॥ धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं कीर्तयिष्यामि तेऽनघ। तेजोभिरुदिताः सर्वे महर्षिसमतेजसः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : O sinless one, Prajapati Daksha, Vaivasvata Manu, Manu, Bharata, Kuru, Puru, Ajamidha, Yadava and all the other kings of the Bharata race, O sinless king, I shall now recite the holy, illustrious and long lifebestowing histories of these great men. They were as effulgent as the sun and the great Rishis.

source: स तत् नास्मि लक्ष्मण दुर्मेधा नाकृतज्ञो न निघृणः। श्रूयतां यः प्रयत्नो मे सीतापर्येषणे कृतः॥
target: "O Lakshmana, I am neither evil-minded nor ungrateful nor cruel. Listen, what pains I have taken in the direction of the discovery of Sita.

source: मुकुटेनाग्निवर्णेन जाम्बूनदविभूषिणा। दिव्यचन्दनदिग्धाङ्गो दिव्यमाल्यविभूषितः॥ दिव्याल्लोकान् विचरति दिव्यैर्भोगैः समन्वितः। विबुधानां प्रसादेन श्रिया परमया युतः॥
target: Crowned with a diadem of the complexion of fire, decked with ornaments of gold, his body smeared with celestial sandalpaste, garnished with celestial garlands, he passes through all celestial regions enjoying all celestial objects of enjoyment, and gifted with grcat splendour, through the grace of the deities.

source: नकुलस्तु चैद्यां करेणुमती नाम भार्यामुदावहत्। तस्यां पुत्रं निरमित्रं नामाजनयत्॥
target: Nakula obtained for his wife Karenumati, the princess of Chedi and he begot on her a son, named Niramitra.

source: स शून्यामिव निःशब्दां दृष्ट्वा परमदुर्मनाः। सुमन्त्रश्चिन्तयामास शोकवेगसमाहतः॥ कच्चिन सगजा साश्वा सजना सजनाधिपा। रामसंतापदुःखेन दग्धा शोकाग्निना पुरी।७।।
target: And beholding it empty and still, Sumantra afflicted with exceeding sorrow, and overwhelmed with grief, thought, “Perhaps the city with her elephants and horses and men and king has been consumed by the fire of grief on account of Rāma."

source: शक्तो ह्येष मया गुप्तो दिव्येन स्वेन तेजसा ॥ राक्षसा ये विकारस्तेषामपि विनाशने। श्रेयश्चास्मै प्रदास्यामि बहुरूपं न संशयः॥ त्रयाणामपि लोकानां येन ख्यातिं गमिष्यति। न च तौ राममासाद्य शक्तौ स्थातुं कथंचन॥ न च तौ राघवादन्यो हन्तुमुत्सहते पुमान्। वीर्योत्सितौ हि तौ पापौ कालपाशवशं गतौ॥ रामस्य राजशार्दूल न पर्याप्तो महात्मनः।
target: By virtue of his own divine energy, he, being protected by me, is capable of even destroying those Rākşasas disturbing the ceremony. And I will, without doubt, confer upon him manifold blessings, by means of which he will secure the golden opinions of the three worlds. And encountering Rāma, they will by no means be able to stand him, nor is there any other who dares to slay them. And puffed up with energy, they have become ensnared at the hands of Käla, (Yama, the god of death.) and, O tiger of a monarch, they are no match for Rāma.

source: गजस्कन्धगतावास्तां भगदत्तेन सम्मितौ। विन्दानुविन्दावावन्त्यौ केतुमन्तमनुव्रतौ॥
target: The two princes of Avanti, named Vinda and Anuvinda who were considered as equal to Bhagadatta followed Ketuman on two elephants.

source: स दृष्ट्वा ज्वलितं दीप्त्या तापसं संशितव्रतम्॥ प्रहृष्टवदनो राजा ततोऽर्घ्यमुपहारयत्।
target: And having come to that ascetic observing vows and of flaming energy, the monarch with a cheerful countenance offered him the Arghya.

source: मरीचिर्दमनो हंसः सुपर्णो भुजगोत्तमः। हिरण्यनाभः सुतपाः पद्मनाभः प्रजापतिः॥
target: He who is full of blazing effulgence. He who removed the afflictions of His adorers. He who assumed the form of a Swan for communicating the Vedas to the Grandfather Brahman. He who has Garuda, the prince of birds for his vehicle. He who is the foremost of snakes on account of His identity with Shesha or Ananta who upholds on his head the vast Earth. He whose navel is as beautiful as gold; He who practised the severest austerities in the form of Narayana at Badari on the breast of Himavat. He whose navel resembles a lotus. He who is the Lord of all creatures. (189-197)

source: एवं कत्थसि कौन्तेय अकत्थन् पुरुषो भव। सूतपुत्रं सुदुर्धर्षं शल्यं च बलिनां वरम्॥
target: You too boast in the same way; O son of Kunti, show forth your manliness without boasting. The son of a Suta, excited with great wrath, and that foremost among persons endued with strength namely Shalya,

source: पञ्चवर्षकदेशीयो बालो नागेन्द्रविक्रमः। सहसोत्पतितं व्याघ्रमाससाद महाबलम्॥
target: Though only five years' old, his prowess, even then, resembled that of a powerful elephant. While thus playing the child met a powerful tiger that attacked him suddenly.

source: काकाः श्येनास्तथा नीचा गृध्राः परिपतन्ति च। शिवाश्चाप्यशुभानादानदन्ति सुमहाभयान्॥
target: Crows, and hawks, and the inferior vultures, wheel all round. And jackals are sending inauspicious yells, exciting great fear.

source: अथ पञ्चालचेदीनां संजयानां च मारिष॥ त्वदीयैः सह संग्राम आसीत् परमदारुणः!
target: And exceedingly dreadful the encounter of your army with the Panchalas, Chedis and Srinjayas.

source: द्विविधौ चाप्युभावेतौ धर्माधर्मी विजानताम्। अप्रवृत्तिः प्रवृत्तिश्च द्वैविध्यं लोकवेदयोः॥ अप्रवृत्तेरमर्त्यत्वं मर्त्यत्वं कर्मणः फलम्। अशुभस्याशुभं विद्याच्छुभस्य शुभमेव च। एतयोश्चोभयोः स्यातां शुभाशुभतया तथा॥
target: To persons capable of judging, acts are of two kinds, viz., virtuous and sinful. From the worldly and the Vedic points of view again, virtue and vice become good or bad. From the Vedic point of view, virtue and vice, would be classed under action and inaction. Inaction, i.e., abstention from Vedic rites leads to liberation (from re-birth while the fruits of action) i.e., performance of Vedic rites, leads to repeated death and re-birth. From the worldly point of view, acts that are evil, lead to sins and those that are good, or virtue. From the worldly point of view, therefore, virtue and vice are to be marked out by the good and the evil character of their fruits.

source: बाघेतामानुषः शत्रुर्यदि त्वां वीर कश्चन। तद्वधाय प्रयुञ्जीथास्तदस्त्रमिदमाहवे॥
target: O hero, if ever any foe, if he is not human, comes to fight with you, may then use it against him to accomplish his death."

source: अलं स्थित्वा श्मशानेऽस्मिन् गृध्रगोमायुसंकुले। कङ्कालबहुले रौद्रे सर्वप्राणिभयङ्करे॥
target: There is no necessity of your waiting in the crematorium, this dreadful place, which abounds with vultures, jackals and skeletons and fills every creature with fear.

source: यमदूतैर्विकृष्यंश्च मृत्यु कालेन गच्छति। वाग्धीनस्य च यन्मात्रमिष्टानिष्टं कृतं मुखे। भूय एवात्मनाऽऽत्मानं बध्यमानमुपेक्षते॥
target: Overcome by his senses, he does good and evil at the every commencement. Having enjoyed or suffered this fruits of these, he again becomes indifferent to his acts of selfdestruction.

source: तथोक्त्वा राक्षसीस्तास्तु राक्षसेन्द्रः प्रतापवान्॥ निष्क्रम्यान्तः पुरात् तस्मात् किं कृत्यमिति चिन्तयन्। ददर्शाष्टौ महावीर्यान् राक्षसान् पिशिताशनान्॥
target: Heaving said this to the Rākşasis, the puissant lord of the Rākṣasas, went out of the inner apartment, and thought within himself as to what was to be done (next). And he saw eight flesheating Rākşasas of wondrous prowess.

source: संजय उवाच सैनापत्यमनुप्राप्य भीष्मः शान्तनवो नृप। दुर्योधनमुवाचेदं वचनं हर्षयन्निव॥
target: Sanjaya said Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, having obtained the generalship, said these words to Duryodhana infusing cheerfulness in him.

source: कर्णेनहि दृढं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रः परिक्षितः। तं दृष्ट्वाऽऽश्वास्य च पुनः कर्णं पार्थ वधिष्यसि॥
target: The royal son of Kunti has been greatly wounded by Karna. Seeing him first you will afterwards kill Karna.

source: गुणवन्तो महोत्साहा धर्मज्ञाः साधवश्च ये। संदधीत नृपस्तैश्च राष्ट्र धर्मेण पालयन्॥
target: Engaged in protecting his kingdom piously the king should make peace with accomplished persons capable of great work, virtuous and honest.

source: ब्राह्मण उवाच स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैव विद्धयुभे मनसी मम। स्थावरं मत्सकाशे वै जङ्गमं विषये तव॥
target: The Brahmana said Know that I have two minds, immovable and movable. That which is immovable, is, indeed, with me; the movable is in your dominion.

source: आशायास्तनयोऽधर्मः क्रोधोऽसूयासुतः स्मृतः। लोभः पुत्रो निकृत्यास्तु कृतम्रो नार्हति प्रजाम्॥
target: Expectation has a child named Sin. Anger, again, is considered to be a child of Envy. Cupidity is the child of Deceit. Ingratitude, however, is barnen.

source: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा। अनित्यमसुखं लोकमिमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्॥
target: What then should I speak of holy Brahmins and royal sages who are my devotees? Having come to this miserable and mortal world, O Partha, worship Me.

source: यं न पश्यन्ति चैवाद्धा देवा ह्यमितविक्रमम्। तमहं दृष्टवान् देवं कोऽन्यो धन्यतरो मया॥
target: Who clse is more praiseworthy than I, since I am seeing with these eyes of mine Him of immeasurable prowess whom the very gods are unable to see without first paying hearty worship?

source: सृष्टास्तु बाणा भरतर्षभेण शतं शतानीव सुवर्णपुङ्खाः॥ प्राच्छादयन् कर्णरथं क्षणेन युगान्तवयर्ककरप्रकाशाः।
target: O Bharata race, they were brilliant as the Yuga fire or the sun's rays ten thousand arrows in not time covered Karna's car.

source: ब्राह्मणांश्चैव मन्येत गुरूंश्चाप्यभिपूजयेत्। सर्वभूतानुलोमश्च मृदुशील: प्रियंवदः॥
target: One should respect the Brahmanas, worship his preceptor and seniors, show mercy to all creatures, be of mild disposition and sweet speech.

source: इत्युक्त्वा काञ्चनं यानं सुग्रीवः सूर्यसंनिभम्॥ बहुभिर्हरिभिर्युक्तमारुरोह सलक्ष्मणः।
target: Having said this, Sugrīva in company with Lakşınana swiftly ascended the golden car resembling the sun, yoked with numerous steeds.

source: ध्वजमेकेन बाणेन चिच्छेदाञ्जनपर्वणः। द्वाभ्यां तु रथयन्तारौ त्रिभिश्चास्य त्रिवेणुकम्॥
target: Cut off the standard of Anjanaparva with one arrow, his two charioteers with two and his Trivenduka with four (arrows).

source: शल्य उवाच परान् प्रति। ननु प्रलापाः कफ्ते यान् ब्रवीपि ऋते कर्णसहस्रेण शक्या जेतुं परे युधि॥
target: Shalya said These are but your ravings, O Karna that you give vent to with regard to your enemies. But I can without a thousand Karnas defeat my foe in battle.

source: अनामयं मद्वचनेन पृच्छेः सर्वांस्तथा द्रौपदेयांश्च पञ्च। स्त्वं मन्येथा भारतानां हितं च। तद् भाषेथाः संजय राजमध्ये न मूर्च्छयेद् यन्न च युद्धहेतुः॥
target: Will you enquire about their health on my behalf and in the same way of the five sons of Draupadi, And whatever you think fit to be said to the foe, as occasion arises and also whatever you think to be conducive the interests of the race of Bharata must you say, O Sanjaya, among those kings. And do not utter anything which may give cause for hostility.

source: प्राणदद् भैरवं नादं प्रावृषीव बलाहकः॥ अब्रवीच ततो राजन् दुर्योधनमिदं वचः।
target: Then like clouds during the rainy season, he uttered a tremendous roar; and then O king,

source: धनंजय कथं शक्यमस्माभिर्यो माहवे। धार्तराष्टैर्महाबाहो येषां योद्धा पितामहः॥
target: "O mighty armed hero, O Dhananjaya, how shall be able to fight with the Dhritarashtra's son's army when the grandfather himself commands it.

source: इह क्षेत्रे क्रियते पार्थ कार्य न वै किञ्चित् क्रियते प्रेत्य कार्यम्। कृतं त्वया पारलौक्यं च कर्म पुण्यं महत् सद्भिरतिप्रशस्तम्॥
target: During this life deeds are done, O son of Pritha and after death, no act whatever is done. And virtuous deeds that are valuable in the next world and so be-lauded by the great and the honest, have been done by you.

source: अहं त्विमं जलनिधि समारप्स्याम्युपायतः। प्रतिशेष्याम्युपवसन् दर्षयिष्यति मां ततः॥
target: I will, however, pray to this Lord of waters (to show me) a means (to cross the sea) and by observing fasts will lie down on the shores. He will then surely show me (a means).

source: ऋषिभिः संशयं पृष्टो वसुश्चेदिपतिः पुरा। अभक्ष्यमपि मांसं यः प्राह भक्ष्यमिति प्रभा॥
target: Doubtful about the propriety of eating flesh, the Rishis asked Vasu the king of the Chedis, for removing their doubt. King Vasu, knowing that flesh should not be taken, answered that it was edible, O king.

source: श्रीकृष्ण उवाच कस्यचित् त्वथ कालस्य पुनरेव महातपाः। मगधेषूपचक्राम भगवांश्चण्डकौशिकः॥

source: मां चापि विषहेत् क्रुद्धं कश्च भीमं दुरासदम्। यमौ च दृढधन्वानौ यमकालोपमद्युती। विराटद्रुपदौ वीरौ यमकालोपमद्युती॥
target: (Who can bear force of) myself when in wrath or of the Bhima who is hard to approach or of the twin brothers who firmly grasp the bow and whose effulgence is like that of Yama (who carries away life) and Kala (who cuts the thread of life) and the heroes Virates and Drupada who have the same quality?

source: सा श्रुत्वा वचनं तस्य कृत्वा रूपमनुत्तमम्। लोभयामास ललिता विश्वामित्रं शुचिस्मिता॥
target: Hearing Indra's words, that comely damsel of luminous smiles, heightening her charms exceedingly inspired Viśvāmitra with desire.

source: एष पारे समुद्रस्य हिरण्यपुरमारुजत्। जित्वा षष्टिं सहस्राणि निवातकवचान् रणे॥
target: He penetrated into Hiranyapura, on the other side of the sea, after vanquiching in battle sixty thousands of Nivatakvachas.

source: तनुत्यजां नृसिंहानामाहवेष्वनिवर्तिनाम्॥ या गतिर्गुरुणा प्रोक्ता पुरा रामेण तां स्मरे।
target: I remember the end, described to me formerly by my preceptor Rama, which befell those foremost of men who laid down their lives and did not return from the field of battle.

source: शङ्खभेरीमृदङ्गानां कुञ्जराणां च गर्जताम्। विस्फारितविकृष्टानां कार्मुकाणां च कूजताम्॥ शब्दः समभवद् राजन् दिविस्पृग् भरतर्षभ। द्रवतां च पदातीनां शस्त्राणां पततामपि॥
target: The noise, O foremost of the Bharata race, created by the blowing of conchs, the bear of drums, the roar of elephants and the twang of bows stretched with force, reached the very heavens, O monarch. The tumult, made also by running foot-soldiers and falling weapons.

source: द्वितीयेन तथैवाह्रा योजनानि तु विंशतिः। कृतानि प्लवगैस्तूर्णं भीमकायैर्महाबलैः॥
target: The exceedingly strong and huge-bodied monkeys on the second day speedily disposed of twenty Yojanas.

source: वेगमास्थाय बलवान् निमील्य नयने राजन् पदातिनॊणमभ्ययात्॥ अंसे शिरा भीमसेनः करौ कृत्वोरसि स्थिरौ। मनोऽनिलगरुत्मताम्॥ यथा हि गोवृषा वर्ष प्रतिगृह्णाति लीलया। तथा भीमो नरव्याघ्रः शरवर्ष समग्रहीत्॥ स वध्यमानः समरे रथं द्रोणस्य मारिष। ईषायां पाणिना गृह्य प्रचिक्षेप महाबलः॥ द्रोणस्तु सत्वरो राजन् क्षिप्तो भीमेन संयुगे।
target: With his eyes closed, on foot, attacked Drona. Then like a bovine bull receiving a shower of rain without any pain whatsoever. Bhima that foremost of men received that shower of arrows, Proceeding from Drona's car. O sire, although wounded by Drona in battle, that puissant hero, catching hold of the shaft of Drona's car with his hands, over-threw it. Thereupon Drona thus over-thrown with vehemence by Bhima.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच तस्मै शुश्रूषमाणाय भूयः शान्तनवस्तदा। दैवं वंशं यथान्यायमाचष्ट पुरुषर्षभ॥
target: Vaishampayana said On this subject, the royal son of Shantanu, ( foremost of men, duly recited the names of the celestials to Yudhishthira who was desirous of hearing.

source: मदं प्रमादं पुरुषेषु हित्वा संयच्छ भावं प्रतिगृह्य मौनम्। प्रद्युम्नसाम्बावपि ते कुमारी नोपासितव्यौ रहिते कदाचित्॥
target: Avoiding all excitement and carelessness in the presence of men, conceal your mind by observing silence. You should not stay or talk long even with your sons Pradyumna and Samba.

source: विशेषतश्च वासार्थं सभां ग्रामे वृकस्थले। विदधे कौरवो राजा बहुरत्नां मनोरमाम्॥
target: Especially for his residence in the town of Vrikasthala the Kuru king erected an enchanting palace adorned with many gems and precious stones.

source: जिघांसन्ती ततस्तां तु ज्वलदग्निशिरोरुहाम्॥ सव्यमुष्टिप्रहारेण पराजित्य सुभैरवाम्। प्रदोषकाले प्रविशं भीतयाऽहं तयोदितः॥
target: And striking with my left clenched fist that exceedingly dreadful (form), having flames for her hair, who had sought to take my life, and vanquishing her (thus), I entered (Lankā) at dusk. Then that one affrighted addressed me, saying,

source: अज्ञायमानापि सती सुखमसम्युषिता त्वयि। सर्वकामैः सुविहिता रक्ष्यमाणा सदा त्वया॥ तु
target: “Although I stayed here unrecognised, still I lived with your happily and supplied with all the objects of my desire and ever protected by you.

source: परित्यज्य च पाञ्चाल्यं प्रयाता यत्र सौबलः। राज्ञोऽदर्शनसंविग्ना वर्तमाने जनक्षये॥
target: Leaving the prince of the Panchalas they proceeded where Subala's son was, anxious to see the king during that terrible onslaught.

source: विव्याध च सुतीक्ष्णेन पृषत्केन महामृधे। परीप्सन् स्वसुतं वार्ष्णेयेनाभिपीडितम्॥
target: Then in that great battle, he pierced him of the Vrishni race with arrows of excceding sharpness, desirous of rescuing his own son so afflicted by the latter (Satyaki).

source: अमोघा रात्रयश्चापि नित्यमायान्ति यान्ति च। यदाहमेतज्जानामि न मृत्युस्तिष्ठतीति ह।
target: When I know that Death waits for none, how can I pass my days without covering myself with the raiment of knowledge.

source: ततः सिंहपुरं रम्यं चित्रायुधसुरक्षितम्। प्राधमद् बलमास्थाय पाकशासनिराहवे॥
target: The son of the chastiser of Paka (Arjuna) then conquered the charming city of Singhapura which was well protected by all kinds of weapons.

source: सा तान् कुशलिनः सर्वान् विमुक्ताञ्जातवेदसः। रोरूयमाणान् ददृशे वने पुत्रान् निरामयान्॥
target: She found that all of them had escaped from the conflagration and they were all well. Seeing their mother, they too began to weep, although they were safe and well.

source: व्रतानां किं फलं प्रोक्तं कीदृशं वा महाद्युते। नियमानां फलं किं च स्वधीतस्य च किं फलम्॥
target: What are the fruits, described in the scriptures, of the vows that men observe. Of what nature are the fruits, you of great splendour, of observances of other kind? What, again, are the fruits of one's Vedic studies.

source: योनिर्वरिष्ठा विरजा वितन्वी शय्याचिरा वारिवहा यशोदा। विश्वावती चाकृतिरिष्टसिद्धा गङ्गोक्षितानां भुवनस्य पन्थाः॥
target: She is the highest cause of all things; she is perfectly pure. She is as subtile as Brahma. She is the best bed for the dying. She takes creatures speedily to the celestial region. She carries a large volume of water. She confers great fame on all. She is the protectress of the universe. She is at one with every forin. She is very much coveted by persons crowned with success. Indeed, Ganga is the path to that celestial region of those who have bathed in her water.

source: स तत्र भगवान देवः पुष्करे भ्राजयन् दिशः। ब्रह्मा समभवत् तात् सर्वभूतपितामहः॥
target: Then, O son the illustrious and divine Brahman, the Grandfather of all creatures, came into being from that lotus, lighting all the points of the horizon with his effulgence.

source: एवमुक्ता तु सा कन्या तेन राज्ञा तमाश्रमे। उवाच हसती वाक्यमिदं सुमधुराक्षरम्॥
target: Having been thus addressed by the king in that lermitage, the maiden smilingly replied to him in sweet words.

source: तां रम्यजलसम्पूर्णां संतीर्य सहबान्धवः। शृङ्गवेरपुरं रम्यं प्रविवेश ससैनिकः॥
target: And having along with his friend crossed over that river filled with beautiful waters, Bharata together with his army entered the charming city of Srigavera.

source: हितं वयस्यभावेन ब्रूमि नोपदिशामि ते। वयस्यतां पूजयन्मे न त्वं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
target: In the spirit of a friend I tell what is for your good: I do not instruct you. Honour the amity I bear towards you. It behoveth you not to weep.

source: तच्छ्रुत्वा विस्मयं जग्मुर्धृतराष्ट्रादयो नृपाः। सम्पूज्य मनसा कृष्णं सर्वे प्राञ्जलयोऽभवन्॥
target: All the kings with Dhritarashtra amongst thein become stricken with wonder upon hearing the words of the Kuru grandfather. In their minds they adored Krishna and then turned towards him with hands clasped in respect.

source: द्रौपद्युवाच इमे ते भ्रातरः पार्थ शुष्यन्ते स्तोकका इव। वावाश्यमानास्तिष्ठन्ति न चैनानभिनन्दसे॥
target: These your brothers, O Partha, are crying and drying their tongues like Chatakas, but you do not please them.

source: पादुके ते तु रामस्य गृहीत्वा भरतः स्वयम्। चरणाभ्यां नरेन्द्रस्य योजयामास धर्मवित्॥ अब्रवीच्च तदा रामं भरतः सकृताञ्जलिः।
target: And himself taking the sandals of Rāma, Bharata, conversant with piety, placed them at the feet of that lord of men. Thereupon Bharata with folded hands spoke to Rāma, saying.

source: तां वृक्षपर्णच्छदनां मनोज्ञां यथाप्रदेशं सुकृतां निवाताम्। वासाय सर्वे विविशुः समेताः सभां यथा देवगणाः सुधर्माम्॥
target: And as the celestials enter the hall entitled Sudharmă, they together with the view of dwelling in it, entered the mansion beautiful to behold, thatched with the leaves of trees, built at a convenient site, well-made, and keeping out the wind.

source: सावित्र्युवाच उपवासान्न मे ग्लानिर्नास्ति चापि परिश्रमः। गमने च कृतोत्साहां प्रतिषेढुं न मार्हसि।॥
target: Savitri said : Neither do I feel exhaustion nor lassitude on account of the fast. (Moreover) I am very eager to go. Do not (therefore) prevent me.

source: यत्र यत्र हतः शूरः शत्रुभिः परिवारितः। अक्षयाँल्लभते लोकान् यदि दैन्यं न सेवते॥
target: Wherever the hero has met with death in the inidst of enemies without showing ignoble fear or cheerlessness, he has succeeded in acquiring blessed regions hereafter.

source: एषा पृथक् समस्तानां श्रूयते मधुरस्वरः। पुष्पसम्मोदने काले वाशतां सुमनोहरम्॥
target: When you put forth your blossoms, the sweet notes of all these dwellers of your branches are heard separately when they sing their melodious songs.

source: द्वियोजनशतास्तस्य दंष्ट्राः परमदारुणाः। हनुस्तस्याभवद् भूमावास्यं चास्यास्पृशद् दिवम्।।२८
target: Of terrible appearance, his fangs were two hundred Yojanas in length. One of his cheeks rested on the Earth and the other touched the sky.

source: षट्कर्मसम्प्रवृत्तस्य आश्रमेषु चतुर्ध्वपि। सर्वधर्मोपपन्नस्य संवृतस्य कृतात्मनः॥ ब्राह्मणस्य विशुद्धस्य तपस्यभिरतस्य च। निराशिषो वदान्यस्य लोका ह्यक्षरसम्मिताः॥
target: That Brahmana, who, in all the four modes of life, performs the sixfold acts (as regulating the breath, contemplation, etc.), who performs all his duties, who is patient, who has his passions under restraint, whose heart is pure and practises penances, who has no desire of bettering his situation and who is charitable, attains to regions of bliss in the next world.

source: आश्रमेषु यथाकालं चैलभाजनभोजनम्। सदैवोपहरेद् राजा सत्कृत्याभ्यर्च्य मान्य च॥
target: The king should always honour the ascetics and present them, at proper times, with clothes, vessels and food.

source: विष्णुना दैत्यघातैश्च गन्धर्वोरंगधर्षणैः। त्वया समं विमर्दैश्च भृशं हि परितोषितः॥
target: And even as Vişnu had pleased me by destroying the Daityas, you pleased me by harassing the Gandharvas and serpents.

source: विधिप्रयुक्तान् नरदेवधर्मा नुक्तान् समासेन निबोध बुद्ध्या। इमान् विदध्याद् व्यतिसृत्य यो वै राजा महीं पालयितुं स शक्तः॥
target: O king, I have briefly described to you of all the duties laid down in the scriptures. Attend to them, helped by your intelligence. That king, who, in obeying his protector, attends to these, succeeds in ruling the whole Earth.

source: महाभाग्यं गवां चैव ब्राह्मणानां तथैव च। रहस्यं चैव धर्माणां देशकालोपसंहितम्॥
target: It describes the great merit of Brahmanas and kine and it reveals the duties in relation to time and place.

source: को नाम जह्यादिह राज्यहेतोः। आर्यस्य मन्ये मरणाद् गरीयो यद्धर्ममुत्क्रम्य महीं प्रशासेत्॥
target: Having entered into such a pledge in the presence of all the pious and good men, who can now dare break it for the sake of a kingdom in this world? For in my opinion, to a respectable person death is not more serious than an act of transgression in order to gain a kingdom.

source: अप्सरोभिः परिवृतः समृद्ध्या नरवाहनः। इह वैश्रवणस्तात पर्वसंधिषु दृश्यते॥
target: Here too, O affectionate one, during the Parvas is seen Vaisravana (Kubera), carried on the shoulders of men, possessed of vast wealth and surrounded by Apsaras.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच धृतराष्ट्रस्ततो भीष्ममनुमान्य प्रसाद्य च। अवभय॑ च राधेयमिदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥
target: Vaishampayana said Then Dhritarashtra, having pleased Bhishma by approving of his words and having rebuked the son of Radha, said these words.

source: श्चकार शत्रूनपसव्यमातुरान्। ततः प्रयातं त्वरितं धनंजय शतक्रतुं वृत्रनिजघ्नुषं यथा॥ समन्वधावन् पुनरुत्थितैर्ध्वजै रथैः सुयुक्तैरपरे युयुत्सवः।
target: Then Keshava, leaving the distressed enemies on he right side, drove the chariot onward and Dhananjaya when going quickly like Satamanyu (Indra) at the time of killing Vritra was followed by other great warriors with lofty banners and excellent chariots all desirous of gaining a name in battle.

source: राजा भवत्वद्य सुनिर्वृतोऽयं कर्णं रणे नाशयितासि बाणैः। इत्येवमुक्त्वा पुनराह पार्थो युधिष्ठिरं धर्मभृतां वरिष्ठम्॥
target: Today a king Yudhishthira will be pleased. I shall distroyed Karna by my arrows. Thus addressing Arjuna, again said to Yudhishthira, the foremost of man of duties.

source: अहो नाहमिदं कर्म कष्टं दुश्चरितं कृतम्। स्वयं दुर्बुद्धिना मोहाद् येन प्राप्तोऽस्मि संशयम्॥
target: Alas, led by folly I have done a highly improper and wicked act, for which, fool that I am, I have now fallen into such distress.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच क्षेत्र केचिदेवाहुः सुतं केचित्तु शुक्रजम्। तुल्यावेतौ सुतौ कस्य तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह॥
target: Yudhishthira said Some say that one's son is he, who is born in his soil. Some, on the other hand, say that one's son is he who has been begotten from his seed. Are both these kinds of sons equal? Whose, again, is the son to be? Do you tell me, this, O grandfather.

source: एतत् ते कथितं पुत्र यथावदनुपृच्छतः। सांख्यज्ञाने तथा योगे यथावदनुवर्णितम्॥
target: I have thus answered you, O son, according to your questions, and according to the way in which the matter is explained in the Sankhya System and the Yoga Philosophy."

source: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा कौतूहलसमन्वितम्॥ कथयामास धर्मात्मा तस्य शब्दस्य निश्चयम्।
target: Hearing Rāghava's words dictated by curiosity, that righteous-souled one spoke, unfolding the true cause of that noise.

source: स नित्यमन्तरप्रेप्सुनिषधेष्ववसच्चिरम्। अथास्य द्वादशे वर्षे ददर्श कलिरन्तरम्॥
target: Always intent on detecting a flaw in Nala, he resided in the country of the Nishadhas. In the twelfth vear Kali found out a fault of his.

source: अर्धचन्द्रेण वदने शिरस्येकेन कर्णिना। बाह्वोर्विव्याध नाराचैर्दशभिस्तु कपीश्वरम्॥
target: He pierced that lord of monkey's face with half-moon (shaped) arrows, his head with one having its head made like a hook and his arms with ten nārācas. (Iron arrows).

source: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा व्यासो धर्मात्मजं नृपम्॥ यथाकालं यथायोगं सज्जाः स्म तव दीक्षणे।
target: Then the highly energetic Vyasa said to the royal son of Dharma, “As regards ourselves, we are all prepared to initiate you in view of the sacrifice.

source: ततो देवर्षिगन्धर्वा विस्मयं परमं गताः। कौतूहलपराः सर्वे पितामहमथाब्रुवन्॥
target: Then the celestials, the sages, and the Gandharvas were all filled with great wonder; and urged by curiosity they then thus spoke to the Grandsire Brahma.

source: यात्राकालाश्च चत्वारस्त्रिवर्गस्य च विस्तरः। विजयो धर्मयुक्तश्च तथार्थविजयश्च ह॥ आसुरश्चैव विजयस्तथा कार्येन वर्णितः। लक्षणं पञ्चवर्गस्य त्रिविधं चात्र वर्णितम्॥
target: The four sorts of time for making journeys, the details of the aggregate of three, the three sorts of victory, viz, that secured piously, that acquired by riches and that obtained by deceit were described, fully. The three kinds of attributes, viz., bad, middling and good, of the five expedients (viz., counsellors, kingdom, fort, army, and treasury) were also described in it.

source: भूतभव्यभवन्नाथः पवनः पावनोऽनलः। कामहा कामकृत् कान्तः कामः कामप्रदः प्रभुः।।४५
target: He who is solicited by all creatures at all times. He who rescues his worshippers by casting kind looks upon them. He who sanctifics even them who are cred. He who merges the lifebreath in the Soul. He who assumes various forms for protecting both the Liberated and the NonLiberated; He who kills the desires of those that are Liberated. He who prevents evil desires from arising in the minds of His worshippers. He who is the father of Kaina. He who is most agreeable. He who is desired by all creatures. He who grants the fruition of all desires. He who has the ability to accomplish all deeds. (290-299)

source: प्राची राजा दक्षिणां भीमसेनो जयः प्रतीची यमजावुदीचीम्। मन्ये त तेषां रथसत्तमानां कालोऽभितः प्राप्त इहोपयातुम्॥
target: The king has gone to the east, Bhimasena towards the south, Arjuna to the west and the twin brothers towards the north. Me-thinks, the time of the arrival of those leading carwarriors, has come.
