source: ततः स मध्यंगतमंशुमन्तं ज्योत्स्नावितानं मुहुरुद्वमन्तम्। ददर्श धीमान् भुवि भानुमन्तं गोष्टे वृष मत्तमिव भ्रमन्तम्॥ लोकस्य पापानि विनाशयन्तं महोदधि चापि समेधयन्तम्। भूतानि सर्वाणि विराजयन्तं ददर्श शीतांशुमथाभियान्तम्॥ या भाति लक्ष्मी वि मन्दरस्था यथा प्रदोषेषु च सागरस्था। तथैव तोयेषु च पुष्करस्था रराज सा चारुनिशाकरस्था॥
target: As if ministering to him (Hanumăn), arose the many thousand-rayed Moon in the midst of the stars, enfolding all creatures with his luminous canopy. And that highly heroic monkey beheld the Moon hued like the sheen of conch, or milk, or lotus-stalk, arisen and afloat (in the heavens), like a swan swimming in a pool. And that intelligent one from the earth beheld the Moon arrive at the mid-heavens, momentarily beaming sea, and on on out in lunar light; appearing (splendid) as if in conjunction with the Sun himself, and like a bull loitering in his stall. And he saw the mild-rayed (Moon), chasing away the remorse of all; swelling the sea; and displaying all creaturs, attain the middle of the sky. And that Lakshmi who on earth remains on Mandara, at eve in the the lotus water, looked exceedingly lovely stationed beside the charming Moon.

source: अनुवर्तामहे यत्तु तं वयं पापपूरुषम्॥ अस्मानप्यनयस्तस्मात् प्राप्तोऽयं दारुणो महान्।
target: Regarding ourselves, since we have followed that sinful wretch, this great calamity has, therefore befallen us.

source: उत्थितः स ह्रदाद् स तुद्यमानो बलवान् वाग्मी रामसमन्ततः॥ वीरः प्रगृह्य महतीं गदाम्।
target: Cut with wordy darts, O Rama, from every side, the powerful and heroic Duryodhana has risen from the lake, armed with his heavy inace.

source: मया समेतोऽरण्यानि रम्याणि विचरिष्यसि। पक्षिभिर्भूङ्गयूथैश्च संघुष्टानि समन्ततः॥
target: You shall range with me in that charming pare of the forest which resounds with the music of the birds and the humming of the bees.

source: धृतराष्ट्रोऽथ राजाऽऽसीत् तस्य पुत्रोऽथ कुण्डिकः। हस्ती वितर्कः क्राथश्च कुण्डिनश्चापि पञ्चमः॥ हविःश्रवास्तथेन्द्राभो भुमन्युश्चापराजितः। धृतराष्ट्रसुतानां तु त्रीनेतान् प्रथितान् भुवि॥ प्रतीपं धर्मनेत्रं च सुनेत्रं चापि भारत। प्रतीपः प्रथितस्तेषां बभूवाप्रतिमो भुवि॥
target: Amongst them Dhritarashtra became king and he had eight sons, namely Kundika, Hasti, Vitarka, Kratha, Kundina, Havishrava, Indrabha and the invincible Bhumanyu. Amongst the sons of Dhritarashtra only three were famous. O descendant of Bharata, (they were) Pratipa, Dharmanetra and Sunetra. Amongst the three Pratipa became unrivalled of all.

source: प्रापणे चास्य मन्त्रस्य निवृत्ताः सर्वमन्त्रिणः। अवश्यं च मया वाच्यं यदृष्टमथवा श्रुतम्।। संविधाय यथान्यायं तद्भवान्कर्तुमर्हति॥
target: All the counsellors have refrained from tendering this counsel to you; but surely I must tell you what I have seen or heard; and adopting proper measures, it behove you to act so.* *In accordance with my suggestion.

source: सुशर्मापि ततो बाणैः पार्थं विव्याध संयुगे। वासुदेवं च सप्तत्या पार्थं च नवभिः पुनः॥
target: Thereupon in that battle Susharma pierced Pritha's son with many shafts; he then pierced the son of Vasudeva with seventy shafts and Arjuna again with nine.

source: शृणु राजन्यथा पौराः कथयन्ति शुभाशुभम्। चत्वरापणरथ्यासु वनेषूपवनेषु च।१३।।
target: Hear, o king, I shall relate to you all those unpleasant things frequently dwelt upon by people in court-yards, markets, public roads, forests and gardens.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तः स भगवान् दाशार्हेणार्जुनेन च। तैजसं रूपमास्थाया दावं दग्धुं प्रचक्रमे॥
target: Having been thus addressed by Dasharha (Krishna) and Arjuna, the illustrious (Agni) put forth his most energetic form and he then prepared himself to consume that forest.

source: एष तावत् समासेन तव संकीर्तितो मया। मोक्षार्थो विस्तरेणाथ भूयो वक्ष्यामि तच्छृणु॥
target: Thus, O son, have I told you briefly. Hear me now, for I shall tell you fully, the desirability of the acquisition of Liberation.

source: भीष्म उवाच अथ सा स्त्री तमुवाच बाढमेवं भवत्विति। तैलं दिव्यमुपादाय स्नानशाटीमुपानयत्॥
target: Bhishma said Thus ordered the lady said Be it so! She then brought oil and a piece of cloth for his wear during the ablutions.

source: भृशं नियुक्तस्तस्यां च मदनेन मदोत्कटः। न तु तं राक्षस: कामं शशाकात्मनि गुहितुम्॥
target: That Raksasa, puffed up with pride, was passionately attached to her and so he could not restrain his amour in him.

source: ये तु दग्धेन्धना लोके पुण्यपापविवर्जिताः। तेषां त्वयाभिनिर्दिष्टा पारम्पर्यागता गतिः॥
target: Of those persons who have freed themselves from desire, and that are shorn of both merit and demerit, you have spoken of the Knowledge they attain, as handed down from preceptor to preceptor, as the end they acquire.

source: येऽन्यायेन जिहीर्षन्तो धनमिच्छन्ति कस्यचित्। तेभ्यस्तु न तदाख्येयं स धर्म इति निश्चयः॥
target: Sometimes men, desirous of getting hold of the wealth of some one, make enquiries. One should never answer such enquiries. That is settled duty.

source: षष्टि गसहस्राणि दशान्यानि च भारत। युधिष्ठिरस्य यान्यासन् युधि सेना महात्मनः॥
target: And besides these, O Bharata, thousand elephants which were in the seven divisions of the army of Yudhishthira in that battle,

source: नूनं शांतनवोऽपीह न धर्ममनुवर्तते। द्रोणश्च विदुरश्चैव कृपश्चान्ये च कौरवाः॥
target: Indeed, the son of Shantanu (Bhishma,) Drona. Vidura, Kripa and other Kurus have not followed the dictates of duty.

source: तस्माद् यत्नात् प्रतीक्षन्ते कालस्योदयमागतम्। न हि ते नाशमृच्छेयुरिति पश्याम्यहं धिया॥
target: It is for this they are carefully waiting for the opportune hour. Such persons never die; this is what I perceive by my good sense.

source: लक्षण्यं गोवृषो यानं यत् प्रधानतमं भवेत्। ब्राह्मण्यास्तद्धरेत् पुत्र एकांशं वै पितुर्धनात्॥
target: The son born of the Brahmani wife shall, in the first place, appropriate from his father's wealth a bull of good marks, and the best car or vehicle.

source: क्लेशिता हि त्वया पार्था धर्मपाशसितास्तदा। सभायां द्रौपदी चैव तैश्च तन्मर्षितं तव॥
target: The sons of Pritha had been persecuted by you in the Assembly-hall, but being bound by the ties of virtue they over-looked all that at the time.

source: संकीर्तनं च रामस्य सीतायाः प्रसवौ शुभौ॥ अर्धरात्रे तु शत्रुघ्नः शुश्राव सुमहत्प्रियम्। पर्णशालां ततो गत्वा मातर्दिष्ट्येति चाब्रवीत्॥
target: Hearing the Sītā without any trouble had given birth to two sons and elderly female ascetics had been engaged in protecting them and bearing the chanting of Råma's glories in the midnight, Satrughna thought within himself.

source: इत्युक्तो वासुदेवेन बीभत्सुरपराजितः। आबभाषे तदा विद्वानिदं वचनमर्थवत्॥
target: Having been thus spoken to by the son of Vasudeva, the invincible and learned Vibhatsu said these words of (grave) signification to the former

source: मां वा शल्यो रणे हन्तां तं वाहं भद्रमस्तु वः॥ इति सत्यामिमां वाणी लोकवीरा निबोधत।
target: Either Shalya will kill me in battle or I will kill him. Blessed be you. Listen to these true words, O foremost of heroes in the world.

source: यत्र पूर्वाभिसर्गे वै धर्मचक्र प्रवर्तितम्। नैमिषे गोमतीतीरे तत्र नागाह्वयं पुरम्॥
target: In that place whence in course of a former creation, the wheel of virtue was set in motion, in that forest which is known by the name of Naimisha, and which is situate on the banks of the Gomati, there is a city called Nagapura.

source: बभूव श्रीमती राजशाण्डिल्यस्य महात्मनः। सुता धृतव्रता साध्वी नियता ब्रह्मचारिणी॥
target: The great Shandilya, O king, had a beautiful daughter who was chaste, observant of severe vows self-restrained, and led a life of cclibacy.

source: जम्बूमार्ग समाविश्य देवर्षिपितृसेवितम्। अश्वमेधमवाप्नोति सर्वकामसमन्वितः॥
target: He who goes to the Jambu marga which is frequented by the celestials Rishis and the Pitris, obtains the fruits of a horse-sacrifice and fulfillment of all his wishes.

source: परस्पराश्लिष्टशाखैः पादपैः कुसुमान्वितैः। अशोभत वनं तत् तु महेन्द्रध्वजसंनिभैः॥
target: The trees, with its flowery branches, entwining with one another, looked exceedingly beautiful and appeared like so many Indra's poles.

source: प्रायेण श्रीमतां लोके भोक्तुं शक्तिर्न विद्यते। काष्ठान्यपि हि जीर्यन्ते दरिद्राणां च सर्वशः॥
target: It is very common in this world, that rich men have no appetite, while the poor can digest pieces of wood.

source: ब्रह्मणा तत्र सरसि यूपश्रेष्ठः समुच्छ्रितः। यूपं प्रदक्षिणं कृत्वा वाजपेयफलं लभेत्॥
target: A best sacrificial pillar was built on that lake by Brahma. He who walks round that pillar obtains the fruits of Vajapeya (sacrifice).

source: तेनैव स्थमुख्येन मनसस्तुल्यगामिना। धर्मराजविसृष्टेन दिव्येनानादयन् दिशः॥
target: On that celestialsly-made and the best of cars, which possessed the speed of mind, and which was given to him by Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira), and which filled the ten points of the horizon with the rattle of his wheels.

source: यस्य भार्या गृहे नास्ति साध्वी च प्रियवादिनी। अरण्यं तेन गन्तव्यं यथारण्यं तथा गृहम्॥
target: He who has not in his house a wife, chaste and of sweet speech, should go to the forest. For such a one there is no difference between a home and a forest.

source: ब्राह्मणानां परिभवात् परिवादाच्च भारत। कुलान्यकुलतां यान्ति न्यासापहरणेन च॥
target: By speaking ill of the Brahmanas and by insulting them, O Bharata, the high families as become degenerated, also by the misappropriation of what has been entrusted to them..

source: यो न यानं न पर्यत न पीठं न गजं रथम्। आरोहेत् सम्मतोऽस्मीति स राजवसतिं वसेत्॥
target: He alone can live in a royal residence who does not, with the confidence that he is a favorite, make use of the king's car, vehicle, or bedstead, or seat, or elephant or chariot.

source: भीष्म उवाच एवमुक्तो मतङ्गस्तु संशितात्मा यतव्रतः। अतिष्ठदेकपादेन वर्षाणां शतमच्युतः॥
target: Bhishma said Thus addressed by Indra, Matanga of restrained vows and wellcontrolled soul, stood for a century of years on one foot, O you of unfading glory.

source: पुण्यश्च रमणीयश्च स देशो वः प्रकीर्तितः। तदेतत्कथितं सर्वं मया ब्राह्मणसत्तमाः। यथा देश: स विख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु सुव्रताः॥
target: I have described to you that beautiful and holy place. I have told you, O best of Brahmanas, all about this place, a place famous in the three worlds.

source: इन्द्रजालं च माया वै कुहका वाऽपि मीषणा। आत्तशस्त्रस्य संग्रामे वहन्ति प्रतिगर्जनाः॥
target: Illusion is sometimes frightful but it only inspires rage in him who has taken up arms and is ready for battle.

source: न च संध्यामुपासीत न च जाप्यं प्रवर्तयेत्। न संकिरेत् तदन्नं च ततः पूयेत ब्राह्मणः॥
target: Without performing his ablutions Brahmana should not recite his evening prayers nor engage in religious meditation, nor take his food a second time. By so doing he is purified.

source: तस्याशुक्षिप्तान् भल्लान् हि भल्लैः संनतपर्वभिः। प्रत्यविध्यदमेयात्मा ब्रह्मास्त्रं समुदीरयन्॥
target: Then Arjuna of generous soul discharging the Brahma weapons and with his Bhallas of close knots, repulsed the Valas so quickly shot at him by Drona.

source: अन्वशासच्च धर्मात्मा पृथिवीं सागराम्बराम्। प्रशान्तचेताः कौरव्यः स्वराज्यं प्राप्य केवलम्। व्यासं च नारदं चैव तांश्चान्यानब्रवीन्नृपः॥
target: And having regained his kingdom, with a tranquil mind, that prince of Kuru's race thus addressed Vyasa, Narada and the other sages who were present.

source: पूर्णचन्द्राननस्याथ शोकापनुदमात्मनः। लोके रामस्य बुबुधे सम्प्रियत्वं महात्मनः॥ आत्मनश्च प्रजानां च श्रेयसे च प्रियेण च । प्राप्ते काले स धर्मात्मा भक्त्या त्वरितवान् नृपः॥ नानानगरवास्तव्यान् पृथग्जानपदानपि। समानिनाय मेदिन्यां प्रधानान् पृथिवीपतिः॥
target: He therefore gave them to understand that the installation of the high-souled Rāma of countenance resembling the full moon would dispel his grief, at the same time that it would be universally hailed by the people. Therefore, influenced by his affection (for his subjects,) and with the view of compassing his own as well as their welfare, the righteous monarch urged expedition (upon his counsellors;) and that lord of earth brought together the prime and noble from the various regions and countries of the earth.

source: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया। मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते॥
target: The Illusion of Mine, developed from the said three qualities is marvelous and difficult to transcend. Those, that resort to Me alone, cross beyond this illusion.

source: सुराणामसुराणां च समजायत वै मिथः। ऐश्वर्य प्रति संघर्षस्त्रैलोक्ये सचराचरे॥
target: In the days of yore, great battles were often faught between the Devas and the Asuras for the sovereignty over the three worlds.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच किमेकं दैवतं लोके किं वाप्येकं परायणम्। स्तुवन्तः कं कमर्चन्तः प्राप्नुयुर्मानवाः शुभम्॥
target: Yudhishthira said Who may be said to be the One God in the world? Who may be said to be the One Object which is our only refuge? Who is He by adoring whom or singing whose praises human beings would get what is beneficial?

source: स्कन्धमारोप्य भद्रं ते मध्येऽस्माकं विहायसा। गच्छ नीचिकया गत्या यथा चैनां न पीडयेः॥
target: On your shoulder and go with us adopting a course not far overhead, so that you may not make her feel uneasy. Let blessings be on you.

source: सत्यवानुवाच अभ्यासगमनाद् भीरु पन्थानो विदिता मम। वृक्षान्तरालोकितया ज्योत्स्नया चापि लक्षये॥
target: Satyavana said : Timid girl, the paths are well known to me as I go by them often. Further, by the moonlight falling between the trees I can discern them.

source: तथेन्द्रियाणि सर्वाणि पश्यन्तीत्यभिचक्षते॥ न चेन्द्रियाणि पश्यन्ति मन एवात्र पश्यति।
target: It is commonly said that the Senses perceive. This is not true, for it is the Mind that perceives through the Senses.

source: जमदग्निरुवाच अद्यैनं दीप्तकिरणं रेणुके तव दुःखदम्। शरैर्निपातयिष्यामि सूर्यमस्त्राग्नितेजसा॥
target: Jamadagni said O Renuka, this very day shall I destroy, with the fiery energy of my weapons, the star of the day with his burning rays, who has afflicted you thus.

source: जलोदरसमायुक्ताः श्चित्रिणः पलितास्तथा। अपुमांसः कृताः स्त्रीभिर्जडान्धबधिरास्तथा॥
target: Women have sometimes caused dropsy and leprosy, decrepitude, impotency and idiocy, blindness and deafness in men (by administering drugs to enchant them).

source: ततः शरसहस्रेण द्रोणं विव्याध पार्थिवः। साश्वसूतध्वजरथं तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: Then with a thousand shafts, the son of Pandu pierced Drona together with his horses, charioteer, standard and car and this (feat on the part of Yudhishthira) seemed marvellous.

source: त्रिवर्गो हि समासक्तो राजधर्मेषु कारैव। मोक्षधर्मश्च विस्पष्टः सकलोऽत्र समाहितः॥
target: O you of Kuru's race, Religion, Profit, and Pleasure depend on royal duties. It is also clear that the practices that lead to liberation equally depend on them.

source: ततोऽसृजत् तमः कृष्णः सूर्यस्यावरणं प्रति॥ योगी योगेन संयुक्तो योगिनामीश्वरो. हरिः।
target: Thereafter that lord of the kings viz., Krishna created a veil of darkness for covering the sun, by means of his Yoga prowess.

source: अस्या नूनं पुनर्लाभान्नैषधः प्रीतिमेष्यति। राजा राज्यपरिभ्रष्टः पुनर्लब्ध्वा च मेदिनीम्॥
target: Certainly the king of the Nishadhas will obtain great delight by regaining his wife, even as the monarch, deprived of his kingdom, does by recovering his lost territories.

source: एकदेवसदायुक्ता एकमन्त्रविधिक्रियाः। पृथग्धर्मास्त्वेकवेदाधर्ममेकमनुव्रताः॥
target: One uniform Soul was the object of their meditation, there was but one religion and one ordinance. Though Though they had different characteristics, they followed one Veda and they had one religion.

source: कुशल्यहं कुशलिनं समासाद्य धनंजयम्। हते जयद्रथे राजन् पुनरेष्यामि तेऽन्तिकम्॥
target: Safely shall I reach Dhananjaya who is also safe and after the slaughter of Jayadratha, we both shall come back to you, O king.

source: द्वैपायन: सशिष्यश्च सिद्धाश्चान्ये मनीषिणः। शतयूपश्च राजर्षिर्वृद्धः परमधार्मिकः॥
target: The Island-born Vyasa with all his disciples, and other persons gifted success, and the royal sage Shatayupa of advanced years and possessed of greit merit, also came.

source: धर्मलब्धैर्युतो दारैरग्नीनुत्पाद्य यत्नतः। द्वितीयमायुषो भागं गहमेधी भवेद् व्रती॥
target: Then, having married according to the ordinances, and having carefully established the domestic fire, he should, observing all the Vows and fasts, become a house-holder and pass the second period of life.

source: सोऽतिविद्धो भृशं क्रुद्धः पदाक्रान्त इवोरगः॥ मानी द्रौणिरसम्भ्रान्तो बाणपाणिरभाषत।
target: The proud and dauntless son of Drona, (thus) deeply pierced (with Dhristdyumna's arrows) became as enraged as a serpent crushed by foot and (then), arrow in hand, thus said

source: किं पुनर्मम दुष्पुत्रैः क्लिष्टः सम्प्रति पाण्डवः। निष्ठुरो रोषणोऽत्यर्थं भज्येतापि न संनमेत्। तदैव न हताः पुत्रा मम मनस्विना। तिर्यक्प्रेक्षी संहतभूः कथं शाम्येद् वृकोदरः॥
target: How can that son of Pandu do so now having been wronged by my wicked sons. Cruel and wrathful, he could not bend even when broken. Looking at things ask once, with his eyebrows contracted how can Vrikodara be peaceful.

source: अद्य मे कुशलं देव अद्य मे कुशलं व्रतम्। अद्य मे सफलं जन्म अद्य मे सफलं तपः॥ यत्ते देवगणैर्वन्द्यौ वन्देऽहं चरणौ तव। इदं राज्यमिमे पुत्रा इमे दारा इमे वयम्। ब्रह्मन्कि कुर्मः किं कार्यमाज्ञापयतु नो भवान् ॥
target: Today have I obtained all auspiciousness, O lord; today has my religious observance been fruitful; today has my birth proved blessed and today has my devout penance been crowned with success, for I bow to your feet, which have been worshipped by the celestials. This my kingdom, these my sons, this my wife and myself are all at your disposal do you order me, O Brahmaņa, what I may do for you.

source: एष चैतत् परं ब्रह्म ज्ञेयो विज्ञानचक्षुषा। एवमेतत् पुरा दृष्टं मया वै ज्ञानचक्षुषा॥ कथितं तच्च वै सर्वं मया पृष्टेन तत्त्वतः।
target: He is the Supreme Lord who can be known with the help of the eye of Knowledge alone. It was thus that, helped by the eye of Knowledge, I saw, in days of yore, that foremost of gods.

source: तांस्तु सम्प्रस्थितान् दृष्ट्वा भीष्मः कुरुपितामहः। लज्जया वीडितो राजञ्जगाम स्वं निवेशनम्॥
target: Having seen them gone, Bhishma, the grandfather of the Kurus, bent down his head in shame. O king, he too then went away to his house,

source: इयं वस्त्रावकर्तेन संवीता चारुहासिनी। उन्मत्तेव वरारोहा कथं बुद्ध्वा भविष्यति॥
target: How will this sweet smiling and slenderwaisted Damayanti live, when awaking, she shall find herself clothed, like one mad, in half a piece of cloth?

source: अशुभान्येव भूयिष्ठं यथा प्रादुर्भवन्ति मे॥ अपि लक्ष्मण सीतायाः सामग्र्यं प्राप्नुयामहे। जीवन्त्याः पुरुषव्याघ्र सुताया जनकस्य वै॥
target: And, considering the many omens that take place before me, O Laksmana, I do not know whether we shall light upon welfare of Janaka's daughter Sita being alive, O best of men.

source: मम कन्या सनाम्नी या भैक्ष्यवच्चोदिता भवेत्। भरेयं चैव यां नाहं तां मे कन्यां प्रयच्छत॥
target: A bride, who bears the same name with me, who will be given to me as a gift and whom I shall not have to maintain,(If there is such a bride), O bestow her on me.

source: उशीनर कपोते तु यदि स्नेहस्तवानघ। ततस्त्वं मे प्रयच्छाद्य स्वमांसं तुलया धृतम्॥
target: O sinless Ushinara, if you feel such affection for this pigeon do you then give me flesh from your own body, of weight equal to that of this pigeon.

source: नाल्पसंनिचयः कश्चिदासीत् तस्मिन् पुरोत्तमे। कुटुम्बी यो ह्यसिद्धार्थो गवाश्वधनधान्यवान्॥
target: In that prime of cities, there was none who had not at his command a plenteous supply of the good things, and there was no householder who was not well off in horses and kine, and corn and wealth.

source: वराहरुधिराभेण शुचिना च सुगन्धिना। अनुलिप्तं परायेन चन्दनेन परंतपम्॥ स्थितया पार्श्वतश्चापि वालव्यजनहस्तया। उपेतं सीतया भूयश्चित्रया शशिनं यथा॥
target: Having his body sprinkled with holy and fragrant sandal of the best kind, red as the blood of a hog; and having by him Sītā with a chowry in her hand, like moon himself in the company of citra.

source: आबध्यन्तां पताकाश्च राजमार्गश्च सिच्यताम्। सर्वे च तालापचरा गणिकाश्च स्वलंकृताः॥ कक्ष्यां द्वितीयामासाद्य तिष्ठन्तु नृपवेश्मनः।
target: And do you set up flags, and water the high ways, and let courtesans whose profession is music, adorning themselves stay in the second apartment of the king's residence.

source: यः पश्यति नरो देवान् जाचद् वा शयितोऽपि वा। उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं तं तु देवग्रहं विदुः॥
target: The man who sees the celestials while sleeping or while he is awake soon turn mad. The spirits under whose influence this happens, are called the celestial spirits.

source: केशवस्तु ततो बाहू विधुन्वन् रणमूर्धनि॥ पातयामास तान् सर्वान् दुष्टहस्तीव हस्तिपान्।
target: Then shaking his arms on the field of battle Keshava struck down all of them like an elephant assailing other leading elephants.

source: प्रशान्तभृकृटिः श्रीमान् कृता शान्तिः कुलस्य नः।।१२ तमभ्येत्य सहामात्यः परिष्वज्य नृपात्मजम्।
target: And with the wrinkles of rage smoothed down, and looking happy as if endued with prosperity then will the peace of our race have been effected. Having gone to him with your ininisters and embracing that son of a ruler of men.

source: नहि भारः स ते राम रावणः पुत्रपौत्रवान्। सधनुस्तवं हि लोकांस्त्रीन्विजयेथा न संशयः॥
target: Sure, O Rama, it was no great matter for you (to slay) Rāvaņa along with his sons and grandsons. Furnished with your bow, you can, without doubt, destroy the three worlds themselves.

source: दीप्तास्यनयनाश्चात्र नैकपादशिरोभुजाः रत्नचित्राङ्गदधराः समुद्यतकरास्तथा॥ द्वीपशैलप्रतीकाशाः प्रादुरासन् महागणाः। श्ववराहोष्ट्ररूपाश्च हयगोमायुगोमुखाः॥ ऋक्षमार्जारवदना व्याघ्रद्वीपिमुखास्तथा। काकवक्त्राः प्लवमुखाः शुकवक्त्रास्तथैव च॥
target: Many powerful beings also, of burning mouths and eyes, of many feet, heads, and arms, adorned with arm-lets, set with gems, and with uplifted arms, and looking like elephants and mountains, appeared there. Their faces resembled those of hares, boars, camels, horses, jackals, cows, bears, cats, tigers, pards, crows, apes and parrots.

source: धर्मराजप्रियान्वेषी हत्वा योधान् वरान् वरान्। शूरश्चैव कृतास्रश्च फाल्गुनाभ्येति सात्यकिः॥
target: Having slain numerous warriors all best of their class, the valorous Satyaki ever solicitous of the welfare of Yudhishthira and accomplished in the use of weapons, is approaching you, O Arjuna.

source: नास्य भक्तात् प्रियतरो लोके कश्चन विद्यते। ततः स्वयं दर्शितवान् स्वमात्मानं द्विजोत्तम॥
target: There exists no one in the universe who is dearer to him than one that worships him with devotion. It is, therefore, O best of twice-born ones, that he showed himself to you!

source: तं नर्मदा देवनदी पुण्या शीतजला शिवा। चकमे पुरुषव्याघ्रं स्वेन भावेन भारत।॥
target: Auspicious and sacred and of cool waters, the celestial stream Narmada, in her own nature, O Bharata, courted him.

source: यावत् स्थास्यन्ति गिरयः सरितश्च जनार्दन। तावत् कीर्तिभवः शब्दः शाश्वतोऽयं भविष्यति॥
target: So long as mountains and lakes will exist, O Janardana, so long will the fame of this event last-that is for ever.

source: भवेद्धतोऽयं वातापिरगस्त्येनेव मा गतः। इह त्वं भव संनद्धो यन्त्रितो रक्ष मैथिलीम् ॥
target: Therefore this Mārīca approaching me shall be killed by me like to Vātāpi being devoured by Agastya. Do you therefore vigilantly protect Vaidehi with mail and armours on.

source: शुद्धात्मानः शुद्धवृत्ता राजन् स्वर्गपुरस्कृताः। आर्य युद्धमकुर्वन्त परस्परजिगीषवः॥
target: Of pure souls and pure behavirous, o king, those warriors, keeping the hope of paradise before their mind's eye, fought on fairly, impelled by a desire for conquering one another.

source: तुल्येष्वस्त्रोपदेशेषु सौष्ठवेन च वीर्यवान्। एकः सर्वकुमाराणां बभूवातिरथोऽर्जुनः॥
target: Though the instructions (of Drona) were equal, (to all), yet the mighty Arjuna excelled all (the princes) and became an Athiratha a warrior capable of fighting with sixty thousands foes all at once.

source: नकुलस्तु ततः कर्णं विद्ध्वा सप्तभिराशुगैः। अथास्य धनुषः कोटि पुनश्चिच्छेद मारिष॥
target: Thereupon Nakula, indeed, after having penetrated Karna with seven impetuous arrows, once more severed one of the horns of his bow, O sire.

source: ज्ञेयाः सर्वे च वृत्तान्ता भरतस्येङ्गितानि च। तत्त्वेन मुखवणेन दृष्ट्या व्याभाषितेन च॥
target: You should know, from the colour of his countenance, his looks and his words, all the movements and actions of Bharata.

source: यशोमानौ वर्धयन् पाण्डवानां पुराऽभिनच्छिशुपालं समीक्ष्य। यस्य सर्वे वर्धयन्ति स्म मानं करूषराजप्रमुखा नरेन्द्राः॥
target: In days of old did Krishna merely by looking at him (Shishupala) who was honoured by the kings, at whose head stood the king of the Karushas thereby increasing the fame and honour of the Pandavas.

source: एतत् ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथावृत्तमनिन्दिते॥ अभिभाषस्व मां देवि दूतो दाशरथेरहम्।
target: O you of a blameless person, I have related all to you in regular order. Do you speak to me, O worshipful dame, I am Dasarathi's messenger.

source: ततो द्वैपायनसुतं बहुमानात् समन्ततः। कृताञ्जलिपुटाः सर्वा निरीक्षन्ते स्म देवताः॥
target: All the gods also, of both sexes, joining their hands, paid respect to the son of Island bonr Rishi and looked act him with wonder and reverence.

source: गौरुवाच कशाग्रदण्डाभिहतां क्रोशन्ती मामनाथवत्। विश्वामित्रवलैोरैर्भगवन् किमुपेक्षसे॥
target: Nandini said: O illustrious Sir, I am afflicted by the : stripes of the fearful troops of Vishvamitra I am crying piteously like one who has none; why are you so indifferent to me?

source: ऋक्षवानररक्षांसि जनाश्च पुरवासिनः। आगच्छन्परया भक्त्या पृष्ठतः सुसमाहिताः॥
target: Bears, monkeys and Räkşasas and all the citizens, followed him with great devotion and collected minds.

source: नैषां पश्यामि हन्तारं प्राणिनां संयुगे परम्। विक्रमेणोपसम्पन्नास्तेजोबलसमन्विताः॥
target: I do not see any one else that could kill any of these men in battle. All of them were gifted with great prowess, great energy, and great strength.

source: मानसानां पुनर्योनिर्दुःखानां चित्तविभ्रमः। अनिष्टोपनिपातो वा तृतीयं नोपपद्यते॥
target: The causes of all mental sorrow are twofold viz., delusion of the mind and distress. No third cause is there.

source: अप्राप्तान्येव तान्याशु असंभ्रान्तस्तदार्जुनः। आयुधान्तमरारीणां जग्राहारिनिषूदनः॥
target: Not the least moved thereby the king Arjuna, the slayer of enemies, bore those weapons of the enemies of the celestials.

source: यदा विबुद्धः कौन्तेयस्तदा संच्छिद्य बन्धनम्। उदतिष्ठन्महाबाहुर्भीमसेनो गतव्यथः॥
target: But when the strong-armed Bhima, the son of Kunti, awoke, he tore up the strings with which he was bound and his pains were all gone.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एतच्छ्रुत्वा महाराज धृतराष्ट्रोऽम्बिकासुतः। शोकस्यान्तमपश्यन् वै हतं मेने सुयोधनम्॥ विह्वलः पतितो भूमौ नष्टचेता इव द्विपः।
target: Vaishampayana said Having heard this (the above intelligence), the great king Dhritarashtra, the son of Ambika, experienced, indeed, the farthest limit of grief and considered Suyodhana slain (in the battle); and highly perturbed, he fell down upon the ground, like an elephant, that had lost all his senses.

source: विषयी पुरुषो नित्यं सत्त्वं च विषयः स्मृतः॥ व्याख्यातं पूर्वकल्पेन मशकोदुम्बरं यथा। भुज्यमानं न जानीते नित्यं सत्त्वमचेतनम्। यस्त्वेवं तं विजानीते यो भुङ्क्ते यश्च भुज्यते॥
target: Purusha is always the subject; and Nature the object. It has been explained, by what has been said in a previous part of the discourse where it has been pointed out, that they exist after the manner of the gnat and the Udumbara,

source: यत् त्विदं भवता किंचित् प्रीत्या समुपकल्पितम्। सर्वं तदनुजानामि नहि वर्ते प्रतिग्रहे ॥
target: The things that you have presented me with out of love I accept but can not enjoy.

source: रक्षसां रावणं चापि वानराणां च राघवम्। पश्यतां विस्मिताक्षाणां सैन्यं चित्रमिवाबभौ॥
target: The Rakşasas beholding Rāvana, and the monkeys beholding Rāma with wonder-stricken eyes, the whole army appeared like a picture.

source: इदं च वैष्णवं राम धनुः परपुरजयम्॥ ऋचीके भार्गवे प्रादाद् विष्णुः स न्यासमुत्तमम्।
target: O Rāma, this bow belonging to Vişnu, capable of conquering hostile cities, Vişnu consigned to Bhrgus' son, Reika, as a worthy trust.

source: तमर्जुनः पृषत्कानां शतैः षड्भिरताडयत्। अत्यर्थमिव संक्रुद्धः प्रतिविद्धे जनार्दने॥
target: Then beholding Janardana pierced and excited to the highest pitch of fury, Arjuna struck his foe with six hundred arrows.

source: बुद्धिर्दीप्ता बलवन्तं हिनस्ति बलं बुद्ध्या पाल्यते वर्धमानम्। शत्रुर्बुद्ध्या सीदते वर्धमानो बुद्धेः पश्चात् कर्म यत्तत् प्रशस्तम्॥
target: even a ever Brilliant intelligence weakens powerful person; by intelligence the growing power may be protected; a growing enemy is weakened by the help of intelligence; therefore, work which is undertaken with intelligence is deserving of praise.

source: संजय उवाच धर्मच्छलमपि श्रुत्वा केशवात् स विशाम्पते। नैव प्रीतमना रामो वचनं प्राह संसदि॥ हत्वाऽधर्मेण राजानं धर्मात्मानं सुयोधनम्। जिह्मयोधीते लोकेऽस्मिन् ख्याति यास्यति पाण्डवः॥
target: Sanjaya continued "Hearing this fallacious argument from Keshava, O king, Rama failed to remove his anger and become cheerful. He then said in that assembly, having unfairly killed the righteous king Suyodhana, the son of Pandu shall be known in the world as a wily warrior.

source: अर्जुन उवाच किंनिमित्तमभूद वैरं विश्वामित्रवसिष्ठयोः। वसतोराश्रमे दिव्ये शंस नः सर्वमेव तत्॥
target: Arjuna said: How the hostility between Vishvamitra and Vasishtha, both of whom lived in celestials hermitages? Tell us all this in detail. arose

source: तथैव कुरवी राजन् भीष्मं कृत्वा महारथम्। अग्रतः सर्वसैन्यानां प्रययुः पाण्डवान् प्रति॥
target: The Kauravas also, O king, placing at the van of all their troops the mighty car-warrior Bhishma, advanced against the Pandavas.

source: अतीव सा निशा तेषां बभूव विजयावहा। विद्योतमाना विबभौ समन्ताद् दीपमालिनी॥
target: That night then exclusively brought victory to the Pandavas; echoing with the sound of musical instruments and illumined with torches it then appeared highly beautiful.

source: ततः क्रोधाभिभूतानां वृत्तं लज्जासमन्वितम्। ह्रीश्चैवाप्यनशद् राजंस्ततो मोहो व्यजायत॥
target: When men thus became overwhelmed with anger, modesty and shame disappeared from them, and then they were possessed by carelessness.

source: धौम्यं च भीमं च युधिष्ठिरं च यमौ च कृष्णां च दशार्हसिंहः। उवाच दिष्ट्या भवतां शिवेन प्राप्तः किरीटी मुदितः कृतास्त्रः॥
target: Then, the chief of the Dasharhas said to Dhaumya, Bhima, Yudhishthira, the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva) and Draupadi “it is by your good fortune that Kiriti (Arjuna who wears a coronet on his head) has returned with a merry mind after having been well-versed in the science of weapons."

source: चलत्केसरमात्मानं कृत्वा तस्य तटे स्थितः। ददर्श तस्मिन्सरसि वक्रच्छायामथात्मनः॥ कोऽयमस्मिन्मम रिपुर्वसत्यन्त ले महान्। रूपं चान्तर्गतं तत्र वीक्ष्य तत्पश्यतो हरिः॥ क्रोधाविष्टमना होष नियतं मावमन्यते। तदस्य दुष्टभावस्य पुष्कलं कुमतेहम्॥ एवं स चिन्त्य मनसा स वै वानरचापलात्। आप्लुत्य चापतत्तस्मिन्हदे वानरसत्तमः॥ उत्प्लुत्य तस्मात्स ह्रदादुत्थितः प्लवगः पुनः। तस्मिन्नेव क्षणे राम स्त्रीत्वं प्राप स वानरः॥ मनोज्ञरूपा सा नारी लावण्यललिता शुभा। विस्तीर्णजघना सुधूर्नीलकुन्तलमूर्धजा॥ मुग्धसस्मितवक्रा च पीनस्तनतटा शुभा।
target: Having shaken his manes with a delighted heart, Rkşarāja saw his reflection in his waters. Beholding his own image there that monkey-chief, stricken with anger and anxiety thought-“What arch-enemy of mine is living in the waters? I shall destroy the excellent abode of the vicious-souled one.” Thinking thus within himself, that monkey, out of fickleness, jumped down into the lake. And he again sprang up therefrom. And at the time of rising, O Rama, that leading monkey found himself-metamorphosed into a female form, which was highly charming, graceful and beautiful. Her waist was spacious, eye-brows beautiful and hairs were black and curling; her countenance was beautiful and smiling, breast high and beauty matchless.

source: क्व ते कृतास्त्रता याता किञ्च शेषे जलाशये। स त्वमुत्तिष्ठ युध्यस्व क्षत्रधर्मेण भारत॥
target: Where is that your mastery in weapons? Why do you live within this lake now? Arise, O Bharata and fight, following the duties of a Kshatriya.

source: तैरियं पृथिवीं सर्वा सपर्वतवनाकरा। आपूर्यते महाराज सलिलौघपरिप्लुता॥
target: O great king, those masses of clouds then flood with water the whole earth with her mountains, forests and mines.

source: सर्वथा क्रियतां यत्नः सीतामधिगमिष्यथ ॥ पक्षलाभो ममायं वः सिद्धिप्रत्ययकारकः।
target: Do you strive every way. You shall meet with Sītā. And my getting (back) my wings inspires (us) with confidence as to success.

source: नागानां वध्यमानानामसुराणां च राघव। राक्षसानां दुराधर्षं सत्त्वानां निनदोऽभवत्॥
target: O Rāghava, O you hard to repress, there arose an uproar from serpents, and Asuras, and Rāks asas, and other creatures, that were being slaughtered.

source: अङ्गदो नाम लक्ष्मीवान् वालिसूनुर्महाबलः। प्रस्थितः कपिशार्दूलस्त्रिभागबलसंवृतः॥
target: Own I am one of them And the beautiful and mighty son of Vali, by name Angada, has proceeded with three armies under him.

source: दीप्तमग्निमरण्यं वा यदि रामः प्रवेक्ष्यति। प्रविष्टं तत्र मां देवि त्वं पूर्वमवधारय॥
target: By truth, bow, gifts and things dear to me, do I swear to you; if Rāma shall enter into the wood, know me, Oh worshipful one, to have entered into the fire before that.

source: ब्राह्मण उवाच नाहं तथा भीरु चरामि लोके यथा त्वं मां तर्जयसे स्वबुद्ध्या। विप्रोऽस्मि मुक्तोऽस्मि वनेचरोऽस्मि गृहस्थधर्मा व्रतवांस्तथास्मि॥
target: The Brahmana said I do not, O timid one, move in this world in the manner which you, according to your own understanding, censure. I am a Brahmana endued with Vedic knowledge. I am liberated. I am a hermit, I follow the duties of a houscholder. I observe vows.

source: कालातिक्रमणादेते भक्तवेतनयो ताः। भर्तुः कुप्यन्ति यद्धृत्याः सोऽनर्थः सुमहान् स्मृतः॥
target: Are you aware that the misery caused by the arrears of pay and the irregularity of the issue of rations creates mutiny amongst the soldiers? The learned men call it the greatest of all mischief.

source: न तं युद्धे प्रपश्यामि यो भिन्द्यात् तु शिखण्डिनम्। शस्त्रेण समरे राजन् संनद्धं स्यन्दने स्थितम्॥
target: I do not see that man who could in battle subjugate Shikhandin while under arms, O king, and seated on his chariot clad in mail.

source: अघोषयन्त पुरुषास्तत्र केशवशासनात्। तीर्थयात्रा समुद्रे वः कार्येति पुरुषर्षभाः॥
target: The messengers immediately proclaimed at the command of Keshava that the Vrishnis should make a journey to the sea-coast for bathing in the sacred waters of the ocean.

source: एवं दत्तास्मि रामाय तथा तस्मिन् स्वयंवरे। अनुरक्तास्मि धर्मेण पतिं वीर्यवतां वरम्॥
target: Thus was I bestowed on Rāma on the occasion of that self-choice. And ever since I have been devoted to my husband, the foremost of those possessing prowess.

source: पुरुषार्थमभिप्रेतं समाहर्तुमिहार्हसि। क्रुद्धाल्लुब्धान् परिक्षीणानवलिप्तान् विमानितान्॥
target: It is proper that you should attain to your desired object which is indeed desired by every man. Those who entertain angry feelings against your enemy, those who covet his prosperity, those who have been weakened by him or have been eclipsed by him or insulted by him,

source: मभ्यर्चनीयां शङ्करीं सृजयानाम्। बुभूषद्भिर्ग्रहणीयामनिन्द्यां परासूनामग्रहणीयरूपाम्॥
target: And uttering blessed words which ought to be listened to with all respect by the Bharatas, words that are for the good of the Sanjayas, unexceptionable words that ought to be accepted by those praying for prosperity and incapable of being acted up to by those who are about to meet their end.

source: वनराजीस्तु पश्येमाः पिप्पलानां मनोरमाः। पार्थ गौतमौकः समीपजाः॥
target: O Partha, behold the charming forest of Pipalas and beautiful Lodhras standing near the place where Goutama lived.

source: रुद्राणी रुद्रमासाद्य ह्रदे तत्र समाश्वसत्। विश्रान्तश्च समुत्थाय कैलासमभितो ययौ॥
target: He then adored with the due rites both Rudra and his wife Uma. and rested for some more time by the side of that lake in the course of the Vahuda whose shores he had reached. Refreshed by such rest, he started from that region and then proceed towards Kailasa.

source: निगृह्य राजन् पार्थेभ्यो दद्यां किं दुष्कृतं भवेत्। इदं तु न प्रवर्तेयं निन्दितं कर्म भारत॥
target: 0 king, and make ever to the son of Pritha which will not be a hard thing to do; but I am not inched to do such a blamable deed, o Bharata.

source: सहदेववचः श्रुत्वा द्रौपदी योषितां वरा। उवाच देवी राजानमभिपूज्याभिनन्द्य च॥
target: Hearing these words of Sahadeva, queen Draupadi, that foremost of all women duly honoring the king, said, with proper salutations,

source: पितुः प्रतिज्ञां तामेव पालयिष्यामि तत्त्वतः। चतुर्दश हि वर्षाणि या प्रतिज्ञा पितुर्मम ॥
target: I would faithfully perform my father's promise for fourteen years; for even this is the promise of my father.

source: दुर्लभो हि मनुष्येन्द्र नरः प्रत्यवमर्शवान्। यो वै प्रियसुखे क्षीणे तपः कर्तुं व्यवस्यति॥
target: A person endued with the knowledge of what is essential and what accidental, O king, is very rare,-a man who tries to practise penances, under the conviction that the happiness one enjoys from the possession of such agreeable objects as wives and children brings on ultimately misery.

source: सुखं हि जन्तुर्यदि वापि दुःखं दैवाधीनं विन्दते नात्मशक्त्या। तस्माद् दिष्टं बलवन्मन्यमानो न संज्वरेनापि हृष्येत् कथंचित्॥
target: Remembering that Destiny is supreme (over all), creatures should know that happiness and misery depend on Destiny and not on their own exertion and power.

source: सुखप्रिये सेवमानोऽतिवेलं योगाभ्यासे यो न करोति कर्म। वित्तक्षये हीनसुखोऽतिवेलं दुःखं शेते कामवेगप्रणुन्नः॥
target: He, who having having devoted himself excessively to pleasures, does not to any deed leading to religious meditation, becomes extremely devoid of happiness after his wealth is gone and remains liable to be led by the force of his desires.

source: तत्र पुष्पाणि दिव्यानि सुहृद्भिः सह पाण्डवाः। ददृशुः पञ्चवर्णानि द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी॥
target: And the Pandavas together with their friends and the renowned Draupadi beheld (those) heavenly flowers of five colours.

source: एते कालस्य निधयो नैताञ्जानन्ति दुर्बुधाः। धात्राभिलिखितान्याहुः सर्वभूतानि कर्मणा॥

source: रामाद् रामं जगदभूद् रामे राज्यं प्रशासति। चतुर्विधाः प्रजा रामः स्वर्गे नीत्वा दिवं गतः॥

source: न च पित्रा परित्यक्तो नामर्यादः कथंचन। न लुब्धो न च दुःशीलो न च क्षत्रियपांसनः॥
target: Rāma, the enhancer of Kausalyā's delight had not been abandoned by his father, nor is he devoid of propriety of conduct; he is not avaricious, wicked nor the destroyer of Kaşatriya race.

source: नृशंसे दुष्टचारित्रे कुलस्यास्य विनाशिनि ॥ किं कृतं तव रामेण पापे पापं मयापि वा।
target: You cruel one! You of vile ways! You destroyer of this race! O wicked woman, what has been done by Räma to you; or what wrong have I done you?

target: In the preceptor there is the knowledge of science. The knowledge of sciences and the means to be applied are in the son of Pandu. Heroism exists in Drona whereas both heroism and mighty exist in the son of Pandu.

source: स मासांश्चतुरः कृत्वा प्रमाणं प्लवगेश्वरः। व्यतीतांस्तान् मदोदग्रो विहरन् नावबुध्यते॥

target: He is said to be foolish-minded who desires what ought not to be desired and forsakes those that are fit to be desired and who treats stronger parties with contempt.

target: This celestial gem has been brought by me, O king. It always revives the snakes as often as they die.

target: Thereupon (Rāvana) having long arms, proud of the boon conferred upon him in the three worlds, beheld the heroic Māndhātā, the lord of Ayodhyā and the foremost of kings. The king of seven islands proceeded in a golden and well-painted car resplendent like that of Mahendra, shining in his beauty and sprinkled with celestial unguents. The Ten-necked demon said to him, “Do you give me battle.” Being thus addressed, he, laughing, said to the ten-necked demon, "If your life is not dear to you, do you fight with me, O Raksasa."

source: वादित्राणि च सर्वाणि प्रत्युद्यान्तु सुतं मम॥ घण्टावान मानवः शीघ्रं मत्तमारुह्य वारणम्।
