source: जामदग्न्यं प्रति विभो धन्यमायुष्यमेव च। जामदग्न्येन रामेण तीव्ररोषान्वितेन वै॥ त्रिःसप्तकृत्व: पृथिवी कृता निःक्षत्रिया पुरा। ततो जित्वा महीं कृत्स्ना रामो राजीवलोचनः॥ आजहार क्रतुं वीरो ब्रह्मक्षत्रेण पूजितम्। वाजिमेधं महाराज सर्वकामसमन्वितम्॥
target: It is highly praiseworthy, and it gives longevity to a man who listens to it. It was first recited to Rama the son of Jamadagni. Formerly Jamadagni's son Rama, existed with great anger, rooted out the Kshatriyas from off the face of the Earth for twentyone times. Having subjugated the entire Earth, the heroic Rama having cyes like lotus petals began to make preparations for celebrating a Horse Sacrifice, O king, that is lauded by all Brahmanas and Kshatriyas and that is capable of granting the fruition of every desire.

source: वीरसेनसुतो यैस्तु राज्यात् प्रभ्रंशितः पुरा। अतर्कितविनाश्च देवनेन विशाम्पते॥
target: And in the days of yore Virasena's son was deprived of his kingdom. Do king of the earth, gambling brings on unthought of misfortunes.

source: स्तपोदमाचारविहारशीलाः। देवानृषीन् प्रेतगणांश्च सर्वान् संतर्पयित्वा विधिना परेण॥
target: Having achieved glorious deeds and having gratified all the gods, the saints and the Pitris, you, who are so heroic, devoted to spiritual meditation, self-controlled, given to purity and engaged in self-extertion will at length in due course.

source: क्षत्रियोऽध्ययने युक्तो यजने दानकर्मणि। युद्धे यश्च परित्राता सोऽपि स्वर्गे महीयते॥
target: That Kshatriya who is given to the studies of the Vedas, to the celebration of sacrifices, to the making of gifts, and who rescues the lives of others in battle, similarly acquires great honors in Heaveri.

source: तं तथा पतितं भूमौ नि:संज्ञं प्रेक्ष्य बान्धवाः। कृष्णद्वैपायनश्चैव क्षत्ता व विदुरस्तथा॥ संजयः सुहृदश्चान्ये द्वा:स्था ये चास्य सम्मताः। जलेन सुखशीतेन तालवृन्तैश्च भारत॥ पस्पृशुश्च करैर्गानं वीजमानाश्च यत्नतः। अन्वासन् सुचिरं कालं धृतराष्ट्र तथागतम्॥
target: Seeing him fall down in that state, his friends as also the island-born Vyasa, Vidura, Sanjaya, and other well-wishers, and the trust worthy attendants who used to wait at the gates, sprinkled cool water over his body, and fanned him with palm leaves, and gently rubbed him with their hands. for a long while they solaced the king while in that state.

source: आत्मा जेयः सदा राज्ञा ततो जेयाश्च शत्रवः। अजितात्मा नरपतिविजयेत कथं रिपून्॥
target: The king should first conquer himself and then try to subdue his enemies. He can a king who has not been able to conquer his own self be able to conquer his enemies?

source: अभिपूज्य महात्मानं भीमं भीमपराक्रमम्। पुनरेवार्जुनो वाक्यमुवाचेदं वृकोदरम्॥ न दूरं नगरं मन्ये वनादस्मादहं विभो। शीघ्रं गच्छाम भद्रं ते न नो विद्यात् सुयोधनः॥
target: Thus congratulating the illustrious and greatly powerful Bhima, Arjuna thus again addressed Vrikodara, "O lord, I believe there is a town not far off from this forest. O blessed one, let us soon go from this place, so that Duryodhana may not trace us."

source: दक्षिणो दक्षिणं बाहुमलक्तमसिना ततः। चिच्छेद रामो वेगेन सव्यं वीरस्तु लक्ष्मणः॥
target: Rāma, stationed on the right side cut off in no time its right arm with his dagger and the heroic Laksmana, the left one. It may mean also expert.

source: संजय उवाच अभिमन्यू रथोदारः पिशङ्गैस्तुरगोत्तमैः। अभिदुद्राव तेजस्वी दुर्योधनबलं महत्॥
target: Sanjaya said Thereafter the generous hero Abhimanyu borne by excellent steeds of tawny colour, rushed against the mighty divisions of Duryodhana,

source: तदाचक्ष्व यथा तत्त्वं देवदेव मम स्वयम्। असिचक्रसहायस्त्वं योत्स्यसे रावणं प्रति॥
target: Do you tell me, the truth, O god of gods, that I may myself fight; or do you, with your sword and discus, vanquish Ravana.

source: पूजयामास चैवाथ विधिवद् भूरिदक्षिणः। यथार्हममितात्मानं विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा॥
target: And that generous one (Yudhishthira) duly worshipped (Indra) of immeasurable soul as befitting his dignity having strict regard to proper forin.

source: र्गदाभिरुग्रैः परिघैश्च दीप्तैः। वजैः पिनाकैरशनिप्रहारैः शतनिचक्रैर्मथिताश्च पेतुः॥ सैन्यं
target: Wounded and crushed with those dreadful arrows, spears, darts, maces, spiked bludgeons of great lustre, thunder-bolts, trident, Asanis, wheels and Shataghnis, the Kaurava troops began to fall down.

source: ज्ञानवृद्धं च वृद्धं च भूयांसं केशवं मम। अजानत इवाख्यासि संस्तुवन् कौरवाधम॥
target: Owretch of the Kuru race, wishing to praise Keshava (Krishna), you describe him before me as great and superior in knowledge and age, as if I know nothing.

source: को ह्येव युष्मान् सह केशवेन सचेकितानान् पार्षतबाहुगुप्तान्। ससात्यकीन् विषहेत प्रजेतुं लध्वाऽपि देवान् सचिवान् सहेन्द्रान्॥
target: Who is capable of withstanding you who are assisted by Keshava, Chekitana and Satyaki and protected by the arms of the son of Prishata even after getting Indra and all his divine followers on his side.

source: पश्य लक्ष्मण गृध्रोऽयमुपकारी हतश्च मे। सीतामभ्यवपन्नो हि रावणेन बलीयसा॥
target: Observe, O Laksmana, this vulture for my benefaction, has been killed by the powerful Rāvaņa in his attempt to rescue Sītā.

source: त्वं हि कृष्णौ रणे शक्तः संसाधयितुमाहवे। तवैव भारो राधेय प्रत्युद्याहि धनंजयम्॥
target: You are the only man who can cope with the Krishnas in battle, so make your march, O son of Radha; you alone are capable of it.

source: कालिकासंगमे स्नात्वा कौशिक्यरुणयोर्गतः। त्रिरात्रोपोषितो राजन् सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥
target: Bathing at the confluence of the Kalika and the Kaushika and the Aruna and fasting there for three nights, a learned man is cleared of all his sins.

source: धर्मार्थमोक्षसंयुक्तमितिहासमिमं शुभम्। श्रुत्वा मनुष्यः सततमिहामुत्र च मोदते॥
target: By frequently listening to this auspicious story fraught with virtue, profit, and emancipation, a man acquires happiness both in this world and the next.'

source: कल्माषाङ्गास्तित्तिरिचित्रपृष्ठा भ्रात्रा दत्ताः प्रीयता फाल्गुनेन। भ्रातुर्वीरस्य स्वैस्तुरङ्गैर्विशिष्टा मुदा युक्ताः सहदेवं वहन्ति॥
target: Horses of black bodies, with backs of variegated colour, like the Tittara bird, presented by his brother Falguna out of dearness and possessed of better limbs than those of his heroic brother (Falguna), bear Sahadeva cheerfully.

source: तुल्य चैभिर्वयसा विक्रमेण महाजवाश्चित्ररूपाः सदश्वाः। सौभद्रादीन् द्रौपदेयान् कुमारान् वहन्त्यश्वा देवदत्ता बृहन्तः॥
target: Excellent horses of large size, of the same age as these and of equal strength, of many colours and great activity, presented by the gods, bear the princes, the sons of Subhadra and Draupadi.

source: एष ते वामनो नाम प्रादुर्भावः प्रकीर्तितः। तेन देवाः प्रादुरासन् वैष्णवं चोच्यते जगत्॥
target: This history which I have just related is known as the incarnation of the dwarf; from him all the celestials came into being and the universe is called Vaishnava (or pervaded by Vishnu).

source: अग्नेरीशस्य सोमस्य वरुणस्य प्रजापतेः। तथा धातुर्विधातुश्च कुबेरस्य यमस्य च॥ अलम्बुषोग्रसेनानां गन्धर्वस्य च तुम्बुरोः। यथामानं यथोद्देशं विमानानि चकाशिरे॥
target: There appeared also in a beautiful array the chariots of Agni, Isha, Soma, Varuna, Prajapati, Dhatri, Vidhatri, Kubera, Yama, Alambusha, Ugrasena and others and of the Gandharva Tumvuru.

source: प्रादुरास्तां तथा दो• संकर्षणधनंजयौ। दक्षिणेऽथार्जुनो धन्वी हली रामश्च सव्यतः॥
target: Issued out thence. In the same way from his two eyes sprang up Sankarshana and Dhananjaya. In his right stood Arjuna the bowman and in his left stood Rama with the plough.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच स तां दृष्ट्वा विशालाक्षीं राजपुत्री सखीं तथा। प्रहसन्नब्रवीद राजन् किमागमनमित्युत॥
target: Beholding his friend the princess of expansive eyes in that condition, her friend (Arjuna) o king, smilingly asked her of the cause of coming.

source: अधस्ताद् धरणीं योऽसौ सदा धारयते नृप। शेषश्च पनगश्रेष्ठः स्वस्ति तुभ्यं प्रयच्छतु॥
target: And he who is underneath this earth and o king who ever upholds her, viz., Shesha, that foremost of snakes-may all these do what is beneficial to you!

source: महोदरः सुसंक्रुद्धः शरैः काञ्चनभूषणैः। चिच्छेद पाणिपादोरु वानराणां महाहवे।९।।
target: And Mahodara, greatly angered, severed in that mighty encounter, with his arrows feathered in gold, the hands, feet and thighs of the monkeys.

source: श्रीरुवाच स शक्रो ब्रह्मचारी यस्त्वत्तश्चैवोपशिक्षितः। त्रैलोक्ये ते यदैश्वर्यं तत् तेनापहृतं प्रभो॥
target: The goddess of Prosperity said Practising the vow of Brahmacharya, that Brahmana who was instructed by you was Shakra. O foremost one, he robbed you of that sovereignty which you had over the three worlds.

source: सूर्य उवाच अदित्या कुण्डले राज्ञि दत्ते मे मत्तकाशिनि। तेऽस्य दास्यामि वै भीरु वर्म चैवेदमुत्तमम्॥
target: Surya said: O queen, O beauteous and timid damsel, I will bestow on him these ear-rings which were given to me by Aditi and also this excellent armour.

source: सुषेण: पश्चिमद्वारं गत्वा तारापिता बली। आवृत्य बलवांस्तस्थौ कटिकोटिभिरावृतः॥
target: The strong sire of Tārā the powerful Sus ena, obstructed the Western gate, backed by kot is upon kotis (of monkeys).

source: सर्वाशिष्यान् समाहूय वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह। सर्वानृषीन् सवासिष्ठानानयध्वं ममाज्ञया॥ सशिष्यान् सुहृदश्चैव सर्विजः सुबहुश्रुतान्।
target: Summoning his disciples, he said, 'Do you by my command bring hither all the saints together with Vasistha's sons; and our friends and their disciples an the family priests variously versed in lore.'

source: पञ्च चैतानि सुभगे बदराणि शुभव्रते। पचेत्युक्त्वा तु भगवाञ्जगाम बलसूदनः॥ आमन्त्रय तां तु कल्याणी ततो जप्यं जजाप सः। अविदूरे ततस्तस्मादाश्रमात् तीर्थमुत्तमम्॥ इन्द्रतीर्थेति विख्यातं त्रिषु लोकेषु मानद।
target: Do you now, O blessed damsel, boil these five jujubes, O you of excellent vows.' Having said these words, the worshipful slayer of Vala went away, taking leave, to recite mentally certain mantras at an excellent Tirtha not far from that herinitage. That Tirtha passed in the three worlds after the name of Indra, O giver of honours.

source: शल्य उवाच प्रविश्यापस्ततो वह्निः ससमुद्राः सपल्वलाः। आससाद सरस्तच्च गूढो यत्र शतक्रतुः॥
target: Shalya said Agni (the god of fire) thus having entered the waters including the seas and the small lakes, came to the lake where Shakra lay in disguise.

source: ततः परमकं ब्रह्म सा गतियोगिनां परा। आत्मा च सर्वभूतानां शुक्लो नारायणस्तदा॥
target: For this reason, even that chief refuge of all Yugas, the Supreme Brahma was attainable to all. The white cloth-wearing Narayana (also was the soul of all creatures,

source: सर्वथा क्षमिणा भाव्यं तथा सत्यपरेण च। वीतहर्षभयक्रोधो धृतिमाप्नोति पण्डितः॥
target: One should always practise forgiveness and be devoted to truth. The wise man who can renounce joy, fear and anger, can gain fortitude.

source: दुपारमेत्यर्हसि वक्तुमच्युता स्तमेष कर्णः प्रसभं हनिष्यति॥
target: O you glorious man, O preceptor's son, it is not meet for you to dissuade Karna from fighting, for Phalguna is greatly tired today and Karna will kill him in no time.

source: पुत्रस्ते वरदः क्षिप्रमयोध्यां पुनरागतः। कराभ्यां मृदुपीनाभ्यां चरणौ पीडयिष्यति॥
target: And soon will your son conferring boons, returning (to this place), press your feet with those soft and plump hands of his.

source: स्रग्विणो मौलिनश्चैव तथा दिव्यपरिच्छदाः। सर्वे लब्धवराः शूराः सर्वे विगतमृत्यवः॥ ते तस्यां वरुणं देवं धर्मपाशधरं सदा। उपासते महात्मानं सर्वे सुचरितव्रताः॥ तथा समुद्राश्चत्वारो नदी भागीरथी च सा। कालिन्दी विदिशा वेणा नर्मदा वेगवाहिनी॥ विपाशा च शतदुश्च चन्द्रभागा सरस्वती। इरावती वितस्ता च सिन्धुर्देवनदी तथा॥ गोदावरी कृष्णवेणा कावेरी च सरिद्वरा। किम्पुना च विशल्या च तथा वैतरणी नदी॥ तृतीया ज्येष्ठिला चैव शोणश्चापि महानदः। चर्मण्वती तथा चैव पर्णाशा च महानदी॥ सरयूरवत्याथ लागली च सरिद्वरा। करतोया तथात्रेयी लौहित्यश्च महानदः॥ लङ्घत्ती गोमती चैव संध्या त्रिःस्रोतसी तथा। एताश्चान्याश्च राजेन्द्र सुतीर्था लोकविश्रुताः॥
target: Floral garlands and crowns and attired in celestials robes, all blessed with boons and possessed of great bravery and immortality all well-conducted and of excellent vows, wait upon the illustrious Varuna, the wielder of the noose (as his weapon). O king, there (wait upon him) the four oceans, the rivers Bhagirathi, the Kalindi, the Vidisha, the Vena, the rapid Narmada, the Vipasha, the Shatadru, the Chandrabhaga, the Sarasvati, the Iravati, the Vitasta, the Sindhu, the Devanadi, the Godavari, the Krishnavena, the queen of river, Kaveri, the Kimpuna, the Vishalya, the Vaitarini, the Tritiya, the Jyesthila, the great river Parnasha, the Sarayu, the Varavatya, that queen of rivers the Langali, the Karatoya, the Atreyi, the red Mahanada, the Laghanti, the Gomati, the Sandhya, and the Trisrotasi, these and many others, all scared and famous pilgrimages,

source: तपोयोगसमारम्भं कुरुते द्विजसत्तम। कर्मभिर्बहुभिश्चापि लोकानश्नाति मानवः॥
target: If they perform asceticism and practise religious meditation, then, O foremost of Brahmanas, men by their these acts can attain to the region of bliss.

source: देवयाना हि पन्थानश्चत्वारः शाश्वता मता: एषां ज्याय: कनीयस्त्वं फलेषूक्तं बलाबलम्॥
target: All the four modes of life have always been considered as Deva-yana ways. The respective strength or weakness of these, are represented by their respective superiority or inferiority, has been declared in the character of their respective ends.

source: अथान्यद्वपुरादाय दारुणं घोरदर्शनम्। निष्पपात महातेजाः कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः॥
target: The exceedingly energetic Kumbhakarna endowed with prodigious strength sallied forth, assuming another form terrific and dreadful to behold.

source: मुहूर्तात् प्रतिबुद्धस्तु सुपर्णो गमनेप्सया। अथ भ्रष्टतनूजाङ्गमात्मानं ददृशे खगः॥
target: After a moment Suparna awoke with the desire of departing and the wanderer of the sky saw himself deprived of his wings.

source: ते निवर्त्य तु संरब्धाः कुम्भकर्णं वनौकसः। निर्जघ्नुः पर क्रुद्धाः समदा इव कुञ्जराः॥ प्रांशुभिर्गिरिशृङ्गैश्च शिलाभिश्च महाबलाः। पादपैः पुष्पिताग्रैश्च हन्यमानो न कम्पते॥
target: Ceasing from flight, the wood-rangers waxing, enraged, began to assail Kumbhakarņa, like to elephants in rut. And the exceedingly strong Kumbhakarna, attacked with towering mountain peaks and crags and trees with flowering top, did not shake.

source: यथात्र कश्चिन्मेधावी दृष्टात्मा पूर्वजन्मनि। यत् प्रवक्ष्यामि तत् सर्वं यथावदुपपद्यते॥
target: All that I say is proper and correct, as a person who has intelligence and who has seen his Soul, would say on this subject of previous births.

source: न हि कामेन कामोऽन्यः साध्यते फलमेव तत्। उपयोगात् फलस्यैव काष्ठाद् भस्मेव पण्डितैः॥
target: Pleasure brings its own fruit; it cannot lead to another (pleasure). Ashes may be had from wood, but nothing could be had from ashes.

source: यदा द्रक्ष्यसि संग्रामे धर्मपुत्रं यमौ तथा॥ शितैः पृषत्कैः कुर्वाणानभ्रच्छायामिवाम्बरे। अस्यतः क्षिण्वतश्चारील्लँघुहस्तान् दुरासदान्। पार्थिवानपि चान्यास्त्वं तदा नैवं वदिष्यसि॥
target: When you will see Yudhishthira and the twins making a canopy with their sharpened shafts like that of clouds in the sky and other irrepressible kings all light-handed, shooting arrows reducing the number of their enemies you will not speak such words.

source: नकुलः सहदेवश्च माद्रीपुत्रो यशस्विनौ। शामित्रं तौ महावी? सम्यक् तत्र भविष्यतः॥
target: Nakula and Sahadeva, the two sons of Madri endued with fame-these two heroes of great strength will be duly the sacrifices of animals in that sacrifice.

source: संजय उवाच भीमसेनं समाकीर्णं दृष्ट्वास्रेण धनंजयः। तेजसः प्रतिघातार्थं वारुणेन समावृणोत्॥
target: Sanjaya said Beholding Bhimasena completely shrouded by that weapon, Dhananjaya for quenching the fire produced by it shot the Varuna weapon.

source: ऋक्षवानरसङ्घानामनीकानि सहस्रशः। गिरिमेघनिकाशानां छादयन्ति वसुंधराम्॥
target: The hosts consisting of thousands of bears and monkeys, resembling hills and clouds, envelope the Earth.

source: सर्वसंहननोपेतं सर्वलक्षणलक्षितम्। दुर्धर्षमृषभस्कन्धं व्यात्ताननमिवोरगम्॥
target: He possessed the power of crushing all his enemies-he had every auspicious mark on his body; he was invincible in battle and as broad shouldered as a bull; he had a face like that of a snake,

source: श्रीः सुखस्येह संवासः सा चापि परिपन्थिनी। ब्राह्मी सुदुर्लभा श्रीहि प्रज्ञाहीनेन क्षत्रिय॥
target: In this world, respect resides in worldly prosperity, through it is an impediment to virtue. Heavenly prosperity is not attainable by one that is devoid of (true) wisdom, O Kshatriya.

source: या संज्ञा विहिता लोके दासे शुनि वृके पशौ। विकर्मणि स्थिते विप्रे सैव संज्ञा च पाण्डव॥
target: Those names, which are applied among men to slaves, dogs, wolves and (other) beasts, are given, O son of Pandu, to the Brahmana who does works which do not become him.

source: ततः शक्रः सुरपतिः श्रिया परमया युतः॥ युधिष्ठिरमुवाचेदं सान्त्वपूर्वमिदं वचः। युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो लोकाश्चाप्यक्षयास्तव॥ एह्येहि पुरुषव्याघ्र कृतमेतावता विभो।
target: Then Shakra, the lord of the celestials, gifted with blazing prosperity, addressed Yudhishthira and consoling him, come, said, O Yudhishthira of mighty arms, come, come O king! These illusions have ended, O powerful one.

source: भर्तारमनुरुन्धन्त्यः क्लिश्यन्ते वीरपत्नयः। शुश्रूषया क्लिश्यमानाः पतिलोकं जयन्त्युत॥
target: The wives of heroes endure pain for the sake of their husbands; but undergoing trouble in waiting upon their lords they at last go to the regions where their husbands depart.

source: अन्तर्धानवधं चास्य चक्रे क्रुद्धोऽर्जुनस्तदा। शब्दवेधं समाश्रित्य बहुरूपो धनंजयः॥
target: Dhananjaya, becoming greatly enraged, prevented the disappearance of his enemy with his weapon called Shabdavedha.

source: एतदर्थं मम प्राणा भार्या पुत्रः सुहृज्जनः। सपुत्रदारः सुश्रूषां नित्यमेव करोम्यहम्॥
target: My five vital airs, my wife, children and friends are all for them. With my wife and my children, I always serve them.

source: बलिना विग्रहो राजन् न कदाचित् प्रशस्यते। बलिना विग्रहो यस्य कुतो राज्यं कुतः सुखम्॥१११।
target: Enmity with a powerful person, O king, is never spoken highly of. That king who has incurred the hostility of one more powerful than himself, loses both kingdom and happiness.

source: सोऽन्यत् कार्मुकमादाय भीष्मस्य प्रमुखे स्थितः। अर्जुनं पञ्चविंशत्या बाह्वोरुरसि चार्पयत्॥
target: Then he took another shaft and stood before Bhishma. He pierced twentyfive shafts on the chaste of Arjuna

source: सर्वलोकात् परं मत्वा जगाम मनसा हरिम्। अप्रमेयं महाबाहुं कामाज्जातमजं नृषु॥
target: knowing his (Krishna) to be the foremost of all persons, the possessor of immeasurable; energy, the mighty-armed, (hero), being without birth and was born among men only out of his pleasure, he (Yudhishthira) thought of Hari (Krishna) in his mind.

source: तामन्वेष्टुं स नृपतिः परिचक्राम सर्वतः। वनं वनजपत्राक्षीं भ्रमन्नुन्मत्तवत् तदा।॥
target: The king then, like one who has loss his reason, wandered through the whole forest in search of that lotus eyed maiden.

source: इत्येषा मे मती राजन् यथा वा मन्यसेऽनघ। एवंगते ममाचक्ष्व स्वयं निश्चित्य हेतुभिः॥
target: O king, O sinless one, this is my opinion. Do as you think (proper)after reflecting over everything, nothing the causes and effects of all. Tell us what you yourself think proper to do.

source: अमुं च लोकं त्वयि भीष्म याते ज्ञानानि नंक्ष्यन्त्यखिलेन वीर। अतस्तु सर्वे त्वयि संन्निकर्ष समागता धर्मविवेचनाय॥
target: When you, O Bhishma, will leave this world all knowledge, O hero, will end with you. It is, therefore, that all these persons, assembled together, have approached you for listening to discourses on duty and morality.

source: कर्णोऽपि भीमसेनस्य निवार्येषून् महाबलः। प्राहिणोन्नव नाराचानाशीविषसमान् रणे॥
target: Karna also, that mighty hero, baffling Bhima's darts, wounded Bhima with nine Narachas resembling snakes of virulent venom.

source: ततो ददृशतुस्तौ तं छिन्नपक्षद्वयं खगम्। तयोः शशंस गृध्रस्तु सीतार्थे रावणाद् वधम्॥
target: Then they both beheld the bird with its wings cut off; and the vulture related to him as to how he came by death while attempting to rescue Sita.

source: कपिराजविमुक्तैस्तैः शैलवस्तु राक्षसाः। विकर्णशिरस: पेतुर्विकीर्णा इव पर्वताः॥
target: Being beheaded by the crags discharged by that monkeys chief the Rākşasas fell down like to mountains cleft.

source: अतीव सर्वशब्देभ्यो लोमहर्षकरः प्रभो॥ अर्जुनस्य महाबाहो तावकानां च धन्विनाम्।
target: That sound surpassed all other sounds and O lord, made the hair stand erect. Thus, O mighty-armed one, the battle between Arjuna and your warriors went on (with unmitigated fury).

source: कर्णं सेनापतिं कृत्वा कृतकौतुकमङ्गलाः। पूजायित्वा द्विजश्रेष्ठान् दधिपात्रघृताक्षतैः॥ गोभिरश्चैश्च निष्कैश्च वासोभिश्च महाधनैः। वन्धमाना जयाशीर्भिः सूतमागधवन्दिभिः॥
target: After having made Karna their generalissimo with the due performance of the most auspicious rites (by tying a thread round his wrist) and having adored the foremost of the regenerate persons by offerings of vessels of curds, clarified butter and vessels, filled with corn and other auspicious articles, as well as by presents of gold-coins, kine and gems, valuable cloths and immense wealth and also having been praised by the charioteers and panegyrists, born in the country of Magadha, (the Magadha-panegyrists are the mixed tribes born of a Kshatriya mother and a Brahmana father), with hymns about victory.

source: न मेऽसि मित्रं न तथानुकम्प्यो न चोपकर्तासि न मे प्रियोऽसि। स्ततोऽसि वालीव वधार्ह वध्यः॥
target: O Rāvana, you are not my friend or an object of pity. You are not my benefactor, not are liked by me. You are Rāma's enemy, and you did therefore deserve to be slain by him like Vāli along with your friends and relatives.

source: एकचक्रां ततो गत्वा प्रवृत्तिं प्रददुः पुरे। ततः सहस्रशो राजन् नरा नगरवासिनः॥ तत्राजग्मुर्बकं दुष्टं सस्त्रीवृद्धकुमारकाः। ततस्ते विस्मिताः सर्वे कर्म दृष्ट्वातिमानुषम्। दैवतान्यर्चयांचक्रुः सर्व एव विशाम्पते॥
target: Going to Ekachakra, they soon gave the intelligence; thereupon, O king, thousands of the citizens. Accompanied by their wives both young and old, (all) went there to see Baka. They were all astonished at seeing the superhuman feat. O king they began to worship the gods.

source: कश्यप उवाच इदं सरो महापुण्यं देवलोकेऽपि विश्रुतम्। यत्र कूर्माग्रजं हस्ती सदाकर्षत्यवाङ्मुखः॥
target: Kashyapa said : This lake you see before you is very sacred. It is even known in the celestial regions. There is an elephant with its face downwards continually dragging a tortoise which is his elder brother.

source: नित्यपुष्पफलास्तत्र नगाः पत्ररथाकुलाः। दिव्यगन्धरसैः पुष्पैः फलैश्च भरतर्षभ॥
target: The trees that bedeck those regions always put forth flowers and fruits, and are always covered with dense foliage. The flowers always yield a celestial fragrance and the fruits are greatly sweet, О chief of Bharata's race.

source: न चेत् तदभिमन्येत तस्मै दद्यामहं पुनः। शकटं रत्नसम्पूर्ण यो मे ब्रूयाद् धनंजयम्॥
target: I shall further more confer upon him, if he is not satisfied, a cart-load of jewels who will tell me where Dhananjaya is.

source: यदसौ मातुलकुले दत्तराज्यः परं सुखी। भरतो वसति भ्रात्रा शत्रुघ्नेन मुदान्वितः॥
target: Bharata, on whom the king has conferred the kingdom, along with his brother Satrughna, is living happily in the house of his maternal uncle.

source: । सौभद्रः पृथिवीपाल जहौ प्राणान् परंतपः। वयं परमसंहष्टाः पाण्डवाः शोककर्शिताः। सौभद्रे निहते राजन्नवहारमकुर्महि॥
target: O ruler of earth, O afflicter of your foes, he gave his life up in battle. At the death of Abhimanyu we were enraptured and the Pandavas were depressed with grief. After Subhadra's son had been slain, the troops were withdrawn by us.

source: सतां बुद्धिं पुरस्कृत्य सर्वलोकनिदर्शिनीम्। राज्यं स त्वं निगृह्णीष्व भरतेन प्रसादितः॥
target: Placing in front the intellect of the good, and approved by all, do you, propitiated by Bharata, accept the monarchy.

source: आत्ममांसोपवृत्तं च शरीरार्धमयीं तनुम्। पितृणां वंशकर्तारं वने त्यक्त्वा क्व यास्यथ॥
target: Where do you go, leaving in the forest this your own begotten son, this perpetuator of the race of his father.

source: न च मन्युस्त्वया कार्यः श्रेयस्ते समुपस्थितम्। यत् काक्षितं हृदिस्थं ते तत्सर्वं हि भविष्यति॥
target: You should not give to anger or grief. The time is come when you shall reap a great reward! That which is coveted by you and which is in your heart will indeed be done.

source: यदा पर्वणि काकुत्स्थ विश्रमार्थं महागजः। खेदाच्चालयते शीर्ष भूमिकम्पस्तदा भवेत्॥
target: And, O Kākutstha, when on sacred days the mighty elephant, from fatigue, shake his head, then takes place the earthquake.

source: धृतराष्ट्र उवाच ये राजानो राजसूयाभिषिक्ता धर्मात्मानो रक्षितारः प्रजानाम्। स्तेषां लोका धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र॥
target: Dhritarashtra said Those kings who have bathed upon the termination of the Rajasuya sacrifice, who are gifted with righteous souls, who have protected their subjects properly, and who have washed their limbs with purified water upon the termination of the Horsesacrifice, go to such regions. Indeed Dhritarashtra shall not go there.

source: धर्मतः पाण्डुपुत्रा वै वनं गच्छन्ति निर्जिताः। ते च द्वादश वर्षाणि वने वत्स्यन्ति पाण्डवाः॥
target: The sons of Pandu, being defeated at dice, are going to the forest to save their virtue. The Pandavas will live for twelve years in the forest.

source: स्निग्धपत्रफला वृक्षा गन्धमादनसानुषु। भ्रमरारावमधुरा नलिनी: फुल्लपङ्कजाः॥ विलोड्यमानाः पश्येमाः करिभिः सकरेणुभिः। पश्येमां नलिनी चान्यां कमलोत्पलमालिनीम्॥ स्रग्धरां विग्रहवती साक्षाच्छ्रियमिवापराम्। नानाकुसुमगन्धाढ्यास्तस्येमाः काननोत्तमे॥ उपगीयमाना भ्रमरै राजन्ते वनराजयः। पश्य भीम शुभान् देशान् देवाक्रीडान् समन्ततः॥८३।
target: On the plateau of the Gandhamadana all the trees are furnished with glossy foliage and fruits. Look! how these lotus-lakes decked with full blown lotuses and sweet with the hum of black fees are being agitated by elephants with their mates! look at another lotus lake decked with an array of lotuses and looking like a second Sree in very flesh and blood with a garland encircling her neck. In this excellent forest, there are ranges of woods rich with the fragrance of various flowers and ringing with the hum of the black fees. O Bhima, behold on all sides the auspicious sporting grounds of the gods!

source: भ्रातृपुत्रसमौ चापि द्रष्टव्यौ च विशेषतः। त्वया भरतशत्रुघ्नौ प्राणैः प्रियतरौ मम॥
target: Should you specially regard Bharata and Śatrughna like to your sons or brothers, who are dearer to me than my life itself.

source: तस्माद् बलवता चैव दुर्बलेन च नित्यदा। क्षन्तव्यं पुरुषेणाहुरापत्स्वपि विजानता॥
target: For this, it is said that a wise man whether he be strong or weak, should always forgive his persecutor, even if he is in difficulty.

source: इमं धर्मपथं नारी पालयन्ती समाहिता। अरुन्धतीव नारीणां स्वर्गलोके महीयते॥
target: That woman who with rapt attention, follows her duty, receives profuse honors in the celestial region like a second Arundhati.

source: भूमेः स्थैर्यं गुरुत्वं च काठिन्यं प्रसवार्थता। गन्धो गुरुत्वं शक्तिश्च संघातः स्थापना धृतिः॥
target: The properties of earth are immobility, weight, hardness, productiveness, scent, density, capacity to absorb all sorts of scents, cohesion, habitableness, and that attribute of the mind which is called patience.

source: कुरवः कर्ण कर्णेति हाहेति च विचुक्रुशुः। तमाधिरथिराक्रन्दं विज्ञाय शरणैषिणाम्॥
target: The son of Adhiratha then hearing those distressful cries of those who deserved his help, proceeded to face Arjuna, saying at the same time, “Be not afraid, Owarriors."

source: दशभिर्दशभिश्चैतान् पुनर्विद्ध्वा ननाद च। साश्वसूतरथच्छत्रांस्ततस्ते विवरं ददुः॥
target: Once more striking each of them and his horses, drivers, car and flag with ten arrows he sent up a loud war-cry. His antagonist then gave him a way.

source: वरव्याजेन मोहोऽस्मै दीयताममितप्रभ॥ लोकानां स्वस्ति चैवं स्याद्भवेदस्य च संमतिः।
target: Do you then, o lord having immeasurable prowess, pretending to give him a boon, give stupefaction (instead). Thereby the welfare of the people would be secured, and the honour of this one too shall be maintained.

source: धनुर्भिरृष्टिभिः खङ्गैर्गदाभिः शक्तितोमरैः। योधाः प्रहरणैः शुभैस्तेष्वनीकेष्ववस्थिताः॥
target: Then the warriors armed with bows, swords, scimitars, maces, javelins, lances, and shining weapons of various kinds took up their respective positions.

source: एकोऽप्यमात्यो मेधावी शूरो दान्तो विचक्षणः। राजानं राजपुत्रं वा प्रापयेन्महतीं श्रियम्॥
target: Even one single minister who is intelligent, heroic, self-controlled, and discriminating cunfers the greatest good on a king of on a king's son.

source: एवमुक्ताः क्षणं चक्रुः पाण्डवाः सह तैर्द्विजैः। मध्यन्दिने यथाऽऽदित्यं प्रेक्षन्तस्ते महामुनिम्॥
target: Thus spoken to, the Pandavas together with the Brahmanas waited a little looking at that great saint glorious as the noon-day sun.

source: मन्ये प्रीतिविशिष्टा सा मत्तोलक्ष्मण सारिका। यत्तस्याः श्रूयते वाक्यं शुक पादमरेर्दश॥
target: O Laksmana, I consider my mother's female parrot as more sharing her affection, since she is heard to say, 'O Śuka, do you bite the foot of the foe?

source: स तां परिषदं कृत्स्नां समीक्ष्य समितिंजयः। प्रबोधयामास तदा प्रहस्तं वाहिनीपतिम्॥
target: Then surveying that entire assembly, that conqueror in battle delivered himself to Prahasta, general of the forces, saying.

source: यथाशं कुरु सौमित्रे त्यज्य मां दुःखभागिनीम्। निदेशे स्थीयतां राज्ञः शृणु चेदं वचो मम॥
target: O Saumitri, do you carry out the orders you have received. By renouncing this wretched wight do you satisfy the King's orders. But hear, what I say.

source: तथैव पाण्डवाः सर्वे महत्या सेनया सह। द्रोणभीष्मौ रणे यत्तौ प्रत्युद्ययुररिंदमौ॥
target: The Pandava also with many thousand troops rushed in battle against those chastiser of foes, the heroic Bhishma and Drona.

source: वार्ष्णेयस्तु ततो राजन् स्वां शक्तिं कनकप्रभाम्। वेगवद् गृह्य चिक्षेप पितामहरथं प्रति॥ वार्ष्णेयभुजवेगेन प्रणुन्ना सा महाहवे। अभिदुद्राव वेगेन कालरात्रिर्यथा नरम्॥
target: O king! Satyaki also picked up the Sakti having golden radiance and threw it with full might on the chariot of Bhishma. That Sakti so thrown with full might by Satyaki rushed rapidly towards Bhishma in that great war. It appeared as if the Kalaratri (the night of devastation) is forwarding to grip the man.

source: बुबुधे तं तु सक्रोधं पितरं राक्षसेश्वरः। कुबेरस्तत्प्रसादार्थं यतते स्म सदा नृप॥
target: Knowing that his sire was angry with him, Kubera, the lord of Rakshasas, always tried to please him, O king.

source: आवर्त इव गङ्गायास्तोयस्य विपुलो महान्॥ परिक्षिप्य हरिश्रेष्ठं स बभौ रक्षसां गणः।
target: Those numbers of Rākşasa, encountering that best of monkeys, resumbled an extensive and mighty whirlpool in the Gangā.

source: अलम्बुषः श्रुतायुश्च जलसन्धश्च वीर्यवान्। सौमदत्तिविराटश्च द्रुपदश्च महारथः॥ घटोत्कचादयश्चान्ये निहता द्रोणपर्वणि। अश्वत्थामाऽपि चात्रैव द्रोणे युधि निपातिते॥
target: In this Drona Parva is narrated the deaths of Alambusha, Shrutayus, valorous Jalasandha, Somdatti, Virata, great car-warrior Drupada, Ghatotkacha and others. Being exceedingly angry on account of the death of Drona in battle, Ashvathama also.

source: भूमिरादिस्तु गन्धानां रसानामाप एव च। रूपाणां ज्योतिरादित्यः स्पर्शानां वायुरुच्यते॥
target: Earth is the source of all smells; and Water of all tastes. The Solar light is the source of all colours; the wind of all sensations of touch.

source: ततस्त्रिशिरसा बाणैर्ललाटे ताडितस्त्रिभिः। अमर्षी कुपितो रामः संरब्ध इदमब्रवीत्॥
target: Then struck on the forehead by a brace of shafts shot by Trisirā, the wrathful Rāma enraged, and inflamed with anger, said.

source: कथं पारमगत्वा हि युद्धे त्वं वै जिजीवीषुः। इमान् निपतितान् दृष्ट्वा पुत्रान् भ्रातॄन् पितूंस्तथा।॥ सम्बन्धिनो वयस्यांश्च मातुलान् बान्धवांस्तथा। घातयित्वा कथं तात इदे तिष्ठसि साम्प्रतम्॥
target: How is it that without having terminated this war, though you were filled with the desire of victory, you live now within this lake, after having brought about the destruction of your sons and brothers and sires and relatives and friends and maternal uncles and kinsmen.

source: तमुवाच ततो धीमान्विभीषण इदं वचः॥ विमृश्य बुद्ध्या प्रश्रितं धर्मार्थसहितं हितम्।
target: Where to the intelligent Vibhīşaņa replied with the following words-pointing out wealth and Piety, and judging by his understanding what is proper.

source: तिस्रो राज्यस्त्वद्भिपोष्य भूमौ तृप्ता गावस्तर्पितेभ्यः प्रदेयाः। स्त्र्यहं दत्त्वा गोरसैर्वर्तितव्यम्॥
target: Abstaining from all food and subsisting upon water alone for three nights and sleeping the while on the naked earth, one should, having properly fed the kine intended to be given away, give them to Brahmanas after having pleased them also (with other gifts).

source: तान् पाण्डुपुत्रश्चिच्छेद नवभिनतपर्वभिः। वसुषेणेन निर्मुक्तान् इव राजन् महाशरान्॥
target: But the son of Pandu cut-off those shafts, with nine shafts of depressed knots shot by himself. Having cut-off, O foremost of men, those arrows shot by Karna.

source: अधीरजुष्टे पथि वर्तमान दमादपेतं विनयाच्च पापम्। अरिव्रतं नित्यमभूतिकामं धिगस्तु तं पापमति मनुष्यम्॥
target: Fie on that sinful wretch, who has followed the footsteps of the foolish who has transgressed all healthy restraints and modesty, who always injures others, and who does not care for his own prosperity.

source: सपार्थः पार्थिवान् सर्वान् भूमिस्थोऽपिरथस्थितान्। एको निवारयामास लोभः सर्वगुणानिव॥
target: As the greed suppresses all qualities, Arjuna resisted all kings seated on their chariots even when his feet were touching the ground and chariot was wrecked.

source: दक्षिणं मण्डलं चोभौ सूतूर्णं संपरीयतुः। अन्योन्यमभिसंक्रुद्धौ जये प्रणिहितावुभौ॥
target: The both of them enraged with each other and anxious to score success, moving in circle on each other's right side, addressed themselves for action.

source: युगपत्पतमानैश्च युगपच्च हतै शम्। युगपत्पतितैश्चैव विकीर्णा वसुधाऽभवत्॥ निहताः पतिताः क्षीणाश्छिन्ना भिन्ना विदारिताः। तत्र तत्र स्म दृश्यन्ते राक्षसास्ते सहस्रशः।॥
target: And the earth was covered with shafts shot, and alighting, and alighted simultaneously. And at places were seen Rākṣasas by thousands slain, falling, enfeebled, torn and riven.

source: भीष्मो वसूनामन्यतमो दिष्ट्या जीवसि पुत्रका गाङ्गेयः शान्तनोः पुत्रो वसुरेष महायशाः॥
target: Bhishma is one of the foremost of the Vasus. It is only by good luck that you are still living. This Shantanu's son by Ganga is a celebrated Vasu,

source: प्रातरुत्थाय तान् राजन् पूजयित्वा यथाविधि। कृत्यकाले समुत्पन्ने पृच्छेथाः कार्यमात्मनः॥
target: Rising early in the morning, O king, adore them with due rites, and when the time comes for action, you should consult them about your (intended) acts.

source: स तत्राद्यापि रक्षांसि वृक्षानश्मन एव च। भक्षयन् दृश्यते वह्निः सदा पर्वणि पर्वणि॥
target: There that fire may be seen to this day, always devouring in all seasons the Rakshasas, trees and stones.

source: क्षीरं पिबन्तस्तिष्ठन्ति भुञ्जानाः शालितण्डुलान्। षष्टिस्तानि सहस्राणि सर्वे विपुलवक्षसः। एतद् राजन् मम धनं तेन दीव्याम्यहं त्वया।॥
target: And who drink milk and eat good rice. They are sixty thousands in number, and all of them possess broad cheats. With this wealth, O king, I shall (now stake with you.

source: ततः स प्रद्रुतं संख्ये रथं दृष्ट्वा महारथः। अन्वधावत् किरन् बाणैः कङ्कपत्रैरजिह्मगैः॥
target: Beholding him thus fly away quickly in battle the mighty car-warrior Karna pursued him shooting straight Kanka-feathered arrows.

source: तं दृष्ट्वा निहतं संख्ये राक्षसास्ते समन्ततः। व्यद्रवन्सहिताः सर्वे क्रोशमानाः परस्परम्। विद्राव्यमाणा वसुना राक्षसा नावतस्थिरे॥
target: Having beheld him slain in the warfare the Räkşasas bewailing ran about on all sides and being distressed by Vasu they could not stay in the battle field.

source: व्युतक्रान्तानपरान् योधांश्छादयित्वा तरस्विनः। पुनर्युद्धाय गच्छन्ति जयगृद्धाःप्रमन्यवः॥
target: The warriors now succumbed to injuries are being covered by the sheets of clothes and the warriors in their sheer excitement for victory are again marching ahead very fast to attack again on the enemy. They are filled with anger.

source: प्रसार्येह यथाङ्गानि कूर्मः संहरते पुनः। तद्वन्महान्ति भूतानि यवीयःसु विकुर्वते॥
target: Like a tortoise extending out its limbs and withdrawing then again, the great elements, by living in innumerable small forms, go through transformations.

source: तदृष्ट्वा लक्ष्मणः संख्ये घोरमस्त्रं सुदारुणम्।।५९ अवार्यं सर्वभूतानां सर्वशस्त्रविदारणम्। माहेश्वरेण द्युतिमांस्तदत्रं प्रत्यवारयत्॥
target: And in the conflict, seeing that dire and dreadful weapon, irresistible to all creatures and capable of riving all arms, the effulgent Lakşmaņa baffled it with a Māheśvara* weapon. *i.e. belonging to Maheśvara or Śiva.

source: एवमुक्तः पाण्डवेन भगवान् केशवस्तदा। अभिगम्य दुराधर्षं प्रव्याहारयदच्युतः॥
target: Thus addressed by the son of Pandu, the illustrious Keshava of undecaying glory, approaching the unconquerable Bhishma, spoke to him as follows.

source: अवश्यं च हितं वाच्यं सर्वावस्थां गतं मया। बन्धुभावादभिहितं भ्रातृस्नेहाच्च पार्थिव॥
target: But whatever condition you may be in, I must tell what is for your welfare; and therefore from sentiment of friendship as well as from fraternal affection I have spoken thus to you o King.

source: शुक उवाच किं तज्ज्ञानमयो विद्या यथा निस्तरते द्वयम्। प्रवृत्तिलक्षणो धर्मो निवृत्तिरिति वा वद॥
target: Shuka said What is that Knowledge? Is it that learning by which, when error is gone, the truth reveals itselt? Or, is it those duties consisting of acts to be done or achieved, by the help of which the object sought for, may be understood or attained? Or, is it those duties, called absention from acts by which an extinction of the Soul is to be sought? Do tell me what it is, so that by its help the two, viz., birth and death, may be avoided.

source: युद्धधर्मेषु सर्वेषु क्रियाणां नैपुणेषु च। न त्वया सदृशः कश्चित् त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते॥
target: There is no one equal to you in the three worlds in all duties connected with battle and in skill in various kinds of acts,

source: श्रीकृष्ण उवाच एवमुक्त्वा तु सा राजंस्तत्रैवान्तरधीयत। स संगृह्य कुमारं तं प्रविवेश गृहं नृपः॥
target: Krishna said O king having said this, she disappeared there and then. Obtaining the child the king then entered his own house.

source: अर्धेनौघवती नाम त्वामधेनानुयास्यति। शरीरेण महाभाग योगो ह्यस्या वशे स्थितः॥
target: And you will acquire all the worlds in this your body, and because the science of Yoga is within her control, this highly blessed lady will follow you with only half her body, and with the other half will she be celebrated as the river Oghavati.

source: संजय उवाच प्रतिघातं तु सैन्यस्य नामृष्यत वृकोदरः। सोऽभ्याहनद् गुरुं षष्ट्या कर्णे च दशभिः शरैः॥
target: Sanjaya said Vrikodara could not tolerate that slaughter of his own troops. He therefore, wounded Balhika with sixty and Karna with ten shafts.

source: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः। स्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्॥
target: Even those persons, Partha, who are of sinful birth, who are women, Vaishyas or Shudras, attain to the supreme goal, if they come to Me..

source: सीतां तु रुदतीं दृष्ट्वा ते तत्र मुनिदारकाः। प्राद्रवन्यत्र भगवानास्ते वाल्मीकिरुनधीः॥ अभिवाद्यः मुनेः पादौ मुनिपुत्रा महर्षये। सर्वे निवेदयामासुस्तस्यास्तु रुदितस्वनम्॥
target: Beholding Sītā thus wailing, the sons of the Rşis there speedily approached the great Vālmīki, well-established in asceticism. And saluting him they all communicated to him Sītā's bewailing and said.

source: त्रिलोचनो विषष्णाङ्गो मणिविद्धो जटाधरः। बिन्दुर्विसर्गः सुमुखः शरः सर्वायुधः सहः॥
target: You are he who has three eyes; you are he whose forms are greatly subtile; you are he whose ears are bored for putting on jewelled earrings; you are the bearer of inatted locks; you are the point which indicates the nasal sound; you are the two dots in the alphabet) which indicate the sound of the aspirated H; you have an excellent face; you are the arrow that is shot by the warrior for bringing about the destruction of his enemy; you are all the weapons that are used by warriors; you are gifted with patience capable of bearing all things. are

source: प्रावृषीवासितग्रीवो मज्जेत निशि निर्जने। मायूरेण गुणेनैव स्त्रीभिश्चालक्षितश्चरेत्॥
target: Like the peacock in the rains, he should enter his nightly habitations alone and unseen. Indeed, he should enjoy, like the peacock, within his inner apartments, the company of his wives.

source: न्यवेदयत चात्मानमर्जुनस्य महात्मनः। इरावानस्मि भद्रं ते पुत्रश्चाहं तव प्रभो॥
target: He introduced himself to the illustrious Arjuna saying-'I am your son Iravat, O lord, may good betide you.'

source: धृतराष्ट्रस्य च तदा दिव्यं चक्षुर्नराधिप। मुनिः सत्यवतीपुत्रः प्रीतः प्रादात् तपोबलात्॥
target: At that time, through the power of his penances, the great ascetic, the of Satyavati, gratified with Dhritarasthra, gave him celestial vision.

source: भीम उवाच उदासीनो निरीक्षस्व न कार्यः समभ्रमस्त्वया। न जात्वयं पुनर्जीवेन्मबाह्वन्तरमागतः॥
target: Bhima said: Look on this combat with unconcern. You need not take part in it. When he has come to my clutches, he will not escape with life.

source: आदानरुचयश्चैव परदाराभिमर्शिनः॥ उग्रदण्डप्रधानाश्च मिथ्या व्याहारिणस्तथा। आक्रोष्टारश्च लुब्धश्च हर्तारः साहसप्रियाः।॥ समाविहारभेत्तारो वर्णानां च प्रदूषकाः।
target: They who take bribes, they who are the violators of the chastity of other peoples' wives, they who inflict heavy punishments, they who are liars, they who are revelers, they who are stained by cupidity, they who are murderers, they who are doers of rash deeds, they who are disturbers of assemblies and the sports of others, and they who brings about a confusion of castes, should, according to considerations of time and place, be punished with either fines or death.

source: तैराख्यातेन मार्गेण ततस्ते जग्मुरञ्जसा। ददृशुश्चाविदूरे तान् सर्वानथ पदातयः॥
target: Proceeding quickly on foot along the path pointed out by them, the Pandavas saw all of them from a distance.

source: आर्चीकपर्वतश्चैव निवासो वै मनीषिणाम्। सदाफलः सदास्रोतो मरुतां स्थानमुत्तमम्॥
target: Yonder is the Archika hill, inhabited by cultured men. Fruits of all seasons grow here at all times and the streams run forever. It is an excellent place.

source: आकाशस्य गुणः शब्दो व्यापित्वं च्छिद्रतापि च। अनाश्रयमनालम्बमव्यक्तमविकारिता॥ अप्रतीघातिता चैव भूतत्वं विकृतानि च। गुणा: पञ्चाशतं प्रोक्ताः पञ्चभूतात्मभाविताः॥
target: The properties of space are sound, extension, capacity of being enclosed, absence of refuge, power of being unmanifest, capacity for modification, incapacity for resistance, material cause for producing the sense of hearing, and the unoccupied parts of the human body. These are the fifty properties, as declared, which form the essences of the five elementary entities.

source: प्रसादये त्वां कौसल्ये रचितोऽयं मयाञ्जलिः। वत्सला चानृशंसा च त्वं हि नित्यं परेष्वपि॥
target: I deprecate your displeasure. O Kausalyä with joined hands. You are ever affectionate and did not treat harshly even enemies.

source: प्रभग्नं बलमेतद्धि योत्स्यमानं जनार्दन। एते द्रवन्ति सगणा: संशप्तकमहारथाः॥ अपारयन्तो मद्वाणान् सिंहशब्दं मृगा इव।
target: This array of these fighting warriors, O Janaradana, has been broken through. These great warriors of the Samasaptakas, unable to withstand my arrows, are running away with their men as a herd of deer at the roar of a lion.

source: तन्महोदधिसंकाशं निरानन्दमनुत्सवम्॥ वीरपत्नीभिराकीर्णं गङ्गातीरमशोभत।
target: The shores of their river though crowded with those wives of heroes, looked as broad as the ocean and presented a sorrow of sorrow and cheerlessness.

source: यदेतद्राक्षसानीकं मेघश्याम विलोक्यते। एतदायोध्यतां शीघ्रं कपिभिश्च शिलायुधैः॥ तस्यानीकस्य महतो भेदने यत लक्ष्मण। राक्षसेन्द्रसुतोऽप्यत्र भिन्ने दृश्यो भविष्यति॥
target: Do you without delay bring on an engagement between this cloud-black Räksasa army, which you behold, and the monkeys having rocks for their arms. O Lakşmaņa, do you exert yourself to break through his* mighty-army; and when the ranks are broken, the son of the Rákşasa-lord shall be visible. * Indrajit's, that is.

source: सैनिकान् मम सूतं च हयांश्च समवाकिरत्। अचिन्तयन्तस्तु शरान् वयं युध्याम भारत॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, he showered arrows on my soldiers, on my charioteer and on my horses. But without much caring for his arrows, we continued to fight.

source: घृतपिण्डोपमान् स्थूलांस्तान् द्विजान् भक्षयिष्यथः। रोहितान् वक्रतुण्डांश्च नलमीनांश्च राघव॥ पम्पायामिषुभिर्मत्स्यास्तत्र राम वरान् हतान्। निस्त्वपक्षानयस्तप्तानकृशानेककण्टकान्॥ तव भक्त्या समायुक्तो लक्ष्मणः सम्प्रदास्यति। भृशं तान् खादतो मत्स्यान् पम्पायाः पुष्पसंचये॥ पद्मगन्धि शिवं वारि सुखशीतमनामयम्। उद्धृत्य स तदाक्लिष्टं रूप्यस्फटिकसंनिभम्॥ अथ पुष्करपर्णेन लक्ष्मणः पाययिष्यति। ।
target: O Rāghava do you fare on those plump birds like to a lump of clarified butter and diverse fishes such as Rohita, Vakratunda+, and Nala. O Rama, the devoted Laksmana, shall offer to you, various other best fishes, devoid of scale and fins, plump, filled with bones, having destroyed them with shafts and roasted them in fire. And after you had feasted on them, Lakşmaņa shall bring you water for drinking on a lotus leaf, smelling like a lotus, coming in contact with flowers, delicious, pleasantly cold, wholesome, void of impurities, transparent like silver and crystal. The Rohi fist-Lat. (cyprinus Rohita Ham). A kind of fish resembling a wheel in appearance. A kind of sprai, according to some, a shrimp or prawn.

source: एष द्रोणश्च कर्णश्च राजा चैव सुयोधनः। निहत्य राक्षसं युद्धे हृष्टाः नर्दन्ति संयुगे॥
target: Yonder joyfully roars Drona and Karna and king Suyodhana himself having slain the Rakshasa in battle.

source: स दृष्ट्वा राघवं दीनमासीनं परमासने। नेत्राभ्यामश्रुपूर्णाभ्यां ददर्शाग्रजमग्रतः॥ जग्राह चरणौ तस्य लक्ष्मणो दीनचेतनः। उवाच दीनया वाचा प्राञ्जलिः सुसमाहितः।७।।
target: Having entered there he saw his elder brother Rāma seated poorly on an excellent seat with his eyes full of tears. Being greatly pained at the sight, Saumitri touched his feet and with folded palms said.

source: ते समन्तान्महाबाहुं परिवार्य वृकोदरम्। दिशः शरैः समावृण्वशलभानामिव व्रजैः॥
target: Surrounding the mighty-armed Vrikodara on all sides, they began to cover the quarters with their arrows resembling flights of locusts.

source: आसीत् परमको हर्षस्तावकानां विशाम्पते। इतरेषां तु वीराणां नेत्रेभ्यः प्रापतज्जलम्॥
target: Indeed, 0 king, your warriors transported with delight, while tears rolled were down from the eyes of the warriors of the other host.

source: आमूर्तरयसश्चेह राजा वज्रधरं प्रभुम्। तर्पयामास सोमेन हयमेधेषु सप्तसु॥
target: Here king Amurtarasya offered oblations of Soma to the wielder of Vajra (Indra) in seven great horse-sacrifices.

source: इत्युक्ते चास्या जग्राह पाणिं गालवसम्भवः॥ ऋषिः प्राक् शृङ्गवान्नाम समयं चेममब्रवीत्। समयेन तवाद्याहं पाणिं स्प्रक्ष्यामि शोभने॥ योकगनं वस्त्वयं त्वया सह मयेति ह। तथेति सा प्रतिश्रुत्य तस्मै पाणिं ददौ तदा॥
target: After she had said these words. the Galava's son, a Rishi known by the name of Shringavai married her on on the following condition. 'On this term, O fair one, I shall marry you, viz., that you, shall live with me for only one night!' Having agreed to that term, she gave him her hand,

source: व्याध उवाच अनतिक्रमणीया वै ब्राह्मणा मे द्विजोत्तम। शृणु सर्वमिदं वृत्तं पूर्वदेहे ममानघ॥
target: The Fowler said: O foremost of the Brahmanas, O sinless one, Brahmanas are worthy of all respect from me, hear about the story of my previous existence.

source: ततो द्रक्ष्यसि सर्वेषां भूतानां प्रभवाप्ययौ। एनं वै सर्वभूतेभ्यो विशिष्टं मेनिरे बुधाः। धर्मं धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठा मुनयस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः॥
target: Wise men consider such an act to be the foremost of all things. Indeed, this act of crossing the river of life is considered by the foremost of pious persons, by ascetics conversant with the truth, to be the greatest of all acts that one can perform.

source: तद् भवानस्य कार्यस्य साधनं सत्यविक्रम। बुद्धिविक्रमसम्पन्नो हेतुरत्र परंतप॥ गुरुश्च गुरुपुत्रश्च त्वं हि नः कपिसत्तमः। भवन्तमाश्रित्य वयं समर्था ह्यर्थसाधने॥
target: You, O you having truth for prowess are the instrument of this undertaking, and, O subduer of enemies, furnished with sense and vigour, you are the occasion herein. And, O foremost of monkeys, you are both our superior, and our superior's son; and resorting to you we are enabled to accomplish our object.

source: अमर्षणं दुर्मतिं राजपुत्रं पापात्मानं धार्तराष्ट्र सुलुब्धम्। सर्वं ममैतद् वचनं समग्रं सहामात्यं संजय श्रावयेथाः॥
target: Make that wrathful prince of wicked intellect, that covetous son of Dhritarashtra of vicious soul hear all these words of mine, O Sanjaya, in the midst of all his ministers and parties.

source: सर्वकालिङ्गसैन्यानां मनांसि समकम्पयत्। मोहश्चापि कलिङ्गानामाविवेश परंतप॥
target: With that tremendous sound the hearts of the Kalinga troops began to tremble in fear. O chastiser of foes, the Kalingas appeared to have lost all consciousness.

source: साधु रावण रामेण मां समानय दुःखिताम्। वने वासितया सार्धं करेण्वेव गजाधिपम्॥
target: to May good betide you, O Rāvaņa. Do you take me to Rāma, stricken with grief as I am, like to a she-elephant anxiously waiting in the forest brought to the lord of elephants.

source: पृष्ठेषु वद्धेषुधयश्चित्रबाणोत्कटास्तथा। सध्वजाः सपताकाश्च सघण्टाः सपरश्वधाः॥
target: Some had quivers containing best arrows on their backs, and all were dreadful in battle. Some had standard containing banners and bells, and some were armed with battle-axes.

source: ज्ञातींस्तानवमुच्याथ राजदारांश्च सर्वशः। कृत्वा च दुष्करं कर्म प्रीतियुक्ताश्च पाण्डवाः॥
target: The Pandavas also, having rescued their relatives with the ladies of the royal household and having achieved that great feat, became exceedingly delighted.

source: बृहस्पतिरुवाच एतत् ते सर्वमाख्यातं आसन्नमात्रः पुरुषस्तैर्भूतैरभिभूयते। विप्रयुक्तश्च तैर्भूतैः पुनर्यात्यपरां गतिम्॥ सर्वभूतसमायुक्तः प्राप्नुते जीव एव हि।
target: Brihaspati said As soon as individual soul enters the vital seed, he becomes overwhelmed by the elements already mentioned. When individual soul become disunited therewith, he is said to attain to the other end (viz., death).

source: तामापतन्ती समरे शरवृष्टिं सुदारुणाम्। असिना तीक्ष्णधारेण चिच्छेद बलिनां वरः॥
target: Then that foremost of those possessed of prowess (Shikhandin) cut off with his sharpedged sword the dreadful shower of arrows that was falling fast upon him.

source: तथा प्रभाते कर्तास्मि यथा कृष्ण सुयोधनः। नान्यं धनुर्धरं लोके मंस्यते मत्समं युधि॥
target: OKrishna, at day-break, I will achieve such feats, that Suyodhana will never think that there is any other bowman equal to me.

source: मुहूर्तमथ संचिन्त्य ब्राह्मणस्तस्य रक्षसः। आभिर्गाथाभिरव्यग्रः प्रश्न प्रतिजगाद ह॥
target: Reflecting for a short time, the Brahmana accepted the question of the Rakshasa and replied in the following well spoken words.

source: अव्यक्तः पावनोऽचिन्त्यः सहस्रांशुर्हिरण्मयः। आदिर्गणानां सर्वेषां भवान् वै जीविताश्चयः॥
target: You are the Unmanifest, you are Pavana, you are inconceivable, you are the thousand rayed Sun, you are the shining intelligence, you are the first of all the subjects, and you are the support of life.

source: कार्णािश्चापि मुदा युक्तः प्रगृह्य सशरं धनुः। नृत्यन्निव रथोपस्थे तद् रक्षः समुपाद्रवत्॥
target: The nephew of Krishna, filled with delight grasping a bow with arrows fixed on the string, rushed against the Rakshasa, as if dancing in the terrace of his car.

source: जनमेजय उवाच सांख्यं योगः पाञ्चरात्रं वेदारण्यकमेव च। ज्ञानान्येतानि ब्रह्मर्षे लोकेषु प्रचरन्ति ह॥
target: The Sankhya System, the Pancharatra Scriptures, and the Aranyaka-Vedas—these different systems of knowledge or religion,-0 twice-born Rishi, are current in the world.

source: यदि विन्देत चाकारमस्माकं स पुरोचनः। क्षिप्रकारी ततो भूत्वा प्रदह्यादपि हेतुतः॥
target: If Purochana finds from our demeanour that we have learnt his design, he may suddenly burn to death by taking immediately steps.

source: प्रतिरूपं यथैवाप्सु तापः सूर्यस्य लक्ष्यते। सत्त्ववत्सु तथा सत्त्वं प्रतिरूपं स पश्यति॥
target: As the shining solar disc is seen reflected in the reflected water so the Yogin sees reflected within gross bodies the existent self.

source: तुल्यरूपाननान् मत्स्यांस्तथा तिमितिर्मिगिलान्। नागाश्वनरवक्त्रांश्च पश्याम्युन्मथितानिव॥
target: The fishes, and Timis and Timingalas possessed of similar faces and and snakes possessed of faces like those of human beings are, I see, crushed, as it were, by the wind.

source: हिमवान् वा महाशैलः समुद्रो वा महोदधिः। महत्त्वान्नान्वपद्येतां नभसो वान्तरं तथा॥
target: The king of mountains, viz., Himavat, and that vast receptacle of waters, viz., the ocean, cannot, for its vastness, equal the extent of the sky.

source: दुर्योधन उवाच कथं त्वामप्यतिक्रान्तः सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरम्। धनंजयो मया शक्य आचार्य प्रतिबाधितुम्॥
target: Duryodhana said O preceptor, how is it possible for me to hold in check that Dhananjaya who has passed even yourself, the foremost of all wielders of weapons?

source: गृहाणेमं महाराज मया संवर्धितं सुतम्। आदाय पुरुषव्याघ्र नयस्वैनं गृहं विभो॥
target: O great king, take him now. He has been carefully reared by me. O best of men, taking him with you, go home.

source: एवमुक्तास्तु शक्रेण देवाः शक्रसमा युधि। संनह्य सुमहासत्त्वा युद्धश्रद्धासमन्विताः॥
target: Being thus addressed by Sakra, the celestials, his equals in the encounter and gifted with great prowess, armed themselves for fight. some

source: सर्वे ज्ञानोपसम्पन्ना सर्वे समुदिता गुणैः। तेषामपि महातेजा रामः सत्यपराक्रमः॥ इष्टः सर्वस्य लोकस्य शशाङ्क इव निर्गलः। गजस्कन्धेऽश्वपृष्ठे च रथचर्यासु सम्मतः॥ धनुर्वेदे च निरतः पितुः शुश्रूषणे रतः।
target: And all were accomplished in knowledge; and endowed with virtues. And among them all, the exceedingly puissant Rāma, having true for prowess, was the desire of every one, and spotless like to the Moon himself. He could ride on elephants and horses, and was an adept in managing cars. And he was ever engaged in the study of arms, and aye occupied in ministering to his sire.

source: एवमुक्ते तु कलिना प्रत्यूचुस्ते दिवौकसः। अस्माभिः समनुज्ञाते दमयन्त्या नलो वृतः॥
target: When Kali had spoken in the above manner, the celestials replied, “With our permission, Nala has been chosen by Damayanti.

source: त्रासितं विविधैर्बाणैः कृतं चैव पराङ्मुखम्। अथोत्क्रुष्टं तदा हृष्टैः सर्वैर्देवैरुदायुधैः॥ संहतनि च तूर्याणि प्रावाद्यन्त ह्यनेकशः। एवमन्योन्यसंयुक्तं युद्धमासीत् सुदारुणम्॥
target: Were struck with panic and they wavered at that shower of various arrows. Then the celestials loudly gave vent to their joy with uplifted weapons. The celestials musicians began to play various airs. Thus took place that great battle, so fearful to both sides.

source: शरजालावृतः सूर्यो न तदा स्म प्रकाशते। अन्योन्यवधसंरम्भादुभयोः सम्प्रयुध्यतोः॥
target: And as each enraged was engaged in coping with the other, the sun, enveloped in a net-work of shafts, did not appear.

source: सान्वितश्च यथाशक्ति पूजितश्च यथाविधि। न चान्यं स द्विजश्रेष्ठः कामयामास वै वरम्॥
target: Though he tried his very best to propitiate him and though he worshipped him duly, yet that best of the twice-born ones did not beg any other boon.

target: When Rama, the giver of thousands, had fallen down, clouds covered the sky discharging copious blood.

source: मोहजालस्य योनिर्हि मूढेरेव समागमः। अहन्यहनिधर्मस्य योनिः साधुसमागमः॥
target: Association with the fools produces delusion, as daily association with the honest and good produces virtue.

source: आस्तीकः किल यज्ञं तं वर्तन्तं भुजगोत्तमे। प्रतिषेत्स्यति मां पूर्वं स्वयमाह पितामहः॥
target: O best of the women of the snake race,। Astika will put an end to this sacrifice which is being performed. The Grandsire himself told me this in time gone by.

target: I will, this very day, send, as a dear guest to the slayer of Bala (Indra), this my adversary who is proud of the prowess of his elephant and of his venerable age, in battle.

target: The force of Duryodhana's arrows, or of Drona's son's, or Kripa's, or Karna's, can shatter even the very mountains. was

target: These seven are ever the defects in those that are striving for knowledge, is my opinion; where is knowledge in those that care for pleasures and there is pleasure for those that care for knowledge. Knowledge should pronounce pleasure.

target: Of creatures, again, who have lillle intelligence, when their mind becomes distracted and checrless, life is seen to be upheld upon our objects discharging their functions.

target: That one at first becomes a Brahmana and then becomes a Kshatriya, A Vahika after that will become a Vaishya, then a Sudra and then a barber.

target: When mounted on horse-back, Rāghava went a-hunting, Lakṣmaṇa went at his back bow in hand, protecting him. And that younger brother of Laksmana, Satrughna, likewise became ever dearer to Bharata than life itself.

source: विदुर उवाच बाहुश्रुत्यं तपस्त्यागः श्रद्धा यज्ञक्रिया क्षमा। भावशुद्धिर्दया सत्यं संयमश्चात्मसम्पदः॥
target: Vidura said Study of the various scriptures, asceticism, gift, faith, celebration of sacrifices, forgiveness, sincerity of purpose, mercy, truth, self-control,-these form the possessions of Virtue.

source: समन्तपञ्चकाद् बाह्यं शिविराणि सहस्रशः। कारयामास विधिवत् कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः॥

target: Dhristadyumna is the brother-in-law of the sons of Pritha by marriage; he is ever engaged in doing the favourite works of the Pandavas. I have, therefore, a great fear.

source: महीध्रकसुतो राजा कीर्तिरातो महाबलः। कीर्तिरातस्य राजर्षेर्महारोमा व्यजायत॥
target: Mahīdhraka's son was king Kirtirāta endowed with great strength. And the Rājarşi Kirtirāta had Mahāroman born to him.

target: O foremost of men, as the fallen king Yayati was saved by his virtuous grandson, so have I now been saved by you.

source: एवमुक्ताः स्त्रियः सर्वाः सुमन्त्रेण नृपाज्ञया। प्रचक्रमुस्तद् भवनं भर्तुराज्ञाय शासनम् ॥

target: As one without a raft cannot cross over the mighty main, how can I, or you, or all the Raksasa combined, cause death to Rāma, who, O Prahasta, is versed in the sense of things.
