source: समभ्यधावद् गाङ्गेयं भैरवास्त्रो धनंजयः। दिशं प्राची प्रतीची च न जानीमोऽस्त्रमोहिताः॥
target: Then Dhananjaya, possessed of dreadful weapons rushed against the son of Ganga. Confounded with his weapons we then were unable to distinguish between the east and the west.

source: बभ्रमुः कुञ्जराश्चात्र शरैर्विद्धा निरङ्कुशाः। अश्वाश्च पर्यधावन्त हतारोहा दिशो दश॥
target: Pierced with shafts and deprived of their riders who used to guide them with hooks, elephants began to course (madly) through the field steeds ran about in all direction having their riders slain.

source: मम दर्शय सुग्रीव वैरिणं भ्रातृरूपिणम्॥ वाली विनिहतो यावद्वने पांसुषु चेष्टते।
target: Do you show me, O Sugriva, your enemy, in the guise of a brother. Wounded (by my shaft) Vāli shall roll in the dust in the forest.

source: तौ पार्थिवानां मिषतां नरेन्द्र कृष्णामुपादाय गतौ नराग्यौ। विभ्राजमानाविव चन्द्रसूर्यो बाह्यां पुराद् भार्गवकर्मशालाम्॥
target: O king, the assembled kings stood motionless looking at these two best of heroes among men. While they, resembling like the sun and the moon, took Krishna with them and went away to a potter's house (situated) outside the city.

source: नाकुलिस्तस्य विशिखैवर्म संनतपर्वभिः। गात्रात् संच्यावयामास तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: The son of Nakula, (also), with straight arrows cut-off his armour from his body and this feat seemed marvellous.

source: अहं सम्पातिवचनाच्छतयोजनमायतम्॥ तस्याहेतोविशालाक्ष्याः समुद्रं वेगवान् प्लुतः।
target: And by Sampāti's counsel and for that largeeyed dame, I have leapt a hundred leagues across the deep.

source: अत्रेस्तु सुमहाभागं पुत्रं पुत्रवतः वरम्। विदुरं विद्धि तं लोके जातं बुद्धिमतां वरम्॥
target: Know, that he who was known as Vidura, he wino was the best of all virtuous men, he who was the god of justice himself who was the excellent and greatly fortunate son of Atri (Surya). one

source: वर्तमाने समाजे तु रमणीयेऽछि घोडशे। आप्लुताङ्गी सुवसना सर्वाभरणभूषिता॥ मालां च समुपादाय काञ्चनीं समलंकृताम्। अवतीर्णा ततो रङ्गं द्रौपदी भरतर्षभ॥
target: When this grand assembly continued (for 15 days,) then on the sixteenth day, O best of the Bharata race, Draupadi, having bathed, attired in the best robes and adorned with all ornaments entered the arena carrying in her hand a golden dish on which there were a garland of flowers and other offerings of the Arghya.

source: तस्यार्थे पृथिवीपाला: कुरुक्षेत्रं समागताः॥ अन्योन्यं घातयिष्यन्ति दृढैः शस्त्रैः प्रहारिणः।
target: For his sake, many kings assemble together on the field of Kuru, They will cause one another to be killed through hard weapons.

source: एवंविधाश्च ये केचिल्लोकेऽस्मिन् पापकर्मिणः। मनुष्या भिन्नमर्यादास्ते सर्वे तामसाः स्मृताः॥
target: Whatever men there are in this world, who are characterised by these and other faults of a similar kind, and who break through the restraints are all considered as belonging is the quality of Ignorance.

source: गच्छ सैरन्ध्र भद्रं ते यथाकामं वरानने। बिभेति राजा सुश्रोणि गन्धर्वेभ्यः पराभवात्॥
target: Go Sairandhri, wherever you like; may good betide you, O fair one, O you having beautiful eye-brows, the king is afraid of defeat from the Gandharvas.

source: त्वया शक्तेन हि सता मिथ्याचारेण माधव। ते परीताः कुरुश्रेष्ठा नश्यन्तः स्म ह्यपेक्षिताः॥
target: It seems, O Madhava, that, though fully able (to save them), you were in different to these foremost of Kurus who, overwhelmed by insincerity and hypocrisy, have all met with destruction.

source: तं रथैर्बहुसाहस्रैः कल्पितैः कुञ्जरैर्हयैः। पदात्योपैश्च संरब्धैः परिबर्धनंजयम्॥
target: Thereupon, neither Govinda nor Arjuna nor their car could be seen; for they were then covered with thick showers of weapons and surrounded with large bodies of troops.

source: यद् द्रव्यं बान्धवानां वा मित्राणां वा क्षये भवेत्। नाहं तत् प्रतिगृह्णीयां भक्ष्यान् विषकृतानिव॥
target: That thing which falls to my lot on the destruction of friends and adherents I never accept, even like food mixed with poison.

source: भवति चात्र श्लोकः-अभयं सर्वभूतेभ्यो दत्त्वा यश्चरते मुनिः। न तस्य सर्वभूतेभ्यो भयमुत्पद्यते क्वचित्॥
target: There are some verses on this subject-that person who, observing the vow of silence roams without giving any creature cause of fear, is never filled with any fear himself by any creature.

source: चेदिराजोऽपि समरे पौरवं पुरुषर्षभम्। आजघान शिताग्रेण जत्रुदेशे महासिना॥
target: The ruler of the Chedis also, with the sharp end of his mighty sword, wounded that descendant of Puru, that foremost of men, on his shoulder joint.

source: रामो विग्रहवान् धर्म: साधुः सत्यपराक्रमः। राजा सर्वस्य लोकस्य देवानामिव वासवः॥
target: It did not behove you therefore to use such improper language towards him. he is an incarnation of virtue, pious and truthful, and lord of all men as Vāsava of all celestials.

source: द्रौपद्युवाच द्रोणपुत्रस्य सहजो मणिः शिरसि मे श्रुतः। निहत्य संख्ये तं पापं पश्येयं मणिमाहृतम्॥ राजशिरसि ते कृत्वा जीवेयमिति मे मतिः।
target: I have heard that Drona's son has a gem on his head, born with him. I shall see that gem brought to me after his death in battle. Placing that gem on your head, O king, I shall live. This is my resolution.'

source: स मे भवान् शंसतु सर्वमेतत् सामान्यशब्दैश्च विशेषणैश्च। ज्ज्ञाने फलं कर्मणि वा यदस्ति॥
target: Describe to me all I have asked you, by making only simple statements and using qualifying adjectives or attributes. Tell me what the fruits are of Knowledge, sacrifices and other religious rites. Explain to me how also an embodied being leaves his body and acquires a new one.

source: खङ्गिनौ दृढधन्वानौ तिग्मतेजो महाभुजौ। भ्रातरौ विवशं प्राप्तौ कृष्यमाणौ महाबलौ॥
target: Those two highly powerful brothers, of mighty arms, with daggers and bows in their hands, were assailed and got hold of by that Raksasha.

source: धर्मराजो न संक्रुद्ध्येद् भीमसेनस्त्वमर्षणः। यज्ञसेनस्य दुहिता तेज एव तु केवलम्॥
target: Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) will never be angry, but Bhimasena is naturally wrathful; the daughter of Yajnasena (Draupadi) also is effulgence herself.

source: यदेषा साध्विति ब्रूयात् कार्यं तन्मुक्तसंशयम्। नहि तारामतं किंचिदन्यथा परिवर्तते॥
target: Do you, without the least doubt perform what shall the chaste lady instruct you to do; for Tārā's advice never goes without effect.

source: रुधिरेणावसिक्ताङ्गौ द्वाविवाौं नभश्च्युतौ। ततस्ता विद्रुता नार्यः स च दैत्यगणस्तथा॥ पातालमगमत् सर्वो विषाद्भयकम्पितः। ततः पितामहस्तत्र सह देवैर्महर्षिभिः॥ आजगाम विशुद्धात्मा पूजयंश्च तिलोत्तमाम्। वरेणच्छन्दयामास भगवान् प्रपितामहः॥
target: Their bodies being covered with blood they looked like two suns loosened from the sky. The women and the others that were present all fled away trembling in grief and fear; and took refuge in the nether regions. Thereupon the pure souled Grandsire with the celestials and great Rishis came there and applauded Tilottama. The illustrious Grandsire cheered her by granting boons. Before she spoke, the Grandsire thus spoke in cheerfulness,

source: एवं ब्रुवाणं देवर्षि नृपतिः सृञ्जयोऽब्रवीत्। ममेयं भगवन् कन्या मत्तो वरमभीप्सति॥
target: Thereupon king Srinjaya replied to the celestial sage who spoke those words, thus-"O almighty Rishis, this damsel is my daughter and she solicits my blessings."

source: ऋषीणामत्र संवादो बहुशः कुरुनन्दन। बभूव तेषां तु मतं यत् तच्छृणु युधिष्ठिर।॥
target: Numberless discourses took place. between the Rishis on this subject, O scion of Kuru's race. Listen, O Yudhishthira, what their opinion was.

source: भीष्म उवाच ब्राह्मणानेव सेवेत विद्यावृद्धास्तपस्विनः। श्रुतचारित्रवृत्ताढ्यान् पवित्रं ह्येतदुत्तमम्॥
target: Bhishma said One should always adore Brahmanas respected for learning, devoted to penances, and observant of Vedic injunctions. This, indeed, is a high and sacred duty.

source: स तु विद्राव्य समरे पाण्डवन् संजयानपि॥ एक एव रणे भीष्म एकवीरत्वमागतः।
target: Indeed he had achieved an unrivalled heroism in the field, having routed the Pandavas and the Srinjayas all single-handed in battle.

source: यथा हि त्वं महाबाहो लालितः सततं मया। न तथा वर्तमानं त्वां सुग्रीवो बहु मन्यते॥
target: O you having long arms, Sugrīva shall not regard you much, if did you remain in the same wise in which you hadst been brought up by me before*. The significance of the passage is as follows:You wert a mere child while I brought you up. But now you are a grown up young man and this is the time for you to serve your elders. Do you therefore serve Sugriva.

source: तथैव चानुयात्रादि चोदयामास पाण्डवः। सज्जयध्वं प्रयास्यामो नगरं गजसाह्वयम्॥
target: The son of Pandu then ordered all his attendants, saying, 'Prepare your selves and be ready. We shall go today to Hastinapur.

source: अमात्सर्यं बुधाः प्राहुर्दाने धर्मे च संयमः। अवस्थितेन नित्यं च सत्येनामत्सरी भवेत्॥
target: Devoted to liberality and the performance of all duties are considered by the wise as forming good-will. One gains universal good will by continued devotion to Truth.

source: कर्णे हि कुरवोऽस्मार्षुः स हि देवव्रतोपमः। सर्वशस्त्रभृतां श्रेष्ठं रोचमानमिवातिथिम्॥ बन्धुमापद्गतस्येव तमेवोपागमन्मनः। चक्रुशुः कर्ण कर्णेति तत्र भारत पार्थिवाः॥
target: Thereafter the Kauravas remembered Karna, who was equal to Devavrata himself and who was the foremost of all wielders of weapons and resplendent like a guest. Then like the heart of a distressed person looking for a friend, their hearts turned towards him (Karna); and, O Bharata, the kings then broke out into exclamations saying, "O Karna, O Karna."

source: छेत्स्यतेऽल्पावशिष्टत्वादेतदप्यचिरादिव। ततस्तु पतितारोऽत्र गर्ने व्यक्तमधोमुखाः॥
target: The little that remains of the single thread will soon be cut away, It is quite evident that you will then fall into the pit with your heads downwards.

source: तात भ्रात: सखे बन्धो वयस्य मम मातुल। मा मां परित्यजेत्यन्ये चुक्रुशुः पतिता रणे॥ दर्पिताः॥
target: Many, fallen on the field of battle, cried aloud, “O father, O brother, O friend, O kinsman, O companion, O maternal uncle, do not abandon me".

source: उल्कापाता दिशा दाहो भूमिकम्पस्तथैव च। प्रादुर्भूतः क्षणे तस्मिंस्तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: Meteors began to shoot. The points of the horizon seemed to be ablaze. The Earth trembled. All these phenomena seemed extremely wonderful.

source: वासवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा सर्वलोकपितामहः। रक्षास्यावाहयामास कुम्भकर्म ददर्श ह॥
target: Hearing Vasava's speech, the Great-father of all creatures called up* the Rākṣasas and saw Kumbhakarņa (before him). *By reciting a certain scriptural formula.

source: पुरुषेषु यथा रुद्रस्तथाऽऽर्या प्रमदास्वपि॥ आर्या माता कुमारस्य पृथक् कामार्थमिज्यते। एवमेते कुमाराणां मया प्रोक्ता महाग्रहाः॥ यावत् षोडश वर्षाणि शिशूनां ह्यशिवास्ततः।
target: This revered goddess acts the same part among the females as does Rudra among the males. She is the mother of all children; she is specially worshipped for their welfare. I have thus described to you all the evil spirits that preside over the destiny of children. Until children attain their sixteenth year, these spirits exercise their influence for evil and after that for good.

source: अहं प्रजापतीनां च सर्वेषां नात्र संशयः। मम विष्णुरचिन्त्यात्मा स्वयम्भूरिति स स्मृतः॥
target: Of all the Prajapatis I am the first. There is no doubt in this, Of inconceivable soul, the self consistent Vishnu is said to be my superior.

source: श्रीभगवानुवाच एवमेतन्महाबाहो यथा वदसि पाण्डवा पाण्डवानां कुरूणां च प्रतिपत्स्ये निरामयम्॥
target: The blessed God said O you of long arms, it will be as you say, O Pandava. I shall accomplish what would be for the well being of the Pandavas and for the Kurus.

source: दैवोपहतचित्तेन यन्मया न कृतं पुरा। अनयस्य फलं तस्य ब्रूहि गावल्गणे पुनः॥
target: Afflicted by fate, I did not then act according to those words. The fruits of that evil course have now appeared. Describe them to me, O son of Gavalgana, once more.

source: सम्प्राप्यैव गता नाशं शलभा इव पारकम्॥ ततो मत्स्याः केकयाश्च धनुर्वेदविशारदाः।
target: Approaching him met with their destruction, like insects burning on fire. Thereupon the Matsyas and the Kaikeyas all accomplished in the science of bowmanship,

source: प्रवृद्धः सहसा पक्षी महाकायो नभोगतः। घोरो घोरस्वनो रौद्रो वह्निरौर्व इवापरः॥
target: As soon as he was born, the huge bird, increasing his body, rose to the sky, fearfully roaring like a second ocean-fire.

source: ते पीड्यमाना द्रोणेन द्रोणानीकं न शक्नुमः। प्रतिवीक्षितुमप्याजौ भेत्तुं तत् कुत एव तु॥
target: My troops then, thus afflicted by Drona, were not even able, in battle, to look at his divisions what to speak of the thought of breaking through them!

source: महेश्वर उवाच सारमुद्धृत्य युष्माभिः साधुधर्म उदाहृतः। धर्मगुह्यमिदं मत्तः शृणुध्वं सर्व एव ह॥
target: Maheshvara said You have recited excellent duties from your Inemory. Listen all of you now to me as I declare some mysteries about religion and duty.

source: सात्यकोऽपि महाराज शरजालं निहत्य तत्। द्रौणिमभ्यकिरत् तूर्णं शरजालैरनेकधा॥
target: Satyki also, O mighty monarch, destroying that net-work of arrows, speedily scattered on Drona's a large number of arrows.

source: पूजन्युवाच यदि कालः प्रमाणं ते न वैरं कस्यचिद् भवेत्। कस्मात् त्वपचितिं यान्ति बान्धवा बान्धवैहतैः॥
target: If Time, as you say, be the cause of all acts, then, of course, nobody can entertain fevlings of enmity towards anybody on earth. I ask, however, why do friends and kinsmen, when friends and kinsmen are killed, try to avenge the latter.

source: पुनरावृत्तिमाप्नोति परं ज्ञानमवाप्य च। नावबुध्यति तत्त्वेन बुध्यमानोऽजरामरम्॥
target: On account of his knowing truly the Supreme Soul which is not subject to decay and death, Individual Soul is obliged to frequently return to the world. When, however, Individual Soul succeeds in acquiring that high knowledge, he has no longer to return.

source: संजय उवाच तथेति राजन् पुत्रस्ते सह कर्णेन भारत। अब्रबीन्मद्रराजस्य मतं भरतसत्तम्॥
target: Sanjaya said O king, O descendant of Bharata, O best of the Bharata race, your son, accompanied by Karna, replied to the son of the king of the Madras, saying-so be it.

source: रात्रिः शशाङ्कोदितसौम्यवक्त्रा तारागणोन्मीलितचारुनेत्रा। ज्योत्स्नांशुकप्रावरणा विभाति नारीव शुक्लांशुकसंवृताङ्गी॥
target: Having the rising Moon for her elegant countenance, the stars for her excellent open eyes and the rays for a piece of white garment, the night appeareth like a damsel wearing a white cloth.

source: बह्वागस्कृत कुसम्बन्धी पापदेशसमुद्भवः। मया सैन्धवको राजा हतः स्वान् शोचयिष्यति॥
target: A greatly sinful wretch, one who had acted not like a kinsman, born in a sinful country, the king of Sindhus slain by me, will, tomorrow, impart sorrow to his followers.

source: एवमेष क्षयो वृत्तः सुमहाँल्लोमहर्षणः। तव दुर्मन्त्रिते राजन् किमर्थमनुशोचसि॥
target: Thus took place the dreadful, hair-stirring onslaught on account of your vile policy. Whey do you grieve for it now.

source: एवमेष क्षयो वृत्तः कर्णार्जुनसमागमे। महेन्द्रेण यथा वृत्रो यथा रामेण रावणः॥ यथा कृष्णेन नरको मुस्श्च नरकारिणा। कार्तवीर्यश्च रामेण भार्गवेण यथा हतः॥ सज्ञातिबान्धवः शूर समरे युद्धदुर्मदः। रणे कृत्वा महद् युद्धं घोरं त्रैलोक्यमोहनम्॥ यथा स्कन्देन महिषो यथा रुद्रेण चान्धकः। तथाऽर्जुनेन सहतो द्वैरथे युद्धदुर्मदः॥ सामात्यबान्धवो राजन् कर्णः प्रहरतां वरः।
target: Thus this destruction was brought about, while Karna and Arjuna fought against each other, even as Vritra was slain by Mahendra or as Ravana by Rama or as Naraka and Mura were slain by Krishna in battle, or as Kartavirjya of mighty strength by Rama of the Bhrigu race. That hero (Kartavirya), who is incapable of being vanquished, had fallen with all his friends and relatives, after having fought a great and terrible battle, renowned in the three worlds. Mahisha was slain by Skanda, as Andhaka by Rudra; even as that hero invincible in battle, was slain by Arjuna in a single engagement of two cars.' O, king that great smiter of enemies Karna, who was the hope of victory of all the Dhartarashtras and the cause of that hostilities, (was slain) with all his counselors and friends.

source: पौण्डरीकाश्वमेधाभ्यां वाजिमेधेन चासकृत्। अन्यैश्च विविधैर्यज्ञैरयजत्पार्थिवात्मजः॥ भुवि यौवराज्ये
target: That son of king performed various sacrifices such as Paundarika, Asvamedha', Vajimedha and other of various kinds. 1. A kind of sacrifice. 2. A kind of Sacrifice in which a horse is slain.

source: विहतान् रथिनस्तत्र धावमानांस्ततस्ततः। सूतपुत्रशरैस्तीक्ष्णैर्हन्यमानान् विशाम्पते॥ विशस्त्रांश्च तथैवान्यान् सशस्त्रांश्च हतान् बहून्।

target: The force of these extend to everything; but it is neutralized of what it is born. Those good people who are born in high families have always a spirit similar to fire.

target: It is known to you that the (people of this) spacious empire now governed by me was governed like to children by those sovereigns that were my predecessors.

source: उपरिष्टादसौ लोको योऽयं स्वरिति संज्ञितः। ऊर्ध्वगः सत्पथः शश्वद् देवयानचरो मुने॥

target: Therefore we cannot know you, although you are known for your greatness all over the world. You are venerable, you are of good fortune, you sorrowfully grieve for us.

target: “If you wish to live, O wretch, hear my words. You should say in courts and assemblies that you are our slave.

source: स हंसः सम्प्रमत्तानामप्रमत्तः स्वकर्मणि। ततः प्रक्षीयमाणेषु तेषु तेष्वण्डजोऽपरः। अशङ्कत महाप्राज्ञः स कदाचिद् ददर्श ह॥
target: That swan, always attentive to his own purpose, ate the eggs foolishly trusted to him, Some time after seeing the eggs decreased in number, another greatly intelligent bird suspected him, and one day he saw him (eat those eggs).

source: स नागप्रवरो भीमं सहसा समुपाद्रवत्। चरणाभ्यामथो द्वाभ्यां संहतेन करेण च॥ व्यावृत्तनयनः क्रुद्धः प्रमथनिव पाण्डवम्। वृकोदररथं साश्चमविशेषमचूर्णयत्॥
target: With its two forelegs and its trunk contracted and with its eyes rolling and inflamed with fury, the elephant seemed to consume the son of Pandu. It then shattered to pieces the car of Vrikodara together with the steeds harnessed thereto. Thereat running on his legs Bhima hid himself underneath body of the elephant.

source: सस्फुलिङ्गः सधूमार्चिः सधूमकलुषोदयः। मन्त्रसङ्घहुतोऽप्यग्निर्न सम्यगभिवर्धते॥
target: Fire, enveloped in smoke at the time of its being ignited, and thereafter throwing out scintillation's, with its brightness obscured by vapour, does not increase adequately even n oblations being poured into it with Mantras,

source: अन्यथैव ही मन्यन्ते पुरुषास्तानि तानि च। अन्यथैव प्रभुस्तानि करोति विकरोति च॥
target: Ordinary people see all those things in a different view; the Lord create and destroy them in a different way.

source: यावन्न ते व्यतिक्रामेत् तावद् सुखमवाप्नुहि। उद्यानानि च रम्याणि पर्वतोपवनानि च॥ सह राक्षसराजेन चर त्वं मदिरेक्षणे। स्त्रीसहस्राणि ते देवि वशे स्थास्यन्ति सुन्दरि॥ रावणं भज भर्तारं भर्तारं सर्वरक्षसाम्।
target: And so long as your youth dose not fade, do you pass your days happily, O you having inebriate eyes, with the lord of Rākşasas, in picturesque gardens, and mountain forests. Do you take, O fair damsel, Ravana, the lord of the Rākşasas, for your husband, and thousands of females shall be placed at your service.

source: भीमसेनं च संक्रुद्धं यमौ चापि यमोपमौ। युयुधानद्वितीयं च धृष्टद्युम्नममर्षणम्॥
target: As also when he sees Bhimasena excited with anger, and the twins who are like Yama himself and the wrathful Dhrishtadyumna having Yuyudhana for his second,

source: श्रुत्वा गुणानहं तस्यां सभायाः पाण्डवर्षभ। दर्शनेप्सुस्तथा राजन्नादित्यमिदमब्रवम्॥
target: O best of the Pandavas, hearing the merits of that Sabha, I became desirous of seeing it. O king, I then spoke thus to Aditya.

source: तानुवाच ततः प्राप्तान् वाचार्कसदृशप्रभः॥ उपस्थापयत क्षिप्रं शिबिकां मम वानराः।
target: To them, who had presented themselves, said the king, of splendour resembling that of the Sun, Do, you monkeys, bring hither a car.8

source: सोमसूर्यौ च काकुत्स्थ शिववैश्रवणावपि ॥ वरुणश्चाग्निरिन्द्रश्च विजयं प्रदिशन्तु ते।
target: Oh! Kākutstha, may the moon, Sun, Siva, Vaisravana, (the god of wealth), Varuna, (the god of water), Agni and Indra grant you victory.

source: आयुधानि च सर्वेषां बाहुनपि विभूषितान्। अपतन्तः निकृत्ताङ्गा मृता भूमौ गतासवः॥
target: Their weapons and their hands furnished with these, fell down on earth, and they themselves deprived of life and with their bodies mangled, fell down dead.

source: यस्तु प्रीतिपुरोगेन चक्षुषा तात पश्यति। दीपोपमानि भूतानि यावदर्थान्न पश्यति॥ सान्त्वेनानप्रदानेन प्रियवादेन चाप्युत। समदुःखसुखो भूत्वा स परत्र महीयते॥
target: That man who regards all creatures impartially guided by affection, considering them worthy of being cherished with loving, aid, who disregards all sorts of wealth, who offers them consolation, gives them food, addresses them in sweet words, and who rejoices in their happiness and grieves in their sorrows, has never to suffer misery in the next world.

source: ततोऽस्य जायते तीव्रा वेदना तक्षयात् पुनः। अबुधा न प्रशंसन्ति मोक्षं सुखमनुत्तमम्॥
target: Upon the termination of the pleasure, which is fickle, on suffers the most acute pain. It is only the senseless that do not speak highly of happiness of Liberation which is peerless.

source: किं नु स्वपो मया दृष्टः कोऽयं विधिरिहाभवत्। क्व नु ते तापसा: सर्वे क्व तदाश्रममण्डलम्॥
target: Did I dream a dream! what an event have occurred even now? Where are all those ascetics and where is that asylum (gone).

source: स्वधर्मः परिपाल्यस्तु राज्ञामिति विनिश्चयः। विप्रधर्मश्च गहनो मामनात्मानमाविशत्॥
target: It is settled that kings should follow the duties sanctioned for them. To my misfortune, however, the course of duties laid down for Brahmanas has affected my wretched self.

source: इत्येतद् वचनं श्रुत्वा दिव्यं रूपमधारयत्। स तस्या महिमां दृष्ट्वा समन्तादवशीर्यत ॥
target: Hearing this speech, she assumed a divine appearance. And beholding her mightiness, Agni was shrunk up on all sides.

source: आत्मानमुपमां कृत्वा स्वेषु दारेषु रम्यताम्। अतुष्टं स्वेषु दारेषु चपलं चपलेन्द्रियम्। नयन्ति निकृतिप्रज्ञं परदाराः पराभवम्॥
target: Making an example of you, do you enjoy with your own wives. Forsooth those vicious-minded, those of agitated senses, who are not satisfied with their own wives, are brought to misery by others' wives.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच भिक्षाभुजो निवर्तन्तां ब्राह्मणा यतयश्च ये। क्षुत्तृडध्वश्रमायासशीतार्तिमसहिष्णवः॥
target: Yudhishthira said : Let the mendicants, Brahmanas and Yogis who are incapable of bearing hunger and thirst, the fatigues of travel and toil and also the severity of winter desist (from following me).

source: तानर्जुनः शरैस्तूर्णं निहत्य भरतर्षभ। व्यरोचत यथा वह्निवं दग्ध्वा हिमात्यये॥
target: Quickly dispatching them with his arrows, O foremost of the Bharata, Arjuna, then appeared beautiful like the fire consuming the forest at the expiration of winter.

source: नाप्राप्तमनुशोचन्ति प्राप्तकालानि कुर्वते। न चातीतानि शोचन्ति न चैव प्रतिजानते॥
target: They never grieve for what is yet to come. They are concerned with only what is present and act as they should. They never grieve for the past or even recollect it.

source: उच्छ्रितान् नाशयेत् स्फीतान् नरेन्द्रानचलोपमान्। श्रयेच्छायामविज्ञातां गुप्तं रणमुपाश्रयेत्॥
target: He should kill those foremost of kings who are puffed up with might and stand with upraised heads like mountains; by bribing the governors of the forests and by ambuscades and sudden attacks.

source: शल्योऽपि राजन् संक्रुद्धो निघ्नन् सोमकपाण्डवान्। पुनरेव शितैर्बाणैयुधिष्ठिरमपीडयत्॥
target: Shalya also excited with anger, O king, killed many Somakas and Pandavas and once more assailed Yudhishthira with many sharp arrows.

source: अर्हतामनुरूपाणां नादेय ह्यस्ति किंचन। उचैःश्रवसमप्यश्चं प्रापणीयं सतां विदुः॥
target: There is nothing that cannot be given to a deserving person. The good and the wise deserve to have even the best of horses, called Uchchaishravas, belonging to Indra himself.

source: तस्य तुष्टो महादेवो भक्त्या च प्रशमेन च। हृद्गतं चास्य विज्ञाय दर्शयामास शङ्करः॥
target: Mahadeva became highly gratified with him for his devotional performances and coolness of mind and Shankara, becoming conscious of the object in his mind showed himself to him.

source: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय निश्चक्राम महायशाः॥ सापि कालेन कौसल्या सुषुवेऽन्धं तमात्मजम्। पुनरेव तु सा देवी परिभाष्य स्नुषां ततः॥ ऋषिमावाहयत् सत्या यथा पूर्वमरिंदम! ततस्तेनैव विधिना महर्षिस्तामपद्यत॥ अम्बालिकामथाभ्यागादृषि दृष्ट्वा च सापि तम्। विवर्णा पाण्डुसंकाशा समपद्यत भारत॥
target: Having promised this, the illustrious (Vyasa) went away. In due time the princess of Kosalya gave birth to a blind son. O chastiser of foes, after securing the consent of her daughter-in-law, Satyavati soon after again summoned Vyasa as she did before. Vyasa came according to his promise and went to the second wife (Ambalika) of his brother in proper form. But she became pale and discoloured with fear on seeing the Rishi.

source: राजा दशरथो राजन् कृतकौतुकमङ्गलैः। पुत्रैर्नरवर श्रेष्ठो दातारमभिकाङ्क्षते॥ दातृप्रतिग्रहीतृभ्यां सर्वार्थाः सम्भवन्ति हि। स्वधर्मं प्रतिपद्यस्व कृत्वा वैवाह्यमुत्तमम्॥
target: King Dasaratha, O foremost of sovereigns, that chief among the best of men-accompanied with his son, who have performed all the rites relative to their nuptials, stay the orders of the bestower (of the bride); for the meeting of the giver and the receiver is indispensable to every transaction (of this nature). Do you therefore maintain your merit by accomplishing this excellent nuptial ceremony.

source: परिष्वज्य च सुग्रीवं लक्ष्मणेनाभिवादितः॥ पूज्यमानो हरिगणैराजगाम बलालयम्।
target: Embracing Sugrīva, bowed to by Lakşmaņa and worshipped by the monkey he repaired to the camp of his soldiers.

source: प्रतिलभ्य ततः संज्ञा चित्रसेनो महारथः। धनुश्चिच्छेद भल्लेन तं च विव्याध सप्तभिः॥
target: Thereupon Chitrasena, that mighty bowman, having attained consciousness again, struck down his enemy's bow by a broodheaded shafts and also pierced him with seven arrows.

source: एवं विलप्य बहुधा करुणं सा सुदुःखिता॥ पतिव्रता सम्प्रदीप्तं प्रविवेश हुताशनम्।
target: Filled with sorrow and bewailing thus, the she-pigeon, devoted to her husband cast herself on the burning fire.

source: श्रियं दिव्यामभिप्रेप्सुर्वम॑वान् मनसा शुचिः। शारीरैर्नियमैरुग्रैश्चरेन्निष्कल्मषं तपः॥
target: He who wishes to secure high prosperity should become pure in mind, and practising austere practices regarding the body and the senses, should devote himself to yoga without seeking for fruits.

source: व्यमुञ्चञ्छरवातान् नानालिङ्गान् समन्ततः। से तैरभ्यर्घमानस्तु भीमसेनो महाबलः॥ तेषामापततां क्षिप्रं सुतानां ते जनाधिप। रथैःपञ्चादशैः सार्ध पञ्चाशदहनद् रथान्॥
target: They discharged at himn from all sides showers of arrows of various sorts. Thus assailed by them, O king, the highly powerful Bhima soon killed fifty leading car-warriors and five hundred from amongst your sons who fell upon him.

source: कृतिर्विकारः प्रणयः प्रधानं बीजमव्ययम्। मनसः परमा योनिः प्रभावश्चापि शाश्वतः॥
target: You are the acts of creatures, you are the joy and sorrow of those acts, you are the absence of joy and sorrow, you are that Nescience which is the eternal seeds of Desire, you are the great origin of Mind, you are Power, and you are Eternity.

source: यच तद् धार्तराष्ट्रस्य क्रूरैः षड्भिर्महारथैः॥ अपश्यं निहतं वीरं सौभद्रमृषभेक्षणम्। द्रोणद्रौणिकृपान् वीरान् कर्षयन्तं नरर्षभान्॥ निर्मनुष्यांश्च मातङ्गान् विरथांश्च महारथान्। व्यश्वारोहांश्च तुरगान् पत्तीन् व्याधुजीविनः॥ कुर्वन्तमृषभस्कन्धं कुरुवृष्णियशस्करम्। विधमन्तमनीकानि व्यथयन्तं महारथान्॥ मनुष्यवाजिमातङ्गान् प्राहिण्वन्तं यमक्षयम्। शरैः सौभद्रमायान्तं दहन्तमिव वाहिनीम्॥ तन्मे दहति गात्राणि सखे सत्येन ते शपे। यत् तत्रापि च दुष्टात्मा कर्णोऽभ्यद्रुह्यत प्रभो॥ अशक्नुवंश्चाभिमन्योः कर्णः स्थातु रणेऽग्रतः। सौभद्रशरनिर्भिन्नो विसंज्ञः शोणितोक्षितः॥
target: I have seen the valiant son of Subhadra, of lustrous eyes, fall at the hands of six heartless charioteers belonging to the Dhritarasthra force. Harassing mighty heroes like Drona, Drona's son and Kripa and others, he divested elephants of their riders and mighty charioteers of their cars. Abhimanyu of mighty neck, the pride and the glory of both the Kurus and the Vrisnis, made also the steeds bereft of their riders and the infantry, their arms and life. Overthrowing the hostile files and harassing many powerful charioteers, he has packed off numbers of men and steeds and elephants to the gates of Pluto. O friend, by truth I swear unto you that I am burning at the thought that while Subhadra's son was thus advancing, striking down with his arrows the hostile force, even then, O lord Partha, the malevolent Karna, unable to withstand him in a face to face fight, had been engaged in acts of hostility to that heroic Abhimanyu. Mangled with the arrows of Subhadra's son, rendered senseless and bathed in blood.

source: मरीचेः कश्यपः पुत्रः कश्यपात्तु इमाः प्रजाः। प्रजज्ञिरे महाभागा दक्षकन्यास्त्रयोदश॥
target: Marichi had a son, named Kashyapa and from Kashyapa have sprung all creatures. Daksha begot thirteen illustrious daughters.

source: इत्युक्तौ तौ नरव्याघ्रौ ययतुर्यत्र सैन्धवः। राजा निववृते कृष्णामादाय सपुरोहितः॥
target: Having been thus addressed those two foremost of men went where Saindhava was; taking Draupadi with him, the king alone with his priest returned.

source: यमौ रणे यत्र यमोपमौ बले ससात्यकिर्यत्र च देवकीसुतः। न तद्बलं कापुरुषोऽभ्युपेयिवान् निवर्तते मृत्युमुखान्न चासुभृत्॥
target: As no one ever returns alive from the jaws of death, so no coward ever returns (alive) after having confronted that hostile army to which belong the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva), each resembling death himself in battle and in which are Satyaki and the son of Devaki.

source: पतिहीना तु या नारी कामं भवतु पुत्रिणी॥ धनधान्यसमृद्धापि विधवेत्युच्यते जनैः।
target: A husbandless woman is always styled by the wise as widow, although she might have a son and enough of riches.

source: न चापि तस्य क्रुद्धस्य वार्ष्णेयस्य महात्मनः॥ स्थास्यते प्रत्यनीकेषु कश्चिदत्र नृपस्तव।
target: There exists no king in our whole army, who will be able to stand in the front of that high-souled descendant of Vrishni's race, when he will be filled with wrath.

source: तैरश्वैर्धाम्यते भ्रान्तैः सुमाली राक्षसेश्वरः। इन्द्रियाश्वैः परिभ्रान्तैधृतिहीनो यथा नरः॥
target: And with his bewildered steeds Sumali wanders like a person deprived of patience, whose senses are under hallucination.

source: देवयान्युवाच कथमाशीविषात् सर्पाज्ज्वलनात् सर्वतोमुखात्। दुराधर्षतरो विप्र इत्यात्य पुरुषर्षभ॥
target: Devayani said : O best of men, why do you say that a Brahmana is to be avoided like an angry and virulently poisonous snake, or a blazing and flaming fire?

source: नकुलस्ते सुतं राजन् विकर्णे पृथुलोचनम्। मुहूर्ताज्जितवाँल्लोके तदद्भुतमिवाभवत्॥
target: O king, Nakula then vanquished in a moment your son Vikarna of expanded eyes; that indeed seemed marvellous, Oking.

source: अधर्मस्य क्षयं गत्वा ततो जायति मानुषः। चोरयित्वा पयश्चापि बलाका सम्प्रजायते॥
target: After the exhaustion of his sin by such suffering he regains the human form. By stealing milk, one becomes a crane.

source: तद् युधिष्ठिर तुष्टोऽस्मि पूजितश्च त्वयाऽनघ। अनुजानामि युध्यस्व विजयं समवाप्नुहि॥
target: O Yudhishthira, O sinless one, I am now pleased and honoured by you. I give you permission. Fight and win victory.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच श्रुत्वैतदाख्यानवरं धर्मराड् जनमेजय॥ भ्रातरश्चास्य ते सर्वे नारायणपराऽभवन्।
target: Vaishampayana said Having listened to this best of discourses, O Janamejaya, king Yudhisthira the just, and all his brothers became devoted to Narayana.

source: बृहस्पतिरुवाच त्वमग्ने सर्वदेवानां मुखं त्वमसि हव्यवाट्। त्वमन्तः सर्वभूतानां गूढश्चरसि साक्षिवत्॥
target: Brihaspati said O Agni, you are within all beings and concealed there you act like a witness.

source: यत्राश्वरथमुख्यानामश्वानां स्याद् गतं न च। हस्तिनां पीठकानां च गर्दभानां तथैव च॥ बस्तानां च गवां चैव शिबिकायास्तथैव च। उडुपप्लवसंतारो यत्र नित्यं भविष्यति। अराजा भोजशब्दं त्वं तत्र प्राप्स्यसि सान्वयः॥
target: You shall be a king only in name. You shall rule over a region where there will be no roads, no passages for horses, cars, elephants, asses, goats, bullocks, palanquins and other good vehicles, where the only means of locomotion will be rafts and floats. In such a place you will live with all your friends.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच अनुज्ञातः संजय स्वस्ति गच्छ न नः स्मरस्यप्रियं जातु विद्वन्। विद्मश्च त्वां ते च वयं च सर्वे शुद्धात्मानं मध्यगतं सभास्थम्॥
target: Yudhishthira said Perinitted by ourselves, go away 0 Sanjaya, May you fare well. Do not, O learned man, think ill of us. They and ourselves all know you to be a pure-souled man, in the midst of (their) court.

source: ततः कर्णस्य मिषतो द्रौणे दुर्योधनस्य च। कृपस्य सोमदत्तस्य बाहीकस्य च पाण्डवः॥
target: Then in the very sight of Karna and Duryodhana and in that of Kripa, Somadatta and Balhika, the Pandava,

source: राजा दशरथो नाम कश्चिदिक्ष्वाकुवर्धनः। तस्य पुत्रो महातेजा रामो नाम भविष्यति ॥
target: There shall be a king named Daſaratha, increaser of the Ikşwāku race. He shall have a son, named Rāma, endowed with exceeding energy.

source: भीष्मे स्वर्गमनुप्राप्ते गते च मधुसूदने। विदुरे संजये चैव कोऽन्यो मां वक्तुमर्हति॥
target: Bhishma has ascended to Heaven. The destroyer of Madhu, has departed (for Dwraka). Vidura and Sanjaya, also (will accompany you to the forest). Who else, therefore, save you, will teach me.

source: ते द्विजास्त्रिविधं वृद्धा ज्ञानेन वयसौजसा। वय:प्रकम्पशिरसो दूरादूचुरिदं वचः॥
target: The three kinds of the twice-born ones, viz., those old by virtue, respectively, of age, wisdom, and ascetic energy, the old folks with their heads shaking through length of years, cried from a distance.

source: सनत्सुजात उवाच अपृच्छः कर्मणा केचिन्मृत्युर्नास्तीति चापरमु। शृणु मे ब्रुवतो राजन् यथैतन्मा विशङ्किथाः॥
target: Sanat-Sujata said You have asked how death is avoided by certain actions and how it does not exit at all. Listen to me, discoursing on this, and do not be moved by doubts for this (inconsistency).

source: चन्द्रे लक्ष्मीः प्रभा सूर्ये गतिर्वायौ भुवि क्षमा। एतच्च नियतं नित्यं त्वयि चानुत्तमं यशः॥
target: Ever manifested itself in you, glory Par excellence like to splendour in the Moon, lustre in the Sun, motion in the wind and forgiveness in the Earth.

source: काञ्चनेषु तनुत्रेषु किरीटेषु ध्वजेषु च। शिलानामिव शैलेषु पतितानामभूद् ध्वनिः॥
target: The sound of the fall of armours, of crowns and diadems and of standards, resembled the sound of falling stones on hard founds.

source: एवमुक्तो यदि मया गृहणीयाद् वचनं मम। अनामयं स्याद्धर्मश्च कुरूणां कुरुवर्धन॥
target: Being thus accosted by me, if he had listened to my words, the well-being and the virtue of the Kurus, O enhancer of the Kuru race, would have been secured.

source: सुरकार्यमियं काले करिष्यति सुमध्यमा। अस्या हेतोः कौरवाणां महदुत्पत्स्यते भयम्॥
target: "This lady of slender waist will in time accomplish the works of gods. From her will arise many fears (dangers) to the Kurus."

source: पश्य पाण्डव मेऽवस्थां यथा नार्हामि वै तथा। युष्मासु ध्रियमाणेषु पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम्॥
target: Though all of you are alive, behold O Pandava, my plight. It is such as is quite undeserving of me. Lo! how times change.

source: प्रातिकाम्युवाच युधिष्ठिरो द्यूतमदेन मत्तो दुर्योधनो द्रौपदि त्वामजैषीत्। सा त्वं प्रपद्यस्व धृतराष्ट्रस्य वेश्म न यामि त्वां कर्मणे याज्ञसेनि॥
target: Pratikamin said O Draupadi, Yudhisthira having been intoxicated with dice you have been won by Duryodhana. Therefore, O Yajnaseni, come now to the house of Dhritarashtra. I shall ' menial work.

source: इह वा मां मृतां कुब्जे नृपायावेदयिष्यसि। वनं तु राघवे प्राप्ते भरतः प्राप्स्यते क्षितिम्॥ सुवर्णेन न मे ह्यर्थो न रत्नैर्न च भोजनैः। एष मे जीवितस्यान्तो रामो यद्यभिषिच्यते॥
target: Do you, O hump-backed one, tell the monarch, that I am dead at this place. On Räghava having gone to the forest, Bharata will obtain the earth. I do not require gold, or gems, or repasts; this will be the end of my existence if Rāma be installed.

source: अथाङ्गदस्तस्य सुतीव्रवाचा सम्भ्रान्तभावः परिदीनवक्त्रः। निर्गत्य पूर्वं नृपतेस्तरस्वी .ततो रुमायाश्चरणौ ववन्दे॥
target: Being greatly agitated with harsh words, Angada, with a pale and poorly countenance issued out speedily and approaching touched first the king's feet and afterwards with reverence Ruma's feet.

source: मया ह्येषा हि ध्रियते पातालस्थेन भोगिना। मया धृता धारयति जगद् विश्वं चराचरम्॥ तस्मात् पृथ्व्याः परित्राणं करिष्ये सम्भवं गतः।
target: Assuming the form of a powerful snake I myself have to uphold the Earth in empty space. Supported by me thus, she will support the entire universe of creatures mobile and immobile. Incarnated on the Earth, therefore, in different forms, I shall have to save her at such time from danger.

source: सुदेव उवाच यथेयं मे पुरा दृष्टा तथारूपेयमङ्गना। कृतार्थोऽस्म्यद्य दृष्ट्वेमा लोककान्तामिव श्रियम्॥
target: Sudeva said: As I saw the lady beforehand, she seems to be the self-same in appearance at present. This day I think myself blessed by the very sight of her, who is like Sree herself, delighting all the worlds.

source: मृतकस्य तृतीयाहे ब्राह्मणो योऽन्नमश्नुते। स त्रिवेलं समुन्मज्य द्वादशाहेन शुध्यति॥
target: The Brahmana who takes food at the house of a dead person on the third day after the death, is purified by bathing three times daily for twelve days.

source: रुदित्वा सुचिरं कालं भ्रातरौ सुमहाद्युती। कृतशौचौ महाराज प्रीतिमन्तौ बभूवतुः॥
target: Having thus indulged themselves for some time and assuaged their grief the two brothers of bright effulgence became reconciled to each other and were once again cheerful.

source: एतन्मङ्कणकस्यापि चरितं भूरितेजसः। स हि पुत्र सुकन्यायामुत्पन्नो मातरिश्वना॥
target: This is the history of Mankanaka. He was begotten by the god of wind upon Sukanya.

source: तत्र गत्वा स धर्मज्ञः सर्वशास्त्रविशारदः। दुपदं न्यायतो राजन् संयुक्तमुपतस्थिवान्॥
target: O king, having arrived there, that virtuous man, learned in all the Shastras, properly addressed Drupada and waited upon him.

source: न जातु हृष्येन्महता धनेन वेदानधीयीतानहंकृतः स्यात्। नानाभावा बहवो जीवलोके दैवाधीना नष्टचेष्टाधिकाराः। तत् तत् प्राप्य न विहन्येत धीरो दिष्टं बलीय इति मत्वाऽऽत्मबुद्ध्या॥
target: No one should be proud of his great wealth; no one should feel exalted, because he has studied the entire Vedas. Men are of different dispositions in the world, but Destiny is supreme. Power and exertion are both futile and useless. Knowing Destiny to be supreme (over all), the wise should neither feel pride nor grief.

source: माधवस्तु रणे विद्धो धर्मपुत्रेण मारिष। प्राकम्पत च रोषेण सप्तभिश्चादयच्छरैः॥
target: Pierced in (that) battle by the son of Dharma, O worshipful sire, the descendant of Madhu (i.e. Kritavarma) trembled in ire and (then) afflicted (Yudhishthira) with seven arrows.

source: सिद्धाश्रम इति ख्यातः सिद्धो ह्यत्र महातपाः। एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु राजा वैरोचनिबंलिः॥ निर्जित्य दैवतगणान् सेन्द्रान् सहमरुद्गणान्। कारयामास तद्राज्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुतः॥
target: And this famed as Siddhāśrama, in consequence of that one of potent asceticism having attained fruition there. And it came to pass that at this time Virocana's son, king Välī; having vanquished the celestials with Indra and the Maruts, established that dominion of his, famous in the three worlds.

source: स शृङ्गे प्रथमे दिव्ये हिमवन्मेरुसम्भवे। संश्लिष्टे श्वेतपीते द्वे रुक्मरूप्यमये शुभे॥
target: Shuka, as he went through the sky, saw two beautiful summits, one belonging to Himavat and another to Meru. These were side by side with each other. One of them was made of gold and was, therefore, yellow; the other was white, being made of silver.

source: व्रतैश्च नियमैश्चैव तपसा च तपोधन। शक्रस्तोषयितव्यो वै मया त्रिभुवनेश्वरः॥
target: I am propitiating Shakra, the lord of the three worlds, with vows and rigid observances and ascetic penances.'

source: द्यौर्वियद्धर्दिशश्चैव प्रपूर्णानिशितैः शरै। अरुणाभ्रावृताकारं तस्मिन् देशे बभौ वियत्॥
target: The sky, the earth and the firmament were filled with his sharpened arrows. The firmament looked brilliant as if covered with clouds smitten with the rays of the sun.

source: सौदासोऽहं महाभाग याज्यस्ते मुनिसत्तम। अस्मिन् काले यदिष्टं ते ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते॥
target: "O illustrious Sir, I am the son of Saudasa; O excellent Rishi, I am your disciple. Tell me what is your desire now and what I am to do."

source: प्रययौ समरे तूर्णं तव पुत्रस्य शासनात्। नर्दमानो महानादं प्रावृषीव बलाहकः॥
target: Complying with the commands of your son, speedily rushed to battle uttering deafening roars like those of clouds in the rainy season.

source: पाण्डवास्तु महात्मानो लघुभूयिष्ठसैनिकाः। पुनर्जग्मुर्महात्मानं सदारास्तं महीपतिम्॥
target: The great Pandavas accompanied by their wives, and with a small retinue, went to the hermitage of the great monarch.

source: सृज्यते ब्रह्ममूर्तिस्तु रक्षते पौरुषी तनुः। रौद्रीभावेन शमयेत् तिस्रोऽवस्थाः प्रजापतेः॥
target: There are three states of the supreme being; in the form of Brahma, he is the creator, in the form of Vishnu, he is the preserver and in the form of Rudra he is the destroyer.

source: तूष्णीमासीत् तदा देवः प्रजानामीश्वरेश्वरः। प्रसादं चागमत् क्षिप्रमात्मनैव प्रजापतिः॥
target: Then that Divinity, the Lord of the lords of creatures also remained silent for a while; and the grandsire soon became satisfied with his ownself.

source: शङ्खवर्णाश्च तानश्वान् बाणैर्निन्ये यमक्षयम्। सारथिं च तथाप्यस्य रथनीडादपातयत्॥
target: The former then felled the latter's charioteer from his niche on the car. Thereupon Vikartana's son was preyed upon by anxious thoughts.

source: अयं च पार्थो बीभत्सुर्वरिष्ठो ज्याविकर्षणे। आस्ते परमसंतप्तो नूनं सिंह इवाशये॥
target: This son of Pritha, Vivatsu (Arjuna) is foremost in drawing the bow-string. He is certainly much aggrieved, though he lives (quietly) like a lion in its den.

source: शालिप्रसूनसदृशैः शिरीषकुसुमप्रभैः। तरुणादित्यसदृशैः शणगौरैश्च वानरैः॥ प्राकारं ददृशुस्ते तु समन्तात् कपिलीकृतम्। राक्षसा विस्मिता राजन् सस्त्रीवृद्धाः समन्ततः॥
target: And the walls (of Lanka) covered all over with monkeys endued with complexions (yellow) as the ears of paddy, (grey) as shirisha flowers (crimson) as the morning sun and white as flax, assumed a tawny hue. And O king, the Rakshasas together with their wives and elders were wonder-struck (at this unusual sight).

source: श्रीभगवानुवाच जानाम्येतां महाराज धार्तराष्ट्रस्य पापताम्। अवाच्यास्तु भविष्यामः सर्वलोके महीक्षिताम्॥
target: The blessed God said I know the vicious nature, O great king, of that son of Dhritarashtra; but (by doing as I say) shall we not be spoken ill of in all these worlds in the universe.

source: सोऽहं वागग्रमृष्टानां रसानामवलेहकः। स्वजात्यानधितिष्ठामि नक्षत्राणीव चन्द्रमा:॥
target: I always lick the nectar that is at the end of their tongue, and it is for this reason that I occupy a position far above that of all others of my family like the Moon transcending all the stars.

source: तथा तु रक्षिणां तेषां ब्रुवतां स तपोधनः। न किंचिद् वचनं राजन्नब्रवीत् साध्वसाधु वा॥
target: O king, having been thus addressed by the guards, the ascetic did not say a word in reply, good or bad.

source: ततो जग्राह तेजस्वी सुग्रीवो वसुधातलात्। आयसं मुसलं घोरं सर्वतो हेमभूषितम्॥
target: Thereupon the effulgent Sugrīva picked up from the ground musala made of iron and ornamented with gold.

source: ते हेमकवचा भूत्वा कालेयाः परिघायुधाः। त्रिदशानभ्यवर्तन्त दावदग्धा इवाद्रयः॥
target: The Kaleyas, clad in golden armour and armed with iron mounted in aces rushed towards the celestials like moving mountains on fire.

source: भवान् नो गतिरव्यग्रा भवान् नः परमः सुहृत्। ते वयं सहिताः सर्वे भवन्तं शरणं गताः॥
target: You are our refuge, you are our best friend; all of us therefore place ourselves under your protection.

source: प्रीयमाणा नरा यत्र प्रयच्छेयुरयाचिताः। स्वस्थचित्तो वसेत् तत्र कृतकृत्य इवात्मवान्॥
target: With a contented heart and considering all his wishes as already gratified, a pious man should live in that country whose denizens gladly give away before even they are asked.

source: अरण्ये गृहवासे च शूराश्चातिथिपूजने। सर्वे यान्ति पराँल्लोकान् सर्वकर्मफलनिर्जितान्॥
target: There are heroes in the matter of hospitality to guests, whether living as hermits or as house-holders. All these heroes attain to very superior regions of happiness which are, of course, acquired by them as the rewards of their own deeds.

source: चकार मृगयां कामी गिरिकामेव संस्मरन्। अतीवरूपसंपन्नां साक्षाछियमिवापराम्॥
target: Went out to hunt (the deer), thinking of Girika who was exceedingly beautiful and was like Sree herself.

source: कण्व उवाच एवमुक्तस्तया शक्रः संदिदेश सदागतिम्। प्रातिष्ठत तदा काले मेनका वायुना सह॥
target: Kanva said: Having been thus addressed, Indra commanded the wind to be present with Menaka when she would be present before the Rishi.

source: ततस्ते हरयः सर्वे प्राकारपरिखान्तरात्। निष्क्रम्योदग्रसत्त्वास्तु तस्थुराविष्कृतं तदा॥
target: And getting over the ditch around the city walls, those terrible-looking monkeys stationed themselves openly.

source: ते तानि वेश्मानि महाधनानि दुःखेन दुःखोपहता विशन्तः। नैव प्रजग्मुः स्वजनं परं वा निरीक्ष्यमाणाः प्रविनष्टहर्षाः॥
target: And entering their wealthy mansions, they deprived of their senses by grief, could not recognize them for their own, nor could they with their hearts rendered absolutely cheerless, although looking at them minutely, distinguish their own from others.

source: न सा स्त्री ह्यभिमन्तव्या यस्यां भर्ता न तुष्यति। तुष्टे भर्तरि नारीणां तुष्टाः स्युः सर्वदेवताः॥ अग्निसाक्षिकमित्येव भर्ता वै दैवतं परम्।
target: She is no wife with whom her husband is not pleased. If their husbands are pleased with women all the gods also become pleased with them. Since the marriage union takes place in the presence of fire, the husband is the wife's greatest god.

source: गुरुः। मां प्रविश्य भवन्तीह मुक्ता भक्तास्तु ये मम्। अहं कि पुरुषो ज्ञेयो निष्क्रियः पञ्चविंशकः॥
target: They who are devoted to me enter into me and become liberated. I am known as Purusha. Without acts, I am the Twenty-fifth.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तस्तु कर्णेन राजा दुर्योधनस्तदा। नैवोत्यातुं मनश्चक्रे स्वर्गाय कृतनिश्चयः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed by Karna, king Duryodhana, being firmly resolved to die, determined not to rise from the place where he sat.

source: आत्तशस्त्रा रथगताः कुपितास्तात पाण्डवाः। निःशेषं वः करिष्यन्ति क्रुद्धा ह्याशीविषा इव॥
target: O father, equipped with weapons and seated on cars, the Pandavas will annihilate us like angry and poisonous snakes.

source: इयं च नलिनी रम्या जाता पर्वतानिर्झरे। नेयं भवनमासाद्य कुबेरस्य महात्मनः॥
target: The lotus-lake has sprung up on the mountain breast. It has not been made in the abode of the illustrious Kubera.

source: दत्तं भुक्तमधीतं च प्राप्तमैश्चर्यमीप्सितम्॥ कृतकृत्योऽनृणश्चासि मा भैयुध्यस्व पाण्डवम्।
target: You have been charitable and enjoyed edibles to your heart's content. You have acquired wealth to your heart's content, you have accomplished all that one should do. You are debtless. Be not afraid. Encounter the son of Pandu battle.

source: मधुरानूषरे देशे शुचो पुण्ये महामतिः। निवेशं कारयामास कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः॥
target: Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, of great intelligence, ordered his army to be encamped, in a part of the field which was delightful and grassy and which was open.

source: सुपर्णनागयक्षाणां दैत्यदानवरक्षसाम्। अवध्योऽहं प्रजाध्यक्ष देवतानां च शाश्वत ॥ नहि चिन्ता ममान्येषु प्राणिष्वमरपूजित। तृणभूता हि ते मन्ये प्राणिनो मानुषादयः॥
target: O lord of creatures, I would, O external one, he incapable of being slain by birds and serpents, Yaksas, Daityas, Danavas and Raksasas, and the deities; for, O you that are worshipped by the immortals, anxiety I have none from any other beings. Indeed, I deem as straw creatures such as men etc.

source: अर्जुन उवाच किमागमनकृत्यं ते कौरव्यकुलनन्दिनि। मणिपूरपतेर्मातस्तथैव च रणाजिरे।।।।
target: What brings you here, O daughter (in-law) of Kuru's race, and what, also, is the cause of the arrival on the field of battle of her who is the mother of the king of Manipura?

source: सुवर्णवर्णाश्च नराः स्त्रियश्चाप्सरसोपमाः। अनामया वीतशोका नित्यं मुदितमानसाः॥
target: The men are of golden complexion. Women are all like Apsaras. All the persons are without sickness, and grief, and are always cheerful.

source: कथा च येयं नृपते प्रसक्ता देवे महावीर्यमतौ शुभेयम्। योगी स सर्वानभिभूय मान् नारायणात्मा कुरुते महात्मा॥
target: This topic, "O king, about the Supreme Being of mighty energy should be considered as auspicious.” The Yogin has Narayana for his soul. Lording over all things, the great Yogin is capable of creating all things.

source: स तु तेनैव मार्गेण समुद्रं प्रविवेश ह। अपश्यच्च महात्मानं कपिलं तुरगं च तम्॥
target: By that passage he entered the ocean and saw the high-souled Kapila and also the horse.

source: अनार्य इति मामार्याः पुत्रविक्रायकं ध्रुवम्। विकरिष्यन्ति रथ्यासु सुरापं ब्राह्मणं यथा॥
target: Surely gentle folks will on the high-way censure me as one lost to gentility, as one who has sold his son (for buying his wife's good graces), even like a Brāhmana given to drinking.

source: आरम्भस्तु मदर्थोऽयं ततस्तव निरर्थकः। त्वया हि सह रामस्य महानागमने गुणः॥
target: All your preparations for me, shall thus be useless. And mighty shall be the result of Rāma's coming with you.

source: अनादिनिधनोऽव्यक्तो महात्मा मधुसूदनः। अयं जातो महातेजाः सुराणामर्थसिद्धये।॥
target: He is without beginning and without destruction. He is unmanifest. He is the great Destroyer of Madhu. Gifted with mighty energy, He has taken birth (among men) for doing the purposes of the gods.

source: तं देवमब्रवीद् भीता बन्धूनां राजसत्तम। व्रीडाविह्वलया वाचा शापत्रस्ता विशाम्पते॥
target: Oforemost of kings, O lord of the world, afraid of the censure of her friends and afflicted with the fear of curse, she spoke to that deity these words tremulous with bashfulness.

source: इति सर्वमशेषतो मया कथितं संभवकारणं तु सौम्य नृपपुङ्गव शाफ्जं द्विजस्य द्विजशापाच्च यदद्भुतं नृपस्य।
target: O gentle one, I have thus related to you the wondrous births, in consequence of the curse, of the great ascetic Vasistha and the royal saint Nimi.

source: त्रस्तरूपं तु विज्ञाय जगत् सर्वं महानृषिः। नृपतिं सुव्रतो धीरो वसिष्ठो वाक्यमब्रवीत्॥
target: And knowing that the entire universe was in trepidation, that mighty saint, the sedate Vasiştha of excellent vows, said these words to the king.

source: ज्ञायमाना रणे वीर्यं घोरं गाण्डीवधन्वनः। हाहाकारकृतोत्साहा भीष्मं जग्मुः समन्ततः॥
target: Though perfectly cognisant of the dreadful prowess of the Pandava heroes with loud cries of 'Oh!' and 'Alas!' advanced towards Bhishma from all sides.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच तथा ब्रुवन्ती करुणं सुमध्यमा भर्तृन् कटाक्षैः कुपितानपश्यत्। सा पाण्डवान् कोपपरीतदेहान् संदीपयामास कटाक्षपातैः॥
target: Vaishampayana said The slender-waisted (Draupadi) thus cried in distress in that Sabha and cast a glance on her enraged husbands, the Pandavas, who were filled with fearful wrath. She inflamed them more by her that glance.

source: नारद उवाच कुत: सृष्टमिदं विश्वं ब्रह्मन् स्थावरजङ्गमम्। प्रलये च कमभ्येति तद् भवान् प्रब्रवीतु मे॥
target: Narada said Whence, O Brahmana, has this universe, consisting of mobile and iminobile objects, been created? When, again, the all-embracing destruction sets in, into whom does it merge! Let your learned self describe this to me.

source: पुण्यं हिमवतः पादं मणिमन्तं च पर्वतम्। ज्योतिर्भिश्च समाकीर्णं सिद्धचारणसेवितम्॥ वायुवेगगतिः पार्थः खं भेजे सहकेशवः। केशवेन गृहीत: स दक्षिणे विभुना भुजे॥
target: Then it seemed that Parth held by his right arın by the lord Keshava and endued with the fleetness of the wind, reached the root of the sacred Himavat mountain teeming with gems, abounding in luminous objects and inhabited by Siddhas and Charanas. He was then accompanied by Keshava.

source: भ्यां विद्ध्वा कार्मुकं च ध्वजं चा पुनः पार्थं शरवप्रेण विद्ध्वा द्रौणिोरं सिंहनादं ननाद॥
target: Piercing Bhima's charioteer with six and cutting off his bow and standard with two other arrows and once more piercing Partha with a shower of arrows, the son of Drona uttered a dreadful war-cry.

source: न मे व्यलीकं कर्तव्यं त्वया वा तव चानुगैः। एवं वत्स्यामि ते गेहे यदि ते रोचतेऽनघ॥
target: I can, if you like it, dwell at your house under the condition that neither you nor your attendants will cross me in any way.

source: अविज्ञातगतिश्चैव द्वौ पुत्रावनिलस्य तु। प्रत्यूषस्य विदुः पुत्रमृषि नाम्नाथ देवलम्॥
target: And Avijnatagati. These two were the sons of Anila. Know, Pratyush's son was the Rishi, named Devala.

source: यात्रामारभसे दिष्ट्या प्राप्तकालमरिंदम। पार्णिमूलं च विज्ञाय व्यवसायं पराजयम्। बलस्य च महाराज दत्त्वा वेतनमग्रतः॥ कच्चिच्च बलमुख्येभ्यः परराष्ट्र परंतप। उपच्छन्नानि रत्नानि प्रयच्छसि यथार्हतः॥
target: O chastiser of foes, when the (proper) time comes, taking into your consideration all the omens you might see and having been convinced that the resolutions you have formed and their unsuccesses depend on the twelve Mandalas and having paid your troops their pays do you begin your march? O great king, O chastiser of foes, do you have gems and jewels to the chief officers of the enemy as they (each of them) deserve without the knowledge of the enemy?

source: यः पुरा गोमतीतीरे रम्यं पर्येति पर्वतम्॥ नाम्ना संरोचनो नाम नानानगयुतो गिरिः। तत्र राज्यं प्रशास्त्येष कुमुदो नाम यूथपः॥
target: From days of yore on the banks of the Gomatī there is a mountain, (named) Ramya, (otherwise) called Sanrocana. The mount abounds with various trees. There that leader of bands, named Kumuda, governs his kingdom.

source: अक्षय्याविषुधी दिव्यौ पाण्डवस्य महात्मनः। तेन पार्थो रणे शूरस्तस्थौ गिरिरिवाचलः॥
target: And because the high-souled son of Pandu, Partha, has a pair of inexhaustible celestials quivers, he remained in battle unmoved like a mountain.

source: केन वा कस्य वा हेतोः सयुगः सपरिच्छदः। खुरनेमिक्षतश्चायं सिक्तो रुधिरबिन्दुभिः॥ देशो निवृत्तसंग्रामः सुघोरः पार्थिवात्मज। एकस्य तु विमर्दोऽयं न द्वयोर्वदतां वर॥ नहि वृत्तं हि पश्यामि बलस्य महतः पदम्। नैकस्य तु कृते लोकान् विनाशयितुमर्हसि॥
target: But I do not know whose is this car with yokes and dresses and what for it has been shattered? Behold, O you the son of a King this terrible spot bathed in blood and raked with hoofs and wheels. Surely here took place a conflict. O you the foremost of those skilled in speech, it appear from these signs that this skirmish did take place with one, not with two. Here are not to be seen the foot-marks of a large army. It therefore dose not behove you to destroy the whole world for one's individual offence.

source: एतेन च प्रकारेण कृत्यानामागतिं गतिम्। युक्तः समनुतिष्ठेत तुष्टश्चारैरुपस्कृतः॥
target: In this way, having determined the course of actions and their final ends, the king should accomplish them carefully; and instructed in all matters by his spies, he may live happily.

source: स ववे तुरगं तत्र प्रथमं यज्ञकारणात्। द्वितीयं वरकं ववे पितृणां पावनेच्छया।॥
target: He first asked the horse for the sacrifice and then he asked for the revivification of his fathers (uncles).

source: मामेवाभिमुखं तूर्णे गजाश्वरथपन्तिमत्। नादयन् वै दिशः सर्वा रथघोषेण सारथे॥
target: And abounding in elephants, horses, chariots and infantry, is rushing at me with vehemence, O charioteer, filling all the quarters with the clatter of its cars.

source: ततः समुपविष्टेषु महर्षिषु महात्मसु। भविष्यदुत्तरं काव्यं जगतुस्तौ कुशीलवौ॥
target: There upon the high-souled Rșis having taken their seats Kusa and Lava began the last portion of the Uttarakāņdam.

source: इहैव तावत्कृतनिश्चयो ह्यहं व्रजेयमद्य प्लवगेश्वरालयम्। परात्मसम्मर्दविशेषतत्त्ववित् ततः कृतं स्यान्मम भर्तृशासनम् ॥
target: Although my sole commission was to effect this much, (i.e. see Sita) yet if I repair to the abode of the lord of monkeys after having ascertained the strength of our ownselves and that of the foe in the field, then I shall have done the mandate of my master.

source: रामचापविसृष्टेन शरेणान्तकरेण तम्। दृष्ट्वा विनिहतं भूमौ तारा ताराधिपानना॥ सा समासाद्य भर्तारं पर्यष्वजत भामिनी। इषुणाभिहतं दृष्ट्वा वालिनं कुञ्जरोपमम्॥ वानरं पर्वतेन्द्राभं शोकसंतप्तमानसा। तारा तरुमिवोन्मूलं पर्यदेवयतातुरा॥
target: Beholding her husband lying dead on the ground with the life-destroying shafts of Rama, Tārā, having a moon-like countenance, approaching, embraced him. And seeing him slain with shafts like to an elephant, resembling a lord mountains and an uprooted tree, Tārā, racked with grief began to bewail.

source: ते वध्यमानास्त्रिदशैर्दानवा भीमनि:स्वनाः। चक्रुः सुतुमुलं युद्धं मुहूर्तमिव भारत॥
target: O descendant of the Bharata, those loudly roaring Danavas, being thus attacked by the celestials, fought a great battle for a moment.

source: गाश्च शुक्षूषते यश्च समन्वेति च सर्वशः। तस्मै तुष्टाः प्रयच्छन्ति वरानपि सुदुर्लभान्॥
target: He who serves kine with respect and who follows them with humility, succeeds in getting many invaluable boons from kine who become pleased with him.

source: स च पत्रलघुर्भूत्वा हरिभिर्दर्शितेऽभये। अन्तरिक्षे स्थितो भूत्वा पुनर्वचनमब्रवीत्॥
target: And again stationing himself on the welkin, that night-ranger said.

source: यन्त्रं वैहायसं चापि कारयामास कृत्रिमम्। तेन यन्त्रेण समितं राजा लक्ष्यं चकार सः॥
target: Causing a machinery to be erected in the sky, the king set up a mark to be shot through that machinery.

source: चिन्तयानस्य तस्यैवं बुद्धिरासीन्महात्मनः। सुतार्थं वाजिमेधेन किमर्थं न यजाम्यहम्॥
target: Mentally turning the matter over, the highsouled one thought, Why do I not celebrate a horse-sacrifice with the intention of obtaining a son?

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच एवमुक्तः स कृष्णेन राजा राजीवलोचनः हितार्थं सर्वलोकस्य समुत्तस्थौ महात्मनाः॥
target: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Krishna, the great king (Yudhishthira) having eyes like lotus petals, rose from his seat for the well-being of the entire world.

source: यथाधनंजयः पार्थस्तपस्वी नियतव्रतः। मुनिरेकचरः श्रीमान्धर्मो विग्रहवानिव॥
target: He heard that Dhananjaya Partha (Arjuna) engaged in asceticism, observing vows of silence and deep in meditation, appeared like the blazing deity, Dharma.

source: धर्मराजोऽब्रवीद्राम प्राग्वंशे वायसं प्रति। पक्षिस्तवास्मि सुप्रीतः प्रीतस्य वचनं शृणु॥
target: O Rāma, then the king of righteousness said to the crow, seated in front of the sacrificial apartment 'O bird, I am well pleased with you. Listen to my words as I utter them.

source: तं तु कालमनुप्राप्तं विदित्वा पृथिवी तदा। अयाचत वरं यन्मां नरकार्थाय तच्छृणु॥
target: On one such occasion, the Earth knowing that the boon-giving hour has come, solicited a boon for her son Naraka; hear, I shall tell it to you.

source: ते निकृत्तभुजस्कन्धाः कवन्धाकृतिदर्शनाः। नदन्तो भैरवान् नादान् निपतन्ति स्म दानवाः॥
target: Having lost their arms and necks and having appeared like Kabandhas (a sort of headless ghosts), the Danavas fell (down into the sea) with fearful cries.

source: गजदन्तमयीं दिव्यां शिबिकान्तरिक्षगाम्॥ युक्तां वाजिसहस्रेण स्वयमास्थाय राघवः। शुक्लमाल्याम्बरधरो लक्ष्मणेन समागतः॥
target: I saw Rāma, wearing garlands and clothed in white, ride in a celestial chariot, along with Lakşmaņa, made of ivory, traversing the etherial regions and drawn by a hundred steeds.

source: यवक्रीतं स हत्वा तु राक्षसो रैम्यमागमत्। अनुज्ञातंस्तु रैभ्येण तया नार्या सहावसत्॥
target: Having killed Yavakrit, that Rakshasha came back to Raivya; and being ordered by Raivya, he lived (there) with his wife (that female).

source: दिवं तु तस्यां यातायां शबाँ स्वेन तेजसा। लक्ष्मणेन सह भ्रात्रा चिन्तयामास राघवः॥ चिन्तयित्वा तु धर्मात्मा प्रभावं तं महात्मनाम्। हितकारिणमेकाग्रं लक्ष्मणं राघवोऽब्रवीत्॥
target: After Savarī had repaired to heaven by virtue of her divine prowess, Rāma with his brother Lakşmaņa began to ponder over the pious influence of those great ascetics. Thinking within himself about the divine authority of those great ones, the virtuous-souled Rāma spoke to Lakşmaņa, devoted and ever engaged in his well-being.

source: को न्वनेनाप्रतीतेन सोत्कण्ठितजनेन च। सम्प्रीयेतामनोज्ञेन वासेन हृतचेतसा॥
target: Who will take pleasure in residing in a dwelling where the heart dies within itself, which is devoid of delight, where the people are always agitated with anxiety and which is exceedingly disagreeable?

source: प्रत्युद्ययुर्महाभागाः साध्याश्च वसुभिः सह। तैर्विसृष्टान्यनीकेषु क्रुद्धः शस्त्राणि संयुगे॥ शराश्च दैत्यकायेषु पिबन्ति रुधिरं बहु। तेषां देहान् विनिर्भिद्य शरास्ते निशितास्तदा॥ निपतन्तोऽभ्यदृश्यन्त नगेभ्य इव पन्नगाः। तानि दैत्यशरीराणि निर्भिन्नानि स्म सायकैः॥ अपतन् भूतले राजंश्छिन्नाभ्राणीव सर्वशः। ततस्तद् दानवं सैन्यं सर्वैर्देवगणैर्युधि॥
target: Along with the greatly exalted Sadhyas and the Vasus returned to the attack, the arrows which they angrily discharged against the enemy drank a large quantity of blood from the bodies of the Daityas and of their horses and elephants. Their sharp arrows passing through their bodies fell upon the ground looking like so inany snakes falling from the sides of a hill. O_king, the Daityas, thus pierced by the arrows, fell on all sides, looking like so many masses of clouds. Attacked by the celestials on the field of battle, the Danava forces.

source: सुमन्तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा हृष्टो दशरथोऽभवत्। अनुमान्य वसिष्ठं च सूतवाक्यं निशाम्य च॥ सान्तःपुरः सहामात्यः प्रययौ यत्र स द्विजः।
target: Hearing Sumantra's words, Dasaratha was exceedingly delighted. And hearing these words, and permitted by Vasistha, he, accompanied with the ladies, and his courtiers, set out for the place where that twice-born one was.

source: तं स्वर्गमेघ गतः शूरो यो हतो न पराङ्मुखः। संस्तम्भयत मा भैष्ट विजेष्यामो रणे रिपून्।॥
target: This heroic son of Subhadra who without turning back from the battle has been slain by the enemy, has ascended to heaven. Stay you all and do not fear. We shall yet conquer the foe.

source: लोकाननुचरन् सर्वान् देवर्षिर्नारदः पुरा। ददर्शाप्सरसं ब्राह्मीं पञ्चचूडामनिन्दिताम्॥
target: Once in ancient times, the celestial Rishi Narada, having roamed over all the world, met the Apsara Panchachuda of faultless, beauty, having her residence in the region of Brahman.

source: ततः स मामश्वो भूत्वा तत्रावहद् यत्र बभूवोलूकः। अथैनं स राजा पप्रच्छ प्रतिजानाति मां भवानिति॥
target: He became a horse and carried me to the place where that owl lived. Then he asked it, “Do you know me?”

source: स युक्तमास्थाय रथं हि काले धनुर्विधुन्वशरपूर्णमुष्टिः। सृजत्यसौ शरवर्षाणि वीरो महाहवे मेघ इवाम्बुधाराः॥
target: In the battle that valiant Brikodara being seated on a superbly-decked chariot has been holding in readiness handful of arrows and opportunely hurling them down in showers, like the clouds pouring torrents of rain.

source: एतच्छ्रुत्वा मया तस्य मैनाकस्य महात्मनः॥ कार्यमावेद्य च गिरेरुद्धतं वै मनो मम । तेन चाहमनुज्ञातो मैनाकेन महात्मना ॥ स चाप्यन्तर्हितः शैलो मानुषेण वपुष्मता। शरीरेण महाशैलः शैलेन च महोदधौ॥
target: Having heard this from the magnanimous Maināka, I apprised the mountain of my mission, and my thought held their course. Having given me his permission, the magnanimous Maināka, the mountain that had put on the forın of a man, vanished, and, assuming his mountain-form, went into the vast sea.

source: ब्रह्मोवाच वैजयन्तो गिरिवरः सततं सेव्यते मया। अत्रैकाग्रेण मनसा पुरुषश्चिन्त्यते विराट्॥
target: This foremost of mountains, called Vaijayanta, is always my abode. Here, with concentrated mind, I meditate on the one universal Soul of infinite proportions.

source: शिलाः शैलस्य शोभन्ते विशालाः शतशोऽभितः। बहुला बहुलैर्वर्णैनीलपीतसितारुणैः॥
target: The giant crags of the mountain grace the place all round by hundreds; many and varioushued, blue and yellow and pale and red.

source: न हि तेन मृगो विद्धो जीवन्गच्छति वै वने। पूर्वरूपं तु तत्तूर्णं सोऽगात्स्वर्गगति प्रति॥
target: Never had a deer, pierced by Parikshit, escaped in the forest with life. This deer, however, wounded as the others, fled away with speed. It shows the proximity of the king's going to heaven (death).

source: शरैः शरांस्ततो द्रौणि: संवार्य युधि पाण्डवम्। ललाटेऽभ्यानद् राजन् नाराचेन स्मयन्निव॥
target: Then, O monarch, the son of Drona, having checked the course of his (antagonist's) shafts by his own arrows in the field of battle, smilingly struck the son of Pandu in the forehead with a dart.

source: ऋषय ऊचुः अधर्मे सम्प्रवृत्तस्त्वं धर्मं न प्रतिपद्यसे। प्रमाणमेतदस्माकं पूर्वं प्रोक्तं महर्षिभिः॥
target: The Rishis said You are going along the path of vice; you do not act virtuously. “That they are authentic" has before been said by our great Rishis.

source: सा त्वं वसेह कल्याणि राज्ञः समनुवर्तिनी। भरतस्य रता धर्मे सत्यव्रतपरायणा॥
target: It therefore behoves you, Oh auspicious one, to live here, abiding by Bharata's commands and being engaged in religious rites and truthful vows.

source: विराटनगरे भग्नाः किं तत्र तव दृश्यताम्। प्रतीक्षमाणो यो वीरः क्षमते वीक्षितं तव॥
target: They were routed at the city of Virata-sce what occurred there. That hero looking at your face and waiting to see your movements will forgive you still.

source: कथं नु तस्य संग्रामे पृथिवी चक्रमग्रसत्॥ कथं नु शप्तो भ्राता मे तत्त्वं वक्तुमिहार्हसि।
target: Why, indeed, did the Earth swallow up the wheels of his car at the time of battle? Why was my brother cursed? You should relate all this to me.

source: नीलोत्पलसवर्णाभं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्र कृशोदरम्। प्रांशुं सुदुर्धर्षतरं तथैव ह्यमितौजसम्॥
target: His complexion was dark like that of the petals of the blue lotus. His teeth were keen. His stomach was lean. His stature was tall. He appeared highly irresistible and energetic.

source: तेषां संघर्षजश्चाग्निरर्चिभि: प्रज्वलन्मुहुः। विद्युद्भिरिव नीलाभ्रमावृणोन्मन्दरं गिरिम्॥
target: And great fires were produced from the mutual friction of the trees that frequently blazed up and the Mandara mountain looked like black clouds charged with lightning,

source: आलिखन्तीमिवाकाशमुत्थितां पश्य लक्ष्मण। मनसेव कृतां लङ्कां नगाग्रे विश्वकर्मणा॥
target: Behold, O Laksmana, Lanka towering up as if piercing the heavens; and, built by Viśvakarmā on the brow of the mountain, she seems to have been made by the Mind.

source: स्त्रियो राजकुले याश्च याश्चेमा मम वेश्मनि। प्रसक्तास्त्वां निरीक्षन्ते पुमांसं कं न मोहयेः॥
target: Charmed by your beauty even the females of the royal house hold and as well as those in my own seraglio are gazing at you. What male person is there whom you will not captivate?

source: क्व ते मानश्च दर्पश्च व ते वीर्ये क्व गर्जितम्। आशीविषसमान् पार्थान् कोपयित्वा व यास्यसि॥
target: Where your pride, your haughtiness and brag? Having provoked the Parthas who are like so may snakes of virulent poison, where do you intend to fly?

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच ततः कृष्णस्य तद् वाक्यं धर्मार्थसहितं हितम्। श्रुत्वा शान्तनवो भीष्मः प्रत्युवाच कृताञ्जलिः॥
target: Vaishampayana said, Hearing these words of Krishna pregnant with morality and worldly profit, Shantanu's son Bhishma answered him thus. Bhishma said

source: नास्ति विद्यासमं चक्षुर्नास्ति सत्यसमं तपः। नास्ति रागसमं दुःखं नास्ति त्यागसमं सुखम्॥
target: There is no eye which is equal to that of knowledge. There is no penance like Truth. There is no sorrow like Attachment. There is no happiness like Renunciation.

source: मरुत्त उवाच बृहस्पतिं गतः पूर्वमहं संवर्त तच्छृणु। न मां कामयते याज्यमसौ वासवकाम्यया॥
target: Marutta said Do you listen to me, O Samvarta, I did go to Brihaspati first, but wishing the patronage of Vasava, he did not wish to have me as his sacrificer.

source: तथा भागीरथी गङ्गा उर्वशी चाभवत् पुरा। दुहितृत्वं गता राज्ञः पुत्रत्वमगमत् तदा॥
target: And because in the days of yore Ganga sat on his lap, she, like Urvashi, came to be regarded as his daughter and was named after him. Then having become the kings daughter, she became his son (i.e. she procured, like a son, the salvation of his ancestors).

source: इमे द्वे धनुषी श्रेष्ठे दिव्ये लोकाभिपूजिते। दृढे बलवती मुख्ये सुकृते विश्वकर्मणा॥
target: These two foremost of bows, extraordinary, and worshipped of all the worlds, and stout, and powerful, surpassingly excellent, constructed with care by Viśvakarman.

source: स शुश्राव महाबाहुः कपिलेन महात्मना। पितृणां निधनं घोरमप्राप्तिं त्रिदिवस्य च॥ स राज्यं सचिवे न्यस्य हृदयेन विदूयता। जगाम हिमवत्पाद्यं तपस्तप्तुं नरेश्वरः॥
target: That might-armed hero heard from the highsouled Kapila how his anccstors had met with their fearful destruction and how they had not been able to go to heaven. That king sorrowfully made over his kingly duties to his ministers and that ruler of men then went to the side of the Himalayas for practising asceticism.

source: तस्मात् त्वं वै महाबाहो मम पार्थस्य चोभयोः॥ व्यतिक्रममिमं राजन् सत्यसंरक्षणं प्रति।
target: Therefore, O long armed king! forgive us of the unmannerly behaviour of us both, Arjuna and myself.

source: अभिप्रेतमसंसक्तमात्मजं दातुमर्हसि॥ दशरात्रं हि यज्ञस्य रामं राजीवलोचनम्। नात्येति कालो यज्ञस्य यथायं मम राघव॥ तथा कुरुष्व भद्रं ते मा च शोके मनः कृथाः।
target: Even this is my wish, and he also has come of age. Do you, therefore, part with your son, the lotus-eyed Rāma, for the ten days of the sacrifice! Do you act so, O descendant of Raghu, that the time appointed for the ceremony may not be overpassed. Good betide you! Let not your mind indulge in grief!

source: द्वैपायनो नारदश्च देवलश्च महानृषिः। देवस्थानश्च कण्वश्च तेषां शिष्याश्च सत्तमाः॥
target: Among them were the Dvaipayana Vyasa, Narada, the great Rishi Devala, Devasthana, and Kanva. They had in their company the best of their pupils.

source: एवमेते दितेः पुत्रा मारुताः परमाद्भुताः। अनारतं ते संवान्ति सर्वगाः सर्वधारिणः॥
target: Wonderful are these winds all of whom are the sons of Diti. Capable of going everywhere and upholding all things, they blow all around you without being attached to you at any time.

source: ततो दृष्ट्वा प्रधावन्तं गदाहस्तं महाबलम्। सर्वेषामेव सैन्यानां संहर्षः समजायत।॥
target: Beholding then the highly powerful Bhima running mace in hand, all the car-warriors were transported with joy.

source: दमस्त्यागो धृतिः सत्यं भवत्यवभृथायते। एष ते विततो यज्ञः श्रद्धापूतः सदक्षिणः॥
target: This is the sacrifice that is spread out for you-a sacrifice which is sanctified by devotion and faith, and who has a large sacrificial gift attached to it. This sacrifice which is formed by gift is superior to all other sacrifices. O son, let this sacrifice be always celebrated by you.

source: अकर्मवान् विकासश्च पश्येज्जगदशाश्वतम्। अश्वत्थसदृशं नित्यं जन्ममृत्युजरायुतम्॥ वैराग्यबुद्धिः सततमात्मदोषव्यपेक्षकः। आत्मबन्धविनिर्मोक्षं स करोत्यचिरादिव॥
target: He who abstains from all deeds, who is free from desire or cupidity, who considers the universe as un-enduring or as like an Ashvatha tree, ever gifted with birth, death, and ! decrepitude, whose understanding is fixed on renunciation, and whose eyes are always directed towards his own faults, soon succeeds in freeing himself from the fetters that bind him.

source: पावितस्तेन यज्ञेन यास्यसे त्रिदिवं ततः। पुत्रश्च तव देवेन्द्र न विनष्टो महारणे॥ नीतः संनिहितश्चैव आर्यकेण महोदधौ।
target: You shall be purified by that sacrifice and go to heaven; and your son, O lord of celestials, has not been destroyed in the conflict. He has been taken into the ocean by his grand father.

source: भीष्म उवाच सैवमुक्त्वा शकुनिका ब्रह्मदत्तं नराधिप। राजानं समनुज्ञाप्य जगामाभीप्सितां दिशम्॥
target: O monarch, having said so to Brahmadatta, the bird, took the king's leave and went away of her pleasure.

source: ततस्ता वर्धमानस्य कुमारस्य महात्मनः। तेजसाभिपरीताङ्ग्यो न क्वचिच्छम लेभिरे॥
target: As the great Kumara, however, began to grow within their wombs their bodies being possessed by his energy, they could not get peace anywhere.

source: तस्याः शक्रस्य पूजार्थं भूमौ भूमिपतिस्तदा। प्रवेशं कारयामास गते संवत्सरे सदा॥
target: After the expiration of a year, the king planted it on the ground for the purpose of worshipping the giver, (Indra.)

source: गच्छ गच्छेति तां शाल्वः पुनः पुनरभाषत। बिभेमि भीष्मात् सुश्रोणि त्वं च भीष्मपरिग्रहः॥
target: Shalva said to her again and again “go, go, I fear Bhishma, O you of beautiful hips, for you are Bhishma's capture."

source: पुनः प्रविश्य नगरं दंशितः स नृपोत्तमः। आरुह्य नागप्रवरं निर्ययौ रणकर्कशः॥
target: Once more entering his capital, that foremost of kings, irresistible in battle, cased himself in mail, and mounting on his prince of elephants, came out.

source: समयेन प्रदद्यां ते कन्यामहमिमां नृप। न हि मे त्वत्समः कश्चिद् वरो जातु भविष्यति।॥
target: O king, if you give me the pledge, I shall then bestow my daughter on you, for I can never obtain a husband for her like you."

source: शल्य उवाच अथ संचिन्तयानस्य देवराजस्य धीमतः। नहुषस्य वधोपायं लोकपालैः सदैवतैः॥ तपस्वी तत्र भगवानगस्त्यः प्रत्यदृश्यत। सोऽब्रवीदर्घ्य देवेन्द्रं दिष्ट्या वै वर्धते भवान्॥ विश्वरूपविनाशेन वृत्रासुरवधेन च। दिष्ट्याद्य नहुषो भ्रष्टो देवराज्यात् पुरंदर। दिष्ट्या हतारिं पश्यामि भवन्तं बलसूदन॥
target: Shalya said While the wise king of the gods was fixing on means of killing Nahusha, along with the ruler of the worlds and the gods, the ascetic, who had the six attributes of a godly being, Agastya, appeared there and having delay greeted the king of the gods, said-It is fortunate that you are gaining in strength, having already killed the great Aşura who had assumed a universal form; it is fortunate, O Purandara the Nahusha is this day ousted from the kingdom of heaven; it is fortunate, O slayer of Bala, that I see you with all your enemies, killed.

source: वैदेह कं शूद्रमुदाहरन्ति द्विजा महाराज श्रुतोपपन्नाः। अहं हि पश्यामि नरेन्द्र देवं विश्वस्य विष्णु जगतः प्रधानम्॥
target: O king of the Videhas, Brahmanas learned in the Vedas, O king, regard a (virtutous) Shudra as equal to Brahman himself. I, however, O king, regard such a Shudra as the effulgent Vishnu of the universe, the foremost one in all the worlds.

source: सा त्वं मया समागच्छ लप्स्यसे मादृशं सुतम्। विशिष्टा सर्वलोकेषु भविष्यसि न संशयः॥
target: Therefore, surrender yourself to me. You will then have a son like myself and will undoubtedly be extolled in all the worlds.

source: पिब विहर रमस्व भुक्ष्व भोगान् धननिचयं प्रदिशाभि मेदिनीं च। मयि लल ललने यथासुखं त्वं त्वयि च समेत्य ललन्तु बान्धवास्ते॥
target: Do you therefore at your pleasure drink, enjoy and eat. I shall confer on you wealth and the whole earth. Do you satisfy all your desires in me, O fair damsel, and let your friends be satisfied in you.

source: काष्ठानि चाभिहार्याणि तथा कूपांश्च खानयेत्। संशोधयेत् तथा कूपान् कृतपूर्वान् पयोऽर्थिभिः॥
target: He should lay by wood for fuel and dig and repair wells for supply of water to the garrison.

source: तस्मात् तस्योपघातेन प्रजाः परमपीडिताः। औदकानीव सत्त्वानि ग्रीष्मे सलिलसंक्षयात्॥
target: Therefore the subjects will be afflicted in consequence of his separation, even as aquatic animals are, when summer dries up the waters of a tank.

source: प्रियाणि लभते नित्यं प्रियदः प्रियकृत् तथा। प्रियो भवति भूतानामिह चैव परत्र च॥
target: The man who makes gifts of agreeable things and who does to others what is agreeable to others, always succeeds in getting things that are agreeable to himself. Such a person certainly becomes agreeable to all, both here and hereafter.

source: पुरा दानवमुख्यानां विश्वकर्मा बभूव ह॥ येनेदं काञ्चनं दिव्यं निर्मितं भवनोत्तमम्।
target: He that as reared this excellent golden grove, and this charming mansion, was formerly the Viśvakarmā* of the principal Dänavas. *The name of the celestial architect.

source: उमोवाच भगवन् सर्वभूतेश भूतभव्यभवोत्तम। त्वत्प्रभावादियं देव वाक् चैव प्रतिभाति मे॥
target: Uma said O holy one, O lord of all created things o source of all that is past, present, and future, it is through your favour that the words I am uttering are originating in my inind.

source: हत्वा तु संयुगे तस्य रथं बाणशतैश्चितम्। गदां तस्य वधार्थाय वसुर्जग्राह पाणिना॥ ततः प्रगृह्य दीप्तायां कालदण्डोपमां गदाम्। । मूर्धि पातयामास सावित्रो वै सुमालिनः॥
target: Having destroyed his car in the warfare with hundreds of arrows Vasu took up mace in his hands for his destruction. Having taken up that mace having a burning head and resembling the rod of Death Sāvitra struck Sumálin on his head there with.

source: यदा तु विषमीभावमाविशन्ति परस्परम्। तदा देहैर्देहवन्तो व्यतिरोहन्ति नान्यथा॥
target: When these (elements), not existing in the natural state, exist with one another, then all creatures without any deviation spring into life with various sorts of bodies.

source: यथा गणाः प्रवर्धन्ते न भिद्यन्ते च भारत। अरींश्च विजिगीषन्ते सुहृदः प्राप्नुवन्ति च।॥
target: I wish to hear how they may advance, how they may be attached to the person of the king, and how, O Bharata, they may subduing foes gain friends.

source: वचनात् कुरुसिंहानां मत्स्यपाञ्चालयोश्च ते। समाजग्मुर्महीपालाः सम्प्रहृष्टा महाबलाः॥
target: At the request of those lions among the Kauravas of the rulers of the Matsya and Panchala, came there cheerfully kings with large arinies.

source: रथसंघांस्तथा नागान् हयांश्च हयासादिभिः। पादातांश्च सुसंक्रुद्धः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः॥
target: Then, O king the elephant careered, hither and thither, and crushed divisions of cars and elephants and horses mounted by cavalrysoldiers.

source: स तान् दृष्ट्वा महावीर्यो वरदानेन मोहितः। उवाच तानिदं वाक्यं प्रशस्य बलवीर्यतः॥
target: And seeing them, the exceedingly powerful. (Ravana), blinded by the bestowal of the boon, after extolling their strength and heroism, addressed them.

source: शुभं वा यदि वा पापं यो हि वाक्यमुदीरितम्। सत्येन परिगृह्णाति स वीरः पुरुषोत्तमः।७२।।
target: He is a true hero and an excellent person who verifies his words whether good or bad.

source: यूयमेवास्य जानीत योऽयं यद् वा करिष्यति। अहिरेव अहे: पादान्विजानाति न संशयः॥
target: You know who he is and what he does. Serpents, without doubt, know the way of serpents.

source: सत्यार्जवं चातिथिपूजनं च धर्मस्तथार्थश्च रतिः स्वदारैः। निषेवितव्यानि सुखानि लोके ह्यस्मिन् परे चैव मतं ममैतत्॥
target: By truth, simplicity, worship of guests, acquisition of religion and profit, and enjoyment of one's own married wife one should enjoy various kinds of happiness both here and hereafter.

source: संजय उवाच तस्मिन् युद्धे महाराज सुसंवृत्ते सुदारुणे। उपविष्टेषु सर्वेषु पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु॥ ततस्तालध्वजो रामस्तयोर्युद्ध उपस्थिते। श्रुत्वा तच्छिष्ययो राजन्नाजगाम हलायुधः॥
target: Sanjaya said When that fierce encounter O king, was about to take place and when all the great Pandavas had taken their seats indeed, having heard that a battle, between those two heroes, both of whom were his disciples, was about to begin, Rama, whose banner bore the emblem of the palmyra palm and who had the plough for his weapon, came there.

source: शब्दे स्पर्शे रसे रूपे गन्धे च रमते मनः॥ तेषु भोगेषु सर्वेषु न भीतो लभते सुखम्।
target: The heart of man finds pleasure in sound, touch, taste, vision, and smell. The man, however, who is filled with fear, finds no pleasure in all these things.

source: गीतगन्धर्वघोषैश्च भेरीपणवनिःस्वनैः। सदा प्रह्लादितस्ताभिर्देवकन्याभिरिज्यते॥
target: Soothed with the sound of music and the sweet voice of Gandharvas and the sounds and blare of drums and Panavas, he is constantly pleased by celestial ladies of great beauty.

source: नहि त्वं शोचितव्यो मे प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः। स्त्रीस्वभावात्तु मे बुद्धिः कारुण्ये परिवर्तते ॥
target: You well-known for your strength and manliness, are not worthy of being grieved by me. On account of my effeminate nature my understanding is possessed by sorrow.

source: इन्द्रसेनो विशोकश्च पूस्चार्जुनसारथिः। अन्नाद्याहरणे युक्ताः सन्तु मत्प्रियकाम्यया॥
target: Let Indrasena and Vishoka and the charioteer of Arjuna, Puru, if, they desire to please me, be employed in collecting them.

source: तत्र भारते पुत्रस्ते कृतवान् कर्म दुष्करम्। प्रतिविध्यहयानुप्रैः पातयामास सायकैः॥
target: There, O Bharata, your son performed a difficult feat in as much as he struck down the steeds of Prativindhya with fierce shafts.

source: अथाशु निशितं भल्लं शैनेयः कृतवर्मणः। प्रेषयामास समरे शरांश्च चतुरोऽपरान्॥
target: arrows Thereafter the grandson of Sini quickly sped at Kritavarman a whetted bhalla and four other shafts in that battle.

source: त्वया रक्षा विधातव्या कृष्णायाः फाल्गुनेन च। विदितं वो यथा सर्वं लोकवृत्तमिदं तव।॥ विदिते चापि वक्तव्यं सुहृद्भिरनुरागतः। एष धर्मश्च कामश्च अर्थश्चैव सनातनः॥ अतोऽहमपि वक्ष्यामि हेतुमत्र निबोधत।
target: You and Falguna (Arjuna) are to protect। Krishna. O kings, the characters of men are properly known to you all. Inspite of your knowledge, it behoves the friends to describe them out of their regard for you and that is reckoned as the everlasting virtue, pleasure and profit. Therefore I shall say something-you should attend.
