source: अलङ्कारैः कवचैः केतुभिश्च सुखप्रणादैहेषितैर्वा हयानाम्। भ्राजिष्मती दुष्प्रतिवीक्षणीया येषां चमूस्ते विजयन्ति शत्रून्॥
target: Those, whose ornaments, armours and standards and their bright shields become incapable of being stared at, always conquei their enemies.

source: यस्य मन्त्री च गोप्ता च सुहच्चैव जनार्दनः। हरिस्त्रैलोक्यनाथः स किं नु तस्य न निर्जितम्॥
target: What is there which is unconquerable by him who has for his protector, counsellor and friend, the Lord of the three worlds, Hari, Janardana (Krishna).

source: न च प्रार्थयते कश्चिन्मनसापि वसुंधराम्। वने निवसतस्तस्य बाहुवीर्याभिरक्षिताम्॥
target: On Rãma having set up his dwelling in the forest, one (like me) does not even mentally covet this earth which had been protected by the immense prowess (of Rāghava).

source: यत्र देवैस्तपस्तप्तं महदिच्छद्भिराश्रमे। गोकर्ण इति विख्यातस्त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत॥
target: In this hermitage, the celestials had undergone penances with the desire of obtaining salvation. In this region is also Gokarna celebrated over the three worlds.

source: याज्ञवल्क्य उवाच तथैवोत्क्रममाणं तु शृणुष्वावहितो नृप। पद्भ्यामुत्क्रममाणस्य वैष्णवं स्थानमुच्यते॥
target: Yajnavalkya said Listen now to me, with attention, O king, as to what the places are to which those who die have to go. If the Individual soul escapes through the feet, it is said that the man goes to the region of Vishnu.

source: उत्तर उवाच आस्थाय रुचिरं वीर रथं सारथिनां मया। कतमं यास्यसेऽनीकमुक्तो यास्याम्यहं त्वया॥
target: Uttara said O hero, mounting this beautiful car with me as the charioteer, which division would you enter into? Commanded by you I shall take you there.

source: शिथिलां वलितां वृद्धां जरापाण्डुरमूर्धजाम्। सततं वेपमानाङ्गी प्रवाते कदलीमिव ॥ तां तु सीता महाभागामनसूयां पतिव्रताम्। अभ्यवादयदव्यग्रा स्वं नाम समुदाहरत्॥
target: Thereupon Sītā, announcing her name, saluted the pious and chaste Anasuyā old with slackened joints, with folds all over her skin, and her hair hoary from age, whose frame shook perpetually, like a plantain-leaf in the wind.

source: कालस्त्वयं प्रत्युपयाति दारुणो दुर्योधनो युद्धमुपागमद् यत्॥ स्तन्मन्यसे यत्र नैकान्त्यमस्ति।
target: The present moment, that has arrived, is really dreadful for Duryodhona has come to battle. I always wish to see his ends accomplished. But you are acting in such a vay that it appears you have no friendship for the Kuru king.

source: अशक्तः पूर्वमासीस्त्वं कथञ्चिच्छक्ततां गतः। कस्त्वदन्य इमां वाचं सुत्रां वक्तुमर्हति॥
target: Formerly, however, you could not behave so. Now you have somehow gained that power. Indeed, who else save you could give vent to such cruel words?

source: यच्चैव नगरे तस्मिञ्छूयते महदद्भुतम्। एकस्य च बहूनां च पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम्॥
target: This tall story that we hear of what occurred in that city-the struggle between one and many is sufficient proof (of what I say regarding their superiority).

source: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि पुरावृत्तमिदं नृप। द्वैपायनस्य संवादं कीटस्य च युधिष्ठिर॥
target: Regarding it, О king, I shall explain to you the old discourse that took place formerly between the Dvaipayana Rishi and a crawling worm.

source: ब्रूहि संजय यच्छेषं वासुदेवादनन्तरम्। यदर्जुन उवाच त्वां परं कौतूहलं हि मे॥
target: Tell me, O Sanjaya, the remaining part, after the speech of Vasudeva, viz., what Arjuna said to you. I have great curiosity for it.

source: संजय उवाच दुपदस्यात्मजान् दृष्ट्वा कुन्तिभोजसुतांस्तथा। द्रोणपुत्रेण निहतान् राक्षसांश्च सहस्रशः॥
target: Sanjaya said Seeing that the sons of Drupada and those of Kuntibhoja as well as thousands of Rakshasas were destroyed by the son of Drona.

source: संजय उवाच पीडिते धर्मराजे तु मद्रराजेन मारिष। सात्यकिर्भीमसेनश्च माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ॥
target: Sanjaya said When king Yudhishthira was thus assailed by the king of the Madras, Satyaki and Bhimasena and the two sons of Madri by Pandu, encircling Shalya with their cars, began to assail him in that battle.

source: संतुष्टपञ्चवर्गोऽहं लोकयात्रां प्रवाहये। अकुहः श्रद्दधानः सन्कार्याकार्यविचक्षणः॥
target: Satisfying the five classes,* I shall, retaining my simplicity and my religious faith and being able to distinguish between right and wrong, pass away the term (of banishment). * Prakrāmam, The commentator says that the word means, Cāndrāyaṇa and other rites.

source: यजस्व विविधैर्यज्ञैर्बहुभिः स्वाप्तदक्षिणैः। देवांस्तर्पय सोमेन स्वधया च पितॄनपि॥
target: Do you (now) celebrate many a sacrifice with suitable presents to the priests; and do you please the celestials with Soma juice and the manes of your forefathers, with their due food and drink.

source: पापमेवाश्रयेदस्मान् हत्वैतानाततायिनः॥ तस्मानार्दा वयं हन्तुं धार्तराष्ट्रान् स्वबान्धवान्। स्वजनं हि कथं हत्वा सुखिनः स्याम माधव॥
target: Even killing these felons, we shall incur sin. Therefore, it is not proper that we shall kill our own kinsmen, these sons of Dhritarashtra. How can we, O Madhava, be happy by killing our own relatives?

source: तान् बाणांस्तव पुत्रोऽपि छित्त्वैकैकं त्रिभिः शरैः। ननाद सुमहानादं दारयाणो वसुन्धराम्॥
target: Your son, too, having severed every one of these arrows with three shafts of his own, sent out a great uproar; and thereby caused the whole earth echo with it.

source: कर्णो लोकानयं मुख्यानाप्नोतु पुरुषर्षभः। कर्णो वैकर्तनः शूरौ विजयस्त्वस्तु कृष्णयोः॥ वसूनां समलोकत्वं मरुतां वा समाप्नुयात्। सहितो द्रोणभीष्माभ्यां नाकलोकमवाप्नुयात्॥
target: Let Karna, the son of Vikartan, who is foremost of men and who is a brave warrior, attain the best region and let him be like the Vasus or Maruts; let him be adored in heaven with Bhishma and Drona, but let the two Krishnas be victorious.

source: बाणवेगं हि कस्तस्य शक्तः सोढुं महात्मनः। प्रव्रज्यायां हि मे हेतुः स एव पुरुषर्षभः॥ विनाशमुखमेतत् वे केनाख्यातं दुरात्मना।
target: Is there any body who can stand the fury of the arrows of that high-souled one? That most heroic mortal is the cause of my leading this ascetic life. What wicked-minded creature has given you this advice which will lead you to the very mouth of destruction?”

source: भीमसनस्तु संसक्ते राधेये पाण्डवैः सह। सर्वतोऽभ्यहनत् क्रुद्धो यमदण्डनिभैः शरैः॥ वाह्रीकान् केकयान् मत्स्यान् वासात्यान् मद्रसैन्धवान्। एक: संख्ये महेष्वासो योधयन् बह्वशोभत।
target: While Karna was thus engaged with the Pandavas, Bhimasena, extremely exercised with anger, began to wound the Kurus with his shafts each of which was as sure as the very rod of Yama. That great bowman, struggling alone with all those Balhikas, Kaikeyas, Matsyas, Vasatiyas, Madras and the Saindhavas, looked exceedingly grand.

source: रौद्रः क्षत्रियधर्मोऽयं गुरुणा यदयुध्यता इत्यब्रुवढानास्तत्र संग्रामशिरसि स्थिताः॥
target: Surely the duty of a Kshatriya is very hard, since he fights with his preceptor.” Thus did the people, stationed in the battle field, say.

source: अथ तस्यामनावृष्ट्यामतीतायां महर्षयः॥ अन्योन्यं परिपप्रच्छुः पुनः स्वाध्यायकारणात्।
target: After the termination of that twelve years' drought the great Rishis requested one another to deliver discourses on the Vedas.

source: हयानां हेषमाणानामनीकेषु सहस्रशः। सर्वानभ्यभवच्छब्दान् भीमस्य नदतः स्वनः॥
target: The shouts of Bhimasena drowned the neighing of thousands of horses in both the armies.

source: प्रवृद्धानां च वृक्षाणां शाखां प्रच्छेदयेत् तथा। चैत्यानां सर्वथा त्याज्यमपि पत्रस्य पातनम्॥
target: He should cause the branches of all large threes to be cut off, but he should not touch the very leaves of Chaitya ones.

source: हविषा यो द्वितीयेन सोमेन सह युज्यते। रथप्रभू रथध्वानः कुम्भरेताः स उच्यते॥
target: He is joined with Soma in the secondary oblations of Ghee and is called Rathaprabhu and Rathadhvana and Kumbhareta.

source: एतान् सहस्रशश्चान्यान् समनुध्यातवान् हरः। कस्मात् प्रसादं भगवान् न कुर्यात् तव माधव।।३७५। त्वादृशेन हिं देवानां श्लाघनीयः समागमः। ब्रह्मण्येनानृशंसेन श्रद्दधानेन चाप्युत॥ जप्यं तु ते प्रदास्यामि येन द्रक्ष्यसि शंकरम्।
target: The great Hara has favoured these thousands of Rishis and others. Why will not the powerful Deity show favour to you, O Madhava! I always like the meeting of the gods as does one like you, who is devoted to the Brahmanas, who is full of mercy and who is full of faith. I shall give you certain Mantras. Recite them continuously. By this you are sure to see Shankara!

source: मयैष प्रार्थितः पूर्वमिन्द्रकीलसमप्रभः। अनादृत्य च तद् वाक्यं प्रजहाराथ फाल्गुनः॥
target: (He said), “This boar like the Indrakila in colour has been first aimed by me." But disregarding his word, Falguni (Arjuna) struck it.

source: त्वया दायादवानस्मि त्वं मे वंशकरः सुतः। पौरवो वंश इति ते ख्याति लोके गमिष्यति॥
target: "From you my race would continue. You are my true son and heir. My race will be known in the world after your name."

source: स रथं प्राप्य तं भ्रातुर्दुर्योधनहयाशरैः। बहुभिस्ताडयामास ते हताः प्रापतन् भुवि॥
target: Ascending the car of his brother, he wounded the horses of Duryodhana with numerous arrows and the horse then slain fell down dead on the ground.

source: सुहृदां हितकामानां न श्रुतं वचनं त्वया । भ्रातृणां चैव कात्स्न्येन हितमुक्तं दशानन।।७६
target: O Ten-necked one, you did not hear the words of your friends and brothers, who spoke those well meaning words out of affection.

source: अधीत्याध्यापनं कुर्यात् तथा यजनयाजने। दानं प्रतिग्रहं वापि षड्गुणां वृत्तिमाचरेत्॥
target: Having studied, one should teach likewise should celebrate sacrifices himself and officiate at the sacrifices of others. One should also make gifts made to oneself. Indeed, one's conduct should be marked by these six deeds.

source: अजितं सर्वलोकानां देवैरपि दुरासदम्। मया दत्तं पाशुपतं दिव्यमप्रतिमं शरम्। अवाप लोकपालेभ्यो वलादीन् स महाशरान्॥
target: He is unconquerable by all men even by the celestials; I myself have given him the celestial shaft Pashupata. He obtained from the Lokapalas thunderbolt and other mighty shafts.

source: तेषां चैव गतिस्तीर्थैर्वासश्चैषां प्रचिन्त्यताम्। नीतिर्विधीयतां चापि साम्प्रतं या हिता भवेत्॥
target: It is proper for you to find out the way they have followed and their whereabouts through spies and adopt what may conduce to your well-being.

source: ततः कपीनामृषभेण चोदितः प्रतीतवेगः पवनात्मजः कपिः। प्रहर्षयंस्तां हरिवीरवाहिनी चकार रूपं महदात्मनस्तदा॥
target: Exhorted by foremost of monkeys, that one famed for has speech, that key, the offspring of the Wind-god, gladdening the monkey-chiefs, wore (a fit) shape for crossing the ocean.* *Another epithet of Hanumān, Pavanātmaja-son to the Wind?? on the score of Redundency.

source: इत्येवं वादिनं तं तु शत्रुघ्नं शत्रुसूदनम्। वाल्मीकिः संपरिष्वज्य विससर्ज स राघवम्॥
target: Satrughna, the slayer of enemies, having said this, the great ascetic Vālmīki embraced and bacle him farewell.

source: ततोऽग्निसदृशं घोरं शरं सर्पविषोपमम्। अश्मसारमयं दिव्यमबिमन्त्र्य परंतपः॥ रौद्रमस्त्रं समाधाय क्षेप्तुकामः किरीटवान्। ततोऽग्रसन्मही चक्रं राधेयस्य तदा नृप॥
target: Worked up with anger Arjuna invoked the aid of another celestial weapon with mantras which was effulgent like fire, dreadful like venom and hard like adamant. Then uniting it with Raudra weapon he was about to hurl it at his enemy when the earth swallowed up one of the wheels of Karna's car.

source: ततः सायकवर्षेण पर्जन्य इव वृष्टिमान्। परानवाकिरत् पार्थः पर्वतानिव नीरदः॥
target: Then, like masses of clouds surcharged with rain drenching the mountain-breast with their contents. Pritha's son covered his enemies with his arrowy downpour.

source: शुभकृच्छुभमाप्नोति पापकृत्पापमश्नुते। विभीषणः सुखं प्राप्तस्त्वं प्राप्तः पापमीदृशम्।।२६
target: The performer of the good receives good (result)-the perpetrator of the vicious (deeds) meets with bad (result). Vibhisana has attained to happiness and you have met with this your end.

source: एवं पुरुषशार्दूलो महाबुद्धिर्जनार्दनः। पाण्डवैर्घातयामास जरासंधमरिं तदा॥
target: O king, thus did that best of men, the greatly intelligent Janardana (Krishna) cause his foe Jarasandha to be killed through the instrumentality of the Pandavas.

source: एवमुक्तस्तु संरब्धः शरानाशीविषोपमान्॥ त्रिशोरोवक्षसि क्रुद्धो निजघान चतुर्दश।
target: Saying this, (Rāma) enraged, and influenced by wrath, wounded Trisiră in the breast with fourteen arrows.

source: ततस्तमपि कौन्तेयः समरेष्वपराजितः। जिगाय युधि दुर्धर्षो यज्ञविघ्नार्थमागतम्॥
target: Unvanquished in battle, the brave son of Kunti defeated the Nishada king who proved an impediinent to the sacrifice.

source: उदितास्तमितो यश्च तथैवास्तमितोदितः। अहिंस्रश्चाल्पदोषश्च स राजन् केतनक्षमः॥
target: That Brahmana who having acquired riches in the morning becomes poor in the afternoon, or who poor in the morning becomes rich in the evening, or who is shorn of inalice or is stained by a minor faulty should, O king, be invited to Shraddhas.

source: बाणशब्दरवश्चोग्रः शुश्रुवे तत्र मारिष॥ अथ द्रोणो द्रुतं तत्र प्रत्यदृश्यत संयुगे।
target: And, O Bharata, sharp whiz's of arrows were also heard there. Then Drona speedily appeared there in that battle.

source: स भूमावल्पतेजोऽसुर्निहतो नष्टचेतनः। अर्थसंहितया वाचा गर्वितं रणगर्वितम्॥
target: And thereupon Vāli, of mitigated prowess, waning vitality, motionless and stretched on the ground, spoke to Rāma, proud of warfare, saying these pregnant words.

source: ततो युधि महाराज सोमदत्तो महारथः। अर्धचन्द्रेण चिच्छेद माधवस्य महद् धनुः॥
target: Then, O great monarch, in that encounter, the mighty car-warrior Somadatta cut-off with cresent-shaped arrows the great bow of the descendant of Madhu.

source: नैव रात्रिं न दिवसं न मुहूर्तं न च क्षणम्। रामरावणयोर्युद्ध विराममुपगच्छति॥
target: Neither for the night nor for the day, nor for a moment did the fight between Rāma and Rāvaņa cease.

source: स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि मैत्रेय गृहान् साधु व्रजाम्यहम्। एतन्मनसि कर्तव्यं श्रेय एवं भविष्यति॥
target: Bless you, O Maitreya, may you have palaces! I depart hence in peace. Do you remember what I have said. You shall then be able to reap many advantages!

source: तस्य निर्धावमानस्य संरब्धस्य युयुत्सया॥ अकस्मादैन्यमागच्छद्धयानां रथवाहिनाम्।
target: And as, burning for battle, he rushed out in wrath, the steeds drawing his car suddenly lost their energy.

source: धनदस्य सुतः श्रीमान् वानरो गन्धमादनः। विश्वकर्मा त्वजनयन्त्रलं नाम महाकपिम्।।१२
target: The Bestower of riches beget as his son the graceful ape Gandhamādana. And Viśvakarman beget that mighty monkey named Nala.

source: फेनमात्रोपमो देहे जीवे शकुनिवत् स्थिते। अनित्ये प्रियसंवासे कथं स्वपिषि पुत्रक॥
target: Your body is as fickle as the froth on the surface of water. The Individual Soul is sitting unattached in it as a bird on a tree. The companionship of all agreeable objects is transitory. Why then, O son, do you sleep in such forgetfulness?

source: उपायपूर्वं शौटीर्यात्प्रत्याख्यातश्च तेन सः। आगम्य हास्तिनपुरादुपप्लव्यमरिंदमः॥
target: Karna's rejection of Krishna's advice out of pride; then the chastiser of his enemies, Krishna returned to Upaplavya from Hastinapur.

source: इत्युक्ते नृपतौ तस्मिन् व्यासेनाद्भुतकर्मणा। वासुदेवो महातेजास्ततो वचनमाददे॥ तं नृपं दीनमनसं निहतज्ञातिबान्धवम्। उपप्लुतमिवादित्यं सधूममिव पावकम्॥ निर्विण्णमनसं पार्थं ज्ञात्वा वृष्णिकुलोद्वहः। आश्वासयन् धर्मसुतं प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमे॥
target: When Vyasa of wonderful deeds had concluded his speech to the king, the highly powerful son of Vasudeva (Krishna) also addressed him. Knowing the king, the son of Pritha, afflicted in mind, and bereft of his relatives and kinsmen killed in battle, and appearing crest-fallen like the sun darkened by eclipse, or fire smothered by smoke, that support of the Vrishni race (Krishna), comforting the son of Dharma, tried to address him thus.

source: ततो निष्कम्य नृपतिस्तस्मादन्तः पुरात् तदा॥ ददृशे तं जनं सर्वे सर्वाश्च प्रकृतीस्तथा।
target: The old king, coming out of the inner apartments saw them all as also his subjects collected together.

source: स्त्रीरत्नं दुष्कुलाच्चापि विषादप्यमृतं पिबेत्। अदृष्या हि स्त्रियो रत्नमाप इत्येव धर्मतः॥
target: A woman who is the ornament of her sex may be married from even a vile race. Nectar, if extracted from poison, may be drunk; women, jewels and other valuables, as also water, can never, according to the scriptural injunction, be impure or unclean.

source: तामुवाच महाराजः कैकेयीमीषदुत्स्मयः। कामी हस्तेन संगृह्य मूर्धजेषु भुवि स्थिताम्॥
target: Thereupon, by his hands placing Kaikeyi's head upon his lap, the mighty monarch, under the influence of passion, smiling fairly, addressed her lying on the ground,

source: एष जेष्यति काकुत्स्थौ सुग्रीवं च महाबलम्। वानरांश्चापरान्धोरान्हनिष्यति न संशयः॥
target: He will conquer the Kākutsthas, as well as sugrīva endowed with exceeding strength, and, without doubt, slay all the other dreadful monkeys.

source: यच्च तत् क्षरमित्युक्तं यत्रेदं क्षरते जगत्। यच्चाक्षरमिति प्रोक्तं शिवं क्षेम्यमनामयम्॥
target: I wish also to know that which is called Destructible and That into which this universe goes when destroyed. Indeed, what is That which is said to be indestructible. Auspicious, wholesome and free from all sorts of evil.

source: तत्र नागा महाकाया ज्वलितास्याः सुदारुणाः। सिताभ्रकूटप्रतिमाः संहताश्च तथोपलाः॥
target: There (were) huge-bodied and fierce Nagas having fiery mouths heaps of stones white as the fleecy clouds.

source: युधिष्ठिर उवाच एवं करिष्यामि यथा ब्रवीषि परां बुद्धिमुपगम्याप्रमत्तः। यच्चाप्यन्यद्देशकालोपपन्नं तद् वै वाच्यं तत् करिष्यामि कृत्स्नम्॥
target: Yudhishthira said : Having the aid of such intelligence (as yours), undisturbed by passion as you advise in respect of time and place, I will carefully and entirely follow (your advice).

source: अपगच्छतु ते दुःखं मा भूर्बाष्पपरिप्लुतः। नहि क्षुभ्यति दुर्धर्षः समुद्रः सरितां पतिः।॥
target: Banish your grief, and suppress your tears. That lord of streams, the irresistible ocean, never forsakes his own magnanimity.

source: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम्। सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति॥
target: He, who knows Me as the enjoyer of all sacrifices and penances, the great lord of all the worlds and the friend of all creatures, obtain peace".

source: अनाधृष्यतमं देवमपि देवर्षिराक्षसैः। अनासाद्यैव पतितो भास्करोदयने गिरौ॥ पतितस्य कपेरस्य हनुरेका शिलातले। किंचिद्भिना दृढहनुर्हनूमानेष तेन वै॥
target: And, not getting that god, incapable of being subdued by the deities, saints and Rākṣasas, he dropped down on the Ascending-hill. And thereat a jaw of that strong jawed one was little fractured on the rock, and he is called Hanuman in consequence.

source: आपस्तस्तम्भिरे चास्य समुद्रमभियास्यतः। सरितश्चानुदीर्यन्त ध्वजभङ्गश्च नाभवत्॥
target: When Prithu desired to cross the sea, the waters become solidified. The rivers also never rose when he had to cross them but remained perfectly calm. The standard on his car moved freely everywhere.

source: यदि नाहं गमिष्यामि नान्यो वानरपुङ्गवः। पुनः खल्विदमस्माभिः कार्य प्रायोपवेशनम्॥
target: If I go not, nor any other powerful monkey, then we should for certain again sit ourselves down to fast to death.

source: स नियुक्तस्ततस्तेन सम्प्रहृष्टतनूरुहः। नमस्यशिरसा देव्यै सीतायै प्रत्यभाषत।७।।
target: Thus directed by him, that one (Hanumān) with his down standing on end, bowing down the head to that revered one, Sītā, replied.

source: न तुल्यं वृष्णिभिरिह दृश्यते किंचन प्रभो। भूतं भव्यं भविष्यच बलेन भरतर्षभ।॥
target: O lord, there is none in this world equal to the Vrishnis. O foremost of the Bharata's none, has been, are or will be a match for the Vrishnis in might.

source: आददान इव प्राणान् सविता शिशिरात्यये॥ गभस्तिभिरिवादित्यस्तस्थौ शरमरीचिमान्।
target: Killing the foes like the sun at the end of the winter, he stood effulgent with the golden rays of his car, as the sun shines with his rays.

source: साम्यमादौ प्रयुक्तं मे राजन् सौभ्रात्रमिच्छता। अभेदायास्य वंशस्य प्रजानां च विवृद्धये॥
target: All the means commencing with conciliation have been employed by me, desirous of bringing on brotherly feelings among you, so that there might not be a dispute and a destruction of the human race.

source: सोऽग्रजेनानुशिष्टार्थो यथावत् पुरुषर्षभः। प्रविवेश पुरी वीरो लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा॥
target: Being thus duly counselled by his elder brother, that best of men, the heroic Laks maņa-the slayer of foes, entered the city.

source: स तेनाकर्णमुक्तेन विद्धो बाणेन कौरवः॥ निषसाद रथोपस्थे भृशं सम्मूढचेतनः।
target: Duryodhana, the king of Kuru clan immediately lost conscious and seated with a thud at the rear part of his chariot when that arrow injured him.

source: धनुर्विस्फारमाणस्य यस्य शब्देन लक्ष्मण। सशैला कम्पिता भूमिः सहायैः किं नु तस्य वै॥
target: O Lakşmaņa, what is the use of help to him the sounds of whose stretching bow made the Earth tremble with her mountains?

source: तेषामन्यतरापत्तौ यद् यदेवोपपद्यते। तदस्य चेतनामाशु हरत्यभ्रमिवानिलः॥
target: Although either of the two may overtake the person, yet whichever actually overtakes him quickly deprives him of his understanding like the wind dissipating gathering clouds.

source: सुखार्हस्य महार्हस्य सर्वभूतहितात्मनः। श्वर्येण विह, नस्य वनवासे रतस्य च॥ रक्षसापहृता भार्या रहिते कामरूपिणा। तच्च न ज्ञायते रक्षः पत्नी येनास्य वा हृता॥
target: Worthy of happiness, homage, and intent upon the welfare of all beings, deprived of wealth and living in the forest, he has his wife carried off by a Rākşasa, wearing shapes at will. Nor have we yet (been able) to ascertain who is that Rākşasa that has carried off his wife.

source: सृजन्तं राक्षसी मायां महानादनिनादितम्। मुञ्चन्तं विपुलान् नादान् सतोयमिव तोयदम्॥
target: Uttering fearful yells and roaring like clouds charged with rain, he spread the Rakshasas illusion.

source: धर्म्यमर्थ्यं च धर्मात्मा ध्रुवं वक्ता जनार्दनः। तस्मिन् वाच्याः प्रिया वाचो भवता बान्धवैः सह।॥
target: Janardana, inclined to virtue, will surely say what is conducive to morality as well as worldly profit; and he should be spoken to in agreeable words by yourself along with your friends.

source: त्वमित्यत्रभवन्तं हि ब्रूहि पार्थ युधिष्ठिरम्। त्वमित्युक्तो हि निहतो गुरुर्भवति भारत॥
target: O Bharata, a superior on being addressed as 'you' dies (at heart). Therefore, you do addressed the much-respected Yudhishthira as 'you.'

source: समुच्चरन्त्यतिवादाश्च वक्त्राद् पैराहतः शोचति रात्र्यहानि। परस्य नामर्मसु ते पतन्त तान् पण्डितो नावसृजेत् परेषु॥
target: One man utters from his lips words that are harsh. Stung by them the other burns day and night. Those words pierce the very heart of another. Therefore, the learned men should never utter such (harsh) words towards others.

source: निरुच्छ् वासोऽभवच्चैव संनिरुद्धो महात्मना। पपात भूम्यां निश्चेष्टो गतसत्त्व इवाभवत्॥
target: Pressed by the high-souled deity, he became breathless and falling on the ground without the power of moving, he looked like one who was dead.

source: समीक्ष्य च बहून् दोषान् संवासाद् विद्धि पाणयोः। यथा निष्ठाकरं शुल्कं न जात्वासीत् तथा शृणु॥
target: The practice of sale and purchase of the daughter, has been known to human beings for a long time. On account of such familiarity with the practice, you may be able, upon careful examination, to find innumerable faults in it. The gift or acceptance of dower alone could not be considered as creating the relation of husband and wife. Listen to what I say on this head.

source: तमुवाच प्रसन्नात्मा गोविन्दो जनमेजय। वरं वृणीष्वेति तदा तमुत्तङ्कोऽब्रवीदिदम्॥ पर्याप्त एष एवाद्य परस्त्वत्तो महाद्युते। यत् ते रूपमिदं कृष्णं पश्यामि पुरुषोत्तम॥
target: To him, O Janaimejaya, Govinda of contented spirit said these words, Do you ask for some boon! To him Utanka, however said this is a sufficient boon from you for the present, O you of great splendour, in that, O Krishna, I have seen this form of yours, O foremost of all beings!

source: ततोऽथ बुद्ध्वा स तदस्त्रबन्धं प्रभोः प्रभावाद् विगताल्पवेग: :1 पितामहानुग्रहमात्मनश्च विचिन्तयामास हरिप्रवीरः॥
target: And thinking that he was bound up with a Brahma weapon, he did not feel the least pain in consequence of Brahmā's blessing.

source: लिप्सेत मनसा यश्च संकल्पादैश्वरं गुणम्। आत्मप्रसादं तं विद्यात् सर्वा ह्यात्मनि देवताः॥
target: That Yogin who by desire covets any of the divine qualities (of Knowledge or renunciation, etc.,) should regard a pure mind to be at one with the object of his desire. All things exist in a pure mind or soul.

source: यः प्राप्य राज्यं धर्मेण ऋत्विग्ब्रह्मपुरोहितान्। अपृच्छदात्मनः श्रेयः पृष्ट्वा तेषां मते स्थितः॥
target: Having obtained his kingdom by virtue, he used to question his Ritvigas, family priests and Brahmanas about its welfare and then used to live up to their instructions.

source: अहं तु तान् कुरुवृषभानजिह्मगैः प्रवेशयन् यमसदनं चरन् रणे। यशः परं जगति विभाव्य वर्तिता परैर्हतो भुवि शयिताऽथवा पुनः॥
target: Coursing (swiftly) in the battle-field, I shall send, by means of my straight-going shafts, to the abode of Death, the foremost descendants of Kuru's race (Pandavas). Considering fame to be the best of all worldly possessions, I shall kill them in the engagement or myself lie on the field being slain by them.

source: सर्वमेतद्धि यस्मात् ये दत्तं शुद्धेन चेतसा॥ कृच्छ्रकाले ततः स्वर्गो विजितः कर्मणा त्वया।
target: Since you have made this gift, in a season of great difficulty, with a pure heart, you have, by this act of yours, conquered the celestial region.

source: तस्मादनशनैर्युक्तो विप्रान् पूजय नित्यदा। विप्राणां वचनात् सर्वं परत्रेह च सिध्यति॥
target: Do you, therefore, O Yudhishtira, observe the vow of fast and adore the Brahmanas every day. The words uttered by Brahmanas can do every things both in this world and in the next.

source: स महात्मा कुलीनायां युक्तायां सुमहाबलान्। वैदां जनयामास चतुरः सदृशान् सुतान्॥ कुशाम्बं कुशनाभं च असूर्तरजसं वसुम्। दीप्तियुक्तान् महोत्साहान् क्षत्रधर्मचिकीर्षया॥ तानुवाच कुशः पुत्रान् धर्मिष्ठान् सत्यवादिनः। क्रियतां पालनं पुत्रा धर्मं प्राप्स्यथ पुष्कलम्॥
target: That high-souled one beget on Vaidarbha, sprung from a respectable line and endowed with all noble qualities, four sons like to himself, and possessed of extraordinary prowess-Kuśămba, and Kušanābha, and Asūrtarajas, and Vasu, resplendent and breathing exhaustless spirits. And with the desire of enhancing Kșetrya merit, Kuśa said to his truthful and virtuous sons"You sons! do you engage in the task of governing, and thereby acquire immense merit.'

source: इमौ च सिंहसंकाशौ भ्रातरौ सहितौ शिशू॥ नकुलः सहदेवश्च कथं पार्थ चरिष्यतः।
target: How will these lion-like young children, together with the two brothers. Nakula and Sahadeva, O son of Pritha, be able to live in secrecy?

source: अपि ते संनताः सर्वे सामन्तरिपवो जिताः॥ दैवं च मानुषं चैव कर्म ते साध्वनुष्ठितम्।
target: And are they captains submissive: and have you vanquished your foes? And have you performed well the human and the divine rites?

source: त्रिशूलखातं तत्रैव तीर्थमासाद्य भारत॥ तत्राभिषेकं कुर्वीत पितृदेवार्चने रतः। गाणपत्यं च लभते देहं त्यक्त्वा न संशयः॥
target: One going there, O king, becomes adored in the celestials region. O descendant of Bharata, going there to the Tirtha called Trishulakhata and bathing there and worshipping the Pitris and the celestials, there is no doubt one obtains the state of Ganapatya after giving up his body.

source: अथ चिन्तयतस्तस्य कर्णाभ्यां पुरुषः स्मृतः। प्रजासर्गकरो ब्रह्मा तमुवाच जगत्पतिः॥
target: While thinking of this, a Being originated from his ears capable to create the universe. The Lord of all called him by the name of Brahman..

source: भिनत्ति शिरसा शैलमहिं भोजयते च यः। धीरेव कुरुते तस्य कार्याणामनुशासनम्। यो बलादनुशास्तीह सोऽमित्रं तेन विन्दति॥
target: He also breaks his head against a stonewall and he that feeds a serpent, is guided in those acts of his by his own reason. He who wants to control another by force becomes his enemy.

source: पौत्रस्यार्थं भवांस्तस्माद् गुणकेशी प्रतीच्छतु। सदृशी प्रतिरूपस्य वासवस्य शचीमिव॥
target: Therefore do you accept for your grandson Gunakeshi, who equals, in point of beauty, Sachi, the queen of Vasava.

source: अथापश्यत् पुरुषं योगयुक्तं पीताम्बरं लुब्धकोऽनेकबाहुम्॥ मत्वाऽऽत्मानं त्वपराद्धं स तस्य पादौ जरा जगृहे शंकितात्मा।
target: Coming up, Jara saw a man dressed in yellow robes, rapt in Yoga, and gifted with many arms. considering himself an offender, and filled with fear, he touched the feet of Keshava.

source: दातुमैच्छत् ततः कन्यां तस्मै संवरणाय ताम्। नृपोत्तमाय कौरव्य विश्रुताभिजनाय च॥
target: O descendant of Kuru, Surya then desired to bestow his daughter on that excellent king Samvarana of the Kuru race, who celebrated all over the world.

source: तं च पर्यचरद् राजा दिवारानमतन्द्रितः॥ दुर्योधनो महाराज शापात् तस्य विशङ्कितः।
target: Janamejaya, king Duryodhana, fearing his curse, served him diligently day and right.

source: देवर्षिर्लोमशो दृष्टस्ततः प्राप्तोऽस्म्यनुस्मृतिम्। दिव्यं चक्षुरपि प्राप्तं ज्ञानयोगेन वै पुरा॥
target: I met with the celestial Rishi Lomasha and acquired from him the boon of spiritual vision. Again on another occasion I obtained second sight through the power of knowledge!

source: ततो निवातकवचा वध्यमाना मया युधि। संहृत्य मायां सहसा प्राविशन् पुरमात्मनः॥
target: Thereupon, the Nivatakavachas, thus struck dead by me, all on a sudden, forsook their illusion and entered into their own city.

source: ततस्त्रयोदशे वर्षे निवृत्ते पञ्च पाण्डवाः। उपप्लव्यं विराटस्य समपद्यन्त सर्वशः॥
target: Thus after the expiration of the thirteenth year, the five Pandavas took up their quarters in Virata's town called Upaplavya.

source: कुबेरसचिवाश्चान्ये सैद्रा मैत्राश्च राक्षसाः। तैः समेष्याम कौन्तेय संयतो विक्रमेण च॥
target: O son of Kunti, here are the ministers of Kubera and his other friends who are all fearful Rakshashas. We shall have to meet them therefore gather up all your prowess.

source: गोप्रदानरतो याति भित्त्वा जलदसंचयान्। विमानेनार्कचर्णेन दिवि राजन् विराजते।॥
target: That man, O king, who habitually makes gifts of kine, proceeds passing through the clouds, on a sunny car to the celestial region and shines there in splendour.

source: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं ब्रह्मा त्रिभुवनेश्वरः। जगाम त्रिदिवं देवो देवैः सह सबान्धवैः॥ ये च तत्र महात्मान ऋषयो ब्राह्मलौकिकाः। ब्रह्मणा समनुज्ञाता न्यवर्तन्त महौजसः॥ उत्तरं श्रोतुमनसो भविष्यं यच्च राघवे।
target: Having said this, the deity Brahmă, the lord of the three worlds, with other deities, repaired to the region of immortals. The high-souled and the highly effulgent ascetics, living in Brahma's region, who were present in the assembly, obtaining Brahma's permission, waited there, to hear Rama's future career in the Uttarakandam.

source: महर्षिभिर्यक्षमहोरगैरपि। जयाभिवृद्ध्या परयाभिपूजितौ हते तु कर्णे परमाहवे तदा॥
target: After Karna had been killed in that dreadful encounter, the celestials, Gandharvas, men, Charanas, Rishis, Yakshas and Nagas respectfully offered adorations of Krishna and Arjuna and wished them success.

source: अत्रोद्यानानि शून्यानि प्रलीनविहगानि च। न चाभिरामानारामान् पश्यामि मनुजर्षभ॥
target: The gardens are idle with their birds drooping. And, O best of men, I do not find the bowers beautiful (as before).

source: यस्य सर्वं तदा ह्यन्नं मनोऽभिप्रायगं शुचि। कामतो बुभुजुर्विप्राः सर्वे चान्नार्थिनो द्विजाः॥ पयो दधि घृतं क्षौद्रं भक्ष्यं भोज्यं च शोभनम्। यस्य यज्ञेषु सर्वेषु वासांस्याभरणानि च॥ ईप्सितान्युपतिष्ठन्ते प्रहृष्टान् वेदपारगान्। मरुतः परिवेष्टारो मरुत्तास्याभवन् गृहे॥
target: At his sacrifices the twice-born sects desirous of food all ate as it pleased them-food that was purified and suited to their tastes. At all his sacrifices, milk and curds and clarified butter and honey and other kinds of drinks and edibles, all of the finest sort and garments and ornaments precious and desirable, used to be given to Brahmanas thoroughly acquainted with the scriptures. The very gods became the distributors of food in Marutta's palace.

source: तपोभिर्यज्ञदानैश्च वाक्यैः प्रज्ञाश्रितैस्तथा। प्राप्नोत्यभयदानस्य यद् यत् फलमिहाश्नुते॥
target: Whatever fruits one enjoys by penances, by sacrifices, by making charities, by speaking the truth, and by seeking wisdom, may all be acquired by practising the duty of harmlessness.

source: स यथाशास्त्रदृष्टेन मार्गेणेह परिभ्रमन्। वार्षिकांश्चतुरो मासान् पुरा मयि सुखोषितः॥
target: Wandering over the Earth and following path that is pointed out by the scriptures, the learned Panchashika formerly lived happily in my abode for four months during the rains.

source: श्रुत्वा च स पितुर्वत्तं भ्रातरौ च विवासितौ। भरतो दुःखसंतप्त इदं वचनमब्रवीत्॥
target: Hearing of his father's death and the exile of his brothers, Bharata burning in grief, said these words.

source: तावुभौ विरथौ वीरौ कुरुणां कीर्तिवर्धनौ। व्यपाक्रमेतां युद्धात्तु प्रेक्षमाणौ परस्परम्॥
target: Then those two brave warriors, who were divested of their cars and who also had contributed to the increase of the glory of the Kurus, really fled away from the battle, looking each other in the face.

source: अनेन तपसा वेद्मि सर्वं परचिकीर्षितम्। सत्यमेतन्निबोधध्वं ध्रियते सत्यवानिति॥
target: By virtue of this asceticism I am aware of the doings of other people. Know this to be certain that Satyavana is alive.

source: हितार्थमेतदुक्तं वः क्रियतां यदि रोचते। उच्यतां हि क्षमं यत् तत् सर्वेषामेव वानराः॥
target: I tell you this for your good. Act accordingly, if you list. And do you also express what else you are capable of.

source: मा च तेऽभूत् स्वभावोऽयमिति ते देवपुङ्गवा ईश्वरः सर्वभूतानां विक्रमेण जितो बलात्॥
target: O king of gods, let not your nature be so. Do not think that you have become the king of all creatures after having defeated all with your might and prowess.

source: वृषभस्कन्धविक्रान्तो वृषभाक्षो नरर्षभः। तावकानां बभौ मध्ये गवां मध्ये यथा वृषः॥
target: That foremost of men graced with shoulders, tread and eyes, resembling those of the moon, appeared in the centre of your army, like a bull in the midst of a cowpen.

source: ददर्श स तदा गावः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः। अङ्कुर्लक्षैश्च ताः सर्वा लक्षयामास पार्थिवः॥
target: The king saw his cattle by hundreds and thousands. Examining their limbs and marks, he supervised their counting.

source: किरीटिभुजनिर्मुक्तैः सम्पतद्भिर्महाशरैः। समाच्छन्नं बभौ सर्वं काद्रवेयैरिव प्रभो॥
target: Indeed those arrows, that were ceaselessly being discharged by Arjuna, falling on all sides looked, O lord, as if so many snakes were lying all around.

source: एतौ निषण्णौ सम्प्रेक्ष्य शतानन्दो नृपात्मजौ। सुखासीनौ मुनिश्रेष्ठं विश्वामित्रमथाब्रवीत्॥
target: And seeing the king's sons seated at their ease, he said to that foremost of ascetics. Visvamitra.

source: अहिर्बुध्योऽनिलाभश्च चेकितानो हविस्तथा। अजैकपाच्च कापाली त्रिशंकुरजितः शिवः॥
target: You are he who lives in the netherinost region; you invisible but be comprehended even as the wind which though invisible is perceived by every body; you are he whose knowledge extends to the bottom of everything and who knows the inner nature of all things; you are the object which is enjoyed by him who enjoys it; you are the Ajaikapad among the eleven Rudras; you are the king of the entire universe; you are of the form of all souls in the universe; you are he who is not subject to those three qualities; you are he who is above all attributes and is a state of pure existence which is incapable of being described with the help of any adjective of a language.

source: रामेण हि प्रतिज्ञातं हवृक्षगणसंनिधौ। उत्सादनममित्राणां सीता यैस्तु प्रधर्षिता॥
target: Rāma has in presence of the tawny-eyed (ones) forsooth promised the annihilation of the foe by whom Sītā has been sore oppressed.

source: नहि तावद् भवेत् कालो व्यतीतश्चोदनादृते। चोदितस्य हि कार्यस्य भवेत् कालव्यतिक्रमः॥ तस्य त्वं
target: T To engage, out of season, in a service, uncalled for, is not blameable; but to defer the performance of an action in proper time after promising is indeed an object of censure.

source: स पृष्टः पाण्डुपुत्रेण प्रीयमाणो महामनाः। उवाच श्लक्ष्णया वाचा हर्षयन्निव पाण्डवान्॥
target: Having been asked by the son of Pandu, the high-minded (Rishi), being well pleased, spoke in sweet words and delighted the Pandavas.

source: ततोऽमृतं द्यौः प्रववर्ष भास्वती पितामहस्यायतने स्वयम्भुवः। अनाहता दुन्दुभयोऽथ नेदिरे तथा प्रसन्नाव दिशश्चकाशिरे॥
target: Heaven's sky became clear and bright and began to shower ambrosia upon the region of the self-create Grand-father. The celestial keule-druns, though struck by none, began to beat, and all the cardinal points, becoming clear, seemed ablaze with splendour.

source: जाम्बूनदमयैः पुढेश्चित्रचापविनिर्गतैः। प्राच्छादयदमेयात्मा दिशः सूर्यस्य च प्रभाम्॥
target: That of immeasurable energy enveloped all the quarters and the lustre of the sun with gold-winged arrows discharged from a variegated bow. one

source: पादे तु दक्षिणे राजन् गौतमः सत्यविक्रमः। त्रिगतैः सुमहेष्वासैर्दाक्षिणात्यैश्च संवृतः॥
target: O king, the son of Gautama, possessed of the unbaffled prowess, was stationed in right foot, encompassed by the most powerful bowmen, the Trigartas and the troops from the south.

source: किं त्वामन्यत वैदेहः पिता मे मिथिलाधिपः। राम जामातरं प्राप्य स्त्रियं पुरुषविग्रहम्॥
target: What thought of you, O Rāma, my father, the king of Mithilā, accepting you as his son-in-law, who was a man if form but (in deeds)a woman?

source: अनेकजयिनौ संख्यै यौ वै पुरुषसत्तमौ। तयोस्त्वं न समो राजन् भविताऽसि कदाचन।॥
target: There are two persons who are the best among men and who have achieved many victories in battle; you are by no means equal to them, Oking.

source: एवमुक्त्वा तु राधेयः पुनरेव विशाम्पते । अब्रवीन्मद्रराजानं याहि याहीत्यसम्भ्रमम्॥
target: Saying this the son of Radha, O king, once more addressed the king of Madras, saying-"go on! go on."

source: ग्रामारण्यानि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च। त्रातारः सिन्धुराजस्य भवन्ति मधुसूदन॥
target: The domestic and the wild animals and all the mobile and immobile beings united together-even if all these become the protector of the Sindhu king, O slayer of Madhu.

source: न निवर्तयितुं शक्यं यदुक्तं ब्रह्मवादिना। त्वमस्मान् मानुषी भूत्वा सृज पुत्रान् वसून् भुवि॥१५
target: We are not able to frustrate what has been said by that Brahma-knowing Rishi. Kindly make us, the Vasus, your sons by becoming a woman on earth.

source: एवं बहुविधैर्लोकधर्मद्वारैरनावृतैः। ममापि मतिराविग्ना मेघलेखेव वायुना॥
target: In this world, it is seen, that men go to heaven through a thousand doors of duty, all standing wide open. My understanding has been troubled by your question, like a cloud before the wind.

source: अपि कीट: पतङ्गो वा भवेयं शङ्कराज्ञया। न तु शक्र त्वया दत्तं त्रैलोक्यमपि कामये॥
target: Ordered by Mahadeva I shall cheerfully become a worm or an insect, but I do not desire for even the sovereignty of the three worlds if bestowed by you, O Shakra.

source: संजय उवाच पतितं प्रेक्ष्य यन्तारं शल्य: सर्वायसी गदाम्। आदाय तरसा राजंस्तस्थौ गिरिरिवाचलः॥
target: Sanjaya said Seeing his charioteer fallen, Shalya, O king, quickly took up his mace made entirely of iron and stood firm as a hill.

source: ततो गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैः शरैः पार्थो धनञ्जयः। जघान दस्यून् सोद्वेगो वृष्णिभृत्यैः सहस्रशः॥
target: The powerful Arjuna, supported by the servants of the Vrishnis, struck the robbers with arrows shot off Gandiva.

source: कालेयानां तु ये पुत्रास्तेषामष्टौ नराधिपाः। जज्ञिरे राजशार्दूल शार्दूलसमविक्रमाः॥
target: O best of kings, the eight sons of the Asura Kaleyas were all born on earth and they all became great kings as powerful as tigers.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच सरस्तदासाद्य तु पाण्डुपुत्रा जनं समुत्सृज्य विधाय वेशम्। वनानि रम्याण्यथ पर्वतांश्च नदीप्रदेशांश्च तदा विचेरुः॥
target: Vaishampayana said : When the Pandavas reached the lake, they chose a place to live in far from the habitations of men. They roamed through charming forests and delightful mountains and beautiful valleys through which ran many rivers and stream-lets.

source: पतङ्गा इव चाग्नौ ते निपेतुः कुकुरान्धकाः॥ नासीत् पलायने बुद्धिर्वध्यमानस्य कस्यचित्।
target: The Kukuras and the Andhakas met with destruction like insects rushing at a burning fire. As they were thus being destroyed, no one among them thought of escaping by flight.

source: शोषोत्सर्गे कर्मभिर्देहमोक्षे सरस्वत्यः श्रेयसे सम्प्रवृत्ताः। यूयं नित्यं सर्वपुण्योपवाह्यां दिशध्वं मे गतिमिष्टां प्रसन्नाः॥
target: For alleviating or curing phthisis and other wasting diseases, and for achieving freedom from the body, if a person takes the help of the five products of the cow, kine confer blessings upon the person like the river Sarasvati you kine, you are always co nveyers of all sorts of merit. Pleased with me, do you assign a desirable end for me.

source: उष्ट्वा द्वादश वर्षाणि पुष्करे नियतः शुचिः॥ क्रतून् सर्वानवाप्नोति ब्रह्मलोकं स गच्छति।
target: He who lives at Pushkara for twelve years in purity. Acquires all the merits of performing sacrifices and goes to the region of Brahma.

source: शूद्रायामस्मि वैश्येन जातो नरवराधिप। इतीव वदतः कृच्छाद् बाणाभिहतमर्मणः॥ विघूर्णतो विचेष्टस्य वेपमानस्य भूतले। तस्य त्वाताम्यमानस्य तं बाणमहमुद्धरम्। स मामुद्वीक्ष्य संत्रस्तो जहौ प्राणांस्तपोधनः॥
target: O lord of the foremost men, I was begot by a Vaisya on a Sudra woman.' As he, his vitals afflicted with the shaft, hi eyes rolling, inert and trembling on the ground, with his limbs drawn in, was speaking with difficulty, I drew out the arrow. Thereupon, looking at me, the ascetic, growing affrighted, gave up the ghost.

source: रथैरनेकसाहौः क्रोधामर्षसमन्वितः नन्दकस्तव पुत्रस्तु भीमसेनं महाबलम्॥ विव्याध विशिखैः षड्भिः कङ्कपत्रैः शिलाशितैः। दुर्योधनश्च समरे भीमसेनं महारथम्॥ आजघानोरसि क्रुद्धो मार्गणैर्नवभिः शितैः। ततो भीमो महाबाहुः स्वरथं सुमहाबलः॥ आरुरोह रथश्रेष्ठं विशोकं चेदमब्रवीत्। एते महारथाः शूरा धार्तराष्ट्राः समागताः॥
target: Supported by many thousand of cars, and excited with rage and fury, your son Nandaka pierced Bhimasena of great might with keenpointed shafts whetted on stone and winged with the feathers of the Kanka bird. Then also, O monarch, Duryodhana excited with rage, in that fierce fight, struck Bhimasena on the breast with nine whetted shafts. Thereafter the mighty-armed Bhimasena endued with superior strength mounted on his own most excellent chariot and thus addressed his charioteer Vishoka. These heroic and mighty carwarriors, these sons of Dhritarashtra endued with prowess.

source: द्रौणिस्तु दृष्ट्वा राजेन्द्र धृष्टद्युम्नमवस्थितम्। क्रोधेन निःश्वसन् वीरः पार्षतं समुपाद्रवत्॥
target: Seeing Dhristadyumna stand firm before him the heroic son of Drona, sighing in anger, rushed towards Parshata.

source: धनमाहुः परं धर्मं धने सर्वं प्रतिष्ठितम्। जीवन्ति धनिनो लोके मृता ये त्वधना नराः॥
target: Wealth is said to be the best virtue. Everything is established on wealth; and wealthy men are living in this world and men without wealth are dead.

source: मासि मासि त्रिरात्राणि कृत्वा वर्षाणि द्वादश। गणाधिपत्यं प्राप्नोति निःसपत्नमनाविलम्॥
target: He whọ observes fasts for three nights every month and acts thus for two and ten years, acquires a position of eminence among his kinsmen and friends, without a rival to contest his claim and without any anxiety caused by any one trying to rise to the same height.

source: मुक्तस्त्वयाहं त्वसमीक्ष्य कर्ण शिरो हृतं यन्न मयार्जुनस्य। समीक्ष्य मां मुञ्च रणे त्वमाशु हन्तास्मि शत्रु तव चात्मनश्च॥
target: O Karna, you discharged me without seeing me and hence I could not cut-off his head. Shoot me again immediately in battle after seeing me and I shall slay your enemies as well as mine.

source: अथवा धारयिष्यामि क्रोधमद्य निशामिमाम्। गृह्यतामुदयः स्वैरं कामभोगेषु वानर ॥
target: Or I shall suppress my wrath for this night and do you, O monkey, enjoy till the rise of the Sun.

source: यथा समुद्रो भगवान्यथा मेरुर्महागिरिः। उभौ ख्यातौ रत्ननिधी तथा भारतमुच्यते॥
target: This Bharata is said to be a mine of gems, as the illustrious ocean or the great mountain Meru.

source: ततः स चिन्तयामास मुहूर्तं कपिकुञ्जरः। गिरेः शृङ्गे स्थिस्तस्मिन् रामस्याभ्युदयं ततः॥
target: Then that elephantine monkey, stationed on the summit of that mountain, for a while bethought himself as the success of Rāma.* *About rescuing his wife.

target: Endue with good qualities; he is, to the exclusion of all your sons, the fore-most among your heirs; he is endued with energy and wisdom and versed both in the codes of morality and earthly good. Out of kindness and simplicity that chief among virtuous men has patiently borne many a trouble in order to uphold your story.

source: एतान् गुणांस्तु क्षेत्रज्ञो भुङ्क्ते नैभिः स भुज्यते। निर्गुणो गुणभुक् चैव गुणस्रष्टा गुणाधिकः॥
target: The Individual Soul, called Kshetrajna, enjoys and suffers the action of these three qualities. He, however, is above them and they cannot touch Him. Freed from these qualities, He is again their enjoyer and sufferer. Having created them Himself, He is above them all.

target: Gifted with high ascetic merit, he at last hit upon the course he should adopt. Summoning his favourite disciple whose name was Vipula and who was of Bhrigu's family, he said as follows.

target: What is Brahman's day covers a thousand such cycles. His night also covers a thousand similar cycles. They who know this are said to know the day and the night.

target: Their species were innumerable. All of them have the Moon for their lord. Some of these creepers and herbs came to be considered as Ambrosia and some came to be considered as Poison. Others that were neither this nor that formed one class.

target: With proper care he should also take care of and rear up all domestic animals as a father looking after his sons. Anything else that he will do, will be considered as improper for him.

target: On the enemy having fallen, I shall behold you, devoted to your lord, with your desire attained, soon lying on the lap of Rama.

target: If you are confident that I have spoken the truth, then rise up, O Sanjaya, tranquilizing your mind with a view to gain victory.

target: Wrought up with ire, they once again quickly filled Arjuna and Keshava with arrows, like the rains filling up a lake.

source: ततो निविष्टां ध्वजिनीं सुग्रीवेणाभिपालिताम्। ददर्श राक्षसोऽभ्येत्य शार्दूलो नाम वीर्यवान्॥ चारो राक्षसराजस्य रावणस्य दुरात्मनः। तां दृष्ट्वा सर्वतोऽव्यग्रां प्रतिगम्य स राक्षसः॥ आविश्य लङ्कां वेगेन राजानमिदमब्रवीत्।
target: Thereupon the greatly powerful Rākşasa, by name Śārdüla, beheld the army of Sugrīva arranged on the shore of the ocean. And, beholding the army all busy, the emissary of the vicious-souled Raksasa-Ravana, entered the city of Lanka and, approaching his lord, said.

source: तस्मिन्नभ्यर्चिते कृष्णे सुनीथः शत्रुकर्षणः। अतिताप्रेक्षणः कोपादुवाच मनुजाधिपान्॥

target: After this the divine Rudra gave the sword, that protector of religion, covered with the blood of Danavas, to Vishnu with proper adorations.

source: आधिभिर्व्याधिभिश्चैव वर्जितस्त्वं भविष्धसि॥ पादाच्चतुर्थात् सम्भूत आत्मा यस्मान्मुने तव। त्वं भविष्यस्यनुपमो जन्म वै सफलं कुरु॥
target: You will also be freed from all sorts of affliction and disease. And since, O ascetic this body of yours has originated from the fourth foot of Dharma, (viz., Truth), you will be peerless on Earth. Do you make your life fruitful.

target: Sanjaya said Hear, O monarch, how the grandson of Sini came to being in days gone by as also how Bhurisravas was descended. O ruler of men, this will explain all your doubts.

target: At this, Janamejaya, a deafening uproar was heard to arise from within the waters, resembling that which had formerly been heard of the armies of the Kurus and the Pandavas.

target: Then facing his whole court, that lord of earth, the king, resounding all sides as if with thunder, in a mighty voice, echoing, and solemn, and like to the sounds of a kettle-drum, spoke words fraught with welfare, and capable of creating high rapture, and worthy of the attention of all. And in tones overflowing with royal signs; and mellifluous; and peerless; and surcharged with the sentiment of surprise, the monarch addressed the princes, saying.

source: पदाताश्च रणे द्रोणं पातयन्तु महारथम्। तथाऽऽज्ञप्तास्तु ते सर्वे पाण्डवेन महात्मना॥

target: O you beautiful, do not give up virtue; O noble minded lady, renounce your wrath. O auspicious one, if king Yudhishthira hears from you such rebukes, he is sure to give up his life.
