source: अद्यास्त्रमाययैतेषां मायामेतां सुदारुणाम्। विनिहन्मि तमश्चोग्रं मा भैः सूत स्थिरो भव॥
target: O charioteer do not be afraid, calm yourself. I will, this day, destroy the terrible illusion created by them and also this dense darkness, by illusion-creating weapon."

source: देवदानवगन्धर्वयक्षराक्षसपन्नगाः। नासन् कृतयुगे तात तदा न क्रयविक्रयः॥
target: O child, in the Krita Yuga there were no celestials, no Danavas, no Gandharvas, no Yakshas, no Rakshasas and no Nagas. There was neither buying nor selling.

source: यो भर्ता वासितातुष्टो भर्तुस्तुष्टा च वासिता। यस्मिन्नेवं कुले सर्वे कल्याणं तत्र वर्तते॥
target: That house in which the husband is pleased with his married wife, and the wife pleased with her husband, all auspicious results ensue.

source: स्वयं कार्याणि यः काले नानुतिष्ठति पार्थिवः। स तु वै सह राज्येन तैश्च कार्यैर्विनश्यति॥
target: The king that dose not act at the proper time, finds destruction along with his kingdom and acts.

source: सुमित्रो नाम राजर्षिर्हहयो मृगयां गतः। ससार स मृगं विद्ध्वा बाणेनानतपर्वणा॥
target: A royal sage of the Haihaya family, Sumitra by namre, went a hunting. Having pierced a deer with a straight arrow, he pursued it.

source: दुर्योधनो भयाद् विद्वन् न दद्यात् पादमन्ततः। धर्मतस्तु महीं कृत्स्नां प्रदद्याच्छत्रवेऽपि च॥
target: O learned one, Duryodhana will not yield even one foot of ground through fear, but responding to the call of virtue he will yield even the entire world to his enemy.

source: उचितत्वं प्रियत्वं च योगस्यापि च वर्णयेत्। पुनः पुनश्च कौन्तेयान् माद्रीपुत्रौ च सान्त्वयन्॥
target: Let him say that the alliance has been exceedingly proper and it has become very picasing to you and that you are quite worthy of it. Let him repeatedly propitiate the sons of Kunti and the two sons of Madri.

source: एवं सर्वेषु भूतेषु गूढचरति संवृतः। दृश्यते त्वग्रयया बुद्ध्या सूक्ष्मया तत्त्वदर्शिभिः॥
target: It is thus that the Soul, covered with various forms, goes form to form, unseen and unnoticed by others. Persons endued with true Knowledge witness the Soul by their keen and subtile intelligence.

source: व्यनदत् सुमहानादं जीमूत इव शारदः। दिशः खं विदिशश्चैव नादयन् भैरवस्वनः॥
target: Then he uttered a loud roar that resembled the rumble of autumnal clouds; and that dreadful reverberated through the subsidiary and cardinal points of the compass.

source: न चैवैनं महात्मानमुत्सहामो निरीक्षितुम्। लेलिह्यमानं सैन्येषु प्रवृद्धमिव पावकम्॥
target: We dare not even look at that illustrious warrior when he licks, like a raging conflagration, all my troops up.

source: तानेवं ब्रुवतो वीरान् सात्यकिनिशितैः शरैः। जधान त्रिशतानश्वान् कुञ्जरांश्च चतुःशतान्॥
target: Satyaki then fell to slaughter those heroes even when they were thus speaking, with his sharp arrows. He slew three hundred steeds and four hundred elephants.

source: शरण्यः सर्वभूतानां पितुर्निर्देशपारगः। ज्येष्ठो दशरथस्यायं पुत्राणां गुणवत्तरः॥
target: He is the refuge of all creatures, and competent to carry out the injunctions of his father. The eldest son of Dasaratha, he is foremost of all his sons in merit.

source: रोहिण्यजनयद् गावो गन्धर्वी वाजिनः सुतान्। सुरसाऽजनयन्त्रागान् राम कद्रूश्च पन्नगान्॥
target: Rohini produced kine, and the sons of Gandharvī are horses. And Surasā, O Rāma, gave birth to Nāgas, and Kadru to Pannagas.

source: गृहमानीय बनीमः क्रतुरेवं भवेन्न सः। अपरे त्वब्रुवंस्तत्र नागाः पण्डितमानिनः॥
target: Let us carry him to our home and keep him bound, so that the sacrifice may not take place.” Others, thinking themselves wise, said,

source: जनस्थानवधं श्रुत्वा निहतौ खरदूषणौ। ततस्त्वमर्षापहृता जानकी रावणेन तु॥
target: And having heard of the destruction of the Rākşasas of Janasthāna and of Khara and Duşaņa, the illusive Rāvana, assuming shapes at will, beguiling Rāma, it the forest, stole away his consort-the Janaka's daughter.

source: तमब्रवीद् दशग्रीवो गच्छ सीतां प्रलोभय॥ रत्नशृङ्गो मृगो भूत्वा रत्नचित्रतनूरूहः। ध्रुवं सीता समालक्ष्य त्वां रामं चोदयिष्यति॥
target: (There at) the ten-headed one replied to him "go and tempt Sita wearing the form of a deer with golden horns and a golden skin. It is certain that on beholding you she will send Rama after you".

source: न च स्वपिषि जागर्षि न्युब्जः शेषे परंतप। घोरामशान्तां रुषती सदा वाचं प्रभाषसे॥
target: You do not sleep but are awake with your face bent downwards, O you chastiser of your enemies; and you always speak terrible and wrathful words inclined towards war.

source: एको द्वाभ्यां हतः शेषे त्वमधर्मेण धार्मिक। किं नु वक्ष्यति वै सत्सु गोष्ठीषु च सभासु च॥
target: Alas, O righteous one, you are lying on the ground, killed unfairly by two foes. Thus, O Madhava, those wives of Bhurishravas are crying aloud in sorrow.

source: एवं श्रुत्वा स संवादं लक्ष्मणः पूर्वमागतः। वाष्पपर्याकुलमुखः शोकं सोढुमशक्नुवन् ॥ स भ्रातुश्चरणौ गाढं निपीड्य रघुनन्दनः। सीतामुवाचातियशां राघवं च महाव्रतम्॥
target: Hearing this conversation, Laksmana, who had gone there before, with tears in his eyes and being unable to bear this terrible sorrow, took hold of his brother's feet and spoke thus to that greatly renowned Sītā and Rāghava.

source: नराश्वकायैः पतितैर्दन्तिभिश्च महाहवे। अगम्यरूपा पृथिवी मांसशोणितकर्दमा॥
target: The ground becoming muddy with flesh and blood, became impassable with the bodies of men, horses and elephants, that were killed in that fearful battle.

source: यूयं हि तप्ततपसः सर्वे च चरितव्रताः॥ सर्वे वेदविदो मुख्या नैमिषारण्यवासिनः।
target: You have have all practised very penances and observed many high and excellent vows. Living in this sacred forest of Naimisha, you are foremost of all persons conversant with the Vedas.

source: ततोऽब्रवीद् धर्मसुतो रौहिणेयमरिंदमम्॥ इदं भ्रात्रोर्महायुद्धं पश्य रामेति भारत।
target: Then Dharma's son, O Bharata, said to that chastiser of foes, viz., the son of Rohini "Witness, O Rama, this dreadful encounter between the two brothers."

source: तस्य वीर्यं महाबाहो शृणु सत्येन कौरव। तं न देवा न गन्धर्वा न यक्षा न च राक्षसाः॥ उत्सहन्ते रणे जेतुं कुपितं सव्यसाचिनम्। खाण्डवे येन भगवान् प्रत्युद्यातः सुरश्वरः॥
target: O mighty-armed Kaurava, listen to what I say regarding his prowess. If Savyasachin's anger is excited, neither the Gandharvas nor the Yakshas, nor the Rakshasas can venture to oppose him. On the occasion of the burning of the Khandava forest, he fought with the chief of the gods himself.

source: दुर्वृत्तमपि कः पुत्रं त्यजेद् भुवि विचक्षणः॥ कश्च प्रव्राज्यमानो वा नासूयेत् पितरं सुतः।
target: What sensible man for sake his son, albeit he may be wicked? And what son being banished, does not bear ill will towards his father?

source: कीचकश्चाप्यलंकृत्य यथाकाममुपागमत्। तां वेलां नर्तनागारं पाञ्चालीसंगमाशया॥
target: Having adorned himself to his liking, Kichaka arrived at the dancing hall at the appointed hour with a view to meet Panchali.

source: पितुर्निदेशेन तु धर्मवत्सलो वनप्रवेशे कृतबुद्धिनिश्चयः। निवेदयस्वागमनं नृपाय मे॥
target: And making up his mind to go to the woods in accordance with the command of his father, Rāghava seeing Sumantra, said to him; “Do you inform the king of my arrival. to

source: भूतं भव्यं भविष्यं च मार्कण्डेयोऽभ्युवाच ह। यज्ञं त्वां चैव यज्ञानां तपश्च तपसामपि॥
target: Markandeya has spoken of you as the Past, the Present, and the Future, the sacrifice of all sacrifices and the Austerity of all austerities.

source: विनष्टान् कौरवान् मन्ये मम पुत्रस्य दुर्नयैः। न हि कर्णो महेष्वासान् पार्थाञ्जेष्यति संजय॥
target: I regard the Kauravas as already slain, in consequence of the evil policy of my son. O Sanjaya, Karna will never be able to vanquish the sons of Pritha, those illustrious bowmen.

source: तस्य निःश्वासवातेन कुम्भकर्णस्य रक्षसः। राक्षसाः कुम्भकर्णस्य स्थातुं शेकुर्न चाग्रतः॥
target: But the Rākşasas could not stay before Kumbhakarņa owing to the hurricane heaving at his breath.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच ततस्ते व्याससहिताः सर्व ऋग्यजुःसामसहितैर्वचोभिः कृष्णमार्चयन्॥
target: Vaishampayana said, Then those great Rishis, with Vyasa amongst them, worshipped Krishna with hymns from the Richs, the Yajus, and the Samans.

source: देवाः साध्यास्तथा विश्वे तथैव च महर्षयः। यामा धामाश्च मौद्गल्य गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा।॥ एषां देवनिकायानां पृथक् पृथगनेकशः। भास्वन्त: कामसम्पन्ना लोकास्तेजोमयाः शुभाः॥
target: O Mudgala, there are established separately myriads of beautiful, shinning and respendent worlds bestowing every object of desire owned by those celestial beings, the gods, the Sadhyas, the Vishvadevas, the great sages, the Yamas, the Dhamas and the Gandharvas and the Apsaras.

source: यदि राज्यं न ते प्राप्ताः पाण्डवेया यशस्विनः। कुत एव तवापीदं भारतस्यापि कस्यचित्॥
target: If the illustrious sons of Pandu do not get the kingdom, how can it be yours or of any descendant of the Bharata race?

source: स च्छिन्नधन्वा विरथो हताश्वो हतसारथिः। गदापाणिरवारोहत् ख्यापयन् पौरुषं महत्॥
target: When his bow was thus cut down again, when he was thus deprived of his car and when his steeds were thus killed and his charioteer overthrown, the Panchala prince, displaying great prowess, jumped down from his car with a mace in hand.

source: ततो वसिष्ठो भगवान् कथान्ते रघुनन्दन। विश्वामित्रमिदं वाक्यमुवाच प्रहसन्निव॥
target: Then, O descendant of Raghu, after the conversation had ended, the adorable Vasiştha, smiling, addressed Viśvāmitra, saying.

source: जरत्कारुरुवाच पन्नगानामशेषाणां माता कदूरिति श्रुता। तया शप्ता रुषितया सुता यस्मान्निबोध तत्॥
target: Jaratkaru said: O son, the mother of all the snakes was Kadru. Hear, why she cursed her sons in anger.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच धनंजयस्य वक्ष्यामि विजयं पूर्वमेव ते। यौगपद्येन पार्हि निर्जितेयं वसुन्धरा॥
target: Vaishampayana said The earth was conquered simultaneously by all the sons of Pritha. I shall first describe the conquest of Dhannajaya (Arjuna).

source: अन्योन्यं श्रावयन्ति स्म नामगोत्राणि भारत। पितृनामानि च रणे गोत्रनामानि वा विभो॥ श्रावयाणाश्च बहवस्तत्र योद्धा विशाम्पते। अन्योन्यमवमृद्नन्तः शक्तितोमरपट्टिशैः॥
target: They called out one another by their own and family names. And many taking the names of their fathers and families began to assail one another with darts, lances and battle axes.

source: ततः सिद्धस्य तपसा तव विप्र शकुन्तकाः। क्षिप्रं शिरस्यजायन्त ते च सम्भावितास्त्वया॥
target: When you had at last acquired ascetic success, certain birds were born on your head. You took great care of the little creatures:

source: तत्र हृष्टा नरा राजंस्तेजोयुक्ता महाबलाः। स्त्रियश्चोत्पलवर्णाभाः सर्वाः सुप्रियदर्शनाः॥
target: The length of human life there is eleven thousand years. O king, the men there are cheerful, and possess great energy and great strength. The women are all of the complexion of the lotus. They are exceedingly beautiful.

source: खानितः सगरेणायमप्रमेयो महोदधिः। कर्तुमर्हसि रामस्य ज्ञातेः कार्य महोदधिः॥
target: This measureless deep was dug out by (the king) Sagara.* And the great ocean shall surely help Rāma belonging to Sagara's race. *Sagara was a sovereign of Ayodhyā, belonging to the same family with Rāma.

source: अथवा तौ नरव्याघ्रौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ। मन्निमित्तमनार्येण समरेऽद्य निपातितौ॥
target: Or it may be that today for me those foremost of men, the brothers-Rama and Laksmana-have been slain in encounter by this inglorious one.

source: ततः प्रकृतिमान् वैद्यः पितुरेषां पुरोहितः। वसिष्ठो भरतं वाक्यमुत्थाप्य तमुवाच ह॥
target: Then the all-knowing priest of their father possessed of sterling worth, Vasistha, raising Bharata, said to him.

source: राजर्षीणां पुराणानामनुयातु गतिं नृपः। राजर्षीणां हि सर्वेषामन्ते वनमुपाश्रयः॥
target: Let this king follow the path of royal sages of old. Indeed, all royal sages retire into the woods at last.

source: प्रायश्चित्तं च वेत्थ त्वं प्रतीघातं च सर्वशः। ततो गुर्वर्थकालोऽयं समुत्पन्नः परंतप॥
target: And the revival of harmless beings burnt by the fire of weapons and the revival of the weapons (themselves) when baffled by those of the enemies. Now, O tormentor of foes the time has arrived for paying your preceptor's fees.

source: ततोऽपरेण भल्लेन धर्मपुत्रस्य मारिष॥ धनुश्चिच्छेद समरे सज्यं स सुमहारथः।
target: With another broad-headed arrow, that great car-warrio; then, O sire, cut off the stringed bow, of Dharma's son in that battle.

source: अहं हत्वा दशग्रीवं सप्रहस्तं सहात्मजम्। राजानं त्वां करिष्यामि सत्यमेतच्छृणोतु मे॥
target: Do you hear truly that I shall slay the Tennecked one together with Prahasta and his sons, and I shall make you king.

source: कैकेयोऽस्रं समालोक्य मुक्तं द्रोणेन संयुगे। ब्रह्मास्त्रेणैव राजेन्द्र ब्राह्ममस्रमशातयत्॥
target: Beholding that weapon discharged by Drona in battle, the Kekaya prince, O foremost of kings, cut down that weapon with his own Brahma weapon.

source: एवमेते महाराज तावकाः पाण्डवैः सह। पर्यवर्तन्त सहिता निशाकाले परंतप॥
target: Thus, O mighty monarch, your warriors as also those of the Pandavas, all chastisers of their enemies, returned to their encampments when the shades of night had fallen on this earth.

source: नैमिषं मृगयानस्य पापस्यार्धं प्रणश्यति। प्रविष्टमात्रस्तु नरः सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥
target: Only by wishing to go to Naimisha, half of one's sins is destroyed. As soon as a man enters it, he is cleansed of all his sins.

source: एकादशं वर्षमिदं वसाम: सुयोधनेनात्तसुखाः सुखार्हाः। मज्ञातवासं सुखमाप्नुयाम॥ तवाज्ञया पार्थिव निर्विशङ्का विहाय मानं विचरन् वनानि। समीपवासेन विलोभितास्ते ज्ञास्यन्ति नास्मानपकृष्टदेशान्॥
target: In spite of our being deprived by Suyodhana of the happiness we deserve, we have been (hitherto happily) dwelling (in the woods) these eleven years. And hereafter too, O monarch, at your command, wandering in the forests regardless of our position, we shall easily spend the period of our incognits life, deluding that being of wicked mind and character. And (Suyodhana) being tempted by our residence in the neighbourhood will not be inclined to believe that we have removed to a distant country.

source: देवा वै दुष्करं कृत्वा विभूतिं परमां गताः। तस्माद् गार्हस्थ्यमुद्वोढुं दुष्करं प्रब्रवीमि वः॥
target: By practising such highly difficult penances, the gods have obtained the highest glory and power. I, therefore, ask you to satisfy the heavy duties of a householder.

source: आदिवंशविशुद्धानां राज्ञां परमधर्मिणाम्। इक्ष्वाकुकुलजातानां वीराणां सत्यवादिनाम्॥ रामलक्ष्मणयोरर्थे त्वत्सुते वरये नृप। सदृशाभ्यां नरश्रेष्ठ सदृशे दातुमर्हसि॥
target: It is in the interests of Rāma and Lakşmaņa belonging to the heroic and truthful and pious sovereigns sprung in the Ikşvāku line, and possessing purity of race even from the time of their founder, that, Oking, we solicit the hands of your daughters. And, O foremost of men, it be-hove you to confer like brides upon like bridegrooms.

source: निवेदयत मां क्षिप्रं राघवाय महात्मने। सर्वलोकशरण्याय विभीषणमुपस्थितम्॥
target: Do you soon mention to the high-souled Rāghava, the refuge of all creatures, that Vibhīşaņa has arrived.

source: सम्मुह्यामि विषीदामि धर्मो मे शिथिलीकृतः। उद्यम नाधिगच्छामि कदाचित् परिसान्त्वयन्॥
target: I am stupefied! My heart is pained. All the bonds that tie me to morality are loosened. I cannot compose my mind and dare act in the way pointed out by you.

source: निवेदयन्ति स्म तदा कुन्त्या भैक्षं सदा निशि। तया विभक्तान् भागांस्ते भुञ्जते स्म पृथक् पृथक्॥
target: They offered to Kunti every night all the food (that they got during the day) and it (the food) was divided (by Kunti) and they each ate separately the share of each.

source: तेषामादित्यवर्णानि विमलानि महान्ति च। श्वेतच्छत्राण्यशोभन्त वारणेषु रथेषु च॥
target: Their clean, costly and white umbrellas, as brilliant as the sun, shone on the back of their elephants and over their chariots.

source: सुरभ्यः पुण्यकर्मिण्यः पावनाः शुभलक्षणाः। यदर्थं गां गताश्चैव सुरभ्यः सुरसत्तम॥
target: Listen to me also, O destroyer of Bala, as I tell you in full the reason why kine, the children of Surabhi, have descended on the Earth, O best of the celestials.

source: हेमपुङ्खा प्रसन्नाग्रा भीमसेनधनुश्च्युताः। प्राच्छादयंस्ते राधेयं शलभा इव पावकम्॥
target: Furnished with golden wings, keen points and discharged from the bow of Bhimasena, those arrows covered Radha's son like fights of insects covering a blazing fire.

source: वैशम्पायन उवाच प्रभासतीर्थं सम्प्राप्य पुण्यं तीर्थं महोदधेः। वृष्णयः पाण्डवान् वीराः परिवार्योपतस्थिरे॥
target: Vaishampayana said: Having arrived at the sacred Tirtha on the coast of sea, the heroic Vrishni surrounded the sons of Pandu and waited upon them.

source: तेषां कुन्ती महाराज पूजां चक्रे यथाविधि। ते चापि तुतुषुस्तस्यास्तापसाः परियर्चया॥
target: Kunti adored them with due rites, O king. All those ascetics were highly pleased with the adorations offered to them.

source: स शूरसेनान् कात्स्न्र्येन पूर्वमेवाजयत् प्रभुः। मत्स्यराजं च कौरव्यो वशे चक्रे बलाद् बली॥
target: That powerful descendant of Kuru, the lord (Sahadeva), strong in his own strength, vanquished the Shurasenas at the very outset. He then subjugated the king of Matsya.

source: इमां महीं शैलवनोपपन्नां ससागरग्रामविहारपत्तनाम्। चलितां यथावत् संगृह्य तिष्ठस्व यथाऽचला स्यात्॥
target: Bearing properly and well, this earth which is so very unsteady, towns retreats and seas, with all her mountains and forests with her O Shesha, remain in the way as she may be steady.

source: येनैव बाणेन हतः प्रियो मे तेनैव बाणेन हि मां जहीहि । हता गमिष्यामि समीपमस्य न मां विना वीर रमेत वाली॥
target: Do you slay me with that self-same shaft with which my dear one was slain. And thus slain, O hero, I shall near him, for Vāli does not relish the company of any other woman but me.

source: नापि स्वे न परे योधाः प्राज्ञायन्त परस्परम्॥ घोरे कर्णस्त्रे च विजृम्भिते।
target: The (atmosphere) became dark as pitch with the shower of arrows shot by Karna and nobody could know each other, or foes from friends.

source: राज्ञः परैः परिभवः सर्वेषामसुखावहः। तस्माच्छत्रं च पत्रं च वासांस्याभरणानि च॥ भोजनान्यथ पानानि राज्ञे दधुर्गृहाणि च। आसनानि च शय्याश्च सर्वोपकरणानि च॥
target: If the king be disregarded by his enemies, all his subjects become unhappy. Therefore, umbrellas, vehicles, external ornaments, foods, drinks, palaces, seats, beds, and all utensils for use and show, should be dedicated to the king.

source: दस्यून् निहन्ति वै राजा भूयसो वाप्यनागसः। भार्या माता पिता पुत्रो हन्यन्ते पुरुषेण ते। परेणापकृतो राजा तस्मात् सम्यक् प्रधारयेत्॥
target: By killing the wicked, the king kills a large number of innocent men. See, by killing a single robber, his wife, mother, father, and children are all killed. When injured by a wicked person, the king should, therefore, think seriously on the question of punishment.

source: कौरवेय न मे त्रासः कथंचिदपि विद्यते। त्वया सार्धमथान्यैश्च युध्यतो हृदि कश्चन॥
target: "O descendant of the Kurus, I entertain not the least fear in my heart whether fighting with you or with others.

source: पश्य शत्रुघ्न कैकेय्या लोकस्यापकृतं महत्। विसृज्य मयि दुःखानि राजा दशरथो गतः॥
target: Behold, O Satrughna, in what a mighty wrong the people are engaged, on account of Kaikeyi. The king Dasaratha has gone away throwing down on me (the burthen of) this misery.

source: एवं दुर्बुद्धिना प्राप्तमुष्ट्रेण निधनं तदा। आलस्यस्य क्रमात् पश्य महान्तं दोषमागतम्॥
target: Thus did that foolish camel die. See what a great evil followed idleness.

source: व्यास उवाच प्रजानां पालनं धर्मो राज्ञां राजीवलोचन। धर्मः प्रमाणं लोकस्य नित्यं धर्मानुवर्तिनः॥
target: Vyasa said 'O you having eyes like lotus petals, the protection of subjects is the duty of kings. Those men who are always observant of duty regard duty to be all powerful.

source: इत्येवं वदमानास्ते हर्षेण महता युता। प्रभग्नांस्तावकान्योधान् संहृष्टा पृष्ठतोऽन्वयुः॥
target: Saying these words and filled with joy, the Srinjayas pursued your soldiers in that battle who had been exceedingly wounded with arrows. as

source: गुह्याय ज्ञानदृश्याय अक्षराय क्षराय च। एष देवः संचरति सर्वत्रगतिरव्ययः॥
target: Bow to Him who is unravelled, who is capable of being apprehended by knowledge only, who is both indestructible and destructible. The supreme Deity, who is iminutable, permeates all things.

source: तस्य वै यजमानस्य पशुमिन्द्रो जहार ह। प्रनष्टे तु पशौ विप्रो राजानमिदमब्रवीत्॥
target: And as he was sacrificing, Indra stole away his sacrificial beast. And on the beast being stolen, the priest said unto the king.

source: तथैव पाण्डवा राजन सर्वोद्योगेन दंशिताः। प्रययुः फाल्गुनार्थाय यत्र भीष्मो व्यतिष्ठत॥
target: So also, O king, the Pandavas, clad in armour, rushed, with all their energies, to the spot where Bhishma was, desirous of rescuing Partha.

source: एवं बुद्धेः परं बुद्ध्वा संस्तभ्यात्मानमात्मना। जहि शत्रु महाबाहो कामरूपं दुरासदम्॥
target: Thus, O mighty-armed, knowing that which is grater than understanding, (i.e., Self), restraining Self by Self, destroy this unconquerable enemy, Desire.

source: इष्टिः पुष्टिर्यजनं याजनं च दानं पुण्यानां कर्मणां च प्रयोगः। शक्त्या पित्र्यं यच्च किंचित् प्रशस्तं सर्वाण्यात्मार्थे मानवोऽयं करोति॥
target: Religious rites, beneficial ceremonies, the performance of sacrifices, officiation at the sacrifices of others, gifts, the doing of other meritorious deeds, the performance according to the best of his power, of all that has been ordained in in the case of his deceased ancestors,-all these one does for benefiting his own self.

source: इदं च ते तीर्थवरं स्थिरं लोके भविष्यति। सर्वपापापहं सुभ्र नाम्ना बदरपाचनम्॥ विख्यातं त्रिषु लोकेषु ब्रह्मर्षिभिरभिप्लुतम्।
target: This hermitage, again, shall become the foremost of Tirthas in the world, capable of cleansing from every sin. O you of fair eyebrows and shall pass by the name of Vadarapachana. It shall be celebrated in the three worlds and shall be lauded by great Rishis.

source: हा फाल्गुनेति चाप्यन्ये हा यमाविति चापरे। कुन्तीमार्ताश्च शोचन्त उदकं चक्रिरे जनाः॥
target: Others again, “O Falguni!" some again, "O the twins!” “O mother Kunti!” They thus bewailed and gave oblations of water.

source: हुताशन समानेतान् महारूपान् महौजसः। उग्रकायान् महासत्त्वान् कीर्तयेत् कीर्तिवर्धनान्॥
target: It was Bhagiratha who caused the ashes of the sixty thousand sons of Sagara to be washed with the sacred waters of Ganga and thereby rescued them from their sin. Indeed, one should take the names of all these who were gifted with the blazing effulgence of fire, great beauty, and high energy.

source: मनसा चिन्तयामास प्रसादं पावकस्य च। स च तच्चिन्तितं ज्ञात्वा ध्वजे भूतान्यदेशयत्॥
target: As soon as he thought of the favour of Agni in his mind the deity, knowing his desire, ordered the creatures (to sit) on the flag.

source: पादौ संस्पृश्य मानार्हो भ्रातुर्येष्ठस्य भारत। तथा तौ दुःखितौ दृष्ट्वा दुःशासनसुयोधनौ।॥ अधिगम्य व्यधाविष्टः कर्णस्तौ प्रत्यभाषत। विषीदथः किं कौरव्यौ बालिश्यात् प्राकृताविव॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, catching, the feet of his eldest brother who deserved worship from him. Having seen Dushasana in great grief and Duryodhana in greatest possible misery, Karna came to them and said, “O Kuru princes, why do you childishly weep like ordinary people?

source: अश्रौषं पतितश्चाहं यमस्योच्चैः प्रभाषतः। वासुदेवः समुद्धर्ता भविता ते जनार्दनः॥
target: Though fallen down I still could hear the words that Yama said to me very loudly. Those words were-Janardana the son of Vasudeva, will save you.

source: रामेण चार्जुनो नाम हैहयाधिपतिर्हतः। तस्य बाहुशतान्यासंस्त्रीणि सप्त च पाण्डव॥
target: The king of the Haihayas, named Arjuna, was killed by Rama. O son of Pandu, he had ons.

source: धृष्टद्युम्नस्तमारोप्य स्वरथे रथिनां वरः। पश्यतां सर्वसैन्यानामपोवाह यशस्विनम्॥
target: But Dhrishtadyumna soon took up that foremost of car warriors on his own car. He then took away that illustrious hero in the sight of all the warriors.

source: प्राप्तकालं च ते सर्वे मेनिरे मन्त्रिसत्तमाः॥ लोहिताक्षं महाबाहुं मत्तमातङ्गगामिनम्। कम्बुग्रीवं महोरस्कं नीलकुञ्चितमूर्धजम्॥ दीप्यमानं श्रिया वीरं शक्रादनवरं रणे। पारगं सर्वधर्माणां बृहस्पतिसमं मतौ॥ सर्वानुरक्तप्रकृति सर्वविद्याविशारदम्। जितेन्द्रियममित्राणामपि दृष्टिमनोहरम्॥ नियन्तारमसाधूनां गोप्तारं धर्मचारिणाम्। धृतिमन्तनाधृष्यं जेतारमपराजितम्॥ पुत्रं राजा दशरथः कौसल्यानन्दवर्धनम्। संदृश्य परमां प्रीतिमगच्छत् कुरुनन्दन॥
target: And all those best of advisers thought that it was the proper time (for the purpose). O descendant of the Kurus, king Dasharatha was greatly pleased on beholding his son (Rama) of red eyes and mighty arms, endued with the gait of an elephant mad (with exuberance of spirits), of long arms and broad chest, having blue and curly hair, blazing with beauty, brave as Shakra in battle, versed in all the religious duties, wise as Brihaspati, an object of adoration with all his subjects, proficient in every science and art, of subdued passions, pleasant to the eye of even his enemies, the chastiser of the wicked, the protector of the virtuous, endued with high intellect, invincible, ever victorious and never vanquished and the enhancer of the joy of (his mother) Kausalya.

source: यजनं याजनं चैव तथा दानप्रतिग्रहौ। अध्यापनं चाध्ययनं षट्कर्मा धर्मभाग द्विजः॥
target: The celebration of sacrifices, officiating at the sacrifices of others, the making of gifts, the acceptance of gifts, teaching and study, are the six deeds by doing which a Brahmana acquires religious merit.

source: चन्दनागुरुसम्पृक्तो धूपसम्मूर्छितोऽमलः। प्रवाति पवनः श्रीमान् किं नु नाद्य यथा पुरा ॥
target: Why, as before, does not the blameless* and bland wind blow mixed with the perfume of sandal and faint with Dhūpa? *Some texts read atula in place of amala, incomparable.

source: यथान्धः स्वगृहे युक्तो ह्यभ्यासादेव गच्छति। तथा युक्तेन मनसा प्राज्ञो गच्छति तां गतिम्॥
target: Like a blind man who, with attention, can move about his own house, the wise man, with mind fixed on Yoga, can proceed along the road.

source: महामेघं महाघोरं दर्दुरः प्रतिनर्दसि। कामतोयप्रदं लोके नरपर्जन्यमर्जुनम्॥
target: Your roaring at Arjuna, the deity of clouds among men, like that of frog at a dreadful huge cloud discharging copious showers of rain.

source: समप्रमाणान् पाण्डूनां समवीर्यान् मदोत्कटान्। सौभद्रं च महेष्वासममरैरपि दुःसहम्॥
target: And who are the equals of the Pandavas in valour and in every other respect and having the true pride of a soldier or (who can approach) the son of Subhadra, whose impetus is hard to be borne even by the gods.

source: क्षणेनैवाभवत् सर्वमद्भुतं मधुसूदन॥ तत् सदो वृषभाङ्कस्य भीमरूपधरं बभौ।
target: Within the twinkling of the eye, O destroyer of Madhu, everything there became highly wonderful. Indeed, the house of the great deity having the bull for his emblem began to blaze with a terrible beauty.

source: अहो क्षत्रसमाचारो यत्र मामितरं यथा। नियोजयसि युद्धाय परमातेव मां तथा॥
target: Fie on the custom of the Kshatriyas since you, being own mother, urge me to go to battle as if were a stranger and you the mother of another.

source: वीर्याधिकमथालक्ष्य धनुर्वेदे धनंजयम्। द्रोणं रहस्युपागम्य कर्णो वचनमब्रवीत्॥ ब्रह्मास्त्रं वेत्तुमिच्छामि सरहस्यनिवर्तनम्। अर्जुनेन समं चाहं युध्येयमिति मे मतिः॥
target: Making that Dhananjaya was superior to every one in the science of arms, Karna one day approached Drona privately and said these words to him,-I desire to master the Brahma weapon, with all its Mantras and the power of withdrawing it, for I wish to fight Arjuna.

source: ऋतुः सुदर्शनः कालः परमेष्ठी परिग्रहः। उग्रः संवत्सरो दक्षो विश्रामो विश्वदक्षिणः॥
target: He who is at once with the seasons. He at whose sight alone all adorers succeed in obtaining the great object of their wish. He who weakens all creatures. He who lives in the sky of the heart, depending upon His own glory and power. He who is capable of being known everywhere. He who fills everyone with dread. He in whom all creatures live. He who is clever in doing all acts. He who forms the Rest of all creatures. He who is more powerful than other Beings. (416-425)

source: कृताश्च वैदूर्यमया विहङ्गा रूप्यप्रवालैश्च तथा विहङ्गाः। चित्राश्च नानावसुभिर्भुजङ्गा जात्यानुरूपास्तुरगाः शुभाङ्गाः॥ प्रवालजाम्बूनदपुष्पपक्षाः सलीलमावर्जितजिह्मपक्षाः। कामस्य साक्षादिव भान्ति पक्षाः कृता विहङ्गाः सुमुखाः सुपक्षाः॥
target: And in that car) were birds made of lapis lazulis; and (other) birds composed of silver and coral; and variegated serpents made of various precious metals; and fair-bodied steeds resembling those of superior breeds; and there were constructed birds having graceful mouths; and fair, tapering, playful and contracted plumage, bearing blossoms made of coral and gold, like to the very plumage of Kama himself.

source: अभिगम्य तु वैदेहीं निलयं रावणस्य च। मासे पूर्णे निवर्तध्वमुदयं प्राप्य पर्वतम् ॥
target: Meeting with Vaidehi and arriving at) Rāvana's mansion, do you, having reached the Rising hill, turn back, when it shall be a full month.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच अग्नीनां विविधा वंशाः कीर्तितास्ते मयानघ। शृणु जन्म तु कौरव्य कार्तिकेयस्य धीमतः॥
target: Markandeya said : O sinless one, O descendant of Kuru, I have told you the history of the various branches of the Agni race. (Now) hear about the birth of the intelligent Kartikeya.

source: चपलस्येह कृत्यानि सहसानुप्रधावतः। क्षिप्रमन्ये प्रपद्यन्ते क्रौञ्चस्य खमिव द्विजाः॥
target: Even as the fowls of the air enter the hole in the Krauñca, enemies find and easy entrance into the short comings of him that is fickle and that rush into act without heed.

source: स बालभावाद् युधि वीर्यदर्पतः प्रवृद्धमन्युः क्षतजोपमेक्षणः। समाससादाप्रतिमं रणे कपिं गजो महाकूपमिवावृतं तृणैः॥
target: As an elephant approach a deep pit covered over with grass, (Aksa) from a spirit of childishness elated in conflict with his prowess, with his ire heightened, and eyes resembling blood, drew near the monkey in the fleld.

source: यथाशक्ति च ते ब्रह्मन् वर्तये वृत्तिमुत्तमाम्। प्रीणामि च यथाशक्ति तच्च त्वं नावबुध्यसे॥
target: To the best of my prowess, O Brahmana, I try to behave well with you. I also, exert to the best of my capabilities for satisfying you; still you do not seem to attach any value to all these.

source: दशमं पारणं प्राप्य द्विजातीनभिवन्द्य च। किंकिणीजालनिर्घोषं पताकाध्वजशोभितम्॥ रत्नवेदिकसम्बाधं वैदूर्यमणितोरणम्। हेमजालपरिक्षिप्तं प्रवालबलभीमुखम्॥ गन्धर्वर्गीतकुशलैरप्सरोभिश्च शोभितम्। विमानं सुकृतावासं सुखेनैवोपपद्यते॥
target: Reaching the tenth Parana and pleasing Brahmanas, he acquires, a car which tinkles with innumerable bells, which is decked with flags and banners, which is equipt with a seat made of precious, gems, which has many arches made of lapis lazuli which has a net work of gold all round, which has turrents inade of corals. Which is adorned with Gandharvas and Apsaras expert in singing, and which is fit for the residence of the Righteous.

source: यद् युद्धेऽभिमुखः प्राणांस्त्यजेच्छठे जयेत वा। एष चास्मान् वयं चैनं युद्ध्यमानाः परंतप॥
target: Than to fall in the field of battle or to defeat a foe. O chastiser of foes, we shall fight; and either he will kill us or we will kill him.

source: कृष्णपार्थो महेष्वासौ व्यतिक्रम्याथ ते अग्रतः पुण्डरीकाक्षं प्रतीयाय नराधिप॥
target: Leaving behind him the two mighty carwarriors Krishna and Partha, your son proceeded ahead and then turned back, p king, facing Keshava of lotus-like eyes.

source: देव्या दिव्यप्रभावेण दग्धं सव्यं ममेक्षणम्। रेणुध्वस्तमिव ज्योतिः पिङ्गलत्वमुपागतम्॥
target: Thereupon through the divine energy of the goddess my left eye was burnt and seemed to be covered with dust, and its lustre became tawny.

source: ये क्रोधं संनियच्छन्ति क्रुद्धान् संशमयन्ति च। न च कुप्यन्ति भूतानां दुर्गाण्यतितरन्ति ते॥
target: Those, who conquer their own anger and pacify the anger of others, and who are never irate with any one, succeed in getting over all difficulties.

source: ततः पर्व परिज्ञेयमानुशासनिकं परम्। स्वर्गारोहणिकं चैव ततो भीष्मस्य धीमतः॥
target: Next Anushasana, then the ascension of wise Bhishma to heaven.

source: पुरोहित उवाच पुण्याहवाचने नित्यं धर्मकृत्येषु चासकृत्। शान्तिहोमेषु च सदा किं त्वं हससि वीक्ष्य माम्॥५०
target: The priest said Every day, on occasions of receiving benedictions from me, when, again, I am engaged in the performance of religious rites, on your behalf, on occasions also of the Homa and other rites of propitiation, why do you laugh upon seeing me?

source: प्रतिजग्राह तं राधा विधिवद् दिव्यरूपिणम्। पुत्रं कमलगर्भामं देवगर्भं श्रिया वृतम्॥
target: Thereupon, Radha duly adopted that body of celestials appearance and birth, endued with the splendour of the filaments of lotuses and possessed of excellent grace.

source: ऋजून्येव विशुद्धानि सर्वे शस्त्राण्यधारयन्। सुयुद्धेन पराँल्लोकानीप्सन्तः कीर्तिमेव च॥
target: O king Arjuna! The son of Kunti did not assert the opinion but being it a trick, all other present there had preferred it. Only Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti could agree to the matter after a lengthy and tough discussion.

source: यदिदं दृश्यते वित्तं पृथिव्यामिह किंचन। ममेदं स्यान्ममेदं स्यादित्येवं काक्षते जनः॥
target: With respect to wealth which is seen in this world, every one fights with every one else, saying,-This shall be mine.-This shall be imine.

source: बद्धासयः पाशहस्ता वारप्रतिवारणा:। समानमृत्यवो राजन् नात्यजन्त परस्परम्॥
target: And O monarch, as they were possessed of swords and nooscs in their hands and endued with the power of with-standing the infuriate elephants and as they were equally determined to die, they (the warriors) did not forsake one another (in the field).

source: दिवापि मयि निष्क्रान्ते संतष्येते गुरू मम। विचिनोति हि मां तातः सहैवाश्रमवासिभिः॥
target: Even if I go out during the day my parents are filled with anxiety. And my father together with all the inhabitants of the hermitages searches for me.

source: पर्वणीव सुसंक्रुद्धो राहुः पूर्ण निशाकरम्॥ पीड्यमानो बलवता पुत्रस्तव विशाम्पते।
target: Like the enraged Rahu afflicting the full moon on the fifteenth day of the light half of a month. Then thus afflicted by the powerful Partha, your son, O ruler of men,

source: हतबान्धवभूयिष्ठा हताश्वा हतकुञ्जरा। एषा ते पृथिवी राजन् भुवनां विगतज्वरः॥
target: Deprived entirely of friends and allies, of horses and elephants, this Earth exists for you, O king. Do you enjoy her now cheerfully.

source: तत ऊर्ध्वं कुमारस्तु स्वर्णष्ठीवी महायशाः। चित्तं प्रसादयामास पितुर्मातुश्च वीर्यवान्॥
target: After this prince Suvarnashthivin of great renown and power began to gladden the hearts of his parents.

source: यं निरीक्षेत संक्रुद्ध आशया पूर्वजातया। प्रदहेच्च हि तं राजन् कक्षमक्षय्यभुग यथा॥
target: That man upon whom a Brahmana with raised expectations looks, is sure, O king, to be reduced to ashes as a heap of straw is capable of being consumed by a burning fire.

source: मार्कण्डेय उवाच ततश्चोरक्षयं कृत्वा द्विजेभ्यः पृथिवीमिमाम्। वाजिमेधे महायज्ञे विधिवत् कल्पयिष्यति॥
target: Markandeya said : Then exterminating all robbers, he (Kalki) will duly give away this earth at a great horsesacrifice to the Brahmanas.

source: तमुवाच ततो ज्येष्ठो भ्राता सप्रणयं वचः। मुञ्चैनमधमाचारं प्रमाणा यदि ते वयम्॥
target: Thereupon his eldest brother said to him a affectionate terms. "If you have any regard for me let him be free."

source: ततो दुमं पतगसहस्रसेवितम् महीधरप्रतिमवपुः प्रकम्पयन्। खगोत्तमो द्रुतमभिपत्य वेगवान् बभञ्जतामविरलपत्रसंचयाम्॥
target: When the best of birds, huge as a huge mountain and of great swiftness, alighted on the tree, the abode of thousands of birds, it trembled; and the bough, full of leaves, was broken.

source: ततः परिवृता योधाः परिवQर्युधिष्ठिरम्॥ वृत्रहत्यै यथा देवाः परिव्रवुः पुरंदरम्। ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा तव पुत्रस्य मारिष।
target: The warriors in Pandavas' army then returned again to battle as they once were fled away. They all took their position around Yudhishthira as all gods had gathered around Indra when the monster Vritra was killed.

source: निसर्गसर्गनिरत कामेश परमेश्वर। अमृतोद्भव सद्भाव मुक्तात्मन् विजयप्रद॥
target: O you that are ever engaged in the acts of creation and destruction, Orepressor of all desires, O most exalted Divinity, O you the origin of Amrita, O you whose existence only is a reality, O you that are the Fire that do appear at the end of a Yoga, O you that are the bestower of victory.

source: गदाविमथितैर्गात्रैर्मुसलैभिन्नमस्तकाः। गजवाजिरथक्षुण्णाः शेरते स्म नराः क्षितौ॥
target: With their bodies crushed with strokes of maces, their heads smashed with the blows of bludgeons, and thoroughly mangled by the cars and elephants and steed, men lay on the field.

source: बृहस्पतिरुवाच इष्टं त्वनिष्टं च सुखासुखे च साशीस्त्वबच्छन्दति कर्मभिश्च।
target: Men aspire to acquire the agreeable which ends in happiness, to avoid the disagreeable which begets misery. Such acquisition and such avoidance again are brought about by acts.

source: स तु त सहसा प्राप्तं नित्यमत्यन्तवैरिणम्॥ कर्णो वैकर्तनः सूत किमुत्तरमपद्यत।
target: Thus meeting all on a sudden his inveterate enemy, what measures, O charioteer, did Karna, the son of Vikartana adopt?

source: एतच्छ्रुत्वा रहः सूतो राजानमिदमब्रवीत्। श्रूयतां तत् पुरावृत्तं पुराणे च मया श्रुतम्।।
target: Hearing all about it, the king's charioteer addressed the monarch in private, saying, Do you listen to what is related in the Purānas, and to what I have heard myself!

source: ततः सविद्युत्स्तनितैः सेन्द्रायुधपुरोगमैः। आवृतं गगनं मेधैर्बलाकापङ्क्तिहासिभिः॥
target: The sky was covered in clouds emitting flashes of lightning and the coloured bow of Indra appeared shedding its effulgent rays. The clouds seemed to be laughing on account of the presence of white cranes that were then flying.

source: भीष्म उवाच शक्यः समासादयितुं गोलोकः पुष्करेक्षण। एतत् ते सर्वमाख्यातं मया शक्रानुपृच्छते॥
target: Bhishma said learing these words of the self-creale Brahman, O Yudhishthira, Shakra of a thousand eyes began from that time to adore kine every day and to show them the greatest respect.

source: तस्य तैरभवद् युद्धमिन्द्रियैरिव देहिनः॥ घोररूपमसंवार्य निर्मर्यादमवर्तत।
target: The encounter that took place between him and those five resembled that which takes place between a man and his five senses. It was awful and fierce and no party showed any consideration for the other.

source: न काल: कपिराजेन्द्र वैकलव्यमवलम्बितुम्। अतिस्नेहोऽपि कालेऽसिमान्मरणायोपकल्पते॥
target: O foremost of monkey-kings, this is no time for being overcome with stupor. At this hour, even immoderate affection may lead destruction.

source: स त्वां मनुजशार्दूलः क्षिप्रं प्राप्स्यति राघवः। समित्रबान्धवं हत्वा रावणं जनकात्मजे॥ ।
target: O daughter of the king Janaka bringing about the destruction of Rāvaņa, with all his kith and kin, Rāghava, the foremost of men, shall soon regain you.

source: विकुर्वन् बहुधा वर्णान् नीलपाण्डुरलोहितान्॥ बिभ्रत्कृष्णाजिनं वासो हेमप्रवरतारकम्। नेत्रं चैकं ललाटेन भास्करप्रतिमं वहन्॥ शुशुभातेऽतिविमले द्वे नेत्रे कृष्णपिङ्गले।
target: Assuming various hues such as blue, white and red, and wearing a black deer-skin set with stars of gold, he bore on his forehead a third eye resembling the effulgent sun. His two other eyes, one of which was black and the other twany, shone very brilliantly.

source: पटच्चरैश्च पौण्ड्रैश्च राजन् पौरवकैस्तथा॥ निषादैः सहितश्चापि पृष्ठमासीद् युधिष्ठिरः।
target: O king, Yudhishthira with the Patachcharas, the Pundras, the Puravakas and the Nishadas, became its back.

source: सान्त्वमानार्थदानैश्च पूजया चानुरूपया। सोदर्यां पूजयामास स्वसारं पन्नगोत्तमः॥
target: O Brahmana, the best of the snakes then adored his sister with best regards, with fitting eulogies and gifts of wealth.

source: ततोऽहं हिमवत्पार्वे वसामि नियतः सुखम्। भगिन्यां स्नेहसंयुक्तः कौशिक्यां रघुनन्दन ॥
target: And thenceforth, out of affection for my sister, Kausiki, I ever dwell happily in the vicinity of the Himavat, O Raghava.

source: धूम्राक्षस्याथ सम्पातेर्भवनं मारुतात्मजः। विधुदूपस्य भीमस्य घनस्य विघनस्य च ॥ शुकनाभस्य चक्रस्य शठस्य कपटस्य च। ह्रस्वकर्णस्य दंष्ट्रस्य लोमशस्य च रक्षसः॥ युद्धोन्मत्तस्य मत्तस्य ध्वजग्रीवस्य सादिनः। विद्युज्जिह्वद्विजिह्वानां तथा हस्तिमुखस्य च॥ करालस्य विशालस्य शोणिताक्षस्य चैव हि। प्लवमानः क्रमेणैव हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः॥ तेषु तेषु महार्हेषु भवनेषु महायशाः। तेषामृद्धिमतामृद्धिं ददर्श स महाकपिः॥
target: And (next) the Wind-god's offspring entered the house of Dhumraksa, and (next) that of Sampāti, and the grim Vidyudrūpa, and Ghana, and Vighana, and Sukanābha, and Cakra, and Satha, and Kapata, and Hrasvakarna, and Danstra, and the Rākşasa Lomasa, and Yuddhyonmatta, and Matta, and the horseman, Dhvajagrīva, and of Vidyujjihva and Vijihva, and of Hastimukha, and of Karāla, and Vicala, and of Sonitaksha. The issustrious offspring of the Wind, Hanumān, one after another, leapt into all these noble edifices. And that redoubtable monkey observed the affluence of all these (Raksasas) possessed of prosperity.

source: ततस्तद् वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रत्युत्थाय कृताञ्जली। वासुदेवार्जुनौ सर्वं तुष्टुवाते महामती॥ भक्त्या स्तवेन दिव्येन महात्मानाविनिन्दितौ॥
target: Hearing these words of the god, Vasudeva and Arjuna rose up with their palms folded;

source: विचित्रवाससः सर्वे दीप्ता राक्षसपुंगवाः। गजा मदोत्कटाः शूराश्चलन्त इव पर्वताः॥ ते युद्धकुशला रूढास्तोमराङ्कुशपाणिभिः। अन्ये लक्षणसंयुक्ताः शूरारूढा महाबलाः॥
target: All those powerful and flaming Rākşasas wore variegated raiments. And heroic elephants in rut resembling mountains in motion, marched, being led by those well-skilled in battle carrying Tomaras and hooks in their hands. And mighty steeds bearing auspicious marks, marched ridden by heroes.

source: भीष्मः कृत्वा महाव्यूहं पिता तव विशाम्पते। सागरप्रतिमं घोरं वाहनोर्मितरङ्गिणम्॥
target: Your sire Bhishma, O ruler of men, formed a mighty array resembling the dreadful ocean itself, having for its waves and currents the vehicles (of the warriors).

source: बुद्धिद्रव्येण दृश्येत मनोदीपेन लोककृत्। महतस्तमसस्तात पारे तिष्ठन्नतामसः॥
target: The Creator of the worlds, He is seen only by a person gifted with wealth of intelligence when helped by the lamp of the mind. He lives on the other shore of the Darkness and is above the Ishvara.

source: एवं त्वसौ राजसुतंन निशम्य ब्रुवन्तमाजौ विनिपीडय वक्षः। मुटुर्ननादाथ समस्तयोधान्॥ त्वसौ भवेदद्य निरस्तबाहुः। माक्षिप्य योधास्तरसा महाबलः॥ एवं क्रुद्धो भीमसेनः करेण उत्पाटयामास भुजं महात्मा। दुःशासनं तेन स वीरमध्ये जघान् वज्रशनिसंनिभेन॥
target: Bhimasena caught Duhshasana forcibly with both arms, climbed on his chest and addressed in loud voice all warriors "The army is being separated from the body of Duhshasana. He is at an anvil of death. Come forward, I challenge the saviour if any is here." Thus, mighty, bold and furiated Bhimasena had uprooted Duhshasana's arm with a jerk by was single hand. His arm as hard hard as thunderbolt. Bhimasena, took it and started thrashing him in the presence of all warriors.

source: शास्त्रतः पूजितश्चैव सम्यक् तेन महात्मना। स भीष्मेण महाभागस्तुष्टोऽस्त्रविदुषां वरः॥
target: That foremost of all men skilled in arms, that illustrious man (Drona) was pleased with the reception given to him by great Bhishma and accepted them as his pupils.

source: न चेत् करिष्यति वचो मयोक्तं जाह्नवीसुतः। धक्ष्याम्यहं रणे भद्रे सामात्यं शस्त्रतेजसा॥
target: If the son of Jahnavi does not do what I say then shall I consume him in battle, O gentle lady, along with his ministers, by the blaze of my weapons.

source: तेषां वेगवतां वेगमिषुभिर्वेगवत्तरैः। अस्त्रवित्परमात्रेण वारयामास रावणिः॥
target: And Ravana's son, skilled in arms, resisted the impetuous march of those vehement ones by means of a powerful weapon as well as arms more forceful (than the force of their rush).

source: धिक्केकयांस्तथा चेदीन् मत्स्यांश्चैवाथ सृञ्जयान्। ये त्वां रणगतं वीरं न शेकुरभिरक्षितुम्॥
target: Fie on the Kaikayas and on the Chedis and the Matsyas and the Srinjayas, who all, united together, could not protect that hero when he went to battle.

source: इत्युक्त्वा भगवान् ब्रह्मा तत्रैवान्तरधीयत। ततः सशिष्यो भगवान् मुनिर्विस्मयमाययौ ॥
target: Having said this, the Lord Brahmä disappeared there. And thereat the sage and his disciples marvelled greatly.

source: ततः स परया प्रीत्या प्रत्युवाच नराधिपम्। औपपत्तिकमाहारं प्रयच्छेस्वेति भारत॥
target: Filled with joy, the Rishi answered that king, O Bharata, saying-Let food that is proper be given to me.

source: अवेक्ष्याञ्जलिपानांश्च ब्राह्मणान् वेदपारगान्। ययुर्मध्येन बाह्रीकान् सुदामानं च पर्वतम्॥
target: Beholding here Brāhmaṇas versed in the Vedas drinking water with their joined hands, they went through Vahllika towards the mount Sudaman.

source: तं प्रत्यविध्यद् दशभिर्भीमसेनः शिलीमुखैः। त्वरमाणो महेष्वासः सव्ये पार्श्वे महाबलः॥
target: But the highly puissant Bhimasena, that fierce bow-man, without the least delay, pierced Drona in return in his left side with ten shafts of great sharpness.

source: अश्मभिः परिभिन्नाङ्गः पादपैराहतो भृशम्। रामबाणेन चाक्रान्तो जीवितान्ते मुमोह सः॥
target: Having his limbs dissevered by stones, being struck with trees and wounded by Rama's shaft, he became senseless at the approach of death.

source: ततो दिव्यं मणिवरं शिरसा धारयन् प्रभुः। शुशुभे स तदा राजा सचन्द्र इव पर्वतः॥
target: Holding on his head that excellent and celestial gem, the powerful king shone like a mountain with the moon above it.

source: ततः पद्मसहस्रेण वृतः शङ्कुशतेन च ॥ युवराजोऽङ्गदः प्राप्तः पितुस्तुल्यपराक्रमः।
target: Then came the young prince Angada, in prowess resembling his sire, accompanied by a thousand padmas and an hundred sankhas.

source: संजय उवाच राजन् सुबहवो द्वीपा यैरिदं सततं जगत्। सप्तद्वीपान् प्रवक्ष्यामि चन्द्रादित्यौ ग्रहं तथा॥

source: इहाहं यदि तिष्ठामि स्वेन रूपेण संवृतः। विनाशमुपयास्यामि भर्तुरर्थश्च हास्यति॥
target: Should I stay here embodied in my native form, I shall come by destruction; and the interest also of my master shall suffer.

source: त्यक्त्वा मन्युं व्युपशाम्यस्व पार्थैः पर्याप्तमेतद् यत् कृतं फाल्गुनेन। भीष्मस्यान्तादस्तु वः सौहृदं च जीवन्तु शेषाः साधु राजन् प्रसीद॥
target: Renouncing your wrath, do you conclude peace with the sons of Pritha. Enough has already been accomplished by Phalguna. Let amity be established among you with the death of Bhishma. Let the rest (of the warriors) live! Relent, reient, O monarch!

source: न ह्यभक्ताय राजेन्द्र भक्तायानृजवे न च। दर्शयाम्यहमात्मानं च चाशान्ताय भारत॥
target: I do not, O foremost of kings, display myself to one which is not my votary, or to a devotee who is not sincere, or to one, O Bharata, who has not restrained his soul.

target: Yudhishthira Said Which act, O grandfather is the foremost of all those that have been laid down for a king? What is that act by doing which a king succeeds in enjoying both this world and the next.

target: If the sons of Dhritarashtra, whose time is now arrived, do not hear my advice; then they will sleep dead on the bare earth and be food for dogs and jackals.

source: संजय उवाच तदनीकमनाधृष्यं भारद्वाजेन रक्षितम्। पार्थाः समभ्यवर्तन्त भीमसेनपुरोगमा:॥
target: Sanjaya said The Parthas then led by Bhimasena marched against that invincible array of your soldiers protected by the son of Bharadvaja.

source: अटवीपर्वताश्चैव नद्यस्तीर्थानि यानि च॥ सर्वाण्यस्वामिकान्याहुन हि तत्र परिग्रहः।
target: Forests, mountains, rivers, and Tirthas, are considered as having no owners. No earth need be bought here for performing Shraddhas.

source: अक्षोहिण्यो दशैका च कौरवाणां समागताः। तासां प्रमुखतो भीष्मस्तालकेतुळरोचत॥
target: Eleven Akshauhinis have assembled for the Kurus and in the foremost ranks of those is shining Bhishma who has a flag-staff as high as a palm tree.

source: स गत्वा तपसः पारं देहमुत्सृज्य भारत। जगाम पितृलोकाय न लेभे तत्र तत्फलम्॥
target: O descendant of Bharata, having reached the opposite shore of asceticism (gaining success in asceticism), he gave up his human body and went to the region of the Pitris. But he did not get there the fruits (of his virtuous actions).

target: According to Rāma's command Laksmana, gifted with auspicious mark, arrived at the gate and called those who had come there for business. But none said that he had been brought there by any business.

target: That flaming dart, feathered in gold, being splintered into several pieces by Rāma's arrows fell down on earth like a huge fire-brand.

target: Vidura will enter into the high souled Yudhishthira. Sanjaya also, through meditation, will ascend from this world into the celestial region.

target: They who lead astray and cheat helpless women, or girls or aged dames, or such women as have been frightened, have to sink in hell.

source: विद्रुतां वाहिनीं मन्ये कृतवैरैर्महात्मभिः। तां रणे केऽनुयास्यन्ति प्रभग्नां पाण्डवैर्युधि॥
target: I see in my mind my army already routed by these large minded ones, whom I converted into enemies, who will follow them to battle, who have been routed by the Pandavas in fight.

target: This Krishna, who always does what is agreeable and beneficial to Jishnu, as also to you, O king, is that foremost of all beings, that irresistible one, that abode of eternal happiness.

source: ते शराः प्राप्य कौन्तेयं समन्ताद् विविशुः प्रभो। फलभारनतं यद्वत् स्वादुवृक्षं विहङ्गमाः॥
target: Those arrows, reaching, the son of Kunti, entered into him, like, O lord, a flight of birds entering a tree bending with the burden of its tasteful fruits.

target: This is my younger brother (named) Laks inana, (ever)serving me. This is my wife, known by the name of Sītā.

target: I do not see your body nor mine own and at every step do I see fire coming from your। body.

source: तं तथा व्यथितं दृष्ट्वा कृष्णो वचनमब्रवीत्। मा व्यथां कुरु कौन्तेय नैतत् त्वय्युपपद्यते॥ वैकुव्यं भरतश्रेष्ठ यथा प्राकृतपूरुषे। उत्तिष्ठ राजन् युद्ध्यस्व वह गुर्वी धुरं विभो॥
target: Seeing him so afflicted, Krishna said these words, “O son of Kunti. let not such gricf overtake you. This depression is not worthy of yourself, O chief of the Bharatas, as it is of an ordinary person; arise O monarch and fight and bear this heavy burden of grief.

source: देवशर्मन् उवाच बहुमायः स विप्रर्षे भगवान् पाकशासनः। तांस्तान् विकुरुते भावान् बहूनथ मुहुर्मुहुः॥
target: Devasharman said The powerful chastiser of Paka, . regenerate Rishi, is full of illusion. Every moment he assumes those forms that he chooses.

source: अथवा न प्रवर्तेत योगतन्त्रैरुपक्रमेत्। येन तन्त्रयतस्तन्त्रं वृत्तिः स्यात् तत् तदाचरेत्॥
target: Then again, one should never show his Yoga power. On the other hand, one should always try to restrain his senses by practising the rules of Yoga. Indeed, one engaged in the practice of Yoga should do all those acts by which his conduct and nature may become pure.
